translated: In that case, the valid cognition of the invariable concomitance should be stated.

original: de yang gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, that is a fallacious reason.

original: ma mthong ba ldog pa 'grub na mang po ma nges pa nyid mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ldog pa 'grub na mang po ma nges pa nyid mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the negation of non-observation is established, the uncertainty of many is not negated.

original: lhag ma dang ldan pa de nyid ston pa ni lus las zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma dang ldan pa de nyid ston pa ni lus las zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The remainder is shown to be possessed by that itself, which is from the body.

original: ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dod pa'i skyes bu'i khyad par du gyur pa 'ga' zhig lus las 'dod chags dang ldan pa yin no zhes kha cig zer ba ni 'dod chags med pa rdo la sogs pa la ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / so so'i skye bo bdag nyid la lus yod na 'dod chags yod par mthong ba'i phyir ma mthong ba las ldog pa grub pa'i phyir nyid kyis lhag ma dang ldan pa yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dod pa'i skyes bu'i khyad par du gyur pa 'ga' zhig lus las 'dod chags dang ldan pa yin no zhes kha cig zer ba ni 'dod chags med pa rdo la sogs pa la ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / so so'i skye bo bdag nyid la lus yod na 'dod chags yod par mthong ba'i phyir ma mthong ba las ldog pa grub pa'i phyir nyid kyis lhag ma dang ldan pa yin pa bzhin no //
translated: This is not so, because attachment is not seen in those without attachment, such as stones and so on, and because it is established that attachment is reversed when attachment is not seen, since attachment is seen to exist when the body exists for ordinary beings.

original: ji ltar 'di lhag ma dang ldan pa yin gyi rnam par gsum nyid du ji ltar mi 'du zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di lhag ma dang ldan pa yin gyi rnam par gsum nyid du ji ltar mi 'du zhe na /
translated: How is it that attachment exists in the remainder, but not in the three types?

original: nus med phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: nus med phyir zhes smos so //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúBecause they are not capable.‚Äù

original: gal te lus la sogs pa 'dod chags skyed par nus na ni de snyed pa de dag nyid las 'dod chags skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu yal bar dor nas rung ba nyid rjes su dpog pas rang bzhin gyi nang du bsdus te rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs suüîΩbrjod pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te lus la sogs pa 'dod chags skyed par nus na ni de snyed pa de dag nyid las 'dod chags skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu yal bar dor nas rung ba nyid rjes su dpog pas rang bzhin gyi nang du bsdus te rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su brjod pa zhig na /
translated: Therefore, since one would be inferring suitability after having abandoned the effect, it would be included within essential nature and would be stated as a reason of essential nature.

original: gang gi phyir de dag nus pa med pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir rgyu 'bras bu nyid yod kyang sbyor bar byed pa ma yin par byas te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag nus pa med pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir rgyu 'bras bu nyid yod kyang sbyor bar byed pa ma yin par byas te /
translated: But since those things are not able to generate attachment, therefore, even though cause and effect exist, one does not engage in the activity of inferring suitability.

original: mthong ba dang mthong ba tsam la brten pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la brten nas gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba dang mthong ba tsam la brten pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la brten nas gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Rather, one should state the reason based on the observation of mere concomitance and reversal.

original: de lta yin dang ma nges pa nyid mi ldog go //üîΩrung ba nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang ma nges pa nyid mi ldog go // rung ba nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa'o //
translated: If that were the case, then one could not avoid the fault of inconclusiveness.üîΩThe Autocommentary states, ‚ÄúSuitability is also . . .‚Äù

original: rung ba nyid kyang tshogs pa dag kho nas rjes su dpog par byed de /
analyzed: rung ba nyid kyang tshogs pa dag kho nas rjes su dpog par byed de /
translated: Suitability is also inferred by the collection of causes and conditions.

original: ma tshogs pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bas ni nges par bzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma tshogs pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bas ni nges par bzung ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot when they are not assembled‚Äù is for the purpose of emphasizing the point.

original: ci'i phyir ma tshogs pas ma yin zhe na ma tshogs pa rnams la ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma tshogs pas ma yin zhe na ma tshogs pa rnams la ni zhes smos so //
translated: Why is it not when they are not assembled? He says, ‚Äúbecause they do not exist when they are not assembled.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu rtsom par byed pa'i khyad par yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir shin tu nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rtsom par byed pa'i khyad par yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir shin tu nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the difference that would initiate the effect is not established, it is utterly incapable of doing so.üîΩThis is what is being said: Here, the inference of the suitability of the effect is called the inference of the effect. Thus, even though it is not an inference, because of the realization of the effect that has become different,

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te 'dir 'bras bu rung ba nyid rjes su dpog pa ni 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa nyid yin par brjod de de ltar na rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid ma yin yang khyad par du gyur pa'i 'bras bu rtogs pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te 'dir 'bras bu rung ba nyid rjes su dpog pa ni 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa nyid yin par brjod de de ltar na rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid ma yin yang khyad par du gyur pa'i 'bras bu rtogs pa'i phyir
translated: it is called an inference.

original: ro // 'di ni med do //
analyzed: ro // 'di ni med do //
translated: This is not so.

original: nus pa yod na mchod pa'i phyir de rung ba'i zhes bya bar 'gyur @60a * //
analyzed: nus pa yod na mchod pa'i phyir de rung ba'i zhes bya bar 'gyur @60a * //
translated: If there were the capacity, it would be called the suitability of that.

original: na ma tshogs pa la ni med do //
analyzed: na ma tshogs pa la ni med do //
translated: But it does not exist when they are not assembled.

original: des na 'dis ni gtan tshigs gsum las phyi rol tu gyur par brjod do //
analyzed: des na 'dis ni gtan tshigs gsum las phyi rol tu gyur par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, this is said to be outside of the three reasons.

original: lus las 'dod chags rjes dpog bzhin //
analyzed: lus las 'dod chags rjes dpog bzhin //
translated: Like inferring desire from the body.

original: zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pas /
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: dper na zhes smos so //
analyzed: dper na zhes smos so //
translated: For example,

original: bzhin gyi don ni dper na'i sgra'i don yin la lus kyi sgra yang dbang po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la yin pas /
analyzed: bzhin gyi don ni dper na'i sgra'i don yin la lus kyi sgra yang dbang po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la yin pas /
translated: the word ‚Äúlike‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúfor example,‚Äù and the word ‚Äúbody‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúsense-faculty,‚Äù etc.

original: lus la 'dod chags rjes dpog bzhin //
analyzed: lus la 'dod chags rjes dpog bzhin //
translated: Desire is inferred from the body,üîΩas if it were a body, sense-faculty, or mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na lus dang dbang po dang blo dag las 'dod chags la sogs pa rjes su dpog pa bzhin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na lus dang dbang po dang blo dag las 'dod chags la sogs pa rjes su dpog pa bzhin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Desire, etc., are inferred from the body, sense-faculty, or mind, as if they were a body, sense-faculty, or mind.

original: 'di ni rgyu ma tshogs pa las rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes gang brjod pa de sgrub pas 'dod chags kyi rgyu bshad pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu ma tshogs pa las rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes gang brjod pa de sgrub pas 'dod chags kyi rgyu bshad pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The cause of desire is explained by the word ‚Äúbecause,‚Äù since it was said that desire is inferred from the collection of causes.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa khong khro ba dang nga rgyal la sogs pa gang dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa khong khro ba dang nga rgyal la sogs pa gang dag yin pa ste /
translated: Desire, etc., are anger, pride, etc.

original: de dag ni bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
translated: They are preceded by the adherence to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: 'o zhes bya bar rtogs pa ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa phung po mang po las tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o zhes bya bar rtogs pa ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa phung po mang po las tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The understanding of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is different from the many aggregates such as consciousness,

original: nga'i rnam par shes pa zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga'i rnam par shes pa zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is understood as ‚Äúmy consciousness.‚Äù

original: de ni rnam par ma brtags pa yin pa'i phyir bdag go snyam du 'du shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam par ma brtags pa yin pa'i phyir bdag go snyam du 'du shes pa yin no //
translated: It is the notion that ‚ÄúI am‚Äù because it is not analyzed.

original: de la yang rtogs pa gzhan gyi yul yin pa dgag pa'i don du rtogs pa de nyid rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis mngon par zhen pa zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la yang rtogs pa gzhan gyi yul yin pa dgag pa'i don du rtogs pa de nyid rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis mngon par zhen pa zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: In order to refute the object of another understanding, that understanding is called ‚Äúadherence to the nature of understanding.‚Äù

original: de nges pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / de'i tshul nyid kyang de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nges pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / de'i tshul nyid kyang de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is so called because it is the nature of certainty and because it is the very mode of that understanding.

original: bdag ni med pa'i phyir de ni 'ga'i yang sngon du 'gro ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang de rtogs pa yin pa des na de ltar bkod do //
analyzed: bdag ni med pa'i phyir de ni 'ga'i yang sngon du 'gro ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang de rtogs pa yin pa des na de ltar bkod do //
translated: Since the self does not exist, it is not the antecedent of anything. However, it is presented in this way because it is understood.

original: de la phan 'dogs pa la de'i yin par rtogs pa ni bdag gir mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de la phan 'dogs pa la de'i yin par rtogs pa ni bdag gir mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: The understanding of ‚Äúmine‚Äù is adherence to ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: de yang 'ga' zhig gis chung zhig skyed pa med par 'gas kyang cung zad kyang phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir bdag gi ba med pas de sngon du 'gro ba ci yang med pa'i phyir rtogs pa nyid sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'ga' zhig gis chung zhig skyed pa med par 'gas kyang cung zad kyang phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir bdag gi ba med pas de sngon du 'gro ba ci yang med pa'i phyir rtogs pa nyid sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Some say: Since the self does not generate even the slightest benefit, and since the self does not benefit even the slightest bit, then since there is no self, there is nothing that precedes it. Therefore realization precedes it.

original: gal te yang 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bdag tu lta ba 'jug pa 'di'o zhes thog ma med pa can yin pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis 'di rtogs par nus pa ma yin pa de lta na yang rigs pas rtogs par @60b
analyzed: gal te yang 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bdag tu lta ba 'jug pa 'di'o zhes thog ma med pa can yin pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis 'di rtogs par nus pa ma yin pa de lta na yang rigs pas rtogs par @60b
translated: If attachment and so on and the view of the self are engaged in this way, since they are beginningless, they cannot be understood through forward or reverse order. Even so, they can be understood through reasoning.

original: nus pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni nyes pa thams cad ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nus pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni nyes pa thams cad ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The statement all faults arise from the view of the self explains this.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang des skyed pa'i bdag gir lta ba ni phyin ci log pa'i yid la byed pa yin la de gnyis las ni 'dod chags la sogs pa skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang des skyed pa'i bdag gir lta ba ni phyin ci log pa'i yid la byed pa yin la de gnyis las ni 'dod chags la sogs pa skyed pa yin no //
translated: The view of the self and the view of mine generated by that are mistaken mental activity and attachment and so on are generated from those two.

original: 'di ni le'u gnyis par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni le'u gnyis par bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is explained in the second chapter of the Abhidharmako≈õa:üîΩAll faults arise from the view of the self.

original: 'di ni rigs pa tsam gyis grub par brjod pa'i phyir rgyur bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa tsam gyis grub par brjod pa'i phyir rgyur bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught as a cause in order to demonstrate that this is established by mere reasoning.

original: de lta na ni 'o na de tsam las skye ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na de tsam las skye ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: If that is so, then they are not causes of attachment, etc. because they arise from just that.

original: ma tshang ba yang ma yin te nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa dag na de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma tshang ba yang ma yin te nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa dag na de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Nor are they incomplete, because they exist in the sphere of infinite space, etc.

original: lus la sogs pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbody, etc.‚Äù is stated.

original: sngar brjod pa ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: sngar brjod pa ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúpreviously stated‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: des na de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'phen pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'phen pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúfor that reason‚Äù is implied.

original: des na 'di ltar 'brel te gang gi phyir ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bdag gir mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa de'i phyir lus la sogs pa rgyu'i dngos por mi 'thad pa dag kyang rgyu nyid du khas blangs nas rgyu nyid yin
analyzed: des na 'di ltar 'brel te gang gi phyir ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bdag gir mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa de'i phyir lus la sogs pa rgyu'i dngos por mi 'thad pa dag kyang rgyu nyid du khas blangs nas rgyu nyid yin
translated: The connection is as follows: because attachment, etc. are preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù therefore, even though body, etc. are not tenable as causes, they are accepted as causes.

original: du zin kyang bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pas stong pa 'ba' zhig pa rnams la ni nus pa med do //
analyzed: du zin kyang bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pas stong pa 'ba' zhig pa rnams la ni nus pa med do //
translated: But they are not capable of producing the effect, because they are empty, that is, devoid of self and what belongs to self.

original: kyang gi sgra ni sdud pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni sdud pa'i don yin la /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúonly.‚Äù

original: pas kyi sgra ni gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: pas kyi sgra ni gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is the reason.

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: Thus, the meaning is this:

original: 'di ltar bshad pa las 'ba' zhig pa rnams rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa lhag ma dang ldan pa'i phyir the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bshad pa las 'ba' zhig pa rnams rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa lhag ma dang ldan pa'i phyir the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Since only those are not causes, and since the remainder of the inference is complete, there is doubt.

original: de tsam nyid du rgyu yin na ni rung ba nyid du nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tsam nyid du rgyu yin na ni rung ba nyid du nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were causes only to that extent, then they would be ascertained as suitable.

original: des na 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dod pa la lus la sogs pa las 'dod chags rjes su dpag gam 'dod chags skyed par rung ba rjes su dpog kyang rung khyad par 'ga' yang med de gnyis ka ltar yang skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dod pa la lus la sogs pa las 'dod chags rjes su dpag gam 'dod chags skyed par rung ba rjes su dpog kyang rung khyad par 'ga' yang med de gnyis ka ltar yang skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, whether one infers the absence of attachment to the body, etc., or infers the suitability of generating attachment, there is no difference, because there is a fault in both cases.

original: rgyu mtshang ba las ni mi rtogs par 'gyur gyi 'bras bu la the tshom za ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshang ba las ni mi rtogs par 'gyur gyi 'bras bu la the tshom za ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that one doubts the effect, but that one does not understand the reason.

original: spyang na gnas pa'i sa bon las myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: spyang na gnas pa'i sa bon las myu gu bzhin no //
translated: For example, a sprout is not doubted when it arises from a seed in a good field.

original: rtogs pa yod na yang rjes su dpag pa lhag ma dang ldan pa'i phyir the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa yod na yang rjes su dpag pa lhag ma dang ldan pa'i phyir the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Even if one understands, one doubts because of the remainder of the inference.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ma mthong bas ni rjes su dpag pa lhag ma dang ldan pa yin la de lta na yang the tshom za ba yin no //üîΩ'dod chags la sogs pas stong @61a * //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ma mthong bas ni rjes su dpag pa lhag ma dang ldan pa yin la de lta na yang the tshom za ba yin no // 'dod chags la sogs pas stong @61a * //
translated: One doubts because of the remainder of the inference, since one has not seen the engagement in the discordant side.

original: pa'i rdo ba la sogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la //
analyzed: pa'i rdo ba la sogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la //
translated: The stone, etc., which are empty of attachment, etc., are the discordant side.

original: de dag la yang lus la sogs pa ma mthong ba des na gang gi tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug ba ma mthong ba la brten nas 'dod chags sgrub pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa 'god pa de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa'i nges par
analyzed: de dag la yang lus la sogs pa ma mthong ba des na gang gi tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug ba ma mthong ba la brten nas 'dod chags sgrub pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa 'god pa de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa'i nges par
translated: Since one has not seen the body, etc., in them, when one posits the body, etc., in order to prove attachment, etc., on the basis of not seeing the engagement in the discordant side, then one doubts the certainty of the exclusion from the discordant side.

original: byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because they are not the cause.

original: de dag 'dod chags med pa la ma mthong yang de tsam gyis de med pa la med pa kho na ni ma yin te /üîΩbdag la sogs par mngon par zhen pa yang de la med pa'i phyir de med pas 'dod chags med dam lus med pas med pa yin zhes ldog pa mi nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag 'dod chags med pa la ma mthong yang de tsam gyis de med pa la med pa kho na ni ma yin te / bdag la sogs par mngon par zhen pa yang de la med pa'i phyir de med pas 'dod chags med dam lus med pas med pa yin zhes ldog pa mi nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though they do not see the absence of attachment in those who are without attachment, it is not the case that the absence of attachment is not established merely by that.üîΩBecause the absence of attachment is not established by the absence of the body, since the absence of attachment is not ascertained as absent due to the absence of the body, because the absence of attachment is not ascertained as absent due to the absence of the body.

original: gal te gang gis bdag la sogs par mngon par zhen pa la yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa ma tshogs pa yin par rjod pa lus la sogs pa rgyu nyid kyis ni rjes su dpog par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te gang gis bdag la sogs par mngon par zhen pa la yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa ma tshogs pa yin par rjod pa lus la sogs pa rgyu nyid kyis ni rjes su dpog par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If you say that the body, etc., are not the cause of the attachment to self, etc., because they are not the cause of the attachment to self, etc., then the body, etc., are not asserted to be the cause of the attachment to self, etc., because they are the cause.

original: 'on kyang rjes su 'gro ldog grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rjes su 'gro ldog grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, they are inferred because of the establishment of concomitance and reverse concomitance.üîΩEven so, the existence and nonexistence of the body, etc., in the similar and dissimilar classes are established.

original: de lta na yang 'di dag mthun pa'i phyogs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pa grub pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di dag mthun pa'i phyogs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pa grub pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: No, they are not.

original: de la yang ldog pa nges pa med pa'i phyir te sems med pa dag lus med pa bzhin du bdag la sogs par mngon par zhen pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang ldog pa nges pa med pa'i phyir te sems med pa dag lus med pa bzhin du bdag la sogs par mngon par zhen pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no certainty in the reversal of that, just as the non-existent body is non-existent, so too the non-existent self and so on are not established.

original: des na bdag la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa med pas sems med pa rnams la 'dod chags la sogs pa med pa yin nam 'on te lus med pa yin zhes nges pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na bdag la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa med pas sems med pa rnams la 'dod chags la sogs pa med pa yin nam 'on te lus med pa yin zhes nges pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, since there is no clinging to the self and so on, it is not certain whether there is attachment and so on to the non-existent or whether there is no attachment to the non-existent.

original: gsum du ma 'dus pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du zhes smos so //
analyzed: gsum du ma 'dus pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du zhes smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate other fallacies that are not included in the three, he says, ‚ÄúLikewise, . . .‚Äù

original: 'di gnyi ga lhag ma dang ldan pa nyid brjod pas rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar rgyu ma tshogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam gyis 'bras bu rjes su dpog pa tshad ma ltar snang ba yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu tsam la ma
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga lhag ma dang ldan pa nyid brjod pas rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar rgyu ma tshogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam gyis 'bras bu rjes su dpog pa tshad ma ltar snang ba yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu tsam la ma
translated: Since both of these are understood by the statement of the remainder, just as the non-collection of causes is not a valid means of cognition, because the mere non-seeing of the opposite is not a valid means of cognition, in the same way, the mere effect is not a valid means of cognition.

original: mthong ba thun mong gi 'bras bu dmigs pa las gtan tshigs shes pa yang tshad ma ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba thun mong gi 'bras bu dmigs pa las gtan tshigs shes pa yang tshad ma ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: The inference of the existence of the mind from the effect which is common to both is also a fallacious inference, like the inference of the existence of the sense-faculties.

original: dpe ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dpe ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the example?üîΩThe author replies:

original: tshig las zhes smos so //
analyzed: tshig las zhes smos so //
translated: From the words.

original: don 'di yin te //
analyzed: don 'di yin te //
translated: The meaning is this:

original: gzhan dag tshig las la lar 'dod chags rjes su dpog pa de ni gtan tshigs gsum du gtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag tshig las la lar 'dod chags rjes su dpog pa de ni gtan tshigs gsum du gtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: In some places, others infer the existence of desire from the words. This is not included in the three types of inference.

original: gal te yang @61b sems med pa dag la 'dod chags med na tshig ma mthong ba'i phyir 'di la 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'khrul pa yin pa de lta na yang tshig thun mong gi 'bras bu yin pas 'di mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba yin no
analyzed: gal te yang @61b sems med pa dag la 'dod chags med na tshig ma mthong ba'i phyir 'di la 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'khrul pa yin pa de lta na yang tshig thun mong gi 'bras bu yin pas 'di mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba yin no
translated: If desire does not exist in those without mind, then since the words are not seen, this is a fallacious inference of the effect. Even so, since the words are the effect of something common, it is not seen in the discordant class.

original: // tshig ni /
analyzed: // tshig ni /
translated: The words

original: brjod par 'dod pa tsam khyad par med pas bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa tsam khyad par med pas bskyed pa yin te /
translated: are produced by the mere desire to express, without distinction.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa 'am 'dod chags kyis stong pa yang blangs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa 'am 'dod chags kyis stong pa yang blangs te /
translated: Whether they are accompanied by desire or empty of desire,

original: 'di ni des skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni des skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they are produced by that.

original: des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la brjod par 'dod pa tsam med pas tshig ma mthong pa yin nam 'dod chags med pas yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la brjod par 'dod pa tsam med pas tshig ma mthong pa yin nam 'dod chags med pas yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since there is no desire to speak of the discordant side, is it because the words are not seen or because there is no attachment?

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs srid pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to infer a cause from a non-effect.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid las rgyu ma yin pa rjes su dpog pa bzhin du ldog pa ma nges pas na ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin te thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa dag bzhin du nges pa med pa las
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid las rgyu ma yin pa rjes su dpog pa bzhin du ldog pa ma nges pas na ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin te thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa dag bzhin du nges pa med pa las
translated: Therefore, just as one infers non-causality from non-effect, since the negation is not ascertained, it is a fallacious reason of non-ascertainment, like the common and uncommon.

original: kyang ma nges pa nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyang ma nges pa nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the lack of ascertainment, it becomes non-ascertainment.

original: 'bras bu'i spyi nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir g-yo ba dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i spyi nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir g-yo ba dang zhes smos so //
translated: In order to establish the general nature of the effect, movement is mentioned.

original: gang gi phyir bya ba dang tshig la sogs pa ni 'dod chags kho na'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bya ba dang tshig la sogs pa ni 'dod chags kho na'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: Because action, speech, etc. are not only the effects of attachment.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni khong khro ba la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni khong khro ba la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: By mentioning etc. anger and so on are included.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yod pa nyid na tshig gi rang bzhin sngon med mthong ba ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yod pa nyid na tshig gi rang bzhin sngon med mthong ba ni ma yin te ;
translated: If desire, etc. exist, the nature of the words is not seen to be non-existent,

original: 'dod chags med par yang yod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags med par yang yod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that they exist even without desire.

original: gal te tshig 'dod chags kyi 'bras bu ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te tshig 'dod chags kyi 'bras bu ma yin na /
translated: If the words are not the effect of desire,

original: 'o na de lan cig kyang 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na de lan cig kyang 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: then they will not occur even once,

original: rgyu ma yin pa las lan cig kyang mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa las lan cig kyang mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because what is not a cause does not occur even once.

original: brjod par 'dod pa spyi'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa spyi'i zhes smos so //
translated: The words are said to be the effect of desire in general.

original: 'dod chags ni brjod par 'dod pa tsam gyi rgyu rkyen yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni brjod par 'dod pa tsam gyi rgyu rkyen yin la /
translated: Desire is the cause of the mere desire to speak.

original: brjod par 'dod pa de yang rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa de yang rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: That desire to speak is consciousness.

original: de yang skad cig so sor 'dod chags la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid khyad par du ma'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de yang skad cig so sor 'dod chags la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid khyad par du ma'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: And that is the nature of many differences, the nature of existing and not existing in each moment, desire, etc.

original: de nas rang bzhin 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa las 'byung zhing res 'ga' ni zhe sdang dang ldan pa las res 'ga' de gnyi ga dang bral ba las yin pas khyad par las tshig 'khrul pa yin yang 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir 'dod pa
analyzed: de nas rang bzhin 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa las 'byung zhing res 'ga' ni zhe sdang dang ldan pa las res 'ga' de gnyi ga dang bral ba las yin pas khyad par las tshig 'khrul pa yin yang 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir 'dod pa
translated: Then, the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is a verbal error for ‚Äúdistinction,‚Äù since it arises from consciousness that is sometimes associated with attachment, sometimes with aversion, and sometimes with neither.

original: tsam rgyu yin par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tsam rgyu yin par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: But since there is no error, it is understood that mere desire is the cause.

original: du ba las me tsam nyid bzhin no //üîΩ'dod chags @62a * //
analyzed: du ba las me tsam nyid bzhin no // 'dod chags @62a * //
translated: Just as fire is inferred from smoke,üîΩbut not mere smoke.

original: tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: Desire is not mere desire.

original: des na ji ltar du ba mthong ba las lo ma las byung ba'i me nyid rjes su dpog pa ma yin pa de bzhin du tshig las kyang 'dod chags nyid ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang brjod par 'dod pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: des na ji ltar du ba mthong ba las lo ma las byung ba'i me nyid rjes su dpog pa ma yin pa de bzhin du tshig las kyang 'dod chags nyid ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang brjod par 'dod pa tsam yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as fire is not inferred from seeing smoke as arising from leaves, so also desire is not inferred from the word, but rather mere desire to speak.

original: ci ste yang 'dod chags brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad bar ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang brjod par 'dod pa nyid 'dod chags yin no //
analyzed: ci ste yang 'dod chags brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad bar ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang brjod par 'dod pa nyid 'dod chags yin no //
translated: But if the distinction of desire to speak is not desire, then desire to speak itself is desire.

original: des na 'dod chags rjes su dpog pa nyid las 'dod chags rjes su dpog par 'grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'dod chags rjes su dpog pa nyid las 'dod chags rjes su dpog par 'grub bo zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since desire is inferred from the one who desires, the one who desires is established by the inference of desire.

original: dogs pa 'di gal te de nyid ces bya bas bsu nas 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas dogs pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: dogs pa 'di gal te de nyid ces bya bas bsu nas 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas dogs pa sel bar byed do //
translated: If you anticipate this qualm with the words ‚Äúin reality,‚Äù then you dispel the qualm with the words ‚Äúbecause of desire.‚Äù

original: brjod par 'dod pa tsam yin na 'dod chags yin /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa tsam yin na 'dod chags yin /
translated: If desire is mere expression, then desire is the nature of the one who desires.

original: don dam par 'dod chags de'i rang bzhin can yin pa'am brjod par 'dod pa don dam par 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin can yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: don dam par 'dod chags de'i rang bzhin can yin pa'am brjod par 'dod pa don dam par 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin can yin par 'gyur /
translated: In reality, either desire would be the nature of the one who desires or the one who desires would be the nature of desire.

original: rtogs pa snga ma ni re zhig mi 'thad do zhes brjod pa ni 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: rtogs pa snga ma ni re zhig mi 'thad do zhes brjod pa ni 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no ;
translated: The former is not tenable, as stated in the words ‚Äúbecause of desire.‚Äù

original: / brjod par 'dod pa tsam tshig las rjes su dpog pa na 'dod chags dang bral ba la de dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin sdud pas ni cung zad kyang gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / brjod par 'dod pa tsam tshig las rjes su dpog pa na 'dod chags dang bral ba la de dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin sdud pas ni cung zad kyang gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If desire is inferred from mere expression, then the one who is free from desire would not be harmed in the slightest by the contradiction of that nature.

original: mi 'dod pa grub na ni gnod par 'gyur gyi 'dod pa thob kyang gnod pa'i don du 'gyur ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa grub na ni gnod par 'gyur gyi 'dod pa thob kyang gnod pa'i don du 'gyur ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: If one does not obtain what one wants, one is harmed. But there is no harm in obtaining what one wants.

original: 'on te yang 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de tsam gyi rang gi ngo bo brjod par 'dod pa yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te yang 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de tsam gyi rang gi ngo bo brjod par 'dod pa yin par 'dod na /
translated: If one maintains that the nature of desire is just that nature which is desired,

original: de bsal ba'i phyir 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin bstan nas 'dod pa'i rang bzhin de las bzlog par brjod pa ni 'dod chags ni zhes bya ba nas snying rje la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin bstan nas 'dod pa'i rang bzhin de las bzlog par brjod pa ni 'dod chags ni zhes bya ba nas snying rje la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: then in order to refute that, the nature of desire is taught, and the nature of desire is said to be the opposite of that nature which is desired, from ‚Äúdesire is the attachment to one‚Äôs own pleasure‚Äù up to ‚Äúcompassion, etc.‚Äù

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The dharmas with outflows are those with afflictions.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga brjod do //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga brjod do //
translated: The five appropriative aggregates are described.

original: de dag kyang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyi sdug bsngal gcig pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyi sdug bsngal gcig pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: They are the nature of the suffering of suffering, as will be explained.

original: de dag la sems kyi mngon par zhen pa chags pa ni 'dod chags yin par smra'o //
analyzed: de dag la sems kyi mngon par zhen pa chags pa ni 'dod chags yin par smra'o //
translated: Desire is said to be the attachment of the mind to them.

original: de la sems kyi chags pa bral bar mi 'dod pa de dang gcig tu mi 'bral bar dga' ba de ni chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la sems kyi chags pa bral bar mi 'dod pa de dang gcig tu mi 'bral bar dga' ba de ni chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who does not wish to be free from the mind that is attached to that, and who delights in not being separated from it, is attached.

original: gal te sdug bsngal ba'i len pa'i phung po rnams la chags par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal ba'i len pa'i phung po rnams la chags par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that one is not attached to the suffering aggregates that are appropriated?

original: sdug bsngal ni mngon par dga' ba'i gnas ma yin pa'i phyir @62b ro zhes dogs na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni mngon par dga' ba'i gnas ma yin pa'i phyir @62b ro zhes dogs na /
translated: Since suffering is not a basis for delight, it is not a cause of attachment.

original: rgyu'i khyad par ston par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par ston par byed do //
translated: The author shows the distinction of the cause.

original: lta ba'i sgra ni rtag pa la sogs pa so sor 'brel to //
analyzed: lta ba'i sgra ni rtag pa la sogs pa so sor 'brel to //
translated: The word ‚Äúview‚Äù is connected with each of the terms ‚Äúeternity‚Äù and so on.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po rnams la yang bde bar lta bas 'phangs pa mi 'bral bar 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po rnams la yang bde bar lta bas 'phangs pa mi 'bral bar 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: One is attached to the contaminated aggregates because one views them as happiness and one desires not to be separated from them.

original: des na sdug bsngal ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa nyid kyis ni mngon par chags pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa nyid kyis ni mngon par chags pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that one is not attached to suffering because one understands it as it really is.

original: 'on kyang bde ba nyid du phyin ci log pa las yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bde ba nyid du phyin ci log pa las yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: But it is said that one is attached because of the error that views suffering as happiness.

original: 'di ni rtag par lta bas 'phangs pa yang yin te mthong ba'i dngos po 'brel par rtogs pa med par bde ba nyid med pa'i phyir de srid gcig pa nyid du rtogs pas mngon par zhen pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'di ni rtag par lta bas 'phangs pa yang yin te mthong ba'i dngos po 'brel par rtogs pa med par bde ba nyid med pa'i phyir de srid gcig pa nyid du rtogs pas mngon par zhen pa yin no ;
translated: This is also projected by the view of permanence, because without realizing the connection between the seen thing and the present thing, there is no pleasure, and one conceives of them as being the same.

original: / de bzhin du rang gi bdag nyid la 'bras bu rtsom pa po dang 'bras bu'i longs spyod pa po'i gnas skabs gnyis gcig pa nyid du mi bzung bar 'bras bu sgrub byed la mngon par zhen pa med la /
analyzed: / de bzhin du rang gi bdag nyid la 'bras bu rtsom pa po dang 'bras bu'i longs spyod pa po'i gnas skabs gnyis gcig pa nyid du mi bzung bar 'bras bu sgrub byed la mngon par zhen pa med la /
translated: Similarly, one should not conceive of the agent of the effect and the experiencer of the effect as being the same in terms of their own nature, and one should not conceive of the effect as being produced.

original: de lta bu yang bdag ces brjod de byed pa po dang za ba po'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu yang bdag ces brjod de byed pa po dang za ba po'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is also called the self, because it has the character of being the agent and the experiencer.

original: de yang nga'o zhes phung po lnga las tha dad par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang nga'o zhes phung po lnga las tha dad par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: And that is conceived of as being separate from the five aggregates, as in ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: mngon las phung po lnga po dag las bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa zhes tha snyad du byed pa ni sgro btags pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir te nya phyis la dngul du sgro btags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon las phung po lnga po dag las bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa zhes tha snyad du byed pa ni sgro btags pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir te nya phyis la dngul du sgro btags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The Abhidharmako≈õa declares, ‚ÄúThe self and mine are the objects of the view of the self and clinging to the belief in a self.‚Äù

original: 'dod chags ni bdag gir lta bas zhugs pa yang yin te nga'o zhes bya bas de 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni bdag gir lta bas zhugs pa yang yin te nga'o zhes bya bas de 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Attachment is also engaged by the view of mine because it engages the self through the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: bdag la brten pa'i phan pa sgrub par byed pa bdag gi don gyi dngos po gzhan nyid bdag gi yin par brjod kyi bdag po'i dbang du gyur pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag la brten pa'i phan pa sgrub par byed pa bdag gi don gyi dngos po gzhan nyid bdag gi yin par brjod kyi bdag po'i dbang du gyur pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: The self is the basis of the self‚Äôs benefit, and that which is other than the self is said to be mine, but it is not that it is the self‚Äôs property.

original: des na bdag po gzhan dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na bdag po gzhan dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the self is associated with another, that is, mine.

original: des na de ltar don mi rtag pa dang bdag kyang stong pa nyid dang / phung po rnams kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pas na rang gyi bdag nyid la gnas pa rtogs pa med pa ni 'bras bu sgrub pa la btang snyoms nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar don mi rtag pa dang bdag kyang stong pa nyid dang / phung po rnams kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pas na rang gyi bdag nyid la gnas pa rtogs pa med pa ni 'bras bu sgrub pa la btang snyoms nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning is that impermanence and selflessness are equivalent, and since the aggregates are the nature of a mere continuum of causes and effects, they are not established in their own nature.üîΩTherefore, attachment is preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine.‚ÄùüîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.

original: des na 'dod chags ni bdag gir mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid do //
analyzed: des na 'dod chags ni bdag gir mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid do //
translated: If it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.

original: gal te ma rig pas 'phangs pa ma yin pa'i yon tan la mngon par zhen pa yin gyi bdag tu lta bas 'jug pa ni ma yin no zhe na /üîΩde lta na yang 'o na zla ba gnyis la sogs pa shes pa yang 'dod chags su 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pas 'phangs pa ma yin pa'i yon tan la mngon par zhen pa yin gyi bdag tu lta bas 'jug pa ni ma yin no zhe na / de lta na yang 'o na zla ba gnyis la sogs pa shes pa yang 'dod chags su 'gyur ba ste /
translated: If it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.üîΩIf it is not preceded by manifest clinging to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù then attachment would not occur.

original: de ma @63a * //
analyzed: de ma @63a * //
translated: If it

original: rig pa la brten pa'i phyir dang / gnod par byed pa skyes pa'i snga rol du bden pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa la brten pa'i phyir dang / gnod par byed pa skyes pa'i snga rol du bden pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is based on knowledge, and because prior to the arising of the afflictions, one is not attached to the unreal qualities of the real nature.

original: rang gi bdag nyid la gnas pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa'i bsam pas ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po la 'jug pa bzhin du gang du yang 'dod chags kyi rgyu mtshan nyid las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la gnas pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa'i bsam pas ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po la 'jug pa bzhin du gang du yang 'dod chags kyi rgyu mtshan nyid las mi 'da'o //
translated: Just as one engages with contaminated things with the intention of enjoying the fruits that abide in one's own nature, one does not go beyond the characteristics of the causes of attachment anywhere.

original: de nas de ltar 'dod chags kyi rang gi ngo bo bstan nas brjod par 'dod pa nyid de las bzlog par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nas de ltar 'dod chags kyi rang gi ngo bo bstan nas brjod par 'dod pa nyid de las bzlog par brjod pa ni /
translated: Then, having thus explained the nature of attachment, in order to express what is intended, he says:

original: snying rje la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Compassion and so forth...

original: snying rje la sogs ba ni bdag la sogs par mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin no //
analyzed: snying rje la sogs ba ni bdag la sogs par mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin no //
translated: Compassion and so forth do not have the prior going of attachment to self and so forth.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni byams pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni byams pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word and so forth includes love and so forth.

original: gal te brjod par 'dod pa ni de lta bu yin no zhes ji skad brjod pa'i tshal gyis brjod par bya ba ma yin nam snying rje la sogs pa ci ste brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te brjod par 'dod pa ni de lta bu yin no zhes ji skad brjod pa'i tshal gyis brjod par bya ba ma yin nam snying rje la sogs pa ci ste brjod ce na /
translated: If one wishes to speak, is it not the case that one should speak in the manner in which one wishes to speak? Why speak of compassion, etc.?

original: bden te 'on kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba la smra ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid ni med pa ma yin la smra ba gzhan gyi don yin pa'i phyir de'i don 'grub pa'i bsam pas de brjod par 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba la smra ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid ni med pa ma yin la smra ba gzhan gyi don yin pa'i phyir de'i don 'grub pa'i bsam pas de brjod par 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is true, but the reason for speaking is not the absence of passion, because speaking is for the benefit of others. Therefore, it is proper to speak with the intention of accomplishing that benefit.

original: des na 'di brjod par 'dod pa nyid ni snying rje'i bdag nyid kho na yin pa des na snying rje'i rang bzhin nyid kyis bstan to //
analyzed: des na 'di brjod par 'dod pa nyid ni snying rje'i bdag nyid kho na yin pa des na snying rje'i rang bzhin nyid kyis bstan to //
translated: Thus, one who wishes to speak is compassionate by nature. Therefore, compassion is taught by its very nature.

original: de lta na 'o na gzhan la phan par sems pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis snying rje nyid tshig gi rgyu yin gyi byams pa la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na gzhan la phan par sems pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis snying rje nyid tshig gi rgyu yin gyi byams pa la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then compassion itself is the reason for speaking, because it has the nature of the desire to benefit others, not love, etc.

original: de dag ni bsam pa'i khyad par tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni bsam pa'i khyad par tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have the nature of mere mental states.

original: des na sogs pa'i sgras ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: des na sogs pa'i sgras ci bya zhe na /
translated: What is the point of the words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù?

original: bden mod kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la yod pa'i byams pa la sogs pa'i sems kyi chos kyang 'dod chags kyi bdag nyid ma yin no zhes brjod pa'i don du de skad brjod do //
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la yod pa'i byams pa la sogs pa'i sems kyi chos kyang 'dod chags kyi bdag nyid ma yin no zhes brjod pa'i don du de skad brjod do //
translated: It is said that the mental phenomena of love, etc. which exist in one who is free from attachment are not of the nature of attachment.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rim pa las brgal te snying rje smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rim pa las brgal te snying rje smos so //
translated: Therefore, compassion is mentioned out of order.

original: ci'i phyir de lta bu ma yin zhe na gzhan du yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de lta bu ma yin zhe na gzhan du yang zhes smos so //
translated: Why is it not so? He says, ‚Äúelsewhere also.‚Äù

original: byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms rnams ni bdag dang bdag gir lta ba la mi ltos par goms pa tsam las 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes le'u gnyis par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms rnams ni bdag dang bdag gir lta ba la mi ltos par goms pa tsam las 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes le'u gnyis par bstan par bya'o //
translated: It will be shown in Chapter Two that love, compassion, joy, and equanimity arise from mere cultivation, without depending on the view of self and mine.

original: goms pa'i rtsa ba can yin yang bdag la sogs par lta bas ma 'phangs pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: goms pa'i rtsa ba can yin yang bdag la sogs par lta bas ma 'phangs pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: But how can they have a root in cultivation and not be projected by the view of self, etc.?

original: de'i rtsa ba can yin yang 'dod chags la sogs @63b pa bzhin du rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir 'bad pas sgrub pa la mi ltos par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba can yin yang 'dod chags la sogs @63b pa bzhin du rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir 'bad pas sgrub pa la mi ltos par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and it would follow that it would operate by its very nature, like attachment and so on, and so it would not depend on being established by effort.

original: de ltar gnas pa ji ltar chags pa smra ba ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa ji ltar chags pa smra ba ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as it is for one who is attached, so it is for one who is free from attachment.

original: 'di gnyis ka brjod par 'dod pa 'dod pa nyid du rtogs pas na brjod par 'dod pa chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba'i khyad par du gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka brjod par 'dod pa 'dod pa nyid du rtogs pas na brjod par 'dod pa chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba'i khyad par du gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since both of these are understood to be the mere desire to speak, the desire to speak is not the basis for distinguishing one who is attached and one who is free from attachment.

original: des na khyad par ni 'bras bu'i spyi las mi rtogs zhes 'chad pa ni tshig tsam las ni ste tshig gi spyi las ni mi rtogs so //
analyzed: des na khyad par ni 'bras bu'i spyi las mi rtogs zhes 'chad pa ni tshig tsam las ni ste tshig gi spyi las ni mi rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, the statement that ‚Äúthe specific property is not understood from the universal of the effect‚Äù is mere verbiage, since it is not understood from the universal of the word.

original: 'on te 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin gyi brjod par 'dod pas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin gyi brjod par 'dod pas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, it is because the desire to speak is confused about the nature of attachment.

original: gang las 'chol bar 'gyur ba ci'i ched du de lta bu ma yin pa de ltar tha snyad byed ce na /
analyzed: gang las 'chol bar 'gyur ba ci'i ched du de lta bu ma yin pa de ltar tha snyad byed ce na /
translated: Why is it that the specific property is not understood from the universal of the effect?

original: bsam pa ni zhes smos so //üîΩ'dod chags dang bral ba chags pa can lta bu'am /
analyzed: bsam pa ni zhes smos so // 'dod chags dang bral ba chags pa can lta bu'am /
translated: The intention is as follows.

original: chags pa can 'dod chags dang bral ba lta bur tha snyad byed pa'i bsam pa mi shes so //
analyzed: chags pa can 'dod chags dang bral ba lta bur tha snyad byed pa'i bsam pa mi shes so //
translated: One does not know the intention of the speaker, whether he is free from attachment or attached, or whether he is attached or free from attachment.

original: de ltar na sgra 'chol ba'i rgyu ni 'dod pa tsam gyi rgyu can nyid yin par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sgra 'chol ba'i rgyu ni 'dod pa tsam gyi rgyu can nyid yin par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the cause of the incoherence of the sound is said to be mere desire.

original: de yang mi shes pas de lta bu'i 'dod pa rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis rtogs pa bsal ba yin no //üîΩgal te yang 'dod pa tsam rgyu yin pa'i phyir sgra'i khyad par sems kyi khyad par la nges pa med pa de lta na yang 'dod chags dang bral ba la smra ba med pa tshad ma gzhan gyis rtogs nas tshig gis 'dod chags rjes su dpog par byed
analyzed: de yang mi shes pas de lta bu'i 'dod pa rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis rtogs pa bsal ba yin no // gal te yang 'dod pa tsam rgyu yin pa'i phyir sgra'i khyad par sems kyi khyad par la nges pa med pa de lta na yang 'dod chags dang bral ba la smra ba med pa tshad ma gzhan gyis rtogs nas tshig gis 'dod chags rjes su dpog par byed
translated: And since that is not known, the understanding that precedes such a desire is eliminated.

original: pa kho na'o //
analyzed: pa kho na'o //
translated: Even if the particular sound is not ascertained in the particular mind because mere desire is the cause, still, when one who is free from attachment speaks, one understands by another means of knowledge and infers attachment from the words.

original: gang gi phyir 'di la rtag par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa dang de'i 'bras bu mtshams mi sbyor bas na smra ba la dgos pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la rtag par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa dang de'i 'bras bu mtshams mi sbyor bas na smra ba la dgos pa med do //
translated: Because there is no realization of permanence in this, there is no purpose in speech, since the means of knowledge and its result are not connected.

original: mtshams sbyor na yang rtag pa nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor na yang rtag pa nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Even if there were a connection, there would be realization of permanence.

original: dogs pa 'di gal te dgos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya bas bsu na ma yin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: dogs pa 'di gal te dgos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya bas bsu na ma yin te zhes smos so //
translated: If this doubt is met by ‚Äúbecause there is no purpose,‚Äù then it is said ‚Äúno.‚Äù

original: dgos pa med pa ma yin te 'dod chags dang bral ba ni gzhan gyi don du smra ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa ma yin te 'dod chags dang bral ba ni gzhan gyi don du smra ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not that there is no purpose, because one who is free from attachment engages in speech for the sake of others.

original: rang gi dgos pa don du gnyer na ni rtag pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur zhing 'bras bu'i don du gzung ba'i sgrub pa la 'jug pas na byed pa po dang spyod pa po dang spyod pa po dang de sngom par yang nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi dgos pa don du gnyer na ni rtag pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur zhing 'bras bu'i don du gzung ba'i sgrub pa la 'jug pas na byed pa po dang spyod pa po dang spyod pa po dang de sngom par yang nges pa yin no //
translated: If one seeks one‚Äôs own purpose, there would be realization of permanence, and one would engage in the means of knowledge for the sake of the result. Therefore, one would be determined as an agent, an experiencer, and one who restrains that.

original: bdag tha dad pa mthong ba med pa ni dar 'dzin pa dang bral zhing don dam par gyur pa'i phung po rnams kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba @64a * //
analyzed: bdag tha dad pa mthong ba med pa ni dar 'dzin pa dang bral zhing don dam par gyur pa'i phung po rnams kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba @64a * //
translated: The non-perception of a separate self is free from grasping at a self, and the aggregates that are ultimate are also the nature of mere dependent origination.üîΩTherefore, the result is not able to appropriate the cause of the aggregates, which is established by other causes, because of being momentary.

original: tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pas na 'bras bu'i rgyu phung po'i tshogs rgyu gzhan gyis nye bar bsgrubs pa gang yin pa 'di skad cig ma nyid kyis 'bras bu bdag gir byed par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhin mthong ba rang giüîΩdon du 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pas na 'bras bu'i rgyu phung po'i tshogs rgyu gzhan gyis nye bar bsgrubs pa gang yin pa 'di skad cig ma nyid kyis 'bras bu bdag gir byed par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhin mthong ba rang gi don du 'jug pa med do //
translated: Therefore, like the four noble truths, there is no engagement for the sake of oneself.üîΩOthers are also like the self, previously empty of connection with the result, later unable to make the result their own.

original: gzhan dag kyang bdag bzhin du sngar 'bras bu dang 'brel pas stong pa phyis 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du bya bar mi nus so zhe na ma yin te dngos po la de ltar yin yang gzhan dag yod pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir brtsams shing rdzogs /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang bdag bzhin du sngar 'bras bu dang 'brel pas stong pa phyis 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du bya bar mi nus so zhe na ma yin te dngos po la de ltar yin yang gzhan dag yod pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir brtsams shing rdzogs /
translated: This is not so, because although things are like that, others are understood to exist.

original: bdag gir yang byas so snyam du rtogs pa'i phyir dang / snying rje can yang de'i don nyid 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gir yang byas so snyam du rtogs pa'i phyir dang / snying rje can yang de'i don nyid 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has the idea that he is the owner, and because the compassionate one engages in that very aim.

original: thar pa'i don la ni gzhan yang bdag nyid bzhin du 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: thar pa'i don la ni gzhan yang bdag nyid bzhin du 'jug par byed do //
translated: And for the sake of liberation, he causes others to engage in it just as he himself does.

original: gal te gzhan la phan btags pas kyang bdag gi don du 'gyur par mi sems pa ni dgos pa med par 'jug pa rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te gzhan la phan btags pas kyang bdag gi don du 'gyur par mi sems pa ni dgos pa med par 'jug pa rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: If one does not think that one‚Äôs own aim is served by helping others, then it is not reasonable to engage in it without a purpose.

original: sems na yang bdag tu rtogs pa 'jug pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no zhes dogs na ma yin no zhes smos so //
analyzed: sems na yang bdag tu rtogs pa 'jug pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no zhes dogs na ma yin no zhes smos so //
translated: But if one does think that, then it is not reasonable, because the idea of self engages.

original: rnam pa thams cad du bdag gi 'bras bu sems pas stong pa gzhan la gnas pa nyid kyi dgos pa 'dod pa'i snying rje can 'jug par 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du bdag gi 'bras bu sems pas stong pa gzhan la gnas pa nyid kyi dgos pa 'dod pa'i snying rje can 'jug par 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reply is ‚ÄúNo,‚Äù because it is reasonable for the compassionate one to engage in the aim of others, who are devoid of the idea of self-interest in every way.

original: gal te phan gdags par bya ba nyid kyis gzhan dag chags pa'i gnas su gyur pas na 'di'i snying rje gang yin pa de nyid 'dod chags su 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te phan gdags par bya ba nyid kyis gzhan dag chags pa'i gnas su gyur pas na 'di'i snying rje gang yin pa de nyid 'dod chags su 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If others are the object of attachment because they are the object of help, then isn‚Äôt his compassion itself attachment?

original: 'dod chags ni chags pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni chags pa yin la /
translated: Attachment is attachment.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan gyi don gtso bor mdzad pas thar pa zhal gyis bzhes pa yang chags pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan gyi don gtso bor mdzad pas thar pa zhal gyis bzhes pa yang chags pa yin te /
translated: The Lord, who makes the welfare of others his principal concern, is also attached, since he has promised to attain liberation.

original: des na rang gi gnyen la chags pa dang sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i chags pa la khyad par ci yod ces dogs pa la 'dod pa yin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: des na rang gi gnyen la chags pa dang sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i chags pa la khyad par ci yod ces dogs pa la 'dod pa yin te zhes smos so //
translated: What is the difference between attachment to one‚Äôs own relatives and attachment to helping all sentient beings?

original: snying rje la 'dod chags zhes zer na 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: snying rje la 'dod chags zhes zer na 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: If you say that compassion is attachment, then it is desire.

original: gal te 'dod na 'o na rtsod pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod na 'o na rtsod pa med do zhe na /
translated: If you admit that, then there is no dispute.

original: rtsod pa med pa ma yin te rang bzhin mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsod pa med pa ma yin te rang bzhin mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is a dispute, because their natures are different.

original: 'di ltar snying rje ni nyes pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar snying rje ni nyes pa med pa yin te /
translated: Compassion is not a fault,

original: 'dod chags bzhin du 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'phen pas sems kyi rgyun nyes par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags bzhin du 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'phen pas sems kyi rgyun nyes par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: because, unlike attachment, it does not lead to a faulty continuum of mind by projecting one into the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: gtan tshigs smras pa ni phyir ci ma log pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs smras pa ni phyir ci ma log pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is given: because it arises from non-error.

original: phyin ci log ni bdag tu 'dzin pa ste de las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log ni bdag tu 'dzin pa ste de las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not arise from the self-habit, which is the root of the inverted views.

original: des na de @64b ltar snying rje 'dod chags dang rang bzhin mi 'dra bar brjod pa na snying rje ni 'dod chags yin no zhes snying rje la 'dod chags kyi sgra 'jug pa tsam zhig lus pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de @64b ltar snying rje 'dod chags dang rang bzhin mi 'dra bar brjod pa na snying rje ni 'dod chags yin no zhes snying rje la 'dod chags kyi sgra 'jug pa tsam zhig lus pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when compassion is said to be unlike attachment, the only thing left is the mere application of the term ‚Äúattachment‚Äù to compassion.

original: de la yang 'di 'dod par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang 'di 'dod par brjod pa yin no //
translated: And that is what is asserted here.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par nges par ming ni mi dgag go zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par nges par ming ni mi dgag go zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the name is not refuted in the Ascertainment.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i rtsa ba can ma yin pa'i phyir snying rje ni 'khor ba 'phen pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i rtsa ba can ma yin pa'i phyir snying rje ni 'khor ba 'phen pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Compassion is not the cause of projecting samsara, because it does not have the root of the self-habit.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis rang dbang nyid du 'jug pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa skye ba na srid pa dang las srid pa 'phen pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis rang dbang nyid du 'jug pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa skye ba na srid pa dang las srid pa 'phen pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the cause of projecting existence and karma, because it is the cause of the ripening of karma that operates independently, as will be explained.

original: bdag tu lta ba zad na ni 'bras bu sems pa med pa'i phyir mi 'jug pa'i las rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba zad na ni 'bras bu sems pa med pa'i phyir mi 'jug pa'i las rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: If the view of self is exhausted, then it is not the cause of the maturation of non-engagement karma, because there is no intention of result.

original: des na 'dod chags bzhin du snying rje nyes pa byed pa ma yin pas nyes pa byed pa med do //
analyzed: des na 'dod chags bzhin du snying rje nyes pa byed pa ma yin pas nyes pa byed pa med do //
translated: Therefore, like attachment, compassion is not a fault, so there is no fault.

original: ji ltar snying rje phyin ci log las ma byung /
analyzed: ji ltar snying rje phyin ci log las ma byung /
translated: How is compassion not arisen from error?

original: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi sdug bsngal mi bzod pa'i rnam pa can gyis sems kyi khyad par de gsal bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid ni snying rjer 'dod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi sdug bsngal mi bzod pa'i rnam pa can gyis sems kyi khyad par de gsal bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid ni snying rjer 'dod do //
translated: Because that specific mind which has the aspect of not tolerating the suffering of others is asserted as compassion, which has the aspect of desiring to clarify.

original: des na bdag gis 'di dag sdug bsngal las bsgral bar bya'o zhes 'di la bdag tu mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na bdag gis 'di dag sdug bsngal las bsgral bar bya'o zhes 'di la bdag tu mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, thinking ‚ÄúI will liberate these from suffering,‚Äù one becomes fixated on self.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i sems can la dmigs pa'i rnam pa can gyi snying rje nyid kyis ni sdug bsngal bzlog pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i sems can la dmigs pa'i rnam pa can gyi snying rje nyid kyis ni sdug bsngal bzlog pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The compassion that has the aspect of observing suffering sentient beings does not itself avert suffering.

original: 'on kyang 'di 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: However, it is the engagement of that.

original: de yang nga'o snyam par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang nga'o snyam par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the realization of ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: des na 'dod pa dang bcas pa bar du zhugs shing mthar 'bras bu dmigs pa gcig tu rtogs shing sdug bsngal bzlog pa la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: des na 'dod pa dang bcas pa bar du zhugs shing mthar 'bras bu dmigs pa gcig tu rtogs shing sdug bsngal bzlog pa la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Thus, with desire intervening, the three are realized as one effect, and one engages in averting suffering.

original: gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable in any other way.

original: dmigs pa 'jug pa'am 'jug pa 'bras bu dang ma 'brel par ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa 'jug pa'am 'jug pa 'bras bu dang ma 'brel par ma yin no //
translated: The object is not engaged without engagement being related to the effect.

original: des na gsum po 'di gcig tu rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gsum po 'di gcig tu rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, these three are realized as one.

original: des na gal te 'di mi rtag pa yin yang rtag pa gzhan dang 'brel pas rtag par rtogs pa na bdag gzhan rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gal te 'di mi rtag pa yin yang rtag pa gzhan dang 'brel pas rtag par rtogs pa na bdag gzhan rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, if this is impermanent but is realized as permanent because it is related to another permanent entity, then self and other are realized.

original: bdag tu rtogs pa dang bral ba la yang gnas gnas skabs 'di gsum rtogs pas gcig tu mtshams sbyor ba ni 'di bdag tu rtogs pa nyid gzhan du brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag tu rtogs pa dang bral ba la yang gnas gnas skabs 'di gsum rtogs pas gcig tu mtshams sbyor ba ni 'di bdag tu rtogs pa nyid gzhan du brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even when free from the realization of self, these three states are realized, and the connection of one to another is said to be the realization of self.

original: rnam pa thams cad du gcig tu sems pa med par ni snying rje can 'jug par mi 'thad do zhe na /üîΩdogs @65a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gcig tu sems pa med par ni snying rje can 'jug par mi 'thad do zhe na / dogs @65a * //
translated: But it is not tenable that the compassionate one engages without a mind that is one in all aspects.

original: pa 'di bsu nas snying rje zhes smos so //
analyzed: pa 'di bsu nas snying rje zhes smos so //
translated: This doubt is anticipated and addressed by the statement ‚ÄúCompassion.‚Äù

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa med kyang sems can sdug bsngal ba mthong bas de mi bzod pa'i rnam pa can sdug bsngal de bsal ba'i bsam pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa med kyang sems can sdug bsngal ba mthong bas de mi bzod pa'i rnam pa can sdug bsngal de bsal ba'i bsam pa skye ba yin no //
translated: Even without grasping at self, one sees that sentient beings are suffering, and the compassionate one generates the thought to remove that suffering.

original: 'di ltar sems dang po bskyed pa nas brtsams te snying rje bzhin du bdag med pa yang goms par byed pa de gnyi ga'i bdag tu gyur pa na rgyu 'bras kyi rgyun tsam gyi rang bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga po mthong ba la brtse
analyzed: 'di ltar sems dang po bskyed pa nas brtsams te snying rje bzhin du bdag med pa yang goms par byed pa de gnyi ga'i bdag tu gyur pa na rgyu 'bras kyi rgyun tsam gyi rang bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga po mthong ba la brtse
translated: Thus, beginning from the generation of the first level of the mind of awakening, one cultivates both compassion and selflessness. When both become one‚Äôs nature, one sees the five aggregates of form and so on as the mere continuum of causes and effects.

original: ba'i bdag nyid kyi rigs yang 'jug ste /
analyzed: ba'i bdag nyid kyi rigs yang 'jug ste /
translated: The nature of compassion engages.

original: gnyi ga yang sgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang sgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are cultivated.

original: des na goms pa las bdag med pa ma thong ba la brtse ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyang yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na goms pa las bdag med pa ma thong ba la brtse ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyang yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, through cultivation, even one who has not seen selflessness has compassion.

original: des na sems can gyi sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi khyad par sems can mthong ba tsam gyis snying rje 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: des na sems can gyi sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi khyad par sems can mthong ba tsam gyis snying rje 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the suffering of sentient beings, compassion is engaged by the mere sight of sentient beings, which is a special kind of suffering.

original: sems can mthong ba nyid goms pa las sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can mthong ba nyid goms pa las sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: From the mere sight of sentient beings, compassion is engaged in the aspect of the desire to remove their suffering.

original: gang las dmigs pa tsam gyi rang bzhin snying rje 'jug pa na rtag par 'gyur pa bdag nyid gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bzlog pa'i byed pa por rtogs pa ni ma yin gyi //
analyzed: gang las dmigs pa tsam gyi rang bzhin snying rje 'jug pa na rtag par 'gyur pa bdag nyid gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bzlog pa'i byed pa por rtogs pa ni ma yin gyi //
translated: When compassion is engaged in the nature of mere observation, it is not realized as the permanent agent that removes the suffering of others.

original: 'on kyang sdug bsngal bzlog pa'i bsam pas de zlog par byed pa'i rgyu skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sdug bsngal bzlog pa'i bsam pas de zlog par byed pa'i rgyu skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: However, with the intention to remove suffering, it generates the cause that removes it.

original: de yang chos kyi de kho na 'chad pa'i rang bzhin 'phags pa'i bden ba bzhi ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang chos kyi de kho na 'chad pa'i rang bzhin 'phags pa'i bden ba bzhi ston pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it teaches the reality of phenomena, which is the teaching of the four noble truths.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sems kyi skad cig de nyid la rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sems kyi skad cig de nyid la rtogs pa yin te /
translated: It is realized in that very moment of the mind of cause and effect.

original: de ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has for its object a past or future entity.

original: sngon ma byung ba gzhan dag gzhan nye bar gnas na gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon ma byung ba gzhan dag gzhan nye bar gnas na gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is manifest when another, previously non-existent, entity is present.

original: des na 'dod pa'i bdag nyid kyi sems de nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'am shes nas rgyu rtogs te skad cig gsum pa la brjod par 'dod par 'gyur yang rung ste rnam pa thams cad du gang gis 'di mthong ba'i des rgyu btsalüîΩte de rtogs par bya'o snyam du sems pa ni med kyi 'on kyang mthong ba las rgyu rtogs pa skye la /
analyzed: des na 'dod pa'i bdag nyid kyi sems de nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'am shes nas rgyu rtogs te skad cig gsum pa la brjod par 'dod par 'gyur yang rung ste rnam pa thams cad du gang gis 'di mthong ba'i des rgyu btsal te de rtogs par bya'o snyam du sems pa ni med kyi 'on kyang mthong ba las rgyu rtogs pa skye la /
translated: Thus, the desire to speak, which is of the nature of the cognition of cause and effect, or the cognition of cause, which is the third moment, is not at all the desire to speak that is produced by the cognition of the cause that is sought by the one who sees.

original: de las ni brjod par 'dod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de las ni brjod par 'dod pa nyid yin no //
translated: But the cognition of the cause is produced from the seeing, and from that there is the desire to speak.

original: rgyu rtogs pa mthong ba byed pa mtshams sbyor ba'am /
analyzed: rgyu rtogs pa mthong ba byed pa mtshams sbyor ba'am /
translated: The cognition of the cause is not connected with the seeing that produces it,

original: brjod par 'dod pa la rgyu rtogs pa mtshams sbyor ba yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa la rgyu rtogs pa mtshams sbyor ba yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: nor is the desire to speak connected with the cognition of the cause.

original: don thams cad dmigs pa la dbang 'byor ba rtogs pa don du gnyer yang rtogs @65b pa mi skye na /
