analyzed: don thams cad dmigs pa la dbang 'byor ba rtogs pa don du gnyer yang rtogs @65b pa mi skye na /
translated: If one who seeks to realize the mastery of all objects of knowledge does not generate the realization,

original: de la dbang 'byor pa nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir dran par bya ba 'das pa la mthong ba nyid sngon du byed pa'i bdag nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dbang 'byor pa nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir dran par bya ba 'das pa la mthong ba nyid sngon du byed pa'i bdag nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin no //
translated: then his mastery would be impaired. Therefore, the Omniscient One is the one who has the nature of seeing the past, which is to be remembered.

original: de bas brjod par 'dod pa nyid yin yang gnyen po dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal rig pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas brjod par 'dod pa nyid yin yang gnyen po dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal rig pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, although he wishes to speak, he has the nature of knowing suffering together with its antidote.

original: 'dis ni kha cig na re bcom ldan 'das gsung bar khas len na rnam par rtog pa khas blangs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dis ni kha cig na re bcom ldan 'das gsung bar khas len na rnam par rtog pa khas blangs par 'gyur la /
translated: By this, he rejects the statement of some who say: ‚ÄúIf one accepts that the Lord spoke, then he would have conceptualization.

original: de yang log pa'i shes pa yin no zhes 'dzer bde spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang log pa'i shes pa yin no zhes 'dzer bde spangs pa yin no //
translated: And that is a wrong consciousness.‚Äù

original: de skad du yang snyan dngags pa gang dag bde ba gshegs pa gsung bar gshegs pa gsung bar rtogs pa zhes rgyas par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de skad du yang snyan dngags pa gang dag bde ba gshegs pa gsung bar gshegs pa gsung bar rtogs pa zhes rgyas par brjod pa yin no //
translated: The poet says: ‚ÄúThose who think that the Sugata spoke . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir rtogs par ni nus pa ni sngar rtogs pa'i 'du byed sad pa las rtogs pa don du gnyer ba'i rnam par brtag par bya bar 'gyur bar bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtogs par ni nus pa ni sngar rtogs pa'i 'du byed sad pa las rtogs pa don du gnyer ba'i rnam par brtag par bya bar 'gyur bar bya ba yin na /
translated: Because it is possible to understand that the conceptualization that is to be understood is to be made into an object of the desire to understand through the arousing of previously understood conceptualizations.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa dmigs pa la dbang 'byor pa ni de lta 'gyur bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa dmigs pa la dbang 'byor pa ni de lta 'gyur bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: But the Omniscient One, who is powerful with regard to his object, is not able to do that.

original: des na dran par bya ba 'das pa dang brtag par bya ba ma 'ongs pa la mngon sum nye 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: des na dran par bya ba 'das pa dang brtag par bya ba ma 'ongs pa la mngon sum nye 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, he is directly engaged in the object to be remembered, the past, and in the object to be understood, the future.

original: des na 'di la rnam par rtog pa'i cha 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di la rnam par rtog pa'i cha 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, he has no conceptualization whatsoever.

original: mi bden pa rtogs pa yang yod pa ma yin te thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bden pa rtogs pa yang yod pa ma yin te thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And he does not have a false understanding, because he is omniscient.

original: rnam par rtog pa med par sgra mi sbyor ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med par sgra mi sbyor ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But it is not so, because one does not employ words without conceptualization.

original: brjod bya rjod byed kyi rtog pa med kyang 'di la sgra 'dis rnam par rtog pa 'di skyed do zhes gzhan gyi rgyud la brten pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mngon du byed pa ni gzhan gyi bsam pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod bya rjod byed kyi rtog pa med kyang 'di la sgra 'dis rnam par rtog pa 'di skyed do zhes gzhan gyi rgyud la brten pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mngon du byed pa ni gzhan gyi bsam pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although there is no conceptualization of the expressed and the expresser, the fact of a cause and effect based on another's continuum is manifested, namely, that this sound produces this conceptualization, because it is engaged by another's thought.

original: log pa'i shes pa mngon du byed kyang log pa'i shes pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa mngon du byed kyang log pa'i shes pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Although a wrong cognition is manifested, it is not a wrong cognition itself.

original: gang gis 'di nyid mi 'grub par 'gyur ba ji ltar kha cig sems pa ltar don dmigs pa rtogs pa la ltos pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis 'di nyid mi 'grub par 'gyur ba ji ltar kha cig sems pa ltar don dmigs pa rtogs pa la ltos pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not that the cognition of the object is dependent on the realization of the object, as some think, because of which this would not be established.

original: phyir la rnam par rtog pa nyid don dmigs pa la ltos pa yin te de'i 'du byed pa la brten pa'i phyir dang / de'i byed pa ma rdzogs par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir la rnam par rtog pa nyid don dmigs pa la ltos pa yin te de'i 'du byed pa la brten pa'i phyir dang / de'i byed pa ma rdzogs par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, conceptualization itself is dependent on the realization of the object, because it is based on its formative force, and because it is not established without completing its function.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'bras bu nyid dang skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'bras bu nyid dang skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa rtogs she na /
translated: Well then, how is the effect itself, momentariness, etc., realized?

original: de yod na gzhan yod par dmigs pa nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pa yin te skad cig gcig rtogs par bya ba nyid na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na gzhan yod par dmigs pa nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pa yin te skad cig gcig rtogs par bya ba nyid na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it exists, the observation of the existence of another is the entity of cause and effect, because the past and future are known when a single moment is known.

original: de bzhin du skad cig gcig sdod pa dang skad cig gzhan skyi ba yang de kho na bzhin gsal ba yin @66a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig gcig sdod pa dang skad cig gzhan skyi ba yang de kho na bzhin gsal ba yin @66a * //
translated: In the same way, the duration of a single moment and the passage to another moment are also just like that.

original: te ; der rnam par rtog pas ni dgos pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: te ; der rnam par rtog pas ni dgos pa ci yang med do //
translated: But there is no purpose at all in conceptualizing it.

original: rnam par rtog pa med na 'di ni sngon po zhes rang bzhin nges par ma brtags par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med na 'di ni sngon po zhes rang bzhin nges par ma brtags par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If there is no conceptualization, then the ascertainment of the nature of this as blue will not be examined.

original: nges par brtags kyang myong ba'i khyad par 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir myong ba'i rang bzhin la nges par brtags pas ci bya /
analyzed: nges par brtags kyang myong ba'i khyad par 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir myong ba'i rang bzhin la nges par brtags pas ci bya /
translated: Even if it is examined, what is the use of examining the nature of experience, since there is no difference in experience at all?

original: gzhan yang lhag par zhen pa 'khrul pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'khrul par brjod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang lhag par zhen pa 'khrul pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'khrul par brjod de /
translated: Moreover, conceptualization is said to be mistaken because of the error of excessive adherence.

original: rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du lhag par zhen nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du lhag par zhen nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it engages by excessively adhering to its own appearance as meaningful, even though it is meaningless.

original: don mi snang ba yang tshu rol mthong ba rnams la dbang po byed pa med par don snang ba med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: don mi snang ba yang tshu rol mthong ba rnams la dbang po byed pa med par don snang ba med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: And the non-appearance of the object is due to the fact that those who see only the near side do not have the object appear without the operation of the sense faculty.

original: / de lta bu'i rang bzhin ma yin pa la de lta bu'i lhag par zhen pa yang don nyams su myong ba'i bag chags kyi dbang gis 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: / de lta bu'i rang bzhin ma yin pa la de lta bu'i lhag par zhen pa yang don nyams su myong ba'i bag chags kyi dbang gis 'byung ba yin no //
translated: And the adherence to the nature of that which is not such is due to the power of the latent impressions of the experience of the object.

original: mngon par rlom pa'i rang bzhin lhag par zhen pa zhes bya ba yang bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin no zhes bstan par bya'o ;
analyzed: mngon par rlom pa'i rang bzhin lhag par zhen pa zhes bya ba yang bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin no zhes bstan par bya'o ;
translated: And the adherence to the nature of the over-esteeming of mere mental activity should be explained as being the nature of consciousness itself, like pleasure and so on.

original: / des na dbang po la sogs pa'i byed pa med par don rtogs par nus pa don snang ba la don du lhag par zhen pa ni don nyid la yin gyi 'khrul pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / des na dbang po la sogs pa'i byed pa med par don rtogs par nus pa don snang ba la don du lhag par zhen pa ni don nyid la yin gyi 'khrul pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the adherence to the object as the object in the appearance of the object without the operation of the sense faculty and so on is in regard to the object itself, but not in regard to the cause of error.

original: don las bzlog pa'i rnam pa ni mi snang ba'i phyir gsal ba'i don la don du lhag par zhen pa ni don la brtan pa nyid yin par 'gyur gyi tshu rol mthong ba'i ltar snang ba la brten pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don las bzlog pa'i rnam pa ni mi snang ba'i phyir gsal ba'i don la don du lhag par zhen pa ni don la brtan pa nyid yin par 'gyur gyi tshu rol mthong ba'i ltar snang ba la brten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since the aspect that is the opposite of the object does not appear, the object of the clear image is conceived to be the object, and thus it is the object that is stable, not the object that is based on the appearance of the one who sees this side.

original: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon po la sngon por lhag par zhen pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon po la sngon por lhag par zhen pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i yul can yin te /
translated: Therefore, the Lord said, ‚ÄúThe conception of blue as blue is a non-erroneous subject,

original: de sngon po nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sngon po nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is blue itself and because there is no error in regard to permanence, etc.‚Äù

original: des na rnam par rtog pa'i chos 'di tsam zhig dang 'dod pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam par mi rtog pa la yang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa'i chos 'di tsam zhig dang 'dod pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam par mi rtog pa la yang mi 'gal lo //
translated: Thus, this mere conceptual dharma and the nature of desire are not contradictory even in the non-conceptual.

original: 'di nyid lung gis zin pa yin no zhes ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid lung gis zin pa yin no zhes ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In order to show that this is established by scripture, he says, ‚ÄúIt is thus,‚Äù etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgra gcig gis ni snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms bzung la /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra gcig gis ni snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms bzung la /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: sogs pa'i sgra phyi mas ni dmigs pa med pa bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra phyi mas ni dmigs pa med pa bzung ba yin no //
translated: The latter ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the objectless.

original: de la sems can la dmigs pa ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste ji srid slob pa'i gnas skabs yongs su rdzogs pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: de la sems can la dmigs pa ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste ji srid slob pa'i gnas skabs yongs su rdzogs pa'i bar ro //
translated: The object of sentient beings is from the first production of the thought of enlightenment until the completion of the stage of learning.

original: chos la dmigs pa ni dgra bcom pa yin no //
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa ni dgra bcom pa yin no //
translated: The object of the Dharma is the Arhat.

original: chos ni gzugs la @66b sogs pa phung po lnga ste de dag la nga'i gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs par tha dad par bdag gi chos nyid du zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos ni gzugs la @66b sogs pa phung po lnga ste de dag la nga'i gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs par tha dad par bdag gi chos nyid du zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma is the five aggregates of form, etc. , because of the attachment to the reality of the self in the form of ‚Äúmy form,‚Äù etc.

original: des na bdag med na chos kho na lus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na bdag med na chos kho na lus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when the self does not exist, only the Dharma remains.

original: des na bdag med par rig pa'i byams pa la sogs pa ni chos la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: des na bdag med par rig pa'i byams pa la sogs pa ni chos la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the love, etc. , of one who knows selflessness is the object of the Dharma.

original: dmigs pa med pa ni chos bdag med pa mkhyen pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyid dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa ni chos bdag med pa mkhyen pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyid dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yin no //
translated: The objectless is that of the Lord Buddha and the Bodhisattvas who know the selflessness of the Dharma.

original: 'di ltar shes rab dang thugs rje gnyi ga goms pas na shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni zhugs kyang med pa'i gzung ba mi snang la /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab dang thugs rje gnyi ga goms pas na shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni zhugs kyang med pa'i gzung ba mi snang la /
translated: Thus, because of the cultivation of both wisdom and compassion, by the power of wisdom, the non-existent object of engagement does not appear.

original: thugs rje'i stobs kyis ni bdag nyid du gyur pa mi ldog go //
analyzed: thugs rje'i stobs kyis ni bdag nyid du gyur pa mi ldog go //
translated: By the power of compassion, the transformation into the self does not cease.

original: sdug bsngal mthong ba med par snying rje med do zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong ba med par snying rje med do zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWithout seeing suffering, how can there be compassion?‚Äù

original: gnyis kyi bag chags dang bral bas gnyis med pa mngon du byas pa na log pa'i shes pa dang bral ba bag chags la brten pa rang dbang mi bden pa sngon po la sogs pa dang bral ba yin yang /
analyzed: gnyis kyi bag chags dang bral bas gnyis med pa mngon du byas pa na log pa'i shes pa dang bral ba bag chags la brten pa rang dbang mi bden pa sngon po la sogs pa dang bral ba yin yang /
translated: When nonduality is manifested because of being free from the traces of the two, although one is free from distorted consciousness, one is not free from the traces that depend on the lack of true independence, such as blue.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa thob pa'i phyir yod pa'i don mngon du byed pa la dbang 'byor pa ni ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa thob pa'i phyir yod pa'i don mngon du byed pa la dbang 'byor pa ni ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: However, because omniscience is obtained, the power to manifest the meaning of existence is not reversed.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud kyang mi bden pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa mngon du byed par nus pa'i nyams su myong ba skyed pa'i nye bar len pa'i dbang gis de 'byung ba mi ldog go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud kyang mi bden pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa mngon du byed par nus pa'i nyams su myong ba skyed pa'i nye bar len pa'i dbang gis de 'byung ba mi ldog go //
translated: And it is not the case that the mindstream of another is not real. Therefore, it is not the case that the arising of the appearance of external objects is averted by the power of the appropriation of the experience that is able to manifest ultimate existence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phyi'i don med par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phyi'i don med par grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nonexistence of external objects is established.

original: de bden na gnyis med par goms kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis grub pa mig la sogs pa las don snang ba ji ltar ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bden na gnyis med par goms kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis grub pa mig la sogs pa las don snang ba ji ltar ldog par 'gyur /
translated: If that is true, then even though one is habituated to nonduality, how can the appearance of objects from such things as the eye, which are established by the nature of things, be averted?

original: des na yod pa'i don mngon du byed pa nyams par byed pa dang 'gal ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa bon thob pa na phyi'i don du snang ba bzhin gzhan gyi rgyud du snang ba skye ba ni dgag par mi nus so //
analyzed: des na yod pa'i don mngon du byed pa nyams par byed pa dang 'gal ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa bon thob pa na phyi'i don du snang ba bzhin gzhan gyi rgyud du snang ba skye ba ni dgag par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, when one obtains the seed of omniscience, which is incompatible with the impairment of the manifestation of existent objects, the appearance of objects as external is not something that can be averted, just as the appearance of another‚Äôs mindstream is not something that can be averted.

original: rnam par shes par rang bzhin gnyis su mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rnam par shes par rang bzhin gnyis su mi 'gyur ram /
translated: But is it not the case that consciousness becomes dual by nature?

original: byams pa la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa nyid 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnyis med pa'i phyogs la nye bar bkod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa nyid 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnyis med pa'i phyogs la nye bar bkod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: This non-apprehension of love, etc. is set forth in the context of the non-dual consciousness.

original: 'gyur mod / 'gal pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'gyur mod / 'gal pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Granted, but there is no contradiction at all.

original: de kho na mthong ba log pa'i shes pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de kho na mthong ba log pa'i shes pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: The vision of reality is contradictory to the false consciousness.

original: sngon po la sogs pa phra mo dang rags pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi bzod pa nyid kyi rang dbang du yod pas mi srid pas don de lta bu ma yin la shes pa yang de tsam gyi rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa phra mo dang rags pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi bzod pa nyid kyi rang dbang du yod pas mi srid pas don de lta bu ma yin la shes pa yang de tsam gyi rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: The subtle and gross aspects of blue, etc. are not possible because they are not accepted as existing independently. Such an object does not exist, and consciousness does not have that nature.

original: des na 'gal @67a * //
analyzed: des na 'gal @67a * //
translated: Therefore, the contradiction

original: ba'i rang bzhin gzhan dang mi ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin log par shes pa nyid ni bag chags kyi rgyu can du nye bar bstan to de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos po ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la med kyi rnam
analyzed: ba'i rang bzhin gzhan dang mi ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin log par shes pa nyid ni bag chags kyi rgyu can du nye bar bstan to de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos po ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la med kyi rnam
translated: is that consciousness, which does not have another nature that is contradictory to that, has a false nature that is taught to be caused by the latent impressions. Such a thing does not exist in the non-dual intuition, but the intuition of the two, object and subject, does exist in the world.

original: pa de lta bu'i rgyud gzhan gyi shes pa mngon du byed pa nyid ni mi 'gal te /
analyzed: pa de lta bu'i rgyud gzhan gyi shes pa mngon du byed pa nyid ni mi 'gal te /
translated: But it is not contradictory for the Buddha to perceive the consciousness of another continuum,

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i shes pa yod par mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i shes pa yod par mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not contradictory for such a consciousness to exist.

original: log pa'i shes pa 'dzin pa ni log pa'i rang gi bdag nyid yod pa'i phyir dang ji ltar snang bzhin pa'i dngos po ma bkag pa log pa'i shes pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa 'dzin pa ni log pa'i rang gi bdag nyid yod pa'i phyir dang ji ltar snang bzhin pa'i dngos po ma bkag pa log pa'i shes pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable that the apprehender is a mistaken consciousness, because the nature of the mistaken is not to exist and because it is not tenable that a mistaken consciousness is a thing that exists as it appears.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i shes pa de lta bur gyur pa'i don gsal bar 'gyur ba ni de lta bur gyur pa'i don med pa'i phyir log pa'i shes pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i shes pa de lta bur gyur pa'i don gsal bar 'gyur ba ni de lta bur gyur pa'i don med pa'i phyir log pa'i shes pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: Because it possesses such aspects, the consciousness of another continuum that is clear with respect to such objects is a mistaken consciousness because such objects do not exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But this is not the Buddha‚Äôs knowledge,

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i shes pa yod par mi 'gal ba'i phyir dang ; de yang de'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i shes pa yod par mi 'gal ba'i phyir dang ; de yang de'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not contradictory for such a consciousness to exist and because it is the object of that knowledge.

original: de nyid kyi phyir log pa'i shes pa bdag rig pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir log pa'i shes pa bdag rig pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the consciousness of self-awareness and so on is not a wrong consciousness.

original: 'khrul pa'i phyir rig pa mngon sum ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i phyir rig pa mngon sum ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is mistaken, it follows that it is not a direct perception.

original: de lta na 'o na phyi'i don khas blangs pa dang 'dra bar don dam par yod pa'i gzhan gyi rgyud snang ba yin na gnyis su med pa gzigs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na phyi'i don khas blangs pa dang 'dra bar don dam par yod pa'i gzhan gyi rgyud snang ba yin na gnyis su med pa gzigs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If, like the assertion of external objects, the appearance of another‚Äôs continuum exists ultimately, then the Buddha‚Äôs perception would not be nondual.

original: ji ltar mi 'gyur gang gi phyir gnyi ga la rang dbang brnyes pas na don thams cad gzigs pa la yang gnas pas ni thams cad gzigs pa nyid yin la gnyis su med pa'i gzigs pa la yang gnas pas ni gnyis su med pa'i gzigs pa yin no
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'gyur gang gi phyir gnyi ga la rang dbang brnyes pas na don thams cad gzigs pa la yang gnas pas ni thams cad gzigs pa nyid yin la gnyis su med pa'i gzigs pa la yang gnas pas ni gnyis su med pa'i gzigs pa yin no
translated: How could it not be? Because both have attained mastery, the Buddha‚Äôs perception of all objects is a perception of all, and because it abides in the perception of nonduality, it is a perception of nonduality.

original: // de nyid kyi phyir chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi gzugs brnyan gyis shes bya mtha' dag la spyi bor 'dzin pa zhes bya ba nas bzung ste gnyis su med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la mnga' brnyes pa zhes bya bas bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: // de nyid kyi phyir chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi gzugs brnyan gyis shes bya mtha' dag la spyi bor 'dzin pa zhes bya ba nas bzung ste gnyis su med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la mnga' brnyes pa zhes bya bas bstod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the praise of the Bhagavat begins with the words: ‚ÄúYou who hold the entire knowable as the reflection of the gnosis of the dharmadhatu‚Äù and ends with the words: ‚ÄúYou who have attained mastery over the nondual samadhi.‚Äù

original: de ji ltar dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rjer brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rjer brjod ce na /
translated: How is it that the Bhagavat is said to have nonconceptual compassion?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu bzhin du shes pa dang shes bya dag 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu bzhin du shes pa dang shes bya dag 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no connection between the knower and the known, as there is between cause and effect.

original: gnyi ga yang rang gi mthar thug pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig gi spyod yul du gyur pa'i shes pa dang shes bya bcom ldan 'das la mi mnga' bas na gzhan gyi sems dmigs pa ma yin la de @67b shes pa yang 'gal ba yang ma
analyzed: gnyi ga yang rang gi mthar thug pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig gi spyod yul du gyur pa'i shes pa dang shes bya bcom ldan 'das la mi mnga' bas na gzhan gyi sems dmigs pa ma yin la de @67b shes pa yang 'gal ba yang ma
translated: The Bhagavat does not have a knower and a known that are the domain of mere conceptualization, because both are limited to their own side. Therefore, the Bhagavat does not have the other mind as an object, and the knowledge of that is not contradictory.

original: yin no // ji ltar tshad ma dang bya ba phan tshun 'brel par mi 'thad pa zhes bya ba de ltar yang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid yin par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: yin no // ji ltar tshad ma dang bya ba phan tshun 'brel par mi 'thad pa zhes bya ba de ltar yang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid yin par bstan par bya'o //
translated: Just as it is not tenable that valid knowledge and activity are mutually related, in the same way, inference should be taught to be valid knowledge.

original: gal te snying rje goms pa'i stobs las skyes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te snying rje goms pa'i stobs las skyes pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is not arisen from the power of cultivating compassion,

original: des na 'dir ci zhig goms par byed snying rje nyid dam 'on te gzhan nyid gzhan goms pas gzhan skye ba yang yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: des na 'dir ci zhig goms par byed snying rje nyid dam 'on te gzhan nyid gzhan goms pas gzhan skye ba yang yod pa kho na ste /
translated: then what is cultivated here? Is it compassion itself or is it something else? It is not the case that something else is cultivated and something else arises,

original: bdag med pa goms pas 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: bdag med pa goms pas 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba bzhin no zhe na /
translated: just as one becomes free from attachment through cultivating the realization of selflessness.

original: de dag kyang zhes so //üîΩbyams pa dang snying rje la sogs pa dag kyang rigs mthun pa goms pa las byung ba yin te ;
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes so // byams pa dang snying rje la sogs pa dag kyang rigs mthun pa goms pa las byung ba yin te ;
translated: Those also,üîΩcompassion, love, and so on, arise from the cultivation of a concordant type,

original: byams pa la sogs pa'i sems yang nas yang du bskyed pa las byung ba yin gyi 'dod chags la ltos pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa'i sems yang nas yang du bskyed pa las byung ba yin gyi 'dod chags la ltos pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: because they arise from repeatedly generating the mind of love and so on, and they are not dependent on attachment.

original: rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rtsol bas bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rtsol bas bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not that it occurs by its own nature, but rather that it is accomplished through effort.

original: 'dod chags ni bdag tu lta ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni bdag tu lta ba yin te /
translated: Attachment is the view of self,

original: bdag tu zhen pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu zhen pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the nature of clinging to a self.

original: de la ltos pa yin na ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin du rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir rigs mthun pa goms pa la mi ltos par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ltos pa yin na ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin du rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir rigs mthun pa goms pa la mi ltos par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it depended on that, then it would follow that it would occur by its own nature, like attachment and so on, and it would not depend on the cultivation of a homogeneous cause.

original: ci ste yang 'dod chags la sogs pa yang sems can dang chos dang dmigs pa med pa can du ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'dod chags la sogs pa yang sems can dang chos dang dmigs pa med pa can du ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: But why don‚Äôt you accept that attachment and so on are also without a sentient being and a referential object?

original: des na de dag kyang snying rje la sogs pa ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de dag kyang snying rje la sogs pa ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then they would be like compassion and so on.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags nyid goms pa las bdag med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags nyid goms pa las bdag med par 'gyur la /
translated: In this way, attachment itself would become non-self through cultivation.

original: stong pa nyid goms pas kyang der 'gyur bas bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med kyang 'gyur ro zhe na mi 'gyur zhes brjod pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid goms pas kyang der 'gyur bas bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med kyang 'gyur ro zhe na mi 'gyur zhes brjod pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Since one would become that by cultivating emptiness, one would become that even without the conception of a self and without the conception of the duality of perceived object and perceiving subject.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni snying rje la sogs pa ltar chos la dmigs pa'am dmigs pa med pa ma yin te bdag la sogs par 'dzin pa phyin ci log med na med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun gyi rang bzhin tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la bdag tu mthong ba med par gang gis de bsgrub pa chags par 'gyur ba'am de dang mi mthun pa la sdang bar 'gyur ba rang gi bdag nyid la gnas pa'i 'bras bu nye bar
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni snying rje la sogs pa ltar chos la dmigs pa'am dmigs pa med pa ma yin te bdag la sogs par 'dzin pa phyin ci log med na med pa'i phyir ro // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun gyi rang bzhin tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la bdag tu mthong ba med par gang gis de bsgrub pa chags par 'gyur ba'am de dang mi mthun pa la sdang bar 'gyur ba rang gi bdag nyid la gnas pa'i 'bras bu nye bar
translated: Attachment and so on do not have a reality or an unreality as their object, as is the case with compassion and so on, because they do not exist without the error of apprehending a self and so on.üîΩHow could one who does not see a self in feelings and so on, which are by nature a continuum of causes and effects, become attached to the establishment of that or hostile to what is contrary to that?

original: spyod par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: spyod par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could one experience the result that is based on one‚Äôs own self?

original: de'i 'bras bu spyod pa po nyid med na ni yul de la btang @68a * //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu spyod pa po nyid med na ni yul de la btang @68a * //
translated: If the experiencer of the result does not exist, then that object is not given up or grasped.

original: snyoms nyid kun du spyod par rigs kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snyoms nyid kun du spyod par rigs kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: One should practice equanimity, not attachment and so on.

original: gal te 'dod chags dang bral bas don thams cad la mi sdug pa'i 'du shes can btang snyoms 'ba' zhig gi chos can yin pa'i phyir snying rje can yang rtsom pa med pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags dang bral bas don thams cad la mi sdug pa'i 'du shes can btang snyoms 'ba' zhig gi chos can yin pa'i phyir snying rje can yang rtsom pa med pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If the compassionate one is free from attachment, he would be indifferent to all things, having the perception of their repulsiveness, and so would not engage in any activity.

original: rtsom na ni mi sdug pa la sogs pa las bzlog par thal ba'i phyir dang / de yang de la med pa'i phyir dang / ji skad du /
analyzed: rtsom na ni mi sdug pa la sogs pa las bzlog par thal ba'i phyir dang / de yang de la med pa'i phyir dang / ji skad du /
translated: If he does engage in activity, then it follows that he would be turned away from the repulsiveness and so on, and that is not the case.üîΩAnd it will be explained that

original: blang dang dor ba bcom pa'i phyir //
analyzed: blang dang dor ba bcom pa'i phyir //
translated: because he has destroyed the acceptance and rejection

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: of the repulsiveness and so on.üîΩIf one objects that the compassionate oneüîΩwould not engage in activity,

original: gal te snying rje can gyi zhes bya bas dogs pa de bsu nas ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs so //
analyzed: gal te snying rje can gyi zhes bya bas dogs pa de bsu nas ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs so //
translated: this is answered by ‚ÄúNo, because he is compassionate.‚Äù

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das rang gi don la btang snyoms pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das rang gi don la btang snyoms pa yin gyi /
translated: This is what is being said: The BhagavƒÅn is indifferent to his own welfare because he is free from attachment.

original: gzhan gyi don la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not for the sake of others,

original: thugs rje can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs rje can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is compassionate.

original: de la ni blang bar bya ba 'ga' yang mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de la ni blang bar bya ba 'ga' yang mi mnga'o //
translated: And he has nothing to adopt.

original: re zhig chos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig chos ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not for the sake of the Dharma,

original: btang snyoms don dam par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btang snyoms don dam par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because equanimity is the ultimate.

original: sems can ma yin te de dag kyang spang bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can ma yin te de dag kyang spang bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not for the sake of sentient beings, because they are to be abandoned.

original: 'on kyang de dag kyang rang gi bdag nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i dngos po mtha' dag la btang snyoms skyed pa'i phyir rtsol ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag kyang rang gi bdag nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i dngos po mtha' dag la btang snyoms skyed pa'i phyir rtsol ba yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, he strives to generate equanimity toward all things, including those sentient beings, up to the limit of reality.

original: de dag la phan pa yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag la phan pa yang de nyid yin no //
translated: That is the benefit for them.

original: de nyid kyi phyir snying rje chags pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de nyid 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir btang snyoms pa 'bras bu la mi ltos pa'i phyir 'bras bu med pa'i rtsom pa 'dor ba yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir snying rje chags pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de nyid 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir btang snyoms pa 'bras bu la mi ltos pa'i phyir 'bras bu med pa'i rtsom pa 'dor ba yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since compassion is not by nature attachment, and since equanimity is its result, there is no abandoning of effort that is without result, because equanimity does not depend on a result.

original: gzhan gyi don 'bras bu ma yin pa yang ma yin te 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ni 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don 'bras bu ma yin pa yang ma yin te 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ni 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is the benefit for others not a result, because the definition of a result is that it is desired.

original: gang la 'dod pa yod pa de ni 'bras bu yin no zhes 'bras bu 'dod pas mtshon pa yin na de lta na yang brjod par 'dod pa dang / dgos pa 'dod pa dang / rtsom pa yang rung ste rnam pa thams cad kyi sgo nas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sgro 'dogs pa 'ga' yang grub pa med pa'i phyir smra ba ni nyes pa med pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la 'dod pa yod pa de ni 'bras bu yin no zhes 'bras bu 'dod pas mtshon pa yin na de lta na yang brjod par 'dod pa dang / dgos pa 'dod pa dang / rtsom pa yang rung ste rnam pa thams cad kyi sgo nas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sgro 'dogs pa 'ga' yang grub pa med pa'i phyir smra ba ni nyes pa med pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: That which is desired is a result, and a result is indicated by the desire for it. Even so, there is no fault in speaking, because there is no establishment of any false superimposition whatsoever in any way, whether it be the desire for expression, the desire for a purpose, or the desire for a beginning.

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In every way means in all ways.

original: nyes pa ni nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: nyes pa ni nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: A fault is an affliction.

original: nyes par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de ltar rnam pa 'gas kyang nyes pa dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyes par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de ltar rnam pa 'gas kyang nyes pa dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, in no way whatsoever is there a connection with a fault, because it is the nature of a fault to be a misdeed.

original: @68b de las gzhan pas zhes bya ba ni gal te yang dag pa ma yin par sgro 'dogs pa las gzhan brjod par 'dod pa nyid la sogs pa nyes pa dang ldan pa nyid du brjod na ni des na mi 'dod pa cung zad med do //
analyzed: @68b de las gzhan pas zhes bya ba ni gal te yang dag pa ma yin par sgro 'dogs pa las gzhan brjod par 'dod pa nyid la sogs pa nyes pa dang ldan pa nyid du brjod na ni des na mi 'dod pa cung zad med do //
translated: ‚ÄúBy any other‚Äù means that if it is said that the one who wishes to speak, etc., are faulty, other than by the superimposition of what is not real, then there is not the slightest unwanted consequence.

original: nyes par byed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa yang srid pa 'phen pa'i nus pas stong pas nyes pa dang ldan pa nyid du bsgrubs na ni mi 'dod pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: nyes par byed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa yang srid pa 'phen pa'i nus pas stong pas nyes pa dang ldan pa nyid du bsgrubs na ni mi 'dod pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: And if it is established that they are faulty because they are devoid of the ability to impel existence, which is not the nature of a fault, then there is not the slightest unwanted consequence.

original: nyes pa ma yin pa la yang nyes pa'o zhes ming du 'dogs pa nyes pa can du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ma yin pa la yang nyes pa'o zhes ming du 'dogs pa nyes pa can du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: The conclusion is: because even that which is not a fault is not a fault when it is designated as a fault.

original: de'i phyir de ltar tshad ma gzhan gyis brjod par 'dod pa nyid khyad par gyi mthar thug pa yin par bsgrub pa gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar tshad ma gzhan gyis brjod par 'dod pa nyid khyad par gyi mthar thug pa yin par bsgrub pa gsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this way, the proof that the one who wishes to speak, etc., is the final limit of the distinction is clear.

original: da ni rgyu dang 'bras bus dngos po la brten nas brjod par 'dod pa tsam rgyu yin par grub pa'i phyir tshig las 'dod chags rjes su dpog pa mi 'thad pa zhes bya ba yin mod /üîΩsmra ba po la 'dod chags mthong bas khyab pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu spangs te tshig las 'dod chags rjes su dpog go zhes gzhan 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu nas lan 'debs pa ni smra ba po bdag la zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: da ni rgyu dang 'bras bus dngos po la brten nas brjod par 'dod pa tsam rgyu yin par grub pa'i phyir tshig las 'dod chags rjes su dpog pa mi 'thad pa zhes bya ba yin mod / smra ba po la 'dod chags mthong bas khyab pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu spangs te tshig las 'dod chags rjes su dpog go zhes gzhan 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu nas lan 'debs pa ni smra ba po bdag la zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Since it is not certain that one who speaks is one who desires, it is not tenable to infer desire from speech.üîΩSince it is not certain that one who speaks is one who desires, it is not tenable to infer desire from speech.üîΩSince it is not certain that one who speaks is one who desires, it is not tenable to infer desire from speech.üîΩSince it is not certain that one who speaks is one who desires, it is not tenable to infer desire from speech.üîΩSince it is not certain that one who speaks is one who desires, it is not tenable to infer desire from speech.üîΩSince it is not certain that one who speaks is one who desires, it is not tenable to infer desire from speech.üîΩSince it is not certain that one who speaks is one who desires, it is not tenable to infer desire from speech.üîΩSince it is not certain that one who speaks is one who desires, it is not tenable to infer desire from speech.üîΩSince it is not certain that one who speaks is one who desires, it is not tenable to infer desire from speech.üîΩSince it is not certain that one who speaks is one who desires, it is not tenable to infer desire from speech.üîΩSince it is not certain that one who speaks is one who desires, it is not tenable to infer desire from speech.

original: gang gi phyir smra ba po bdag la 'dod chags la sogs pa mthong ba de'i phyir tshig yod na 'dod chags la sogs pa yod pas gzhan la tshig mthong bas 'dod chags la sogs pa rjes su dpog na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir smra ba po bdag la 'dod chags la sogs pa mthong ba de'i phyir tshig yod na 'dod chags la sogs pa yod pas gzhan la tshig mthong bas 'dod chags la sogs pa rjes su dpog na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is not certain that one who speaks is one who desires, it is not tenable to infer desire from speech.

original: sngo bsangs nyid la sogs pa bdag nyid la tshig yod na mthong zhing sems med pa dag la tshig med na ma mthong ba'i chos mtha' dag smra ba po mtha' dag la rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngo bsangs nyid la sogs pa bdag nyid la tshig yod na mthong zhing sems med pa dag la tshig med na ma mthong ba'i chos mtha' dag smra ba po mtha' dag la rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro //
translated: All things that are seen to have words, such as ‚Äúblueness,‚Äù etc., in the speaker‚Äôs own mind, and all things that are not seen to have words, such as the mind of one who is unconscious, are inferred by all speakers.

original: 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi tshig las gzhan rjes su mi dpogs te gang gi phyir de de la 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi tshig las gzhan rjes su mi dpogs te gang gi phyir de de la 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of error‚Äù means that one does not infer another‚Äôs thoughts from his words, because that would be erroneous.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni lan 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni lan 'debs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this case‚Äù means in the case of the speaker‚Äôs own thoughts.

original: rigs pa mtshungs pa las gal te der 'khrul na 'di la de med do zhes bya ba'i nges pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: rigs pa mtshungs pa las gal te der 'khrul na 'di la de med do zhes bya ba'i nges pa ci zhig yod /
translated: If there is error in that case, what certainty is there that there is no error in this case?

original: 'on te chos gzhan rjes su dpog pa la ni 'khrul pa mthong la 'di la ni ma mthong ngo zhes brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te chos gzhan rjes su dpog pa la ni 'khrul pa mthong la 'di la ni ma mthong ngo zhes brjod na /
translated: But if you say that error is seen in the inference of another‚Äôs thoughts, but not in this case,

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: that is not tenable.

original: ma mthong yang the tshom mi ldog pas the tshom za ba'i ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur gyi thun mong nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong yang the tshom mi ldog pas the tshom za ba'i ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur gyi thun mong nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Even though there is no error, doubt is not eliminated, so there is no certainty, only doubt.

original: nges pa med pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir tshig gis @69a * //
analyzed: nges pa med pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir tshig gis @69a * //
translated: In order to show that there is no certainty, he says:

original: ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: ni zhes smos so //
translated: ‚Äúby the word.‚Äù

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir te /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúBy the word‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: tshig gis byed pa'i yon tan bya ba las su rung ba dang / brjod par 'dod pa nyid dag rjes su dpog par byed do //
analyzed: tshig gis byed pa'i yon tan bya ba las su rung ba dang / brjod par 'dod pa nyid dag rjes su dpog par byed do //
translated: The word causes the inference of the two qualities of fitness for action and desire to speak.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i phyir der mi 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i phyir der mi 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no error in that, since there is the relation of cause and effect.

original: 'dod chags la ni de las bzlog pa'i phyir mi 'khrul par nges pa med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags la ni de las bzlog pa'i phyir mi 'khrul par nges pa med do //
translated: But there is no certainty of non-error in desire, because it is the opposite of that.

original: gal te gang la brjod par 'dod pa nyid spyir rjes su dpog par 'gyur ba shes par 'dod pa rjes su dpag par bya ba yin na yang 'di'i rang bzhin 'di 'dod chags la sogs pa'i thun mong ba rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gang la brjod par 'dod pa nyid spyir rjes su dpog par 'gyur ba shes par 'dod pa rjes su dpag par bya ba yin na yang 'di'i rang bzhin 'di 'dod chags la sogs pa'i thun mong ba rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the desire to speak is inferred in general, then is not the nature of that desire to speak, which is common to desire and so on, also to be inferred?

original: gal te 'dod chags med kyang khyad par gzhan dang ldan pa'i brjod par 'dod pa'i tshig gi rgyu dmigs na de'i phyir 'dir 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags med kyang khyad par gzhan dang ldan pa'i brjod par 'dod pa'i tshig gi rgyu dmigs na de'i phyir 'dir 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If, although there is no attachment, there is a cause of speech that is associated with some other distinction, then it is so.

original: des na gal te yang 'dod chags la sogs pas stong pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs kyis bskyed pa'i tshig yod pa de lta na yang de tsam gyi sems 'dod chags dang bral ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gal te yang 'dod chags la sogs pas stong pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs kyis bskyed pa'i tshig yod pa de lta na yang de tsam gyi sems 'dod chags dang bral ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, even if there is a statement produced by a state of mind that is empty of attachment, etc., still, that much does not constitute a mind free from attachment,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ma skyes kyang skye bo'i sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa can du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ma skyes kyang skye bo'i sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa can du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though attachment, etc., are not produced, one admits that all sentient beings are afflicted.

original: des na de ni nyon mongs pa skyed par rung ba nyid kyis nyon mongs pa can du brjod do //
analyzed: des na de ni nyon mongs pa skyed par rung ba nyid kyis nyon mongs pa can du brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that they are afflicted by the mere fact that they are fit to produce afflictions.

original: des na ji ltar brjod par 'dod pa tsam rgyu yin te nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar brjod par 'dod pa tsam rgyu yin te nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the cause is merely the desire to speak, because a state of mind that is not afflicted is not observed.

original: 'dod chags skyed par rung ba nyid dang bral ba la zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'dod chags skyed par rung ba nyid dang bral ba la zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe absence of the capacity to generate desire‚Äù means the absence of the capacity to generate desire when the word is seen.

original: tshig ni mthong na 'dod chags skyed par rung ba nyid dang bral ba la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig ni mthong na 'dod chags skyed par rung ba nyid dang bral ba la ni ma yin te /
translated: The word is not the absence of the capacity to generate desire when it is seen.

original: des na tshig 'dod chags skyed par rung ba nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed par brjod do //
analyzed: des na tshig 'dod chags skyed par rung ba nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, we say that the word follows the presence and absence of the capacity to generate desire.

original: des na tshig las 'dod chags rjes su dpog na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na tshig las 'dod chags rjes su dpog na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If desire is inferred from the word, the consequence is absurd.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gal te don ji snyed nye bar gnas pa na 'bras bu sngar med pa dmigs pa de snyed rgyu yin par brjod na /
analyzed: gal te don ji snyed nye bar gnas pa na 'bras bu sngar med pa dmigs pa de snyed rgyu yin par brjod na /
translated: If it is said that the cause is the totality of the things that exist in the object when the effect is observed that was not previously observed,

original: sngo bsangs la sogs pa yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa bzhin du sngo bsangs la sogs pa yang smra ba po la rjes su dpog la rag na /
analyzed: sngo bsangs la sogs pa yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa bzhin du sngo bsangs la sogs pa yang smra ba po la rjes su dpog la rag na /
translated: then, because the blue color, etc. is also a cause, the blue color, etc. would be inferred from the speaker, just as the passion is.

original: 'on kyang du ba la yang yul de na nye bar gnas pa gcig la sogs pa rgyu yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang du ba la yang yul de na nye bar gnas pa gcig la sogs pa rgyu yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: But rather, the cause of the smoke is only the fuel, etc. that exists in that place.

original: 'on @69b te de las gcig med na yang ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tshul 'dis rgyu de tsam nyid yin par nges par bya ba'i phyir yang ldog pa tshol ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on @69b te de las gcig med na yang ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tshul 'dis rgyu de tsam nyid yin par nges par bya ba'i phyir yang ldog pa tshol ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if even one of those is absent, then in order to ascertain that the cause is just that much, one seeks the counter pervasion by the method called non-observation.

original: rung ba nyid dang ldog pa ma gru ba ste rdo ba la sogs pa dag la rung ba bzhin du sems kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rung ba nyid dang ldog pa ma gru ba ste rdo ba la sogs pa dag la rung ba bzhin du sems kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind does not exist like a suitable place, or like a rock, etc.

original: gal te sems yod kyang rung ba med na tshig med par grub na de'i phyir der 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te sems yod kyang rung ba med na tshig med par grub na de'i phyir der 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: If it is established that there is no speech when the mind exists but a suitable place does not, then that is so.

original: dper na bud shing med na shing yod kyang du ba med pa'i phyir bud shing dang bcas pa'i me rgyu yin par rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bud shing med na shing yod kyang du ba med pa'i phyir bud shing dang bcas pa'i me rgyu yin par rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when there is no fuel, even if the wood exists, there is no smoke, so one understands that fire with fuel is the cause.

original: des na gal te ldog pa tshol na 'di rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gal te ldog pa tshol na 'di rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, if one seeks the counter pervasion, this is not an inference.

original: 'on te snga ma bzhin du yod pa tsam la rtogs na ni des na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te snga ma bzhin du yod pa tsam la rtogs na ni des na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if one understands mere existence as before, then that leads to an absurd consequence.

original: des na 'dir ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur bar brjod la /
analyzed: des na 'dir ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur bar brjod la /
translated: Therefore, here we state the absurd consequence.

original: rnam par nges pa ni rgyu nyid ma grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: rnam par nges pa ni rgyu nyid ma grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: The distinction is that the cause itself would not be established.

original: der rung ba dang bral ba'i sems kyi gnas skabs ma dmigs par brjod par 'dod pa tsam rgyu yin par yang ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: der rung ba dang bral ba'i sems kyi gnas skabs ma dmigs par brjod par 'dod pa tsam rgyu yin par yang ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: How is it understood that mere desire, the state of mind devoid of suitability, is the cause?

original: 'dod chags kyis zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis zhes smos so //
translated: It is said: ‚Äúdue to attachment.‚Äù

original: rung ba nyid rgyu yin no zhes smra ba ni tshig nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyi rgyun can yin no zhes bya ba brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rung ba nyid rgyu yin no zhes smra ba ni tshig nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyi rgyun can yin no zhes bya ba brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: One who maintains that suitability is the cause should say that it is the continuum of a defiled mind.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems ma gtogs par rung ba nyid ces bya ba gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems ma gtogs par rung ba nyid ces bya ba gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Apart from a defiled mind, there is nothing else called suitability.

original: sems ni nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis nyon mongs pa yin te /
analyzed: sems ni nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis nyon mongs pa yin te /
translated: The mind is defiled by two types of defilements:

original: bag la nyal dang kun nas ldang bas so //
analyzed: bag la nyal dang kun nas ldang bas so //
translated: latent and manifest.

original: de la ma sad pa'i nyon mongs pa ni bag la nyal yin la sad pa'i ni kun nas ldang ba yin no zhes bya bar khas blangs pa'i phyir rung ba nyid ni bag la nyal gyi dngos po la brjod do //
analyzed: de la ma sad pa'i nyon mongs pa ni bag la nyal yin la sad pa'i ni kun nas ldang ba yin no zhes bya bar khas blangs pa'i phyir rung ba nyid ni bag la nyal gyi dngos po la brjod do //
translated: Because it is accepted that the latent state of the passion is the non-awakened state, and the aroused state is the awakened state, the suitability is described as the state of latency.

original: de skyes na ni de kun nas ldang ba yin no //
analyzed: de skyes na ni de kun nas ldang ba yin no //
translated: When it arises, it is the awakened state.

original: des na gal te 'dir 'dod chags nyid kyis phan 'dogs par grub na de'i tshe rnam pa gnyis kyis nye bar sbyor ba yin par 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: des na gal te 'dir 'dod chags nyid kyis phan 'dogs par grub na de'i tshe rnam pa gnyis kyis nye bar sbyor ba yin par 'gyur ba na /
translated: If it is established that attachment itself is helpful in this case, then it would be applied in two ways.

original: des na phan 'dogs pa nyid ni bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: des na phan 'dogs pa nyid ni bkag pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the helpfulness itself is refuted,

original: gnyen po bsgoms pas sems kyi rgyun nyon mongs pa med par byas kyang snying rjes kyang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po bsgoms pas sems kyi rgyun nyon mongs pa med par byas kyang snying rjes kyang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though the continuum of mind is made passionless by the cultivation of the antidote, it is engaged by compassion.

original: byed pa nges par sbyor ba na 'dod pa la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa nges par sbyor ba na 'dod pa la brten pa yin no //
translated: When one is definitely engaged in action, it is based on desire.

original: des na 'dod chags med kyang snying rje can gyi 'dod pa la ni 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: des na 'dod chags med kyang snying rje can gyi 'dod pa la ni 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, even without attachment, there is no contradiction in the desire of the compassionate one.

original: des na nyon mongs pas phan mi 'dogs na nyon mongs pa'i @70a * //
analyzed: des na nyon mongs pas phan mi 'dogs na nyon mongs pa'i @70a * //
translated: Therefore, if afflictions do not benefit, then why do they not benefit?

original: nus pas phan 'dogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pas phan 'dogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, if the defilements do not benefit, they do not benefit through the power of the defilements.

original: gal te nus pa las nyon mongs pa gzhan nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te nus pa las nyon mongs pa gzhan nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If the defilements are not different from the power,

original: de ji ltar nyon mongs pa nus pa'i phyir nus pa nus par brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar nyon mongs pa nus pa'i phyir nus pa nus par brjod ce na /
translated: how can the power be said to be the power of the defilements?

original: nus pas phan 'dogs na ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: nus pas phan 'dogs na ni zhes smos so //
translated: If the power benefits,

original: gal te nus pa nye bar sbyor ba yin na ni 'dod chags nyid kyis nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te nus pa nye bar sbyor ba yin na ni 'dod chags nyid kyis nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: if the power is applied, then attachment itself would be applied.

original: 'dod chags ni nye bar sbyor ba ma yin pa des na nus pas phan 'dogs pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni nye bar sbyor ba ma yin pa des na nus pas phan 'dogs pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: But attachment is not applied, therefore the power does not benefit.

original: gal te nus pa rang gi ngo bos phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te snying rjes kyang 'jug par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te nus pa rang gi ngo bos phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te snying rjes kyang 'jug par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the power does not benefit by its own nature, then compassion would not benefit.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir 'di nye bar bkod ce na 'dod chags kyis phan 'dogs pa yod pa'i rgyu khyad par med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir 'di nye bar bkod ce na 'dod chags kyis phan 'dogs pa yod pa'i rgyu khyad par med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Well then, why was this example cited? It was cited in order to show that there is no special reason for the existence of attachment.

original: de lta na yang 'dod chags med kyang 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i tha snyad du grub pa des na /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'dod chags med kyang 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i tha snyad du grub pa des na /
translated: Even though this is so, the convention of ‚Äúone who possesses attachment‚Äù is established even in the absence of attachment.

original: gnas skabs de nyid bag la nyal yin gyi /
analyzed: gnas skabs de nyid bag la nyal yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, this very state is the latent state.

original: ma sad pa'i don gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma sad pa'i don gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: There is no other state that is not awakened.üîΩThus, this is the proof.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù concludes the topic.

original: gal te yang 'bras bu med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pa mi srid pa de lta na yang 'bras bu'i spyi rgyu'i khyad par dag dang med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te yang 'bras bu med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pa mi srid pa de lta na yang 'bras bu'i spyi rgyu'i khyad par dag dang med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it is impossible for something to arise without a cause, still, the general effect does not arise in the absence of the special cause.

original: khyad par de dag rgyu yin no zhes de la ltos nas 'bras bu nyid du brjod pa yin na khyad par med na mi 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par de dag rgyu yin no zhes de la ltos nas 'bras bu nyid du brjod pa yin na khyad par med na mi 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: If the special cause is the cause, then the effect is described as dependent on that cause. But the effect does not arise in the absence of the special cause.

original: de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists even when that does not exist.

original: des na med na mi 'byung ba kho nas rgyu rjes su dpog par byed kyi /
analyzed: des na med na mi 'byung ba kho nas rgyu rjes su dpog par byed kyi /
translated: Therefore, one infers a cause only from the invariable relation of causality.

original: med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pas ni ma yin te tshig gi 'dod chags bzhin no //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pas ni ma yin te tshig gi 'dod chags bzhin no //
translated: One does not infer it from a relation of invariable concomitance, as in the case of the desire for words.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: de la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause it is dependent on that.‚Äù

original: 'di gang med na mi 'byung ba de nyid la 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di gang med na mi 'byung ba de nyid la 'brel pa yin te /
translated: That which is invariably related to something else is related to it.

original: 'bras bu'i spyi rgyu'i spyi nyid la bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i spyi rgyu'i spyi nyid la bzhin no //
translated: It is like the universal of effect and the universal of cause.

original: khyad par la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par la ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not related to a particular,

original: de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists even when the particular does not exist.

original: de bshad pa ni gzhan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni gzhan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He explains this in the line, ‚Äúbecause it is not the case that the other is not.‚Äù

original: khyad par dang med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par dang med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the case that the particular is not invariably related to the effect.

original: gal te phyogs kyi chos dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis gtan tshigs tshul gsum par brjod pa ma yin nam tshul gsum po de yang tshad mas grub par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te phyogs kyi chos dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis gtan tshigs tshul gsum par brjod pa ma yin nam tshul gsum po de yang tshad mas grub par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: If the reason is stated as having the three modes of the property of the subject, positive concomitance, and negative concomitance, then the three modes are established by a valid cognition.

original: gzhal @70b bya grub pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal @70b bya grub pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the establishment of the object of evaluation depends on valid cognition.

original: gtan tshigs kyi tshul rnams la ni mthar yang mngon sum gdon mi za bar tshad mar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi tshul rnams la ni mthar yang mngon sum gdon mi za bar tshad mar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: In the case of the rules of logic, in the end, direct perception is certainly valid cognition,

original: gzhan du na thug pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na thug pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: otherwise, there would be an infinite regress.

original: des na tshig gi mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa mngon sum nyid kyis rtogs pas na ji ltar gtan tshigs ma yin pa nyid yin /
analyzed: des na tshig gi mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa mngon sum nyid kyis rtogs pas na ji ltar gtan tshigs ma yin pa nyid yin /
translated: Therefore, since the pervasion of a reason characterized by words is understood by direct perception itself, how can it not be a reason?

original: de ltar yang bdag rang nyid la tshig don yod na 'dod chags dmigs la sems med pa dag la 'dod chags med na tshig med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang bdag rang nyid la tshig don yod na 'dod chags dmigs la sems med pa dag la 'dod chags med na tshig med pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, if the meaning of the words exists for oneself, attachment is observed, but if there is no attachment for those without minds, there are no words.

original: ji ste de lta na ha cang thal bar brjod na de ni du ba las me rjes su dpog pa la yang ha cang thal bar ji ltar mi 'gyur tshang bang gi chos rnams ri la yang 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ste de lta na ha cang thal bar brjod na de ni du ba las me rjes su dpog pa la yang ha cang thal bar ji ltar mi 'gyur tshang bang gi chos rnams ri la yang 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is said that this leads to an absurd consequence, then how can it not lead to an absurd consequence in the case of inferring fire from smoke? Because the properties of a kitchen could also be on a mountain.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin pa'am /
translated: Therefore, inference is not valid cognition,

original: yang na smra ba po 'dod chags can du thal ba yang spang dka'o zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu nas khyab pa mngon sum gyis grub kyang gtan tshigs nyid ma yin bar brjod pa ni /
analyzed: yang na smra ba po 'dod chags can du thal ba yang spang dka'o zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu nas khyab pa mngon sum gyis grub kyang gtan tshigs nyid ma yin bar brjod pa ni /
translated: Having anticipated this qualm, he says that although the pervasion is established by perception, the reason is not.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te yang 'di mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ma mthong ba yin pa de lta na yang tshig ni brjod par 'dod pa tsam gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir de yal bar dor nas ma mthong bas grub pa'i ldog pa la brten te brjod par 'dod
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'o // gal te yang 'di mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ma mthong ba yin pa de lta na yang tshig ni brjod par 'dod pa tsam gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir de yal bar dor nas ma mthong bas grub pa'i ldog pa la brten te brjod par 'dod
translated: It is not that it is not seen in the discordant side.

original: pa'i khyad par rjes su dpog par byed pa mi nus so //
analyzed: pa'i khyad par rjes su dpog par byed pa mi nus so //
translated: Even if it is not seen to occur in the discordant side, since the word is the mere effect of the desire to speak, it is not possible to infer the specific desired object based on the exclusion that is established by ignoring it and not seeing it.

original: ji ltar mi nus gang gi phyir gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa ni ldog pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar mi nus gang gi phyir gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa ni ldog pa yin la /
translated: How is it not possible? Because the reason is not in the discordant side, it is the exclusion.

original: de yang ma mthong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad mas grub pa yin no zhe na thams cad gzigs pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: de yang ma mthong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad mas grub pa yin no zhe na thams cad gzigs pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: Moreover, it is established by a valid cognition that has the characteristic of not seeing.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te gal te ma mthong bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa rtogs par byed na su zhig de la ma mthong yang gtan tshigs nyid yin pa spong /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te gal te ma mthong bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa rtogs par byed na su zhig de la ma mthong yang gtan tshigs nyid yin pa spong /
translated: This is what is being said: if one understands that the property of the counter-pervasion does not exist due to not seeing, then who would abandon it as a reason, even though it is not seen?

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not like that.

original: gang gi phyir gang 'ga' zhig la bsgrub par bya ba med pa de mtha' dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa la de med pa'i chos can nges pa 'ga' zhig ni yin par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang 'ga' zhig la bsgrub par bya ba med pa de mtha' dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa la de med pa'i chos can nges pa 'ga' zhig ni yin par mi 'thad do //
translated: Because if something is not the probandum, it is not the entire counter-pervasion. It is not tenable that it is ascertained as having the property of not existing in some of that.

original: de la yang thams cad nyid la med par rtogs par bya ba yin gyi 'ga' zhig kho na la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang thams cad nyid la med par rtogs par bya ba yin gyi 'ga' zhig kho na la ni ma yin no //
translated: And there, it is understood that it does not exist in everything, not in just some.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba med pa dang ldan pa mtha' dag pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par ma @71a * //
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba med pa dang ldan pa mtha' dag pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par ma @71a * //
translated: If the entire counter-pervasion has the property of the absence of the probandum, then it is not the counter-pervasion.

original: gyur ram / de la gtan tshigs med par nges par bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gyur ram / de la gtan tshigs med par nges par bya ba ma yin na /
translated: If it is not ascertained that there is no reason for it not to exist,

original: de'i tshe la lar med pa grub kyang thams cad la de med par the tshom za bas na yul la sogs pas chod pa'i chos can sngar ma myong ba bzhin du bsgrub bya yod pa dang med par ma mthong ba nyams su myong ba'i chos can dag la
analyzed: de'i tshe la lar med pa grub kyang thams cad la de med par the tshom za bas na yul la sogs pas chod pa'i chos can sngar ma myong ba bzhin du bsgrub bya yod pa dang med par ma mthong ba nyams su myong ba'i chos can dag la
translated: then even if it is established that it does not exist in some cases, since there is doubt that it does not exist in all cases, then with respect to a subject that is obstructed by an object and so on, just like a subject that has not been previously experienced, one does not see whether the probandum exists or not.

original: yang de med na gtan tshigs med par the tshom za bar 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: yang de med na gtan tshigs med par the tshom za bar 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: If it does not exist, then there is doubt that there is no reason for it not to exist.

original: des na me yod pa dang med par the tshom za ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can nyid la du ba dmigs pa na 'dir me med kyang yod dam yod pa na yod pa yin zhes the tshom mi za zhes su smra mthun ba'i phyogs dang mi mthun
analyzed: des na me yod pa dang med par the tshom za ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can nyid la du ba dmigs pa na 'dir me med kyang yod dam yod pa na yod pa yin zhes the tshom mi za zhes su smra mthun ba'i phyogs dang mi mthun
translated: Therefore, when the existence or nonexistence of fire is doubted, if smoke is observed in the subject that is to be established, then one does not doubt whether fire exists or not, thinking, ‚ÄúHere, even though fire does not exist, it exists or if it exists, it exists.‚ÄùüîΩWho would say that the observation of smoke in a similar instance and the nonobservation of smoke in a dissimilar instance are not the means of understanding the pervasion?

original: pa'i phyogs dag la mthong ba dang ma mthong bas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la the tshom za ba'i bsgrub bya nges par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: pa'i phyogs dag la mthong ba dang ma mthong bas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la the tshom za ba'i bsgrub bya nges par byed do zhe na /
translated: But if one does not see it in the similar instances, and does not see it in the dissimilar instances, then one is certain that the probandum is absent in the subject.

original: ji ltar byed gang gi phyir de ltar bsgrub bya med na med pa nyid kyis bsgrub bya'i chos can la yang med par 'gyur ro zhes nges par mi nus so //
analyzed: ji ltar byed gang gi phyir de ltar bsgrub bya med na med pa nyid kyis bsgrub bya'i chos can la yang med par 'gyur ro zhes nges par mi nus so //
translated: How does one do this? Because if the probandum is absent in this way, then the absence of the probans is certain in the subject.

original: chos can gzhan la 'di bsgrub bya med na med par 'dzin pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa de nyid kyis de gzhan du yang de lta yin par 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos can gzhan la 'di bsgrub bya med na med par 'dzin pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa de nyid kyis de gzhan du yang de lta yin par 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But the valid cognition that apprehends the absence of the probandum in another subject does not apprehend it in that other subject in the same way.

original: tshad ma rnams ni yul nges pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams ni yul nges pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the valid cognitions have a definite object.

original: gang la de dag zhugs pa de nyid du de ltar nges par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la de dag zhugs pa de nyid du de ltar nges par byed pa yin no //
translated: They ascertain it in just that way in which they engage.

original: zhugs pa des gzhan du de ltar rnam par 'jog par byed pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: zhugs pa des gzhan du de ltar rnam par 'jog par byed pa mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that they engage in one way and ascertain it in another way.

original: du ba 'am chos can gcig tu ji lta ba de bzhi du gzhan du yang yin no zhes ni nges par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: du ba 'am chos can gcig tu ji lta ba de bzhi du gzhan du yang yin no zhes ni nges par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not possible to ascertain that ‚Äújust as smoke is in one place, so it is in another place.‚Äù

original: de la gnas pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par 'ga' zhin ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par 'ga' zhin ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the difference in the nature of the existence of that is not established.

original: de'i phyir thams cad du bsgrub par bya ba med na med do zhes nges na du ba mi dmigs pa las me nges par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad du bsgrub par bya ba med na med do zhes nges na du ba mi dmigs pa las me nges par nus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when it is ascertained that ‚Äúif the probandum is absent, the probans is absent,‚Äù then fire can be ascertained from the perception of smoke.

original: de'i phyir gang la lar bsgrub par bya ba med pa de mtha' dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la de la med par nges par bya ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang la lar bsgrub par bya ba med pa de mtha' dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la de la med par nges par bya ba yang yin no //
translated: Therefore, in some cases, where the probandum is absent, that is the counter-example, and it is ascertained that the probans is absent there.

original: thams cad gzigs pa ma yin pa'i mthong ba log pas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la med pa go bar byed pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang thams cad gzigs pa nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: thams cad gzigs pa ma yin pa'i mthong ba log pas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la med pa go bar byed pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang thams cad gzigs pa nyid kyi'o //
translated: But the perception of one who does not see everything cannot prove the absence of the probans in all counter-examples. Rather, it is the perception of one who sees everything.

original: tshu rol mthong bas ni yul dang dus kyis chod pa'i chos can bsgrub byas stong pa rtogs pa'i spyod yul du byed par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong bas ni yul dang dus kyis chod pa'i chos can bsgrub byas stong pa rtogs pa'i spyod yul du byed par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The one who sees only the near side cannot make the subject that is separated by place and time the object of the realization of emptiness.
