original: des na ji ltar de dag la gtan tshigs mang par nges @71b par byed /
analyzed: des na ji ltar de dag la gtan tshigs mang par nges @71b par byed /
translated: Therefore, how can one be certain about many reasons in regard to that?

original: ji ltar gcig la yod pa de bzhin du 'di thams cad du yod par ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig la yod pa de bzhin du 'di thams cad du yod par ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not the case that just as it exists in one, it exists in all.

original: la la na zhes smos so //
analyzed: la la na zhes smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúIn some places‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de ltar rang bzhin 'ga' zhig gis mthong ba rnams kyang yul la sogs pa'i khyad par las gzhan du snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin 'ga' zhig gis mthong ba rnams kyang yul la sogs pa'i khyad par las gzhan du snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, even those who see some nature, due to the difference of place and so on, see it as different.

original: dper na 'bras bu skyur po can skyu ru ra'i shing dag kyang 'du byed pa'i khyad par las 'bras bu mngar po chags par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu skyur po can skyu ru ra'i shing dag kyang 'du byed pa'i khyad par las 'bras bu mngar po chags par 'gyur la /
translated: For example, even sour fruit trees such as the emblic myrobalan, due to the difference of cultivation, can produce sweet fruit.

original: lan mang du de ltar ma mthong yang yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lan mang du de ltar ma mthong yang yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Even though one has not seen it that way many times, it is still possible.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig tu de ltar mthong ba ni rnam pa der nges pa ma yin nam du ba du ba'i rnam par nges pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig tu de ltar mthong ba ni rnam pa der nges pa ma yin nam du ba du ba'i rnam par nges pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is seen in some cases, then it is not ascertained in that form, just as smoke is not ascertained in the form of smoke.

original: rang bzhin nges pa med par ni su yang mi smra'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin nges pa med par ni su yang mi smra'o //
translated: No one says that the nature is not ascertained.

original: bsgrub bya med na du ba med pa ni du ba nyid bzhin du rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub bya med na du ba med pa ni du ba nyid bzhin du rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: If the probandum does not exist, the nonexistence of smoke is not the nature of smoke.

original: du ba'i rang bzhin de med na med pa'i chos nyid mthong bas nges par byas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: du ba'i rang bzhin de med na med pa'i chos nyid mthong bas nges par byas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the nature of smoke is ascertained by seeing the fact that it does not exist without that,

original: de med na med pa tsam las ni med pa'i chos rang bzhin yin par ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de med na med pa tsam las ni med pa'i chos rang bzhin yin par ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the mere fact that it does not exist without that is not the nature of the nonexistence of that fact.

original: bum pa la sogs pa med pa 'ga' zhig tu yang lan du mar yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa med pa 'ga' zhig tu yang lan du mar yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nonexistence of a pot, etc. is sometimes seen in some places.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'brel pa khas blang bar bya ba yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'brel pa khas blang bar bya ba yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the relation must be accepted.

original: de bas na 'brel pa bzhag nas ma mthong bas grub pa'i khyab pa la tshig gis 'dod chags dpog par byed nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'brel pa bzhag nas ma mthong bas grub pa'i khyab pa la tshig gis 'dod chags dpog par byed nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the relation is established by the nonobservation of the pervader, not by the nonobservation of the related object.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs des na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs des na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du bdag lta bu'i smra ba po ni 'dod chags can yin no zhes brjod par rigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bdag lta bu'i smra ba po ni 'dod chags can yin no zhes brjod par rigs par 'gyur te /
translated: It would be reasonable to say that a speaker like me is desirous,

original: bdag lta bu yin pa'i phyir chos can smra ba po la 'dod chags bsgrub par bya ba des na de ltar 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag lta bu yin pa'i phyir chos can smra ba po la 'dod chags bsgrub par bya ba des na de ltar 'thad pa yin no //
translated: because I am like one who is desirous. The reason is established in the subject, the speaker. Therefore, it is reasonable.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa can gyi 'dod chags la bdag lta bu nyid 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa can gyi 'dod chags la bdag lta bu nyid 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because being like me is related to being desirous in the way that has been explained.

original: 'brel pa nyid ston pa ni 'dod chags skye ba'i rkyen gyi khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa nyid ston pa ni 'dod chags skye ba'i rkyen gyi khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The relation is shown by the words ‚Äúthe special condition for the arising of desire.‚Äù

original: bdag tu lta ba'i mtshan nyid tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa log pa'i shes pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i mtshan nyid tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa log pa'i shes pa yin la /
translated: The view of a self is a wrong cognition that is a form of incorrect mental attention.

original: de yang 'dod chags skye ba'i rkyen khyad par can yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dod chags skye ba'i rkyen khyad par can yin no //
translated: And that is a special condition for the arising of desire.

original: rkyen gzhan yod kyang 'di rgyu khyad par can yin te gzhan rnams 'di'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen gzhan yod kyang 'di rgyu khyad par can yin te gzhan rnams 'di'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though there are other conditions, this is the special cause, because the others follow after it.

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir te /üîΩgtan tshigs de'i phyir na bdag dang 'dra ba nyid kyis tshul bzhin ma yin pa dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir te / gtan tshigs de'i phyir na bdag dang 'dra ba nyid kyis tshul bzhin ma yin pa dang ldan pa ni /
translated: Because it possesses that.

original: 'dod chags can yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags can yin no //
translated: For that reason, the one who possesses incorrect mental activity is a lustful person,

original: bdag lta bu nyid ni tshul bzhin ma @72a * //
analyzed: bdag lta bu nyid ni tshul bzhin ma @72a * //
translated: because of being like me.üîΩThe one who is like me is the nature of incorrect mental activity.

original: yin pa yid la byed pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa des na 'dod chags dang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid du bsgrub po //
analyzed: yin pa yid la byed pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa des na 'dod chags dang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid du bsgrub po //
translated: Therefore, lust is established as having the same nature as that.

original: de'i tshe yang smra ba dper brjod pa ni don med de /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang smra ba dper brjod pa ni don med de /
translated: Even at that time, the example of the speaker is meaningless.

original: smra ba po smos pa ni don dang mi ldan no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: smra ba po smos pa ni don dang mi ldan no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The mention of the speaker is meaningless, that is the meaning.

original: bdag lta bu gang yin pa de 'dod chags can yin no zhes bya ba nyid kyis bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag lta bu gang yin pa de 'dod chags can yin no zhes bya ba nyid kyis bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established that whoever is like me is lustful.

original: des na de ltar lus dang tshig dag gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las gzhan yin pa na 'brel pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ltar snang ba nyid du bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: des na de ltar lus dang tshig dag gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las gzhan yin pa na 'brel pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ltar snang ba nyid du bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, when the body and speech are other than the three types of reasons, they are established as fallacious reasons because they lack the relation.

original: de'i phyir zhes mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: Thus, concludes the verse.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba gang yin pa de gtan tshigs ma yin pa de bas na gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum kho na'o zhes gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba gang yin pa de gtan tshigs ma yin pa de bas na gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum kho na'o zhes gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
translated: Since the mere non-observation of the discordant side is not a logical reason, it is established that there are only three kinds of logical reasons.

original: yang ci'i phyir mngon sum gyis grub pa'i khyab pa nyid gzhan nas 'brel pa la brten pa nyid gtan tshigs yin pa na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir mngon sum gyis grub pa'i khyab pa nyid gzhan nas 'brel pa la brten pa nyid gtan tshigs yin pa na /
translated: Again, why is it that when the pervasion established by perception itself is the logical reason based on the relation between the two terms,

original: gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum kho nar bstan gyi rnam pa 'di lta bu dag kyang gtan tshigs min par mi 'gyur zhes bya bar dogs pa bsu nas sun dbyung zhing 'brel pa bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum kho nar bstan gyi rnam pa 'di lta bu dag kyang gtan tshigs min par mi 'gyur zhes bya bar dogs pa bsu nas sun dbyung zhing 'brel pa bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: the three kinds of logical reasons are taught, and not that such kinds of logical reasons do not exist? Anticipating this doubt, in order to refute it and establish the relation,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la zhes smos so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la zhes smos so //
translated: he says, The mere non-observation of the discordant side.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam gyis mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba la ni 'khrul pa med pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam gyis mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba la ni 'khrul pa med pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The mere non-observation of the discordant side does not have the nature of positive and negative concomitance in the observation of the concordant side, which is free from error.

original: gtan tshigs mthong la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong bar yang brjod do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs mthong la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong bar yang brjod do //
translated: Because the reason is seen in the similar class, but not seen in the dissimilar class, it is also said to be seen in the similar class.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mang po zhig tshogs par mthong du zin kyang zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mang po zhig tshogs par mthong du zin kyang zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: For this very reason, it is explained that even if many are seen to assemble.

original: ji ltar tshad mas de ltar rtogs kyang mi 'thad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar tshad mas de ltar rtogs kyang mi 'thad ce na /
translated: Even though it is understood in this way by valid cognition, why is it not tenable?

original: bshad pa / gal te yang 'dir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba med pa de lta na yang 'khrul pa srid pa can nyid do //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te yang 'dir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba med pa de lta na yang 'khrul pa srid pa can nyid do //
translated: It is said: Even if seeing does not exist in the dissimilar class here, error is still possible.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong na ni grub pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong na ni grub pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If seeing existed in the dissimilar class, it would be established.

original: ma mthong na ni grub pa ma yin la bsal ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa srid pa yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong na ni grub pa ma yin la bsal ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa srid pa yin no //
translated: If it is not seen, it is not established, but it is not excluded, so error is possible.

original: gal te yang rtag pa la 'gar yang byas pa nyid ma mthong ba de lta na yang rnam pa de lta bu'i byas pa 'ga' zhig rtag par yang 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni yod srid do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang rtag pa la 'gar yang byas pa nyid ma mthong ba de lta na yang rnam pa de lta bu'i byas pa 'ga' zhig rtag par yang 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni yod srid do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But even though one never sees the state of being produced in the permanent, it is possible that some sort of state of being produced would occur even in the permanent.

original: mi mthun phyogs la 'jug pa ma mthong yang 'khrul pa mthong ba yang yod pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni phru ba'i 'bras ni tshogs pa @72b bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs la 'jug pa ma mthong yang 'khrul pa mthong ba yang yod pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni phru ba'i 'bras ni tshogs pa @72b bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: But even though one does not see the occurrence of the counter-correlate, one does see error. The example is ‚Äúthe rice in the pot.‚Äù

original: ji ltar phru ba'i nang du chud pa'i gtan tshigs kyis 'bras chos par sgrub pa de bzhin du 'di la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar phru ba'i nang du chud pa'i gtan tshigs kyis 'bras chos par sgrub pa de bzhin du 'di la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the rice in the pot is established as cooked by the reason of being in the pot, so it is in this case.

original: phru ba'i nang du chud pa nyid ni ma tshos pa la mthong ba med de /
analyzed: phru ba'i nang du chud pa nyid ni ma tshos pa la mthong ba med de /
translated: The rice in the pot is not seen to be uncooked,

original: phyi rol na gnas pa'i ma tshos pa rnams phru bar tshud pa med pa'i phyir dang / phru ba na gnas pa 'ga' zhig kyang chos par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol na gnas pa'i ma tshos pa rnams phru bar tshud pa med pa'i phyir dang / phru ba na gnas pa 'ga' zhig kyang chos par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the uncooked rice that exists externally is not in the pot, and because some of the rice that exists in the pot is seen to be cooked.

original: de lta mod kyi de'i nang du chud pa mtha' dag bsal na /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi de'i nang du chud pa mtha' dag bsal na /
translated: But if all that is included in it is excluded,

original: de la 'ga' zhig ma tshos par yang de nyid kyi tshem thod ba yin no //
analyzed: de la 'ga' zhig ma tshos par yang de nyid kyi tshem thod ba yin no //
translated: then at that time, some of it would not be dyed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de mthong ba tsam gyis tshos pa po mi ldog go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de mthong ba tsam gyis tshos pa po mi ldog go //
translated: Therefore, merely by seeing that, the dyer would not stop.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: rang gi yul tsam gyi mthar thug pa'i tshad mas mthong ba las tha dad pa gzhan du 'byung ba mi spong ba'i phyir ma mthong du zin kyang the tshom du 'gyur bar rigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de rnam pa 'di lta bu la ni 'khrul
analyzed: rang gi yul tsam gyi mthar thug pa'i tshad mas mthong ba las tha dad pa gzhan du 'byung ba mi spong ba'i phyir ma mthong du zin kyang the tshom du 'gyur bar rigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de rnam pa 'di lta bu la ni 'khrul
translated: Not only is it reasonable that doubt arises even when there is no seeing, because of not abandoning that which occurs as different from the seeing of the valid cognition that reaches the limit of its own object,

original: pa dmigs pa yang yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: pa dmigs pa yang yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: but in this kind of case, there is also the observation of error.

original: mang po zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa'o ;
analyzed: mang po zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa'o ;
translated: Many and so on is the commentary.

original: /'dis ni mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par dmigs pa nyid brjod do //
analyzed: /'dis ni mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par dmigs pa nyid brjod do //
translated: This expresses the observation of the presence of the similar class.

original: mdor smos kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba ni ma bshad de /
analyzed: mdor smos kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba ni ma bshad de /
translated: Although it is stated briefly, the non-observation in the dissimilar class is not explained.

original: 'dis de 'phags par bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'dis de 'phags par bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement that it is a noble truth.

original: 'phen par byed pa dang 'phang bar bya ba'i dngos pos na mdo'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong bas mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa 'phangs pa ci nas kyang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phen par byed pa dang 'phang bar bya ba'i dngos pos na mdo'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong bas mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa 'phangs pa ci nas kyang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the nature of the impelling and the impelled, the existence of the object of the concordant side is implied by the non-perception of the object of the discordant side, in order that it be understood with certainty.

original: phru ba'i nang du 'dug pa rnams las mang po zhig tshos par mthong bas na phru ba'i nang du tshud pa zhes bya ba kho nas ni tshos par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: phru ba'i nang du 'dug pa rnams las mang po zhig tshos par mthong bas na phru ba'i nang du tshud pa zhes bya ba kho nas ni tshos par mi 'grub ste /
translated: Since many of those who are in the pot are seen to be cooked, the mere statement that they are in the pot does not prove that they are cooked.

original: tshos pa me dang phru ba'i nang du chud pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de yod na chos par 'gyur ba yin no zhes mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: tshos pa me dang phru ba'i nang du chud pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de yod na chos par 'gyur ba yin no zhes mi 'grub bo //
translated: If they were cooked, they would not be in the pot and in the fire, and so it is not established that they are cooked if they are in the pot.

original: ji ltar mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'grub ce na /
translated: How is it not established?

original: 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: Because of the perception of error.

original: gal te phru ba'i nang du chud pa nyid kyang tshos pa skyed pa'i tshogs pa tshang bar rtogs par byed pa na tshos pa bsgrub par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te phru ba'i nang du chud pa nyid kyang tshos pa skyed pa'i tshogs pa tshang bar rtogs par byed pa na tshos pa bsgrub par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: If you think that the very fact that the rice is in the pot is the cause of the collection of conditions that generates the cooking, then you are not establishing the cooking.

original: gal te 'di rgyu tshang ba ma yin na 'ga' yang tshos par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'di rgyu tshang ba ma yin na 'ga' yang tshos par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If this is not a complete cause, then nothing would be cooked.

original: de dag tshos pa yang rgyu med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag tshos pa yang rgyu med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established that cooking is without a cause.

original: de rgyu tshogs pa yin na ji ltar gzhan yang ma tshogs des na 'di la 'khrul pa mthong ba ji ltar 'thad ce na /
analyzed: de rgyu tshogs pa yin na ji ltar gzhan yang ma tshogs des na 'di la 'khrul pa mthong ba ji ltar 'thad ce na /
translated: If it is a complete cause, how could it be incomplete for another? Therefore, how could it be tenable that you see a mistake here?

original: dogs pa 'di bsu nas smras pa ni 'di ltar 'di lta bu'i zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dogs pa 'di bsu nas smras pa ni 'di ltar 'di lta bu'i zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In response to this doubt, he says, ‚ÄúIt is like this: it is like this kind of . . . ‚Äù

original: @73a * // bsam pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: @73a * // bsam pa 'di yin te /
translated: This is the thought:

original: phru ba la sogs pa'i tshogs pa yongs su 'gyur ba la ltos nas 'bras rnams 'bras can du 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: phru ba la sogs pa'i tshogs pa yongs su 'gyur ba la ltos nas 'bras rnams 'bras can du 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: The rice becomes cooked in dependence on the transformation of the collection of the pot and so on.

original: de yang dus gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang dus gnas pa nyid do //
translated: And that is just the passage of time.

original: de la 'bras 'ga' zhig ni dus cung zad gnas pa la ltos nas de ltar 'gyur la gzhan dag la ni gzhan du'o //
analyzed: de la 'bras 'ga' zhig ni dus cung zad gnas pa la ltos nas de ltar 'gyur la gzhan dag la ni gzhan du'o //
translated: Some results are seen to last for a short time, while others are seen to last for a long time.

original: des na de lta bu'i dngos por mthong ba dag dang mtshungs par gnas pa la ltos pa dag ni tshos pa kho nar 'gyur la gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de lta bu'i dngos por mthong ba dag dang mtshungs par gnas pa la ltos pa dag ni tshos pa kho nar 'gyur la gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, those that are seen to last for a short time are seen to be cooked, while those that last for a long time are not.

original: de bzhin du gang dag drod dang nye bar 'brel pa de dag ni myur bar tshos par 'gyur la gzhan ni ma yin pa des na 'khrul pa dmigs par 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dag drod dang nye bar 'brel pa de dag ni myur bar tshos par 'gyur la gzhan ni ma yin pa des na 'khrul pa dmigs par 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, those that are in contact with heat are cooked quickly, while those that are not are not. Thus, the observation of error is tenable.

original: des na 'di bstan pa'i phyir de ltar 'brel pa rjes su dpyod pas rtogs par ston to //
analyzed: des na 'di bstan pa'i phyir de ltar 'brel pa rjes su dpyod pas rtogs par ston to //
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate this, it is said that ‚Äúone should understand this by examining the connection.‚Äù

original: 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin can yin la zhes bya ba ni gnas pa la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin can yin la zhes bya ba ni gnas pa la ltos pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving such a nature‚Äù means that it depends on duration.

original: 'di dang tshos pa'i rgyu 'dra ba can zhes bya ba ni drod nye ring ngo //
analyzed: 'di dang tshos pa'i rgyu 'dra ba can zhes bya ba ni drod nye ring ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving a cause similar to cooking‚Äù means that it is near or far from heat.

original: des na de ltar 'di dag tshogs pa gcig la rag las par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de ltar 'di dag tshogs pa gcig la rag las par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they are all dependent on a single collection.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par 'di lta bu'i rigs pa la mi ltos par de ltar dmigs pa tsam la brten pa de'i tshe 'di rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bshad pa ni de lta ma yin na ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par 'di lta bu'i rigs pa la mi ltos par de ltar dmigs pa tsam la brten pa de'i tshe 'di rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bshad pa ni de lta ma yin na ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: When it is not based on a reasoning of this type, but is based on mere observation, then it is not inference at all. This is what is meant by the phrase ‚Äúif it were not so.‚Äù

original: ma mthong ba tsam la brten na ni rjes su dpag pa 'di lhag ma dang ldan pa yin la des na 'khrul pa can yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam la brten na ni rjes su dpag pa 'di lhag ma dang ldan pa yin la des na 'khrul pa can yin no //
translated: If it were based on mere non-observation, then this inference would be incomplete, and therefore erroneous.

original: lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni /
analyzed: lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni /
translated: The nature of an incomplete inference is as follows:

original: yang lhag ma dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces dri ba sngon du btang ba can gyis ston par byed pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang lhag ma dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces dri ba sngon du btang ba can gyis ston par byed pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The question is raised, ‚ÄúWhat is this ‚Äòincomplete‚Äô that you speak of?‚Äù The answer is given in the passage beginning with the words ‚ÄúThat which . . .‚Äù

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis gang zhig ma mthong ba kho nas ldog pa rab tu ston par byed pa /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis gang zhig ma mthong ba kho nas ldog pa rab tu ston par byed pa /
translated: That which is taught by mere non-observation, that is, by non-observation alone, is the object of an incomplete inference.

original: de ni lhag ma dang ldan pa yin no zhes 'dri ba dang ngag gcig nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de ni lhag ma dang ldan pa yin no zhes 'dri ba dang ngag gcig nyid bstan to //
translated: The question and the answer are given in the same passage.

original: ji skad bshad ma thag pa de'i ldog pa de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam gyis ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs kyis na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug par the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad ma thag pa de'i ldog pa de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam gyis ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs kyis na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug par the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The contrapositive of the reason just explained is not ascertained by the mere non-seeing of the discordant side, and so there is doubt that it engages the discordant side.

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir lhag ma dang ldan pa nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir lhag ma dang ldan pa nyid du bshad do //
translated: Master DignƒÅga explained that it has a remainder because it has the property of engaging the discordant side.

original: de yang 'di la yod pa'i phyir 'di yang rnam pa de lta bu kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang 'di la yod pa'i phyir 'di yang rnam pa de lta bu kho na'o //
translated: Since that also exists in this [reason], this [reason] is exactly that type.

original: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos can rnam pa @73b gsum las /
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos can rnam pa @73b gsum las /
translated: From among the three types of subjects of the concordant side and discordant side,

original: gcig ni gtan tshigs yod pa yin pas de las mi mthun pa'i phyogs gcig tu lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig ni gtan tshigs yod pa yin pas de las mi mthun pa'i phyogs gcig tu lhag ma yin no //
translated: one is the existent reason, and from that, the discordant side is the remainder.

original: gnyid pa de ni gtan tshigs dang 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyid pa de ni gtan tshigs dang 'brel pa yin te /
translated: That remainder is related to the reason

original: de dag las ldog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag las ldog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the contrapositive of those [two].

original: lhag ma ni ldog mtshams yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni ldog mtshams yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: The remainder is not the domain of relation because it is a limit.

original: de las mi ldog pa'i phyir 'di la ni de yang yod pas na lhag pa dang lda pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de las mi ldog pa'i phyir 'di la ni de yang yod pas na lhag pa dang lda pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Since there is no turning away from that, it is called the remainder and the remainder-possessor.

original: yang ji ltar gang zhig ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa brjod pa de de ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar gang zhig ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa brjod pa de de ltar brjod ce na /
translated: How can it be said that it is like that, when it is said that there is a turning away from something merely by not seeing it?

original: bshad pa ldog pa sgrub pa ma mthong ba tsam ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa ldog pa sgrub pa ma mthong ba tsam ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The explanation is that the mere non-seeing of the proof of a turning away is a cause of doubt.

original: gal te ma mthong ba ni snang ba mi dmigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ba ni snang ba mi dmigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: If non-seeing is not a non-apprehension of appearance,

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa la med pa'i ldog pa yang des rtogs pa yin pa des na ji ltar 'di the tshom gyi rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa la med pa'i ldog pa yang des rtogs pa yin pa des na ji ltar 'di the tshom gyi rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: then the non-existence of the probandum is understood by that non-existence of the turning away. So how is this a cause of doubt?

original: 'di la bshad pa ni mi dmigs pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa ni mi dmigs pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of this is:üîΩAll non-apprehensions are of two types: non-apprehension of something seen and non-apprehension of something not seen.

original: 'di la lan mang du ma mthong yang dngos po nyung zad la bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa ma mthong ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can nyid la /
analyzed: 'di la lan mang du ma mthong yang dngos po nyung zad la bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa ma mthong ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can nyid la /
translated: Although this is not seen many times, if there is no object of proof in a small object, the proof is not seen. The object of proof is not the subject.

original: bsgrub bya med na gtan tshigs yod pa ma yin no zhes mngon sum gyis ni nges par mi nus te /
analyzed: bsgrub bya med na gtan tshigs yod pa ma yin no zhes mngon sum gyis ni nges par mi nus te /
translated: It is not possible to ascertain by perception that if the object of proof does not exist, the reason does not exist.

original: rang gi yul tsam gyis mthar thug pa'i byed pa can nyid kyi yul du ma byas pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin nges par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi yul tsam gyis mthar thug pa'i byed pa can nyid kyi yul du ma byas pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin nges par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because perception, which has the mere object as its limit, does not ascertain the nature of an object that is not perceived.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa las gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa las gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Non-apprehension of appearance is not different from non-apprehension.

original: des na 'di bsgrub par bya ba med na med pa nyid yin la de yod na yang bsgrub par bya ba yod pa nyid do zhes nges pa skyes pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la sgrub par byed pa rtogs pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rtogs par
analyzed: des na 'di bsgrub par bya ba med na med pa nyid yin la de yod na yang bsgrub par bya ba yod pa nyid do zhes nges pa skyes pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la sgrub par byed pa rtogs pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rtogs par
translated: Therefore, if the object of proof does not exist, it does not exist. If it exists, the object of proof exists. Thus, when ascertainment arises, the proof is understood in the subject of the object of proof. By understanding the proof, the object of proof is understood.

original: 'gyur ro // chos can thams cad kyang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa des 'di de la mi snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // chos can thams cad kyang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa des 'di de la mi snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And all things that are the bases of properties are not of the nature of being perceived. Therefore, the non-perception of that [property] would be non-perception itself.

original: de yang dngos po med pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang dngos po med pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: And that [non-perception] does not establish the non-existence of the property.

original: des na mi dmigs pa thams cad ni med pa bsgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: des na mi dmigs pa thams cad ni med pa bsgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that not all non-perceptions establish non-existence.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i chos yod par dogs pa /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i chos yod par dogs pa /
translated: If there is doubt that the property to be established exists in the subject,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag kho nas bzlog par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag kho nas bzlog par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: is it not to be refuted only by seeing and not seeing in the similar and dissimilar classes?

original: ma mthong ba de @74a * //
analyzed: ma mthong ba de @74a * //
translated: And that non-seeing

original: yang tshad ma kho na yin pa des na bsgrub par bya ba med pa la med pa mngon sum gyis grub par ji ltar chos can la de ltar nges par mi 'gyur zhe na 'di la bshad zin te /
analyzed: yang tshad ma kho na yin pa des na bsgrub par bya ba med pa la med pa mngon sum gyis grub par ji ltar chos can la de ltar nges par mi 'gyur zhe na 'di la bshad zin te /
translated: is a valid cognition itself. Therefore, how could it not be ascertained in the subject that the absence of the property to be established is established by perception? This has already been explained.

original: mngon sum ni rang gi rten nyid la de lta bu'i ngo bor gcod par byed kyi chos can gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni rang gi rten nyid la de lta bu'i ngo bor gcod par byed kyi chos can gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: Direct perception determines that very basis to be of such a nature, but not another subject.

original: de'i yul 'di ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan yang de ltar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges par yang med do //
analyzed: de'i yul 'di ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan yang de ltar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges par yang med do //
translated: And there is no certainty that just as it is in regard to its object, so it is in regard to another.

original: des na gang gi phyir 'dir 'di bsgrub par bya ba med na med par mngon sum gyis mthong ba de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la yang de lta yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa ci zhig yod//
analyzed: des na gang gi phyir 'dir 'di bsgrub par bya ba med na med par mngon sum gyis mthong ba de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la yang de lta yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa ci zhig yod//
translated: Therefore, since here it is seen by direct perception that if the probandum is not present, the probans is not present, what certainty is there that it is so in regard to the subject of the probandum?

original: gal te mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la de ltar mthong ba'i phyir de dang mthun pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la rtogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa nyid nges pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la de ltar mthong ba'i phyir de dang mthun pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la rtogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa nyid nges pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If it is so in regard to the similar and dissimilar instances, then is it not the case that the inference that is in conformity with that is ascertained in regard to the subject of the probandum?

original: des na bsgrub bya'i chos can la de ltar 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir nges pa gzhan dgos pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: des na bsgrub bya'i chos can la de ltar 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir nges pa gzhan dgos pa ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, in order to make it so in regard to the subject of the probandum, there is no need for another certainty.

original: / rjes su dpag pa la zhugs pa'i sngon rol du bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la bsgrub pa'i chos yod pa dang med par the tshom 'jug kyang skyon yod pa ma yin te khyab pa ma dran pa na the tsam 'jug kyang de rjes su dpyod pas
analyzed: / rjes su dpag pa la zhugs pa'i sngon rol du bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la bsgrub pa'i chos yod pa dang med par the tshom 'jug kyang skyon yod pa ma yin te khyab pa ma dran pa na the tsam 'jug kyang de rjes su dpyod pas
translated: Before engaging in inference, one may doubt whether the property of the probandum exists or does not exist in the subject. However, this is not a fault, because when one recalls the pervasion, one engages in inference.

original: chos mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i dper dag la mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dran pa las bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ldan par nges pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rjes su dpag pa skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: chos mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i dper dag la mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dran pa las bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ldan par nges pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rjes su dpag pa skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Through recalling what is seen and not seen in the similar and dissimilar examples, inference arises, which is characterized by ascertaining that the subject possesses the property of the probandum.

original: de ni mi rung ste de bzhin du mthong ba'i 'du byed skyes pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la sgrub par byed pa'i rtogs pa skyes pa kho na las dngos po'i ngo bos bsgrub par bya ba'i rtogs pa dbang med du 'jug pa'i phyir der rjes suüîΩdpag pa nyid nges pa yin par brjod dam /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste de bzhin du mthong ba'i 'du byed skyes pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la sgrub par byed pa'i rtogs pa skyes pa kho na las dngos po'i ngo bos bsgrub par bya ba'i rtogs pa dbang med du 'jug pa'i phyir der rjes suüîΩdpag pa nyid nges pa yin par brjod dam /
translated: This is not correct, because in the same way, when the realization of the property of the probandum arises in the subject, the produced conditioned phenomena that are seen, the realization of the property of the probandum arises involuntarily due to the nature of things. Therefore, is it said that inference itself is ascertained there?

original: yang rgyu'i tshigs pa la rag las pa med par 'jug par rang dbang du gyur pa'i rtogs pa po gnyis la de ltar dmigs pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la yang de de ltar 'gyur ba yin no zhes rigs pa la ltos nas rtogs pa yin
analyzed: yang rgyu'i tshigs pa la rag las pa med par 'jug par rang dbang du gyur pa'i rtogs pa po gnyis la de ltar dmigs pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la yang de de ltar 'gyur ba yin no zhes rigs pa la ltos nas rtogs pa yin
translated: Also, because of the observation of the two realizers, the one who is not dependent on the power of the cause and the one who is dependent on the power of the cause, the probandum is also like that.

original: no // de la re zhig rtogs pa snga ma ni mi 'thad de sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: no // de la re zhig rtogs pa snga ma ni mi 'thad de sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: The first of these realizers is not tenable, because it is the proof.üîΩIf the probandum does not exist in the probandum, then even if the realization arises by the power of the thing, it is not tenable that it is supported by the thing.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod par so sor nges pa ma yin na dngos pa'i mthu la rtogs pa skyes kyang dngos po'i rten dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir tshad @74b ma ma yin pa kho na'o
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod par so sor nges pa ma yin na dngos pa'i mthu la rtogs pa skyes kyang dngos po'i rten dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir tshad @74b ma ma yin pa kho na'o
translated: It is not a valid cognition.

original: // du ba dang bcas pa'i chos can gcig me dang ldan pa yin pas gzhan yang de ltar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i dngos po yod pa'i nges pa ni ma grub bo //
analyzed: // du ba dang bcas pa'i chos can gcig me dang ldan pa yin pas gzhan yang de ltar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i dngos po yod pa'i nges pa ni ma grub bo //
translated: The ascertainment of the existence of the thing, ‚ÄúBecause one locus that has smoke has fire, another locus that has smoke also has fire,‚Äù is not established.

original: mngon gsum bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa skyes pa yang gang gi tshe don yod pa de'i tshe ni tshad ma yin no zhes de ltar rjes su dpag pa tshad ma med par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon gsum bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa skyes pa yang gang gi tshe don yod pa de'i tshe ni tshad ma yin no zhes de ltar rjes su dpag pa tshad ma med par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as in the case of direct perception, inferential cognition is valid only when it is about an existent object. Thus, inferential cognition cannot be valid without a valid means of knowledge.

original: dper na 'dir yang dngos po yod pa'i nges pa bsgrub par la ltos par bya bsgrub par bya pa'i chos can la sgrub par byed pa'i rtogs pa skyes pa kho na las dngos po'i ngo bos bsgrub par bya ba'i rtogs so zhe na gal te nges pa nyid
analyzed: dper na 'dir yang dngos po yod pa'i nges pa bsgrub par la ltos par bya bsgrub par bya pa'i chos can la sgrub par byed pa'i rtogs pa skyes pa kho na las dngos po'i ngo bos bsgrub par bya ba'i rtogs so zhe na gal te nges pa nyid
translated: For example, here too, if one relies on the ascertainment of existence, the cognition of the probandum arises only from the cognition of the probans with regard to the subject, and the cognition of the probandum is by the nature of the thing itself. If ascertainment itself

original: rang bzhin gyi khyad par gyi bdag nyid yin na lan cig mthong bas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi khyad par gyi bdag nyid yin na lan cig mthong bas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: is of the nature of a specific property, then it would be cognized even by a single perception.

original: de lta ma yin na ni yang nas yang dmigs pa yang sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni yang nas yang dmigs pa yang sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: If it were not so, then repeated observation would not establish it.

original: med na mi 'byung ba ni lhan cig yod par nges pa yin la de yang lan mang por lhan cig mthong bas rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba ni lhan cig yod par nges pa yin la de yang lan mang por lhan cig mthong bas rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Non-apprehension is ascertained to be co-existent, and that is cognized by seeing them together many times.

original: gal te 'di yang rgyu dang bcas pa yin na lan cig nyid rtogs pas rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di yang rgyu dang bcas pa yin na lan cig nyid rtogs pas rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If this is also with cause, then it would be understood by the mere understanding of one.

original: gzhan du na ni mang du de ltar yin yang ji snyed dmigs pa de lta bu'i ngo bor dmigs par gyur gyi ma dmigs pa gzhan la ni de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir nges pa ma 'gyur bo //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni mang du de ltar yin yang ji snyed dmigs pa de lta bu'i ngo bor dmigs par gyur gyi ma dmigs pa gzhan la ni de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir nges pa ma 'gyur bo //
translated: Otherwise, even if there are many, it would be understood as the nature of what is observed, but not as the nature of what is not observed. Therefore, it would not be ascertained.

original: 'bras bu la sogs pa bzhi du gang nges pas rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs par 'gyur ba mi 'khrul pa nyid kyang dngos po'i chos yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu la sogs pa bzhi du gang nges pas rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs par 'gyur ba mi 'khrul pa nyid kyang dngos po'i chos yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the four such as effect are ascertained, and by that non-deception is understood, and that non-deception is also a property of real things,

original: mi 'khrul ba de ci zhig de yod na gzhan yod la gzhan med na ni med pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'khrul ba de ci zhig de yod na gzhan yod la gzhan med na ni med pa'o zhe na /
translated: then what is that non-deception? If it exists when the other exists and does not exist when the other does not exist,

original: gal te de nyi tshe ba yin na ni re 'ga' 'khrul par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de nyi tshe ba yin na ni re 'ga' 'khrul par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: if it is limited, then it would sometimes be deceptive.

original: 'o na te thams cad pa yin na de ltar na de ltar 'thad pa yin na 'di rtogs pa go ji ltar yin gal te thams cad du de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'o na te thams cad pa yin na de ltar na de ltar 'thad pa yin na 'di rtogs pa go ji ltar yin gal te thams cad du de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir na /
translated: If it is universal, then if it is tenable in that way, how is that understood? If it is understood in all cases,

original: de ni de ltar 'thad mod kyi 'on kyang thams cad du de ltar rtogs pa thams cad gzigs pa ma yin pa'i mthong ba med pa'i nges pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: de ni de ltar 'thad mod kyi 'on kyang thams cad du de ltar rtogs pa thams cad gzigs pa ma yin pa'i mthong ba med pa'i nges pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: That is correct, but still, there is no certainty that the perception of one who does not see all things as they are is not mistaken.

original: /'on te nyi tshe ba'i rtogs pas yin na de lta na la lar 'gyur ba 'khrul par yang mi 'gal te /
analyzed: /'on te nyi tshe ba'i rtogs pas yin na de lta na la lar 'gyur ba 'khrul par yang mi 'gal te /
translated: If it is by limited knowledge, then it is not contradictory that it is sometimes mistaken,

original: lan mang du de ltar gyur pa gang yin pa gzhan gyi tshe de ltar ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes nges par mi nus pa'i phyir dang / de ltar ma yin na 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan mang du de ltar gyur pa gang yin pa gzhan gyi tshe de ltar ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes nges par mi nus pa'i phyir dang / de ltar ma yin na 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to ascertain that what has been so many times will not be otherwise at another time, and if it were not so, it would not be established as non-resultant.

original: @75a * // 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid na de med kyang yod pas mi 'khrul ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: @75a * // 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid na de med kyang yod pas mi 'khrul ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro//
translated: If it is not a result, then it is not non-mistaken because it exists even when it does not exist.

original: mi 'khrul na yang 'bras bu nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'khrul na yang 'bras bu nyid do //
translated: And if it is non-mistaken, then it is a result.

original: tha dad pa med pa byas pa dang / mi rtogs pa dag ni gcig la ltos nas gzhan gyi ngo bo rnam par 'jig pa ma yin pa'i phyir gang zhig gang dang mi 'khrul ba'i rang bzhin yin /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa byas pa dang / mi rtogs pa dag ni gcig la ltos nas gzhan gyi ngo bo rnam par 'jig pa ma yin pa'i phyir gang zhig gang dang mi 'khrul ba'i rang bzhin yin /
translated: The non-difference of the two, the produced and the non-apprehended, is not destroyed by the other‚Äôs nature, in dependence on the one.

original: des na mi 'khrul ba ni ma mthong ba rtogs par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mi 'khrul ba ni ma mthong ba rtogs par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, non-error is not the means of knowing the non-seen.

original: de ltar na de ni the tshom sgrub par byed pa kho na'o //üîΩgang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir gcig ces bya ba bsgrub par bya ba log pas de med pas de med pas de med pas gzhan zhes bya ba sgrub par byed pa ldog par 'dod pas ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub bar byed pa de
analyzed: de ltar na de ni the tshom sgrub par byed pa kho na'o // gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir gcig ces bya ba bsgrub par bya ba log pas de med pas de med pas de med pas gzhan zhes bya ba sgrub par byed pa ldog par 'dod pas ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub bar byed pa de
translated: Thus, it is only the means of knowing doubt.

original: gnyis rang bzhin 'brel pa yang 'dod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: gnyis rang bzhin 'brel pa yang 'dod par bya dgos so //
translated: Since that is so, one who asserts that the negation of the probandum, ‚Äúone,‚Äù negates the probans, ‚Äúother,‚Äù must also assert that the probandum and probans are essentially related.

original: sgrub par byed pa bsgrub par bya bar 'brel pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'i bdag nyid can yin gyi gnyis ka yang phan tshun rag las pa'i rang bzhin ni ma ni no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa bsgrub par bya bar 'brel pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'i bdag nyid can yin gyi gnyis ka yang phan tshun rag las pa'i rang bzhin ni ma ni no //
translated: The proof and the probandum are related in such a way that the probandum is the nature of the proof. But neither is the nature of the other, in the sense of being dependent on the other.

original: de ltar khas mi len na gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar khas mi len na gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not accept this, then the reason would not prove the probandum.

original: gzhan log pas gzhan ldog par khas blangs nas de yod na bsgrub bya yod pa yang grub pa nyid pas logs su ma bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan log pas gzhan ldog par khas blangs nas de yod na bsgrub bya yod pa yang grub pa nyid pas logs su ma bstan te /
translated: Since one accepts that the negation of one thing is the affirmation of another, and since the existence of the probandum is established by the existence of the proof, it is not taught separately.

original: 'phen par byed pa dang 'phang par bya ba'i dngos pos na 'di gnyis tha mi dag par bsnyad pa'i gnyis tha mi dad pa ra ba snyad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phen par byed pa dang 'phang par bya ba'i dngos pos na 'di gnyis tha mi dag par bsnyad pa'i gnyis tha mi dad pa ra ba snyad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the proof and the probandum are related as that which impels and that which is impelled, they are said to be not different.

original: de bas na sgrub par byed pa yod pas bsgrub par bya ba yod par 'dod pas rang bzhin 'brel bar 'gyur dgos so zhes bya ba yang brjod pa nyid du nges par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sgrub par byed pa yod pas bsgrub par bya ba yod par 'dod pas rang bzhin 'brel bar 'gyur dgos so zhes bya ba yang brjod pa nyid du nges par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since the existence of the probandum is accepted as being due to the existence of the proof, it must be the case that there is a natural relation between them. This is what is being said, and this is how one should understand it.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis grub pa nyid bsal ba 'di ni 'di las phyi rol pa dag bzhin du 'di pa de lta smra ba dag la yang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis grub pa nyid bsal ba 'di ni 'di las phyi rol pa dag bzhin du 'di pa de lta smra ba dag la yang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: The mere non-observation of something does not establish it, and this is the same for the proponents of this system as it is for those outside this system.

original: 'di pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa ni de yis te rgyu des na gtan tshigs kyi ni tshul gsum la'ang phyogs kyi chos tsam la ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rjes su 'gro ldog gnyis la rang nges pa brjod par mdzad pa yin no zhes
analyzed: 'di pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa ni de yis te rgyu des na gtan tshigs kyi ni tshul gsum la'ang phyogs kyi chos tsam la ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rjes su 'gro ldog gnyis la rang nges pa brjod par mdzad pa yin no zhes
translated: The explanation from the perspective of the Buddhist is ‚Äúby that,‚Äù that is, by that reason, the trimodal conditions of the reason are not merely the property of the subject, but rather the expression of the positive and negative concomitance is definite.

original: bya ba ni 'ang gi sgra'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba ni 'ang gi sgra'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that the trimodal conditions are not merely the property of the subject.

original: nye bar gnas pa'i chos can tsam la brten pa phyogs kyi chos nyid ni mngon sum kho nas nges par nus pa de la nges par brjod par rigs kyi /
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa'i chos can tsam la brten pa phyogs kyi chos nyid ni mngon sum kho nas nges par nus pa de la nges par brjod par rigs kyi /
translated: The property of the subject that is based on the mere subject that is present can be ascertained by perception alone. It is reasonable to express the trimodal conditions in terms of that.

original: rjes su 'gro ldog ni mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa la brten pa nyid du shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag las ga la nges /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ldog ni mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa la brten pa nyid du shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag las ga la nges /
translated: But the positive and negative concomitance must be understood to be based on perception and nonperception. So how can they be ascertained from seeing and not seeing?

original: des na 'di de'i yul can nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par @75b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'di de'i yul can nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par @75b 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be stated as the subject of that.

original: des na ji ltar gang dag gi phyogs bstan pa yan lag tu 'dod pa ni ma nges pa nyid yan lag yin pa de bzhin du rjes su 'gro ldog dag kyang yin pas tshul gsum ka la nges pa mi brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ji ltar gang dag gi phyogs bstan pa yan lag tu 'dod pa ni ma nges pa nyid yan lag yin pa de bzhin du rjes su 'gro ldog dag kyang yin pas tshul gsum ka la nges pa mi brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, just as the position of those who assert the three modes is uncertain, so too is the pervasion. Therefore, the three modes are not to be stated as certain.

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gyi 'brel par bzhed pa de'i nges pa brjod pa mdzad do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gyi 'brel par bzhed pa de'i nges pa brjod pa mdzad do //
translated: Since the master [DignƒÅga] asserts a natural relation, he states the certainty.

original: 'di yang brjod par mi bya'am /
analyzed: 'di yang brjod par mi bya'am /
translated: Should this not be stated?

original: don gzhan gyis bstan pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir slob dpon bzhed pa de nyed par bstan pa'i dgos pa ston to //
analyzed: don gzhan gyis bstan pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir slob dpon bzhed pa de nyed par bstan pa'i dgos pa ston to //
translated: In order to show that the master's assertion is not taught by another meaning, the purpose of the teaching is shown.

original: ma grub ces bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can dang 'brel par ma shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma grub ces bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can dang 'brel par ma shes pa'o //
translated: Not established means not known to be related to the subject to be established.

original: ldog don ni 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: ldog don ni 'gal ba'o //
translated: The meaning of contradictory is contradictory.

original: 'khrul pa can ni ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa can ni ma nges pa'o //
translated: The mistaken is uncertain.

original: de dag gi gnyen por te /
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen por te /
translated: Those are the antidotes.

original: de dag bsal ba'i don du tshul gsum la nges pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag bsal ba'i don du tshul gsum la nges pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The three modes are taught in order to eliminate those.

original: 'di ltar 'dir nges pa khas mi len na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir nges pa khas mi len na /
translated: If one does not accept the three modes here,

original: 'di dag kyang ma bsal ba'i phyir gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang ma bsal ba'i phyir gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then those [reasons] would not be eliminated, and so they would be reasons.

original: des na nges par gdon mi za bar 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: des na nges par gdon mi za bar 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one must certainly accept the three modes.

original: de yang 'brel ba'i rtsa ba can nyid kyis de khas ma blangs par brjod par mi nus pas na 'brel pa yang grub bo //
analyzed: de yang 'brel ba'i rtsa ba can nyid kyis de khas ma blangs par brjod par mi nus pas na 'brel pa yang grub bo //
translated: Moreover, since one cannot say that one does not accept the three modes because one does not accept the root of the connection, the connection is established.

original: 'brel pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //üîΩgang gi phyir 'brel pa med na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang ji skad sngar brjod pa bzhin the tshom nyid du 'gyur ba des na ma mthong bas grub pa nyid du khas len na de'i 'brel bu nyi khas blang
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'grel pa'o // gang gi phyir 'brel pa med na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang ji skad sngar brjod pa bzhin the tshom nyid du 'gyur ba des na ma mthong bas grub pa nyid du khas len na de'i 'brel bu nyi khas blang
translated: The phrase without a connection is an explanation.

original: bar rigs kyi gzhan gyi 'bras bu gzhan ston pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bar rigs kyi gzhan gyi 'bras bu gzhan ston pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because if there is no connection, there is no ascertainment of positive and negative concomitance, but rather, as stated above, there is doubt. Therefore, if one accepts that non-observation establishes [the pervasion], then it is reasonable to accept the connection. But one cannot teach the effect of one thing as the effect of another.

original: des 'brel pa'i 'bras bu zhal gyis bzhes pas na 'brel pa nyid ston par mdzad pa na nges par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des 'brel pa'i 'bras bu zhal gyis bzhes pas na 'brel pa nyid ston par mdzad pa na nges par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Since he accepts the effect of the relation, when he teaches the relation itself, he is explaining the effect.

original: gzugs rtogs pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa la brten nas nyan pa'i rnam par shes pa bsgrub par khas blang bar ni mi nus /
analyzed: gzugs rtogs pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa la brten nas nyan pa'i rnam par shes pa bsgrub par khas blang bar ni mi nus /
translated: But it is not possible to establish the auditory consciousness on the basis of the effect of the apprehension of sound.

original: ma grub ces bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pa ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma grub ces bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pa ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary on ‚Äúnot established‚Äù and so on is ‚Äúin that case.‚Äù

original: rjes su 'gro ba nges pas ni 'gal ba bsal ste byas pa nyid rtag par rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba nges pas ni 'gal ba bsal ste byas pa nyid rtag par rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ascertainment of the pervasion eliminates the contradiction, because being produced does not pervade permanence.

original: des na rjes su 'gro ba nges pa go bar byed par ston par mdzad pas byas pa nyid rtag pa'i sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rjes su 'gro ba nges pa go bar byed par ston par mdzad pas byas pa nyid rtag pa'i sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since he teaches the ascertainment of the pervasion, he is not proving that being produced is the reason for permanence.

original: gal te rjes su 'gro ba la the tshom za ba yin yang 'gal ba gtan tshigs ma yin pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rjes su 'gro ba la the tshom za ba yin yang 'gal ba gtan tshigs ma yin pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But if there is doubt about the pervasion, is it not the case that the reason is not contradictory?

original: des na 'gal ba ni nges par brjod pa spang bar bya ba ma yin te /üîΩbyas pa nyid ni bzlog pas @76a * //
analyzed: des na 'gal ba ni nges par brjod pa spang bar bya ba ma yin te / byas pa nyid ni bzlog pas @76a * //
translated: Therefore, contradiction is not necessarily to be avoided in a reason.

original: khyab par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is ascertained that the pervasion is reversed by the opposite of the probandum.

original: gal te 'di mi rtag pa la the tshom za ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di mi rtag pa la the tshom za ba ma yin na /
translated: If one is not in doubt about impermanence,

original: de'i tshe rtag pa'am 'on te mi rtag pa la yod pa yin zhes de rtag pa la yang 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe rtag pa'am 'on te mi rtag pa la yod pa yin zhes de rtag pa la yang 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: then at that time, it would be either permanent or impermanent.üîΩTherefore, if the pervasion is ascertained, then if production is a reason, impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.

original: des na rjes su 'gro ba nges pa gtan tshigs yin na byas pa nyid rtag pa la the tshom za ba gtan tshigs ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //üîΩgang gi tshe 'di bzlog par nus pa de'i tshe 'di rtag pa la yang the tshom med do //
analyzed: des na rjes su 'gro ba nges pa gtan tshigs yin na byas pa nyid rtag pa la the tshom za ba gtan tshigs ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro // gang gi tshe 'di bzlog par nus pa de'i tshe 'di rtag pa la yang the tshom med do //
translated: If production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.üîΩIf production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.

original: des na the tshom za ba gtan tshigs yin yang 'gal ba gtan tshigs ma yin no //
analyzed: des na the tshom za ba gtan tshigs yin yang 'gal ba gtan tshigs ma yin no //
translated: If production is a reason, then impermanence is a reason.

original: des na ji ltar 'di nges pa brjod pas gsal bar bya ba yin /
analyzed: des na ji ltar 'di nges pa brjod pas gsal bar bya ba yin /
translated: If production is a reason, then

original: 'gal ba la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba nges pas spong pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'gal ba la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba nges pas spong pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Because there is no pervasion of the contradictory, the pervasion is ascertained by the exclusion.

original: der yang nges pa smos pa don med de the tshom za ba la yang rjes su 'gro ba med pas rjes su 'gro ba smos pa nyid kyis gsal bar grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der yang nges pa smos pa don med de the tshom za ba la yang rjes su 'gro ba med pas rjes su 'gro ba smos pa nyid kyis gsal bar grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even there, the mention of ascertainment is meaningless, because there is no pervasion even for one who doubts, and because it is clearly established by the mere mention of the pervasion.

original: brjod pa bzlog pas khyab pa yang mang du mthong ba la brten nas nges par mi nus pa kho na ste /
analyzed: brjod pa bzlog pas khyab pa yang mang du mthong ba la brten nas nges par mi nus pa kho na ste /
translated: One cannot ascertain the pervasion based on seeing many instances of the reversal of the statement,

original: des na byas pa mi rtag pa la yang ma nges pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na byas pa mi rtag pa la yang ma nges pa kho na'o //
translated: so it is only uncertain that the produced is impermanent.

original: des na the tshom za ba gtan tshigs yin na 'di gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: des na the tshom za ba gtan tshigs yin na 'di gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, if doubt is the reason, this would be a reason.

original: de ltar na nges par brjod par bzlog par bya ba rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na nges par brjod par bzlog par bya ba rigs pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, it is only reasonable to reverse the statement of ascertainment.

original: 'gal ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa ni rjes su 'gro ba ma nges pa ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa ni rjes su 'gro ba ma nges pa ste /
translated: The concordant side of the contradictory is the uncertain pervasion,

original: bzlog pa rjes su 'gro ba nges pa med pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: bzlog pa rjes su 'gro ba nges pa med pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: because the reversal does not have a certain pervasion, is it not contradictory?

original: rjes su 'gro ba ma nges pas bsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ni 'gal ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa zhes brjod do //üîΩldog pa nges pas ni ma nges pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa bsal te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ma nges pas bsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ni 'gal ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa zhes brjod do // ldog pa nges pas ni ma nges pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa bsal te /
translated: The term ‚Äúcontrary‚Äù is used because the reason is inconclusive, since it is not restricted to the presence of the probandum.üîΩThe term ‚Äúrestricted‚Äù is used because the reason is not inconclusive, since it is restricted to the presence of the probandum.

original: de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med par nges par bsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdes na de ltar gnyi ga la 'jug par nges pa nyid bsal gyi thun mong ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med par nges par bsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro // des na de ltar gnyi ga la 'jug par nges pa nyid bsal gyi thun mong ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúrestricted‚Äù is used because the reason is not inconclusive, since it is restricted to the presence of the probandum.

original: de'i phyogs dang mthun pa lhag ma dang ldan pa la sogs pa yang spangs te ;
analyzed: de'i phyogs dang mthun pa lhag ma dang ldan pa la sogs pa yang spangs te ;
translated: Thus, the restriction of the reason to the presence of the probandum is established by the two kinds of restriction, but the restriction to the absence of the probandum is not established by the two kinds of restriction.üîΩThe term ‚Äúrestricted‚Äù is used because the reason is not inconclusive, since it is restricted to the presence of the probandum.

original: ldog pa nges pas dgag par bya ba nyid kyis de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyir dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'jug par the chom za ba yang lhag ma dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa nges pas dgag par bya ba nyid kyis de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyir dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'jug par the chom za ba yang lhag ma dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúrestricted‚Äù is used because the reason is not inconclusive, since it is restricted to the presence of the probandum.

original: gnyi ga la yang rab tu grub pa ni zhes bya bas gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa bsal ba yin no zhes @76b brjod pa ni gnyi ga la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang rab tu grub pa ni zhes bya bas gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa bsal ba yin no zhes @76b brjod pa ni gnyi ga la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase in both indicates that the word established excludes the possibility that the reason is not established in either of the two.

original: de ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par rtogs pa nges par brjod pas gsal bar bya ba gang yin pa de bstan nas rab tu grub pa smos pa'i bsal bar bya ba yang bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par rtogs pa nges par brjod pas gsal bar bya ba gang yin pa de bstan nas rab tu grub pa smos pa'i bsal bar bya ba yang bshad pa ni /
translated: Having thus explained the ascertainment of the understanding of the forward and reverse entailments, he now explains the exclusion that is accomplished by the word ‚Äúonly.‚Äù

original: rab tu grub pa zhes smos pas ni the chom za ba dag kyang bsal to //üîΩde dag kyang gang zhe na lhag ma dang ldan pa dang thun mong ma yin pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: rab tu grub pa zhes smos pas ni the chom za ba dag kyang bsal to // de dag kyang gang zhe na lhag ma dang ldan pa dang thun mong ma yin pa zhes smos so //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù excludes the possibility that the reason is uncertain.üîΩWhat is that uncertainty? It is the possibility that the reason is present in the discordant side.

original: gang la the tshom za zhen mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun ba'i phyogs dag la zhes bya bas ston to //
analyzed: gang la the tshom za zhen mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun ba'i phyogs dag la zhes bya bas ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the similar and the discordant‚Äù indicates what is uncertain.

original: lhag ma dang ldan pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la the tshom za la thun mongs ma yin pa mnyan bya nyid la sogs pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis ka la yang ngo //
analyzed: lhag ma dang ldan pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la the tshom za la thun mongs ma yin pa mnyan bya nyid la sogs pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis ka la yang ngo //
translated: The remaining two are doubt about the discordant side and the uncommon object of doubt, etc., are doubt about both the concordant and discordant sides.

original: yang na gnyi ga yang gnyi ga la the tsho ma za ba yin te phru ba'i nang na 'dug pa nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs la yang the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na gnyi ga yang gnyi ga la the tsho ma za ba yin te phru ba'i nang na 'dug pa nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs la yang the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, both are doubt about both, because the one who is in the pot is doubtful about the concordant side.

original: de ni mthong ba'i tshos pa 'ga' dag la mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang ma mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'i tshos pa 'ga' dag la mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang ma mthong ba nyid do //
translated: That is, some who see the concordant side do not see the discordant side.

original: de ji ltar ma nges par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de ji ltar ma nges par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba yang yin no //
translated: Just as it is not ascertained that it is not a maker, so too it is not ascertained that it is seen on the concordant side.

original: de bzhin du thun mong ma yin pa la yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang ma mthong ba yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du thun mong ma yin pa la yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang ma mthong ba yang yod pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, it is not ascertained that it is not seen on the discordant side.

original: des na gnyi ga gnyi ga la yang yin par rigs so //
analyzed: des na gnyi ga gnyi ga la yang yin par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that both are the effect of both.

original: de'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i sel ba'i 'bras bu can nyid kyi nges par brjod pa ni 'brel pa rtog par byed pa'i 'bras bu can nyid rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i sel ba'i 'bras bu can nyid kyi nges par brjod pa ni 'brel pa rtog par byed pa'i 'bras bu can nyid rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the statement of ascertainment that has the effect of exclusion as explained is the understanding that has the effect of conceiving a relation.

original: slob dpon 'brel pa zhal gyis bzhes par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir shes par byed pa gzhan yang bshad pa ni de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: slob dpon 'brel pa zhal gyis bzhes par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir shes par byed pa gzhan yang bshad pa ni de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to prove that the master accepts a relation, another proof is explained: ‚ÄúIt is not like that.‚Äù

original: 'brel pa ston par byed pa na nges pa bshad pa yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ltar ma gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha chig go //
analyzed: 'brel pa ston par byed pa na nges pa bshad pa yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ltar ma gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha chig go //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúWhen a relation is taught, ascertainment is explained‚Äù is the word ‚Äúnot‚Äù in ‚Äúit is not like that.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe ni 'brel pa med par yang ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog par grub pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni 'brel pa med par yang ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog par grub pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, even without a relation, it would be established that there is an exclusion by mere non-seeing.

original: de brjod pa ni 'brel pa med kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de brjod pa ni 'brel pa med kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is stated as ‚Äúeven without a relation.‚Äù

original: de lta yin yang nyes pa gang yod pa de bshad pa ni 'khrul pa can gyi gnyen por ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin yang nyes pa gang yod pa de bshad pa ni 'khrul pa can gyi gnyen por ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Nevertheless, the fault that is there is explained by ‚Äúthe antidote to the confused.‚Äù

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyi ldog pa yin na 'dis gang yin pa zhes bya bas mi mthun pa'i chos brjod pa bzung nas gal te zhes bya bas de'i dgos pa rtogs par bya @77a * //
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyi ldog pa yin na 'dis gang yin pa zhes bya bas mi mthun pa'i chos brjod pa bzung nas gal te zhes bya bas de'i dgos pa rtogs par bya @77a * //
translated: If it is a negation that is merely non-seeing, then by ‚Äúwhat is this?‚Äù one takes up the expression of a contrary property, and by ‚Äúif‚Äù one understands its purpose.

original: ste ; de zhes bya bas bstan pa de ma smos kyang rtogs par 'gyur zhes dogs pa bkag pa'i mthar thug pa nyid kyis ngag mthar phyin par nye bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ste ; de zhes bya bas bstan pa de ma smos kyang rtogs par 'gyur zhes dogs pa bkag pa'i mthar thug pa nyid kyis ngag mthar phyin par nye bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By ‚Äúthat‚Äù one teaches that even though it is not mentioned, it will be understood. Thus, by the very conclusion of the refutation of doubt, the sentence is shown to be complete.

original: 'brel pa yang mdo'i mdo sbyor bzhin kho nar 'brel to //
analyzed: 'brel pa yang mdo'i mdo sbyor bzhin kho nar 'brel to //
translated: The connection is also connected just like the connection of the sutra.

original: 'khrul pa can ma des pa smod bar mi mthun chos brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa can ma des pa smod bar mi mthun chos brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The confused one is the one who is not careful, who expresses a contrary property.

original: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni re zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni re zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: This very thing is explained by ‚Äúat first.‚Äù

original: chos mthun pa dang mi mthun pa gnyi ga brjod par bya ba gang yin pa'i de ni rigs so //
analyzed: chos mthun pa dang mi mthun pa gnyi ga brjod par bya ba gang yin pa'i de ni rigs so //
translated: That which is to be expressed by both the similar and contrary properties is reasonable.

original: rigs pa nyid ston pas gnyi ga sgrub pa la nye bar mkho ba ston pa ni 'gal ba dang ma nges pa'i gnyen por zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa nyid ston pas gnyi ga sgrub pa la nye bar mkho ba ston pa ni 'gal ba dang ma nges pa'i gnyen por zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe reason is taught in order to establish both‚Äù teaches the necessity of the reason in establishing both the pervasion and the property of the subject. The statement ‚ÄúThe antidote to contradiction and the antidote to inconclusiveness‚Äù teaches the antidote to the two faults of the reason.

original: brjod pa 'di ni 'gal ba dang ma nges pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa 'di ni 'gal ba dang ma nges pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no //
translated: This statement is the antidote to contradiction and inconclusiveness.

original: chos mthun pas rjes su 'gro ba bstan pas na 'gal bsal bar byed do //
analyzed: chos mthun pas rjes su 'gro ba bstan pas na 'gal bsal bar byed do //
translated: By teaching the forward pervasion through similarity, contradiction is eliminated.

original: bsgrub bya nyid dang rjes su 'gro ba yin gyi bsgrub bya las bzlog pa dang ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩchos mi mthun pas ni ldog pa rtog pa'i phyir mi mthun phyogs la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ma nges pa sel ba yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub bya nyid dang rjes su 'gro ba yin gyi bsgrub bya las bzlog pa dang ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro // chos mi mthun pas ni ldog pa rtog pa'i phyir mi mthun phyogs la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ma nges pa sel ba yin no //
translated: Because the reason is concomitant with the property of the thesis, and not with the opposite of the property of the thesis.üîΩBy teaching the reverse pervasion through dissimilarity, inconclusiveness is eliminated.

original: chos mi mthun pa smos pas ni ma nges pa'i gnyen por ro zhes bya ba ni tshig le'u byas pa'i don ston pa'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa smos pas ni ma nges pa'i gnyen por ro zhes bya ba ni tshig le'u byas pa'i don ston pa'o //
translated: By stating the dissimilar instance, the antidote to inconclusiveness is stated. This is the meaning of the verse.

original: sngar ni don 'di khas blangs pa'i rang bzhin slob dpon gyi tshig brjod do //
analyzed: sngar ni don 'di khas blangs pa'i rang bzhin slob dpon gyi tshig brjod do //
translated: Previously, the nature of the statement of the thesis was stated by the master.

original: gang yin pa zhes bya bas bzung ba mi mthun pa'i chos brjod pa de zhes 'brel par 'gyur ba yin no //
