analyzed: gang yin pa zhes bya bas bzung ba mi mthun pa'i chos brjod pa de zhes 'brel par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The phrase that which refers to the expression of a property inconsistent with the property being proved.

original: gal te zhes bya bas ni de'i dgos pa dgos par byed do //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya bas ni de'i dgos pa dgos par byed do //
translated: The word if indicates the purpose of the statement.

original: gal te mi mthun pa'i chos brjod pa des ma mthong ba'i 'bras bu can yin na'o //
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa'i chos brjod pa des ma mthong ba'i 'bras bu can yin na'o //
translated: The meaning is: If the expression of a property inconsistent with the property being proved is a means of knowing the nonexistence of the property being proved.üîΩThe word also indicates that the expression of a property inconsistent with the property being proved is a means of knowing the nonexistence of the property being proved even if the expression of a property inconsistent with the property being proved does not show the nonexistence of the property being proved in the locus of the property to be negated.

original: 'di nyid gal te mi mthun pa'i chos brjod pa gang yin pa des mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba ston par byed na zhes bya bas rnam par bkral nas de med kyang dgos pa de grub par mdos rjod par byed pa ni de ma smos kyangüîΩrtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gal te mi mthun pa'i chos brjod pa gang yin pa des mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba ston par byed na zhes bya bas rnam par bkral nas de med kyang dgos pa de grub par mdos rjod par byed pa ni de ma smos kyang rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word also indicates that the purpose of the statement is established even if the expression of a property inconsistent with the property being proved does not show the nonexistence of the property being proved in the locus of the property to be negated.

original: ma mthong ba de ni mi mthun pa'i chos brjod bya rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba de ni mi mthun pa'i chos brjod bya rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: The word also indicates that the expression of a property inconsistent with the property being proved is a means of knowing the nonexistence of the property being proved even if the expression of a property inconsistent with the property being proved does not show the nonexistence of the property being proved in the locus of the property to be negated.üîΩThe word also indicates that the expression of a property inconsistent with the property being proved is a means of knowing the nonexistence of the property being proved even if the expression of a property inconsistent with the property being proved does not show the nonexistence of the property being proved in the locus of the property to be negated.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te ji srid du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa rab tu ston par byed pa'i tshad ma bstan ba ma byas kyi bar du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa tsam la bstan pas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par mi
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te ji srid du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa rab tu ston par byed pa'i tshad ma bstan ba ma byas kyi bar du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa tsam la bstan pas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par mi
translated: This is what is being said: As long as the valid cognition that reveals the absence of the counter-pervasion is not taught, the mere absence of the counter-pervasion is not understood by the teaching.

original: rtogs so // des na chos mi mthun pa bstan pa ni de 'dzin par byed pa'i tshad ma'i yul can @77b gyi dran pa sad par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtogs so // des na chos mi mthun pa bstan pa ni de 'dzin par byed pa'i tshad ma'i yul can @77b gyi dran pa sad par byed pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of the counter-example awakens the memory that is the subject of the valid cognition that apprehends it.

original: dran pa'i tshad ma des kyang tshad ma dang ldan pa'i chos mi mthun pa la yang dag pa kho nar ma nges pa bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa'i tshad ma des kyang tshad ma dang ldan pa'i chos mi mthun pa la yang dag pa kho nar ma nges pa bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And that valid cognition of memory eliminates the uncertainty about the correct counter-pervasion.

original: ldog pa nges par byed pa'i tshad ma yang mthong ba kho na yin la de ni chos mi mthun pa ma brjod kyang rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ldog pa nges par byed pa'i tshad ma yang mthong ba kho na yin la de ni chos mi mthun pa ma brjod kyang rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: The valid cognition that ascertains the counter-pervasion is seen, and that is understood even without stating the counter-example.

original: 'di ltar chos mthun pa nyid brjod par bya ba yin te bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa'i dus na de la rjes su 'gro ba 'dzin pa'i mtheng  ba ni med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos mthun pa nyid brjod par bya ba yin te bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa'i dus na de la rjes su 'gro ba 'dzin pa'i mtheng  ba ni med do //
translated: In this way, the similarity is to be stated, because when the probandum is understood, there is no seeing that apprehends the pervasion.

original: de med par rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba gtan tshigs las don rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: de med par rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba gtan tshigs las don rtogs pa med do //
translated: Without that, there is no understanding of the object from the reason, because there is no seeing of the pervasion.

original: de brjod na ni yul de la sngon zhugs pa khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus na yod pa mthong ba'i yul can gyi dran pa skye'o //
analyzed: de brjod na ni yul de la sngon zhugs pa khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus na yod pa mthong ba'i yul can gyi dran pa skye'o //
translated: If that is stated, then when the pervasion is apprehended, there arises a memory of the subject that sees the existence in the object.

original: chos mi mthun pa brjod pas rtogs par bya ba mthong ba med pa ni de nyid kyi tshe yod pa nyid de des na chos mi mthun pa bstan pas don ci yod /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa brjod pas rtogs par bya ba mthong ba med pa ni de nyid kyi tshe yod pa nyid de des na chos mi mthun pa bstan pas don ci yod /
translated: When the dissimilar is stated, there is no seeing of the object to be understood, because it exists at that time. Therefore, what is the point of stating the dissimilar?

original: 'di ltar bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i dus na yang 'dis me med pa 'ga' zhig tu du ba mthong ba ni med la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i dus na yang 'dis me med pa 'ga' zhig tu du ba mthong ba ni med la /
translated: In this way, even when the probandum is understood, there is no seeing of smoke in some place without fire by this.

original: sngar gyi ma mthong ba yang rang bzhin 'di nyid du zad do //
analyzed: sngar gyi ma mthong ba yang rang bzhin 'di nyid du zad do //
translated: The previous non-seeing is exhausted in just this nature.

original: du ba yod na me yod pa ni de'i tshe ma dmigs te /
analyzed: du ba yod na me yod pa ni de'i tshe ma dmigs te /
translated: When there is smoke, the existence of fire is not observed at that time.

original: de'i phyir chos mthun pa brjod par rigs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos mthun pa brjod par rigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is proper to state a reason by similarity,

original: de de'i tshe ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de'i tshe ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time, the non-apprehension is not yet understood.

original: ldog pa ni de nyid kyi tshe rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ldog pa ni de nyid kyi tshe rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: The exclusion is understood only at that time.

original: 'di nyid bshad pa ni de la ldog pa brjod pa'i sngon rol na brjod pas ldog par 'gyur pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba'i rang bzhin du 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni med do //
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pa ni de la ldog pa brjod pa'i sngon rol na brjod pas ldog par 'gyur pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba'i rang bzhin du 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni med do //
translated: This is explained as follows: At that time, prior to the statement of the exclusion, there is no error in the statement of the nature of the non-apprehension in the discordant class.

original: de'i tshe yang ma mthong ba yod pa kho na bas brjod pa don med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang ma mthong ba yod pa kho na bas brjod pa don med do //
translated: Since the non-apprehension exists at that time, the statement is not meaningless.

original: gal te de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba'i rang bzhin 'khrul par gyur na ni de'i tshe sngon rtogs pa'i ma mthong ba nye bar ston pa'i tshig de gsal ba'i phyir brjod par yang 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi tshe 'khrul pa yang med pa de'i
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba'i rang bzhin 'khrul par gyur na ni de'i tshe sngon rtogs pa'i ma mthong ba nye bar ston pa'i tshig de gsal ba'i phyir brjod par yang 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi tshe 'khrul pa yang med pa de'i
translated: If at that time there were an error in the apprehension of the nature of the non-apprehension in the discordant class, then at that time the statement showing the non-apprehension of the previously understood would be stated in order to clarify it. But when there is no error,

original: tsha yod bzhin pa nyid kyi ma mthong ba khyad du bsad de 'bras bu'i med pa'i tshig tsam nye bar bkod pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: tsha yod bzhin pa nyid kyi ma mthong ba khyad du bsad de 'bras bu'i med pa'i tshig tsam nye bar bkod pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of this mere word ‚Äúnon-seeing‚Äù of the effect when the cause is present?

original: 'di nyid rgya che ra rnam par phye nas bstan pa'i phyir gal te tshig gis ma mthong ba las zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: 'di nyid rgya che ra rnam par phye nas bstan pa'i phyir gal te tshig gis ma mthong ba las zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: In order to teach this very point in a more extensive way, [the root text] says, ‚ÄúIf [you say that the reason is not established] because of not seeing [the reason] with words . . .‚Äù

original: mthong ba ma rtogs pa ni zhes bya bas lan 'debs so //
analyzed: mthong ba ma rtogs pa ni zhes bya bas lan 'debs so //
translated: [The root text] responds to this qualm with ‚ÄúThe non-realization of seeing . . .‚Äù

original: mthong ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs yod pa'i yan lag yin na de bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa'i dus na med do zhes @78a * //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs yod pa'i yan lag yin na de bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa'i dus na med do zhes @78a * //
translated: If seeing is a part of the reason‚Äôs presence in the similar class, then it does not exist at the time of realizing the probandum.

original: sngon zhugs pa'i mthong ba dran pa la gnas pas rtogs par gyur na yan lag yin no //
analyzed: sngon zhugs pa'i mthong ba dran pa la gnas pas rtogs par gyur na yan lag yin no //
translated: If one realizes [the reason] by recalling the seeing that occurred earlier, then it is a part [of the reason].

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa'i dus na mthong ba bzhin du ma mthong ba yang med do zhes bya bar 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa'i dus na mthong ba bzhin du ma mthong ba yang med do zhes bya bar 'dod na ni /
translated: If you assert that, at the time of realizing the probandum, there is no non-seeing that is like seeing,

original: de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba med pas mthong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba med pas mthong par 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time, because there is no seeing of the dissimilar class, there would be seeing [of the reason in the dissimilar class].

original: de med do zhe na ni ma mthong ba grub pa'i phyogs brjod pas ci bya de bshad pa ni mthong ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de med do zhe na ni ma mthong ba grub pa'i phyogs brjod pas ci bya de bshad pa ni mthong ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúSeeing is . . . ‚Äù

original: gal te ma mthong ba yod kyang 'di ma brtags pa'i phyir ma 'phrigs pas na de'i don du brjod do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ba yod kyang 'di ma brtags pa'i phyir ma 'phrigs pas na de'i don du brjod do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that even though it does not exist, it is not understood because it is not examined, and therefore it is stated for that purpose, that is not so.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i skabs nyid kyis yongs su rtogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i skabs nyid kyis yongs su rtogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is understood by the context of the proof itself.

original: gang gi tshe 'di rang nyid rjes su dpag pa la 'jug gam gzhan gyis bcug pa de'i tshe ji ltar phyogs kyi chos mthong ba na bzung ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dran pa la ltos pa de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba la niüîΩma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di rang nyid rjes su dpag pa la 'jug gam gzhan gyis bcug pa de'i tshe ji ltar phyogs kyi chos mthong ba na bzung ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dran pa la ltos pa de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: When one engages in inference oneself or is engaged in it by another, then just as one relies on the memory of the observed concomitance when seeing the property of the position, it is not so in the case of the nonobservation of the discordant side.

original: de'i mthun pa'i phyogs la yod dam med ces the tshom za ba ni rang nyid de ltar dmigs pa dran pa'am chos mthun pa brjod pas bcug pa las ldog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i mthun pa'i phyogs la yod dam med ces the tshom za ba ni rang nyid de ltar dmigs pa dran pa'am chos mthun pa brjod pas bcug pa las ldog pa yin gyi /
translated: One doubts whether it exists or does not exist in the concordant side, and one is engaged in the reverse by the memory of the observation of that or by the statement of a similar property.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med par the tshom za ba de la ma mthong bas bzlog par bya ba ni de'i dus dus nges pa'i ma mthong ba nyid kyis bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med par the tshom za ba de la ma mthong bas bzlog par bya ba ni de'i dus dus nges pa'i ma mthong ba nyid kyis bzlog pa yin no //
translated: The reversal of the doubt that the property of the thesis exists or does not exist in the discordant side is accomplished by the non-apprehension of that. The reversal is accomplished by the non-apprehension of that at the time when it is to be apprehended.

original: de la ni dran pa 'am de sad par byed pa'i tshig gis ci yang byar med do //
analyzed: de la ni dran pa 'am de sad par byed pa'i tshig gis ci yang byar med do //
translated: In that case, there is nothing to be done by memory or by the words that awaken it.

original: de'i tshe ma dmigs kyang sngar yang dmigs par dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ma dmigs pa dran pa'i don du brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ma dmigs kyang sngar yang dmigs par dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ma dmigs pa dran pa'i don du brjod do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that at that time, although there is no apprehension, the non-apprehension is stated for the sake of memory of the apprehension, in order to remove the doubt that it was previously apprehended,

original: 'di la sngon brjod pas ldog par 'gyur ba mthong ba'i 'khrul pa gang yin pa ni med do zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la sngon brjod pas ldog par 'gyur ba mthong ba'i 'khrul pa gang yin pa ni med do zhes bshad zin to //
translated: it has already been explained that there is no error of seeing reversal by the previous statement.

original: gal te da ltar yod na sngon gyi ma mthong ba dran pa la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te da ltar yod na sngon gyi ma mthong ba dran pa la ltos pa yin te /
translated: If it exists now, it would depend on the memory of not seeing it before.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs par shes bzhin du 'khrul pa la 'khrul par rtogs kyang mi ldog pa'i chos can nyid kyis de'i tshe ma mthong bas ma nges pa yin yang sngon gyi ma mthong ba la ltos nas nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs par shes bzhin du 'khrul pa la 'khrul par rtogs kyang mi ldog pa'i chos can nyid kyis de'i tshe ma mthong bas ma nges pa yin yang sngon gyi ma mthong ba la ltos nas nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, when one sees two moons, one knows that one is mistaken, but one does not stop seeing two moons.üîΩOne is not certain that one does not see two moons, but one is certain that one did not see two moons previously.

original: sngar ma mthong ba la 'khrul par yang da ltar gyi la ltos nas yin no //
analyzed: sngar ma mthong ba la 'khrul par yang da ltar gyi la ltos nas yin no //
translated: And one is mistaken about not seeing two moons previously because one sees two moons now.

original: 'on te sngar mthong bar the tshom za ba nyid 'khrul par brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sngar mthong bar the tshom za ba nyid 'khrul par brjod do zhe na /
translated: But if one says that one is mistaken about the doubt that one had previously about seeing two moons,

original: de yang mi rigs te de yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te de yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not correct, because that doubt does not exist.

original: sgrub par byed pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs sam mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ngam ma mthong snyam du the tshom za ba ni ma yin @78b gyi 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa'i dus na the tshom med pa nyid kyis mthong ba dang / ma mthong ba gnyis ma rtogs pas kho na ste /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs sam mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ngam ma mthong snyam du the tshom za ba ni ma yin @78b gyi 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa'i dus na the tshom med pa nyid kyis mthong ba dang / ma mthong ba gnyis ma rtogs pas kho na ste /
translated: One does not doubt whether one has seen or not seen the property of the similar or dissimilar instances, but rather, when one understands the probandum, one is certain that one has seen or not seen.

original: de sngon brjod pa ldog par 'gyur ba mthong ba'i 'khrul pa gang yin pa ni med do zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de sngon brjod pa ldog par 'gyur ba mthong ba'i 'khrul pa gang yin pa ni med do zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that the error of the reversal of what was previously stated is seen.

original: de la 'dir brjod pa mthong ba ni de'i dus na med pa'i phyir dran par bya ba nyid kyis ltos par bya ba nyid du rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dir brjod pa mthong ba ni de'i dus na med pa'i phyir dran par bya ba nyid kyis ltos par bya ba nyid du rigs pa yin no //
translated: Here, what is stated is seen to be dependent on the object of memory because it does not exist at that time.

original: ma mthong ba ni de'i tshe yang yod pa kho na bas de la dran pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni de'i tshe yang yod pa kho na bas de la dran pas ci zhig bya /
translated: But what is not seen exists at that time, so what is the use of memory?

original: ci ste yang sngon gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba la the tshom za na de lta na 'o na ni brjod kyang de mi ldog ste tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste yang sngon gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba la the tshom za na de lta na 'o na ni brjod kyang de mi ldog ste tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if one doubts what was not seen before in the case of a dissimilar instance, then even if it is stated, it is not reversed, because it is valid cognition.

original: tshig ni ma mthong ba nges par rtogs pa'i 'du byed sad par byed pa nyid kyis dran par byed pa na ldog par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tshig ni ma mthong ba nges par rtogs pa'i 'du byed sad par byed pa nyid kyis dran par byed pa na ldog par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The statement is that it is a cause of memory, since it awakens the latent impressions of the ascertainment of what was not seen.

original: ma yin te 'bad pa med par dran bzhin du the tshom yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te 'bad pa med par dran bzhin du the tshom yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because even while remembering without effort, there is no doubt.

original: 'bad rtsol las ni dran pa'i sa bon yod na dran pa nyid kyis the tshom med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol las ni dran pa'i sa bon yod na dran pa nyid kyis the tshom med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the seed of memory exists due to effort, then memory itself is without doubt.

original: 'bad rtsol las kyang mi dran pa'i the tshom za ba gang yin pa de la ni tshig gis phan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol las kyang mi dran pa'i the tshom za ba gang yin pa de la ni tshig gis phan pa ma yin no //
translated: But for one who is not mindful due to effort, and who has doubt, words are not helpful.

original: des na de'i dus kyi the tshom med pa'i ma mthong ba nyid la brten nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nges par bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i dus kyi the tshom med pa'i ma mthong ba nyid la brten nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nges par bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, at that time, one should ascertain the absence in the discordant class, based on the very non-perception of the absence of doubt.

original: yang nas yang du ma mthong bas khyab pa rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de yang nas yang du yin par sgrub pa'i rgyur sngon ma mthong ba yang dran par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yang nas yang du ma mthong bas khyab pa rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de yang nas yang du yin par sgrub pa'i rgyur sngon ma mthong ba yang dran par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Because the pervasion is to be understood through repeated non-perception, that is also established as repeated. The non-perception of the past is to be remembered as the cause.

original: ma mthong ba la ni yang nas yang gi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba la ni yang nas yang gi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Non-perception does not have the nature of repetition,

original: dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is non-existent.

original: rten de dang de dag la des dben par dmigs pa de yang nas yang nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: rten de dang de dag la des dben par dmigs pa de yang nas yang nyid do zhe na /
translated: That is the repeated observation of the absence of that in those bases.

original: 'di la yang yod pa nyid de de'i tshe yang rten dpag tu med pa la ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la yang yod pa nyid de de'i tshe yang rten dpag tu med pa la ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, too, there is existence, because at that time, the basis is not observed in an infinite number of cases.

original: smras pa gal te 'dis de'i tshe yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa ma dmigs pa de lta na yang ma dmigs pa'i mi dmigs pa tsam gyis med do zhes bya ba ma yin pa nyid pas de'i don du brjod do //
analyzed: smras pa gal te 'dis de'i tshe yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa ma dmigs pa de lta na yang ma dmigs pa'i mi dmigs pa tsam gyis med do zhes bya ba ma yin pa nyid pas de'i don du brjod do //
translated: Objection: Even if at that time, this does not observe existence in the discordant class, still, it is not the case that nonexistence is ascertained by the mere nonobservation of nonobservation. Therefore, it is said for that purpose.

original: des ni 'di'i 'di ni rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar ma dmigs pa yin no snyam du 'di ni thams cad du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba la log par rtog pa ldog go zhe na /üîΩgal te ma dmigs pa'i zhes bya bas dogs pa de bsu nas /
analyzed: des ni 'di'i 'di ni rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar ma dmigs pa yin no snyam du 'di ni thams cad du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba la log par rtog pa ldog go zhe na / gal te ma dmigs pa'i zhes bya bas dogs pa de bsu nas /
translated: By that, the reversal of this misconception is stated: ‚ÄúThis is a nonobservation in some way.‚Äù

original: med ces bya ba'i zhes bya bas sel bar byed do //üîΩbsgrub par bya ba med pa la med ces @79a * //
analyzed: med ces bya ba'i zhes bya bas sel bar byed do // bsgrub par bya ba med pa la med ces @79a * //
translated: If one anticipates that qualm with ‚Äúnonobservation of,‚Äù then one should dispel it with ‚Äúof nonexistence.‚Äù

original: bya ba'i tshig gang gis bsgrub bya med na med par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba'i tshig gang gis bsgrub bya med na med par brjod pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúnonexistence‚Äù is used to express nonexistence when the probandum is nonexistent.

original: de ni chos mi mthun pa'i ngag nyid do //
analyzed: de ni chos mi mthun pa'i ngag nyid do //
translated: This is the statement of the dissimilar instance.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i ngag gis kyang de med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i ngag gis kyang de med pa kho na yin no //
translated: And by the statement of the dissimilar instance, it is just that which is nonexistent that is understood.

original: 'o na ji ltar med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can it be nonexistent?

original: bshad pa gal te ji ltar de rnam pa gang gis med rigs brjod na /
analyzed: bshad pa gal te ji ltar de rnam pa gang gis med rigs brjod na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow could it be nonexistent? By what kind of reasoning?‚Äù

original: de tshe med ces bya bar rtogs //üîΩrnam pa gang gis med pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa nyid rigs pa'i rang bzhin du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de tshe med ces bya bar rtogs // rnam pa gang gis med pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa nyid rigs pa'i rang bzhin du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Then it is understood to be nonexistent.üîΩ‚ÄúBy what kind of reasoning?‚Äù means that the very form is explained to be the nature of reasoning.

original: tshig gis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig gis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par ston pa yin no //
translated: By the statement, ‚ÄúIt is nonexistent in the dissimilar instance,‚Äù the dissimilar instance is shown to be nonexistent.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang gang la bsgrub par bya ba med pa de yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang gang la bsgrub par bya ba med pa de yin no //
translated: And the dissimilar instance is just that in which the probandum is nonexistent.

original: bsgrub par bya bas stong pa'i rten gyi khyad par ni de'i tshe yang dmigs pa kho na yin no /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya bas stong pa'i rten gyi khyad par ni de'i tshe yang dmigs pa kho na yin no /
translated: The particular locus that is empty of the probandum is also just that which is observed.

original: de dag la yang sgrub par byed pa mi dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag la yang sgrub par byed pa mi dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And in those, the nonobservation of the proof is not the case.

original: des na gang du ma dmigs pa la yang yid mi ches pa der tshig kyang de ston pa nyid kyi 'bras bu dang ldan pa yin gyi med pa ston pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gang du ma dmigs pa la yang yid mi ches pa der tshig kyang de ston pa nyid kyi 'bras bu dang ldan pa yin gyi med pa ston pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, where there is no observation, one should not believe it, and the statement also has the effect of showing that. It is not showing non-existence.

original: de ltar des na de'i tshe tshad mas grub pa nyid ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar des na de'i tshe tshad mas grub pa nyid ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, at that time, because it shows what is established by valid cognition,

original: de'i phyir chos mi mthun pa brjod pa ni tshad ma ston pa gtsor byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos mi mthun pa brjod pa ni tshad ma ston pa gtsor byed pa nyid do //
translated: therefore, the statement of the dissimilar example emphasizes the teaching of valid cognition.

original: tshad ma da ni de'i tshe na yod pa ma yin yang yid brtan du nus pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad ma da ni de'i tshe na yod pa ma yin yang yid brtan du nus pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, at that time, even though valid cognition does not exist, because it is not possible to rely on it,

original: brjod kyang don med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: brjod kyang don med pa kho na'o //
translated: even if stated, it is meaningless.

original: de'i phyir tshig gis kyang med do zhes mi rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig gis kyang med do zhes mi rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, one does not understand that even the statement says it does not exist.

original: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pas bshad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pas bshad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained by the commentary: If...

original: 'dis ni mi dmigs pa la yid mi ches pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi dmigs pa la yid mi ches pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: This explains that there is no belief in non-observation.

original: de bzhin du chos mi mthun pa brjod pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni brjod pas kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos mi mthun pa brjod pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni brjod pas kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the statement of the dissimilar example is also... means by the statement...

original: de yang mi dmigs pa rjod par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang mi dmigs pa rjod par byed pa nyid do //
translated: and that is the non-observation of the imperceptible.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya bas gtan tshigs la khyab pas khyab par byed pa med pa la khyab par bya ba med pa yin nam /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya bas gtan tshigs la khyab pas khyab par byed pa med pa la khyab par bya ba med pa yin nam /
translated: If the probandum is pervaded by the probans, is the absence of the pervader absent from the absence of the pervaded?

original: 'di dag gis bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po de yang sgrub par byed pa rtogs pa'i dus nyid na rtogs par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di dag gis bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po de yang sgrub par byed pa rtogs pa'i dus nyid na rtogs par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The relation of probandum and probans is not understood at the time of understanding the probans,

original: 'on kyang khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus su rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus su rtogs pa yin no //
translated: but rather at the time of understanding the pervasion.

original: khyab pa yang dang yang zhugs pa'i mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag gis rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab pa yang dang yang zhugs pa'i mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag gis rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The pervasion is understood from seeing and not seeing the pervasion again and again.

original: des na 'di dag gis nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus na rtogs pa gang yin pa de bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i dus na tshig @79b gis dran pa'i rten du nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i dus na ma mthong ba
analyzed: des na 'di dag gis nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus na rtogs pa gang yin pa de bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i dus na tshig @79b gis dran pa'i rten du nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i dus na ma mthong ba
translated: Therefore, the particular nature of the ascertainment that is understood at the time of understanding the pervasion is established as the basis of memory at the time of understanding the probandum, because it is established as the basis of memory at the time of understanding the probandum.

original: yod kyang der yan lag ma yin no //
analyzed: yod kyang der yan lag ma yin no //
translated: But even if it does exist, it is not a part of the reason.üîΩIt is reasonable to say that the definition of a reason is that it is a property of the subject, and that the definition of an example is that it is a similar instance.

original: de'i bsgrub bya med na sgrub par byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khyad par ni chos mthun pa brjod pas rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs so zhes bya ba'i dogs pa 'di bsu nas bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i bsgrub bya med na sgrub par byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khyad par ni chos mthun pa brjod pas rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs so zhes bya ba'i dogs pa 'di bsu nas bshad pa ni /
translated: The response to the doubt that it is reasonable to say that the reason is a property of the subject and the example is a similar instance is as follows:

original: bsgrub par bya ba gcig mi dmigs pas gzhan med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gcig mi dmigs pas gzhan med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nonobservation of one thing does not prove the nonexistence of another, because that would be absurd.

original: gzhan nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir bum pa log pas kyang snam bu ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir bum pa log pas kyang snam bu ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because there is no difference in being different from the vase, the negation of the vase would also negate the cloth.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag 'brel pa med par ni gang las dngos po'i mthu nyid kyis gcig yod na gzhan yod par 'grub par khyab pa dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po yang mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag 'brel pa med par ni gang las dngos po'i mthu nyid kyis gcig yod na gzhan yod par 'grub par khyab pa dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po yang mi 'grub bo //
translated: And because there is no relation between the probandum and the proof, it is not established that the mere existence of one thing entails the existence of another, nor is it established that there is a relation of pervaded and pervader between them.

original: gal te 'brel pa med kyang gcig med pa'i phyir gzhan med do zhes bya bar 'dod pa ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa med kyang gcig med pa'i phyir gzhan med do zhes bya bar 'dod pa ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you assert that although there is no relation, one is understood to be nonexistent because the other is nonexistent, then that is an absurd consequence.

original: tshig ni mi dmigs par rjod par byed pa nyid spangs nas tshig gi rang bzhin nyid kyis yan lag ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni med do zhes brjod pas kyang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshig ni mi dmigs par rjod par byed pa nyid spangs nas tshig gi rang bzhin nyid kyis yan lag ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni med do zhes brjod pas kyang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The words ‚Äúnot‚Äù and ‚Äúno‚Äù are not branches of the statement, because they are not the nature of words, having abandoned the function of expressing nonapprehension.

original: tshig gi rang bzhin tsam nyid kyis ni tshig gis med par go bar byed pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sngon zhugs pa'i tshad ma ston par byed pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: tshig gi rang bzhin tsam nyid kyis ni tshig gis med par go bar byed pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sngon zhugs pa'i tshad ma ston par byed pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The mere nature of words does not cause understanding of nonexistence through words, but rather through the function of indicating valid knowledge that has previously engaged.

original: des na ji ltar zhes ji ltar yang chos mi mthun pa brjod pas /
analyzed: des na ji ltar zhes ji ltar yang chos mi mthun pa brjod pas /
translated: Therefore, how can it be that by stating a dissimilar example,

original: ma nges pa spangs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa spangs pa ma yin te /
translated: nonascertainment is abandoned?

original: tshig tsam gyi rang bzhin gyis ma yin /
analyzed: tshig tsam gyi rang bzhin gyis ma yin /
translated: It is not through the mere nature of words.

original: gzhan med na gzhan med pa go bar byed pa nyid kyis ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan med na gzhan med pa go bar byed pa nyid kyis ma yin /
translated: It is not through the function of causing understanding of the nonexistence of one when the other is nonexistent.

original: sngar zhugs pa'i tshad ma ston par byed pa nyid kyis ma yin te ma mthong ba tsam gyis lus can de ni de'i tshe yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar zhugs pa'i tshad ma ston par byed pa nyid kyis ma yin te ma mthong ba tsam gyis lus can de ni de'i tshe yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not shown by the mere non-perception of the evidence previously admitted, because the body exists at that time, even though it is not seen.

original: de lta bas na bsgrub par bya ba med pa la sgrub par byed pa ldog par te /
analyzed: de lta bas na bsgrub par bya ba med pa la sgrub par byed pa ldog par te /
translated: Therefore, the evidence is not reversed when the probandum is absent.

original: med par 'dod pas ma mthong ba tsam gyis grub pa spangs te /
analyzed: med par 'dod pas ma mthong ba tsam gyis grub pa spangs te /
translated: Since it is accepted that it is absent, the mere non-perception is rejected.

original: gang gis na rtogs pa po de la ldog pa zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rigs pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: gang gis na rtogs pa po de la ldog pa zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rigs pa brjod dgos so //
translated: It is necessary to state the reasoning by which the knower would understand the reversal.

original: nyes pa gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir spangs zin pa nyid yin yang rtsod par byed pa des med pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir spangs zin pa nyid yin yang rtsod par byed pa des med pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to show another fault, although it has already been rejected, the opponent argues, ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the evidence is absent when the probandum is absent.‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba de med pa la sgrub par byed pa de mi dmigs pas na bsgrub par bya ba la med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ldog @80a * //üîΩpa grub po zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba de med pa la sgrub par byed pa de mi dmigs pas na bsgrub par bya ba la med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ldog @80a * // pa grub po zhe na /
translated: When the probandum is absent, the evidence is not observed. Therefore, the reversal is established by the definition of absence in the probandum.

original: 'di dgag pa'i phyir gal te zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di dgag pa'i phyir gal te zhes smos so //
translated: In order to refute this, he says, ‚ÄúIf the evidence is absent when the probandum is absent.‚Äù

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba med pa la gtan tshigs ma mthong ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya pa med pa las ldog par 'gyur na ji ltar lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'khrul pa can yin /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba med pa la gtan tshigs ma mthong ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya pa med pa las ldog par 'gyur na ji ltar lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'khrul pa can yin /
translated: If the reason is not seen in the absence of the probandum, then the probandum would be reversed from the absence. How is the inference with remainder erroneous?

original: de la yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is the non-seeing of the reason in the discordant class.

original: 'khrul pa can du yang slob dpon gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa can du yang slob dpon gyis gsungs so //
translated: The Master has also said that it is erroneous.

original: des na gtan tshigs thams cad de dang mtshungs pa'i 'khrul pa can du brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs thams cad de dang mtshungs pa'i 'khrul pa can du brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, all reasons would be said to be erroneous, being similar to that.

original: lhag ma dang ldan pa de yang gang yin zhe na de'i rang bzhin ngo bo bshad pa ni ;
analyzed: lhag ma dang ldan pa de yang gang yin zhe na de'i rang bzhin ngo bo bshad pa ni ;
translated: What is that with remainder? The explanation of its nature is:

original: dper na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For example,

original: 'bras bu 'di dag ni chos can smin pa'am ro bro ba yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gzugs khyad par med pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'di dag ni chos can smin pa'am ro bro ba yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gzugs khyad par med pa'i phyir ram /
translated: these effects are the ripened or the tasted property of the subject, because the probandum is indistinguishable.

original: gcig las skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs zos pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: gcig las skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs zos pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
translated: The example is: ‚Äúlike the reason ‚Äòbecause it arises from one,‚Äô which is refuted.‚Äù

original: da ni 'di ji ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba de 'chad do //
analyzed: da ni 'di ji ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba de 'chad do //
translated: Now, how is it that non-observation of the counter-pervasion is not seen in this [reason]?

original: lhag ma dang ldan pa 'di la yang bsgrub par bya ba med pa la gtan tshigs mi dmigs pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma dang ldan pa 'di la yang bsgrub par bya ba med pa la gtan tshigs mi dmigs pa yod pa yin te /
translated: In this [reason] that has a remainder, there is non-observation of the reason in the absence of the probandum.

original: de bas na ji ltar 'khrul pa yin 'khrul pa can ni ldog pa ma nges pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar 'khrul pa yin 'khrul pa can ni ldog pa ma nges pa nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, how is it mistaken? Mistakenness is just the uncertainty of the counter-pervasion.

original: ldog pa nges par byed pa mi dmigs pa tsam yang yod pa nyid des na 'khrul pa dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: ldog pa nges par byed pa mi dmigs pa tsam yang yod pa nyid des na 'khrul pa dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: Since the ascertainment of the counter-pervasion is by mere non-observation, it would be mistaken.

original: yal ga de las skyes pa nyid ni ro de med pa la dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: yal ga de las skyes pa nyid ni ro de med pa la dmigs pa med do //
translated: The fact of arising from that branch does not exist in the absence of that tree.

original: 'on te yang gal te zos pa'i 'bras bu la yal ga de las skyes pa nyid yod na de'i rang bzhin du dmigs pa de lta na yang 'bras bu gzhan la de las skyes pa nyid de med par yag 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te yang gal te zos pa'i 'bras bu la yal ga de las skyes pa nyid yod na de'i rang bzhin du dmigs pa de lta na yang 'bras bu gzhan la de las skyes pa nyid de med par yag 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if the fact of arising from that branch exists in the fruit that is eaten, then the observation of its nature would be like that. In that case, the fact of arising from that [branch] would not exist in other fruits.

original: gang gis de la ro der rtogs par 'gyur ba 'bras bu gzhan yang zos pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis de la ro der rtogs par 'gyur ba 'bras bu gzhan yang zos pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But the result that is eaten is not another result that is understood to be the same taste as that.

original: des na ldog pa la the tshom za'o //
analyzed: des na ldog pa la the tshom za'o //
translated: Therefore, there is doubt about the exclusion.

original: 'bras bu gzhan dag la ni de las skyes pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i ro dang ldan pa nyid la 'jug gam ro gzhan dang ldan pa la 'jug pa yin zhes de rtogs par byed mi nus so //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan dag la ni de las skyes pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i ro dang ldan pa nyid la 'jug gam ro gzhan dang ldan pa la 'jug pa yin zhes de rtogs par byed mi nus so //
translated: In the case of other results, it is not possible to understand whether the result is established as having the same taste as that or as having another taste.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di lhag ma dang ldan pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di lhag ma dang ldan pa zhes brjod de /
translated: For that very reason, it is said to have a remainder.

original: bsgrub par bya ba yod pa dang med par the tshom za ba 'khrul pa'i yul nges pa med pa'i 'bras bu gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba yod pa dang med par the tshom za ba 'khrul pa'i yul nges pa med pa'i 'bras bu gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because there is doubt about the existence and nonexistence of the probandum, the result of error is not ascertained.

original: dogs pa 'di bsu nas bshad pa ni /
analyzed: dogs pa 'di bsu nas bshad pa ni /
translated: In response to this doubt, it is explained:

original: brjod @80b par 'dod pa ma lus pa phyogs su byas na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod @80b par 'dod pa ma lus pa phyogs su byas na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If all that is desired to be expressed is taken as the subject.

original: 'dir gtan la ma phebs pas gcig zos kyang lhag ma 'khrul pa'i yul nyid du brjod par 'dod pa gang yin pa'i brjod par 'dod pa de dag ma lus par phyogs su byas par gyur na'o //
analyzed: 'dir gtan la ma phebs pas gcig zos kyang lhag ma 'khrul pa'i yul nyid du brjod par 'dod pa gang yin pa'i brjod par 'dod pa de dag ma lus par phyogs su byas par gyur na'o //
translated: Here, since it is not established, even if one were to consume it, the remainder would be said to be the object of error.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: 'khrul pa'i yul nyid du dogs pa thams cad phyogs su byas pa la ni ro de dang de ma yin par the tshom za ba rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis bzlog par bya ba yin gyi phyogs las bsgrub par bya ba'i chos the tshom za bas ni gtan
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i yul nyid du dogs pa thams cad phyogs su byas pa la ni ro de dang de ma yin par the tshom za ba rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis bzlog par bya ba yin gyi phyogs las bsgrub par bya ba'i chos the tshom za bas ni gtan
translated: Regarding all doubts about being the object of error, having taken them as the subject, that doubt about whether or not it is that taste is to be refuted by inference itself, not by the probandum being doubtful in the subject.

original: tshigs kyi ldog pa ma nges pa nyid kyis 'khrul par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tshigs kyi ldog pa ma nges pa nyid kyis 'khrul par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Because the reversal of the reason is not ascertained, it does not become erroneous.

original: phyogs nyid ni 'khrul pa'i yul ma yin te de'i phyir zos pa'i 'bras bu la de las skyes pa nyid yod na ro de mthong pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba rtogs la ro de med par ni 'gar yang de las skyes pa nyid ma mthong bas bsgrub parüîΩbya ba med pa la de ma dmigs pa'i phyir ldog par rtogs so ;
analyzed: phyogs nyid ni 'khrul pa'i yul ma yin te de'i phyir zos pa'i 'bras bu la de las skyes pa nyid yod na ro de mthong pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba rtogs la ro de med par ni 'gar yang de las skyes pa nyid ma mthong bas bsgrub par bya ba med pa la de ma dmigs pa'i phyir ldog par rtogs so ;
translated: And since the effect of eating it is never seen to exist in the absence of the taste, the negative concomitance is understood through the nonobservation of that.

original: / gal te khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus na mthun pa'i phyogs dang cig shos la yod pa dang med par rtogs pa'i gtan tshig bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa'i dus na yan lag ma yin na /
analyzed: / gal te khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus na mthun pa'i phyogs dang cig shos la yod pa dang med par rtogs pa'i gtan tshig bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa'i dus na yan lag ma yin na /
translated: If at the time of apprehending the pervasion one does not understand the presence and absence of the reason in the similar and dissimilar classes, then at the time of understanding the probandum, the thesis, one would not understand the reason.

original: 'bras bu de zos pa'i dus nyid khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu de zos pa'i dus nyid khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the time of apprehending the pervasion is the time of eating the fruit, then that is not so.

original: de'i tshe yang bsgrub par bya ba med pa la gtan tshigs med pa mi mthun pa phyogs la bltar rung ba mthong bas rtogs par bya ba yin na lce'i dbang po byed pa med pa ni ro bltar rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang bsgrub par bya ba med pa la gtan tshigs med pa mi mthun pa phyogs la bltar rung ba mthong bas rtogs par bya ba yin na lce'i dbang po byed pa med pa ni ro bltar rung ba ma yin no //
translated: And if the reason is seen to be absent in the dissimilar instances, then the probandum is understood. But the tongue faculty, which is not a perceiver of taste, is not a perceiver of taste that is absent.

original: yal ga la sogs pa 'bras bu de tsam zhig skyed pa yin pa'i phyir de las skyed pa nyid gzhan la med pa yin nam /
analyzed: yal ga la sogs pa 'bras bu de tsam zhig skyed pa yin pa'i phyir de las skyed pa nyid gzhan la med pa yin nam /
translated: Is it because the branches, etc. produce only that much effect that the production of that effect is not found in anything else?

original: 'on te ro de med pas yin zhes ma mthong yang ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ro de med pas yin zhes ma mthong yang ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: Or is it because the taste is not there that it is not seen? Even if it is not seen, there is doubt about the absence of the taste.

original: brjod pa ro gzhan nyams su myong ba la yang ro de med par de las skyes pa dmigs pa ni med do //
analyzed: brjod pa ro gzhan nyams su myong ba la yang ro de med par de las skyes pa dmigs pa ni med do //
translated: We reply: Even when another taste is experienced, the taste that is absent is not observed to arise from that.

original: de la ni de las skyes pa nyid dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de la ni de las skyes pa nyid dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa kho na yin te /
translated: In that case, the mere fact of arising from that would be the defining characteristic of the observation.

original: 'bras bu gzhan las skye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan las skye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the arising of an effect from something else is observed.

original: ro gzhan dmigs pa'i phyir yang dmigs par rung ba'i ro de med pa yin no //
analyzed: ro gzhan dmigs pa'i phyir yang dmigs par rung ba'i ro de med pa yin no //
translated: And because another taste is observed, the taste that is suitable to be observed is absent.

original: de ltar smra ba la ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa snang ba mi dmigs pas ci yang byar med de mthong ba'i rten tsam dngos po med par sgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩthams @81a * //
analyzed: de ltar smra ba la ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa snang ba mi dmigs pas ci yang byar med de mthong ba'i rten tsam dngos po med par sgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro // thams @81a * //
translated: In this way, for one who speaks in this way, there is nothing to be done, since the object to be established and the means of establishing it are not perceived. This is because the mere basis of seeing is not a part of the proof of the non-existence of entities.

original: cad du de ltar med pa ni ldog pa yin no zhes bshad zin te /
analyzed: cad du de ltar med pa ni ldog pa yin no zhes bshad zin te /
translated: It has already been explained that non-existence in all cases is the negation.

original: des na 'ga' zhig tu khas blangs nas dmigs par rung ba mi dmigs pa nyid yin yang /
analyzed: des na 'ga' zhig tu khas blangs nas dmigs par rung ba mi dmigs pa nyid yin yang /
translated: Therefore, even though non-apprehension is suitable as an apprehension by accepting it in some cases,

original: thams cad du de lta bu yin pa la ni dmigs pa log pa tsam nyid tshad mar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du de lta bu yin pa la ni dmigs pa log pa tsam nyid tshad mar bya ba yin no //
translated: in all cases, it is merely the negation of the object of apprehension that is taken as valid cognition.

original: des na ro gzhan dang skye ba gzhan ma dmigs kyang ro de med pa nyid la de las skyes pa nyid dmigs pa med pa ni grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na ro gzhan dang skye ba gzhan ma dmigs kyang ro de med pa nyid la de las skyes pa nyid dmigs pa med pa ni grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, even though the other taste and the other arising are not apprehended, the non-apprehension of that taste and the arising from that is established.

original: slob dpon gyi gzhung 'chad par byed pa kha cig na re ni 'di lta ste mngon sum gyis gnod par dogs pa'i 'khrul pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi gzhung 'chad par byed pa kha cig na re ni 'di lta ste mngon sum gyis gnod par dogs pa'i 'khrul pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some who comment on the master's text say that this is a mistake suspected of being contradicted by perception.

original: gtan tshigs kyis yul la zhugs su zin kyang 'di la mngon sum gyis gnod par dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyis yul la zhugs su zin kyang 'di la mngon sum gyis gnod par dogs pa yin no //
translated: Even though the reason does engage its object, it is suspected that it is undermined by perception.

original: 'di ltar de las rjes su dpag pa'i don la zhugs pa res 'ga' de la ro gzhan dmigs pa srid pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de las rjes su dpag pa'i don la zhugs pa res 'ga' de la ro gzhan dmigs pa srid pa yin no //
translated: For, when one engages in inferring the meaning of a reason, it is possible that sometimes one will perceive another meaning.

original: de ltar yin yang de'i 'bras bu nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyis sngo bsangs zhes rjes su dpag pa na de sngo bsangs ma yin par yang mngon sum gyis mthong ba de bzhin du 'di la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin yang de'i 'bras bu nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyis sngo bsangs zhes rjes su dpag pa na de sngo bsangs ma yin par yang mngon sum gyis mthong ba de bzhin du 'di la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though that is the case, when one infers that the reason is the effect of the thing to be inferred, it is possible that perception will see that the reason is not the effect of the thing to be inferred. In the same way, it is possible that perception will see that the reason is not the property of the subject.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs la tshul gsum yod kyang gnod pa med pa'i yul can nyid kyang mtshan nyid du bstan par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs la tshul gsum yod kyang gnod pa med pa'i yul can nyid kyang mtshan nyid du bstan par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: For that reason, even though the reason has the three modes, the subject must be stated to be not undermined.

original: ma yin te zhes pas de 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes pas de 'gog par byed do //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúNo!‚Äù

original: rjes su dpog pa'i dus na phyogs lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir phyogs su byas pa'i yul la mngon sum gyis gnod pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpog pa'i dus na phyogs lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir phyogs su byas pa'i yul la mngon sum gyis gnod pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: Because the subject is hidden at the time of inference, the subject that is posited as the subject must be stated to be not undermined by perception.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos ni rjes su dpag pas grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos ni rjes su dpag pas grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the property to be inferred is established by the inference.üîΩIt is true that the subject is hidden when the inference is engaged, and therefore, although it is not contradicted by the direct perception of the property, still, it is not that it is not contradicted by existence.

original: bden te rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa'i gnas skabs na phyogs lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir de la chos mngon sum gyis gnod pa med pa de lta na yang 'dir yod pa nyid kyis gnod pa ni ma yin te 'on kyang gnod par dogs pa nyid
analyzed: bden te rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa'i gnas skabs na phyogs lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir de la chos mngon sum gyis gnod pa med pa de lta na yang 'dir yod pa nyid kyis gnod pa ni ma yin te 'on kyang gnod par dogs pa nyid
translated: However, the doubt of contradiction is

original: do zhen ci ste zhes bya bas dogs pa 'di bsu nas de lta bur dogs na zhes bya bas zlog par byed do //
analyzed: do zhen ci ste zhes bya bas dogs pa 'di bsu nas de lta bur dogs na zhes bya bas zlog par byed do //
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù he responds to this doubt with ‚ÄúIf you think that,‚Äù and he refutes it with ‚ÄúIt is not so.‚Äù

original: gal te yongs su dag pa'i tshul gsum pa can gyi rjes su dpag pa yod kyang gnod par dogs pa 'khrul pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te yongs su dag pa'i tshul gsum pa can gyi rjes su dpag pa yod kyang gnod par dogs pa 'khrul pa nyid yin na /
translated: If, although the inference has the three modes that are completely pure, there is the doubt of contradiction, then it would be mistaken.

original: khyed kyi phyogs la rjes su dpag pa mtha' dag de bzhin du 'gyur te rjes su dpag pa mngon sum gyi rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir gyi dngos po'i rtsa ba can ni ma yin pa'i phyir dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa yang de'i tshe nyid rtogs
analyzed: khyed kyi phyogs la rjes su dpag pa mtha' dag de bzhin du 'gyur te rjes su dpag pa mngon sum gyi rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir gyi dngos po'i rtsa ba can ni ma yin pa'i phyir dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa yang de'i tshe nyid rtogs
translated: All of your inferences would be like that, because inferences have direct perception as their root, not things as their root, and because the harm that will occur is understood at that time.

original: @81b par me nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @81b par me nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because fire is capable of that.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'ga' yang tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'ga' yang tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, no inference at all would be a valid means of cognition.

original: de bshad pa ni me la sogs pa'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa gzhan la yang gnod pa med par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni me la sogs pa'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa gzhan la yang gnod pa med par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The explanation of that is that in other inferences that have fire, etc. as their object, there is no harm, because they are ascertained.

original: de'i phyir tshul gsum pa las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang gnod pa med par gtan la phab pa la brten nas ltos pa nyid yin na rjes su dpag pa 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul gsum pa las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang gnod pa med par gtan la phab pa la brten nas ltos pa nyid yin na rjes su dpag pa 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if an inference that arises from the three modes is ascertained without harm, and is dependent on that, then the inference would be destroyed.

original: des na gnod pa med pa'i yul can nyid du smra ba'i gzhung la tshad ma zhugs pa gnod par byed pa yin te de nyid gnod byed du 'thad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩma zhugs zhugs pa the tshom za ba dang 'brel pa'i byed pa'i khyad par gnod pa khas len na ni de yod pas rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug par yang brjod pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa thams cad la yid brtan du med de /
analyzed: des na gnod pa med pa'i yul can nyid du smra ba'i gzhung la tshad ma zhugs pa gnod par byed pa yin te de nyid gnod byed du 'thad pa'i phyir ro // ma zhugs zhugs pa the tshom za ba dang 'brel pa'i byed pa'i khyad par gnod pa khas len na ni de yod pas rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug par yang brjod pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa thams cad la yid brtan du med de /
translated: Therefore, the authoritative text of the proponents of the non-erroneous subject is undermined, because it is reasonable that it be undermined.üîΩIf one accepts that the non-engagement of authoritative cognition in the text is undermined by the engagement of authoritative cognition in the text of the proponents of the non-erroneous subject, then since that is the case, one should not say that inference does not engage because of the presence of an undermining factor.

original: gnod par byed pa med pa shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med pa shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, all inferences are unreliable, because it is impossible to know that there is no undermining factor.

original: nged kyi rjes su dpag pa la ni thal ba 'di med de dngos po'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: nged kyi rjes su dpag pa la ni thal ba 'di med de dngos po'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: But our inference is not subject to this reductio, because it is based on fact.

original: / mngon sum la ni 'gyur ba yin na de la yang dngos po'i gnas thabs rjes su rtogs pa phyi mas sel ba yin no //
analyzed: / mngon sum la ni 'gyur ba yin na de la yang dngos po'i gnas thabs rjes su rtogs pa phyi mas sel ba yin no //
translated: If it were to occur in perception, then the subsequent understanding of the actual mode of being would eliminate it.

original: phyi rol gyi don la mi srid na ni /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la mi srid na ni /
translated: If it were impossible for external objects,

original: gang la de mi srid pa'i rang rig pa de nyid rnam par dpyod pa la mkhas pa rnams kyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la de mi srid pa'i rang rig pa de nyid rnam par dpyod pa la mkhas pa rnams kyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: The self-awareness that is impossible for that [object] is the valid cognition of those skilled in analysis.

original: des na de ltar 'dir phyogs su byas pa'i yul la med par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: des na de ltar 'dir phyogs su byas pa'i yul la med par brjod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, in this way, the object that is made into a position here is said to be nonexistent.

original: lkog tu gyur pas gnod pa 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pas gnod pa 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is hidden, there is no engagement of harm.

original: gnod pa nyid du dogs pas skyon can du 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gnod pa nyid du dogs pas skyon can du 'gyur na ni /
translated: If there were doubt about harm itself, there would be a fault.

original: rjes su dpag pa chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Inference would be cut off.

original: de'i phyir ma bsal pa nyid kyis phyogs kyi bdag nyid thob pa dang gtan tshigs dang dpe'i nyes pa rnams med pa yin yang sngon gyi 'chad pa po rnams kyis gnod pa med pa med pa'i yul can nyid bla lhag pa nye bar bkod de de'i phyir de
analyzed: de'i phyir ma bsal pa nyid kyis phyogs kyi bdag nyid thob pa dang gtan tshigs dang dpe'i nyes pa rnams med pa yin yang sngon gyi 'chad pa po rnams kyis gnod pa med pa med pa'i yul can nyid bla lhag pa nye bar bkod de de'i phyir de
translated: Therefore, by not being refuted, the nature of the position is obtained. Although there are no faults of the reason and example, the previous commentators have set forth the subject that is not without harm as superior. Therefore, that

original: med par rjes su dpag pa 'di 'khrul pa can yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas slob dpon gyis 'dir gnod pa med pa'i yul can nyid kyang gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir dogs pa'i gnod pas gnod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: med par rjes su dpag pa 'di 'khrul pa can yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas slob dpon gyis 'dir gnod pa med pa'i yul can nyid kyang gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir dogs pa'i gnod pas gnod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The Acarya, anticipating the qualm, ‚ÄúThis inference of nonexistence is erroneous,‚Äù has stated, ‚ÄúHere, the subject is not invalidated, and therefore it is not invalidated by the qualm.

original: 'on kyang zhugs pa'i gnod pa dag kho nas yin no zhes de ltar nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhugs pa'i gnod pa dag kho nas yin no zhes de ltar nye bar bkod do //
translated: However, it is invalidated by the qualms of the opponent.‚Äù

original: gnod pa ma byas pa'i yul can nyid med pas na nye bar bstan pa'i 'jig rten rgyas par mdzad pas 'di rjes su dpag par mi bzhed pa yin gyi /üîΩldog pa sgrub @82a * //
analyzed: gnod pa ma byas pa'i yul can nyid med pas na nye bar bstan pa'i 'jig rten rgyas par mdzad pas 'di rjes su dpag par mi bzhed pa yin gyi / ldog pa sgrub @82a * //
translated: The author of the commentary explains that the subject is not invalidated because it is not taught that the subject is nonexistent.

original: par byed pa ma mthong ba the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes 'chad pa po rnams kyis 'di rnam pa gzhan du bsal to //
analyzed: par byed pa ma mthong ba the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes 'chad pa po rnams kyis 'di rnam pa gzhan du bsal to //
translated: The commentators explain that the reason is not the nonobservation of a pervader, because the nonobservation of the negatee is not established.üîΩThe commentators explain that the reason is not the nonobservation of a contradictory object, because the nonobservation of the negatee is not established.

original: da ltar ni gtan tshigs kyi chos thams cad yod kyang gtan tshigs ma yin pa nyid du gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni ma mthong bas rtogs pa'i ldog pa can nyid kyis yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud do zhes grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar ni gtan tshigs kyi chos thams cad yod kyang gtan tshigs ma yin pa nyid du gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni ma mthong bas rtogs pa'i ldog pa can nyid kyis yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud do zhes grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, it is said that all the properties of the reason exist, but they are not the reason itself. Since this is not seen, it is understood that it is due to the reversal of the realization. Thus it is established.

original: de ltar ma mthong bas ldog pa grub pa yin na lhag ma dang ldan pa 'khrul pa can nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bsgrubs nas 'brel pa khas lan na 'khrul pa can nyid ji ltar yin pa de ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar ma mthong bas ldog pa grub pa yin na lhag ma dang ldan pa 'khrul pa can nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bsgrubs nas 'brel pa khas lan na 'khrul pa can nyid ji ltar yin pa de ston pa ni /
translated: Having thus established that the reversal is accomplished by not seeing, if one accepts the connection, then how it is mistaken is shown:

original: ldog pa med pa ni ste ldog pa dang mi ldan pa ni lhag ma dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa med pa ni ste ldog pa dang mi ldan pa ni lhag ma dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The absence of reversal, that is, the lack of reversal, is the possession of the remainder.

original: ji ltar zhe na the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: How so? Because of doubt.

original: bsgrub bya med pa las gtan tshigs med par the tshom za ba de'i phyir 'di ldog pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub bya med pa las gtan tshigs med par the tshom za ba de'i phyir 'di ldog pa med pa yin no //
translated: Since there is doubt that the reason does not exist due to the absence of the probandum, therefore this is the absence of reversal.

original: gang the tshom za ba de ldog pa med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba de nyid gang las she na /
analyzed: gang the tshom za ba de ldog pa med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba de nyid gang las she na /
translated: If one doubts, then the negation is not established.

original: bshad pa ni'i sgra ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: bshad pa ni'i sgra ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is the reason.

original: gang gi phyir ldog pa ni sgrub pa yin la de la de yang grub pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ldog pa ni sgrub pa yin la de la de yang grub pa kho na yin no //
translated: The negation is the proof, and that is established.

original: de'i don 'di yin te the tshom za ba ldog pa med pa nyid du ni mi 'grub kyi 'on kyang the tshom du gyur pa nyid yin pa des na ji ltar ldog pa med par brjod ces brtsad par 'gyur ba gang yin pa med pa tsam ni ldog
analyzed: de'i don 'di yin te the tshom za ba ldog pa med pa nyid du ni mi 'grub kyi 'on kyang the tshom du gyur pa nyid yin pa des na ji ltar ldog pa med par brjod ces brtsad par 'gyur ba gang yin pa med pa tsam ni ldog
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: One does not establish the negation as not established when one doubts. However, since one doubts, one would be criticized, saying, ‚ÄúHow can you say that the negation is not established?‚Äù

original: par mi brjod kyi 'on kyang 'dir sgrub par byed pa'i chos su gyur pa'i ldog pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: par mi brjod kyi 'on kyang 'dir sgrub par byed pa'i chos su gyur pa'i ldog pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: One does not say that the mere absence of the object of negation is the negation. However, here the negation is the property to be proven.

original: de yang grub pa nyid de ltar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang grub pa nyid de ltar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And that is established.

original: gang gi phyir 'di grub pa nyid de ltar 'gyur ba de'i phyir de lta bu'i ngo bo sgrub par byed pa nyid ni nges pa la ltos so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di grub pa nyid de ltar 'gyur ba de'i phyir de lta bu'i ngo bo sgrub par byed pa nyid ni nges pa la ltos so //
translated: Since that is established, the proof of that kind of nature depends on the ascertainment.

original: 'di grub pa ni nges pa nyid yin la ;
analyzed: 'di grub pa ni nges pa nyid yin la ;
translated: And the establishment of that is the very ascertainment.

original: grub pa yang sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: grub pa yang sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: And that which is established is the proof.

original: des na nges pa la ltos pa'i phyir the tshom za na ldog pa med par brjod do //
analyzed: des na nges pa la ltos pa'i phyir the tshom za na ldog pa med par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, since it depends on ascertainment, it is said that when there is doubt, there is no reversal.

original: the tshom za na ldog pa med pa la rag mod /
analyzed: the tshom za na ldog pa med pa la rag mod /
translated: If there is doubt, there is no reversal.

original: 'dir de nyid ga las she na /
analyzed: 'dir de nyid ga las she na /
translated: But how is that so here?

original: bshad pa de der snang ba mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas bltar rung ba'i yul 'ga' zhig la med par grub tu zin kyang bsgrub par bya ba med pa la sgrub par byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis med pa ni snang baüîΩmi dmigs pas kyang grub pa yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa de der snang ba mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas bltar rung ba'i yul 'ga' zhig la med par grub tu zin kyang bsgrub par bya ba med pa la sgrub par byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis med pa ni snang ba mi dmigs pas kyang grub pa yin te /
translated: Because that is the non-apprehension of the appearance of that, non-apprehension is established as the non-existence of some object suitable to be seen by means of non-apprehension. However, the non-existence of the probandum is not established by the mere non-existence of the proof.üîΩThe non-existence of the probandum is established by non-apprehension of the appearance of the probandum.

original: 'on kyang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dag las yin no zhes dogs nas kyang gi sgra srid pa la yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dag las yin no zhes dogs nas kyang gi sgra srid pa la yin no //
translated: But it is also from the non-apprehension of the cause and the pervader.

original: 'brel @82b pa med pa ni thams cad la med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel @82b pa med pa ni thams cad la med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the absence of relation does not establish the absence in everything.

original: bltar rung ba'i yul 'ga' zhig la med pa grub tu zin kyang snang ba mi dmigs pa yin yang thams cad du rnam par 'jog na ni /
analyzed: bltar rung ba'i yul 'ga' zhig la med pa grub tu zin kyang snang ba mi dmigs pa yin yang thams cad du rnam par 'jog na ni /
translated: Although non-apprehension of appearance is established in regard to some objects that can be seen, if it were posited in all cases,

original: de nyid las thams cad la med par rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid las thams cad la med par rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: then, because of the realization of non-existence in all cases,

original: bltar mi rung ba mi dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bltar mi rung ba mi dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: non-apprehension of the unobservable would occur.

original: des na med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not prove non-existence.

original: 'brel pa yod na ni de ltar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa yod na ni de ltar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If there were a connection, that would be the case.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin no //üîΩldog pa ma mthong bas sgrub pa ma yin pa la gtan tshigs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir gal te ma mthong bas ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i skabs la gtan tshigs gzhan snon 'di bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin no // ldog pa ma mthong bas sgrub pa ma yin pa la gtan tshigs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir gal te ma mthong bas ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i skabs la gtan tshigs gzhan snon 'di bstan pa ni /
translated: But that does not exist.üîΩIn order to demonstrate another reason for the non-establishment of the pervasion, he says, ‚ÄúIf non-existence were established by non-apprehension, then existence would be established by apprehension.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The other reason is stated in the passage that begins with ‚ÄúIf non-existence were established by non-apprehension,‚Äù and is concluded with ‚ÄúTherefore, non-existence is not established by non-apprehension.‚Äù

original: gal te ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog na de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang bral ba ldog pa tsam dang ldan pa yang go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog na de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang bral ba ldog pa tsam dang ldan pa yang go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to turn away from the counter-position merely on the basis of non-perception, then the mere absence of concomitance and pervasion would be the logical reason that establishes.

original: de nyid ston pa ni gson po'i lus 'di ni zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩbdag med pa yin na zhes bya ba ni bdag gis stong na'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni gson po'i lus 'di ni zhes bya ba yin no // bdag med pa yin na zhes bya ba ni bdag gis stong na'o //
translated: He shows just that: ‚ÄúThis living body‚Äù and so on.

original: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is without self, then it would follow that it is not endowed with life and so on.

original: gal te gson po'i lus bdag med pa yin na de'i tshe'i srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pas khyab pa'i phyir de yang de la khyab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gson po'i lus bdag med pa yin na de'i tshe'i srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pas khyab pa'i phyir de yang de la khyab par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the living body is without self, then at that time it would be pervaded by being not endowed with life and so on, and that would pervade it.

original: de ltar rnam pa 'dis de zhes bya ba srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa ste de log pas khyab par bya ba bdag med pa ldog pa'i phyir bdag yod pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa 'dis de zhes bya ba srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa ste de log pas khyab par bya ba bdag med pa ldog pa'i phyir bdag yod pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, by this mode, it would be not endowed with life and so on, and by the reversal of that, the pervaded, the absence of self, would be reversed, and therefore the existence of the self would be understood.

original: srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa log pa ni srog la sogs pa nyid yin la bdag med pa la sogs pa yang bdag nyid do //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa log pa ni srog la sogs pa nyid yin la bdag med pa la sogs pa yang bdag nyid do //
translated: The negation of that which is not endowed with life-force and so on is life-force and so on, and also selflessness and so on is self.

original: des na srog la sogs pa las bdag rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na srog la sogs pa las bdag rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the self is understood from life-force and so on.

original: de ltar ldog pa can nye bar bkod nas ji ltar bdag med pa srog la sogs pa med pa'i khyab bya yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir de khyab par byed pa nyid du tshad mas grub par ston pa ni bdag med pa'i bum pa la sogs pa mthong
analyzed: de ltar ldog pa can nye bar bkod nas ji ltar bdag med pa srog la sogs pa med pa'i khyab bya yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir de khyab par byed pa nyid du tshad mas grub par ston pa ni bdag med pa'i bum pa la sogs pa mthong
translated: Having thus specified the qualifier, in order to demonstrate how selflessness is pervaded by the absence of life-force and so on, he teaches that this is established by valid cognition as the pervader: The non-existence of life-force and so on is seen in the non-existence of self,

original: ba dang / ma mthong ba yin la de dag la ni srog la sogs pa med pa yang mthong ba de bas na srog la sogs pa med pa bdag med pas khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: ba dang / ma mthong ba yin la de dag la ni srog la sogs pa med pa yang mthong ba de bas na srog la sogs pa med pa bdag med pas khyab pa yin no //
translated: and that is seen in the non-existence of life-force and so on. Therefore, the absence of life-force and so on is pervaded by selflessness.

original: de lta yin na gang gi phyir bdag med pa la srog la sogs pa med pas khyab pa grub pa de'i phyir khyab par @83a * //
analyzed: de lta yin na gang gi phyir bdag med pa la srog la sogs pa med pas khyab pa grub pa de'i phyir khyab par @83a * //
translated: If that is so, then because the absence of life-force and so on is established as pervading selflessness, by that pervasion,

original: byed pa srog la sogs pa gson po'i lus la med par mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir bdag med pa yang med par rtogs pa de bas na /
analyzed: byed pa srog la sogs pa gson po'i lus la med par mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir bdag med pa yang med par rtogs pa de bas na /
translated: Since the existence of the life force and so on is established by direct perception to be absent in the living body, the nonexistence of the self is also understood to be absent.

original: srog la sogs pa dag las bdag rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dag las bdag rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the self is understood to exist in dependence on the life force and so on.

original: de lta yin dang srog la sogs pa bdag med pa la med pa zhes grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang srog la sogs pa bdag med pa la med pa zhes grub pa yin te /
translated: If that is so, it is established that the life force and so on do not exist in the absence of the self.

original: srog la sogs pa med pas bdag med pa la khyab pa'i phyir dang / khyab par bya ba yod na khyab par byed pa gdon mi za bar yod pa'i phyir ro //
