analyzed: srog la sogs pa med pas bdag med pa la khyab pa'i phyir dang / khyab par bya ba yod na khyab par byed pa gdon mi za bar yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the life force and so on are pervaded by the nonexistence of the self, and because when the pervaded exists, the pervader necessarily exists.

original: de'i phyir bdag med pa yod na srog la sogs pa med pa yod pa'i phyir 'dir bsgrub par bya ba med pa la sgrub par byed pa med pa ldog pa grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag med pa yod na srog la sogs pa med pa yod pa'i phyir 'dir bsgrub par bya ba med pa la sgrub par byed pa med pa ldog pa grub bo //
translated: Therefore, when the nonexistence of the self exists, the nonexistence of the life force and so on exists. Thus, in this case, the absence of the proof in the absence of the probandum is established.

original: srog la sogs pa yod pa na bdag yod pa ni grub pa med pa'i phyir ldog pa 'ba' zhig dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa yod pa na bdag yod pa ni grub pa med pa'i phyir ldog pa 'ba' zhig dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: When the life force and so on exist, the existence of the self is not established. Therefore, it is only associated with the absence of the proof.

original: des na 'di de ltar gtan tshigs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di de ltar gtan tshigs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is taught as the reason in this way.

original: 'grel pa'i rim pa ni 'di ni bdag med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'grel pa'i rim pa ni 'di ni bdag med pa ma yin te /
translated: The order of the commentary is this: ‚ÄúThis is not the self,

original: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa bdag med pa dang rjes su 'gro ba nyid brjod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ldog pa can du gsal bar bstan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa bdag med pa dang rjes su 'gro ba nyid brjod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ldog pa can du gsal bar bstan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would not possess life and so on.‚Äù Since it would be stated that the self is not the life faculty and so on, it would not be clearly taught as having a reverse pervasion.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni bdag med pa ma yin na zhes ldog pa nye bar bstan nas de log pas bdag yod par rtogs pa zhes bya ba 'dis 'di la gtan tshigs su bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni bdag med pa ma yin na zhes ldog pa nye bar bstan nas de log pas bdag yod par rtogs pa zhes bya ba 'dis 'di la gtan tshigs su bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, after teaching the reverse pervasion with ‚ÄúThis is not the self,‚Äù by saying ‚Äúbecause of the negation of that, the self is understood to exist,‚Äù he teaches this as a reason.

original: 'di ldog pa can yin par shin tu gsal bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ldog pa can yin par shin tu gsal bar bstan to //
translated: Thus it is clearly taught as having a reverse pervasion.

original: des na ma mthong bas ldog pa grub pa yin na 'di yang gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ma mthong bas ldog pa grub pa yin na 'di yang gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if the reverse pervasion is established by nonobservation, this would also be a reason.

original: ji ltar ma mthong bas thams cad du bsgrub par bya ba med pa la med par 'jog par byed pas don de la tshad mar brten pa de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa las bdag med pa yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ma mthong bas thams cad du bsgrub par bya ba med pa la med par 'jog par byed pas don de la tshad mar brten pa de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa las bdag med pa yang yin no //
translated: Just as one posits the nonexistence of something not seen as nonexistent, and one relies on that as a valid cognition of that object, in the same way, the self is also nonexistent in a pot, etc.

original: des na bdag dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin yang bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par grub pa'i phyir 'di khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa'i dngos po grub pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i gtan tshigs las kyang bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na bdag dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin yang bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par grub pa'i phyir 'di khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa'i dngos po grub pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i gtan tshigs las kyang bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, although the self is not the characteristic of the observed, since the selflessness of the pot, etc. is established, this pervasion and the fact of the pervaded are established. Therefore, one understands the probandum even from a reason that lacks concomitance.üîΩWhen mere non-seeing is valid cognition, then this fault does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe ma mthong ba tsam tshad ma yin pa de'i tshe ni nyes pa 'di med do zhes bshad pa ni bltar mi rung ba mi dmigs pas med par ma grub na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma mthong ba tsam tshad ma yin pa de'i tshe ni nyes pa 'di med do zhes bshad pa ni bltar mi rung ba mi dmigs pas med par ma grub na /
translated: If non-apprehension of the imperceptible does not establish non-existence,

original: bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par ma grub pa'o //
translated: the selflessness of the pot, etc. is not established.

original: de'i phyir bdag med pa @83b la srog la sogs pa med pas khyab pa ma grub pas bdag med pa yod pas srog la sogs pa ldog pa'i ldog pa med de sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag med pa @83b la srog la sogs pa med pas khyab pa ma grub pas bdag med pa yod pas srog la sogs pa ldog pa'i ldog pa med de sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no pervasion that the life-force, etc. do not exist when the self does not exist, the negation of the life-force, etc. does not follow from the existence of selflessness, as was explained earlier.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i khyab pa grub pas de ltar 'gyur ba yin na de ni ma grub pa de 'ga' yang bdag med par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i khyab pa grub pas de ltar 'gyur ba yin na de ni ma grub pa de 'ga' yang bdag med par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were so, then the pervasion would be established as explained, but that is not established, because it is not established that any of them are selfless.

original: de ltar na bdag med pa med na srog la sogs pa ldog pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag med pa med na srog la sogs pa ldog pa med do //
translated: Thus, if selflessness does not exist, the life-force, etc. do not exist.

original: gal te de ltar na srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid bdag med pa la ma mthong ba tsam gyis khyab pa ma grub par brjod par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid bdag med pa la ma mthong ba tsam gyis khyab pa ma grub par brjod par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the pervasion that the possession of the life-force, etc. does not exist when the self does not exist is not established by mere non-observation.

original: 'dir 'di bstan par 'dod pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i ldog pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma mthong ba tsam mi byed na bdag med pa dang srog med pa khyab pa ma grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin
analyzed: 'dir 'di bstan par 'dod pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i ldog pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma mthong ba tsam mi byed na bdag med pa dang srog med pa khyab pa ma grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin
translated: But if one does not see the mere evidence that refutes the existence of life, etc., then the nonexistence of self and the nonexistence of life would not be established as a universal principle.

original: no // gal te yang bdag dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par ma grub pa de lta na yang bdag med par smras pa la bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par grub pa yin la de dag la
analyzed: no // gal te yang bdag dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par ma grub pa de lta na yang bdag med par smras pa la bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par grub pa yin la de dag la
translated: Even though a pot, etc., is not established as selfless because it is not the object of the perception of self, still, the proponent of selflessness has established that a pot, etc., is selfless.

original: srog la sogs pa med par grub pa yin pa des na /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa med par grub pa yin pa des na /
translated: And since it is established that they are devoid of life, etc.,üîΩhow can it be said that the universal principle is not established?

original: ji ltar khyab pa ma yin zhes smras pa ni gal te khas blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar khyab pa ma yin zhes smras pa ni gal te khas blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If it is said that it is accepted,

original: dogs pa 'di sel bar byed pa ni da ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa 'di sel bar byed pa ni da ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: this is the doubt that is being dispelled.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te gal te tshad mas grub pa la mi ltos par nged kyis khas blangs pa las bum pa la sogs pa bdag med pa yin no /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te gal te tshad mas grub pa la mi ltos par nged kyis khas blangs pa las bum pa la sogs pa bdag med pa yin no /
translated: This is what is said: If, without depending on what is established by valid knowledge, we assert that such things as pots are selfless,

original: gson po'i lus la yang khas blangs pa khyad par med pa'i phyir bdag dang bcas pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gson po'i lus la yang khas blangs pa khyad par med pa'i phyir bdag dang bcas pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then, since there is no difference between the assertion and the living body, it would not be endowed with a self.

original: gzhan yang gang gis de khas blangs pas grub par 'dod pa bdag med par smra ba la yang bum pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ma grub pa'i bdag med pa'i tshad ma ma yin pa ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gis de khas blangs pas grub par 'dod pa bdag med par smra ba la yang bum pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ma grub pa'i bdag med pa'i tshad ma ma yin pa ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, how could one who asserts that it is established by the assertion of the proponent of selflessness establish the valid knowledge that is not established with respect to such things as pots, which are characterized by non-observation?

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: sangs rgyas pa la yang mi dmigs pa las bdag med par grub pa ma yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la yang mi dmigs pa las bdag med par grub pa ma yin la /
translated: For the Buddhist, selflessness is not established from non-observation.

original: tshad ma gang gis 'dod pa de ni gson po'i lus la yang nyams pa med do //
analyzed: tshad ma gang gis 'dod pa de ni gson po'i lus la yang nyams pa med do //
translated: And whatever valid knowledge is asserted, it is not undermined with respect to the living body.

original: re zhig bdag med par smra bas bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par khas blangs pa yin pa la ni 'u bu cag rtsod pa med do //
analyzed: re zhig bdag med par smra bas bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par khas blangs pa yin pa la ni 'u bu cag rtsod pa med do //
translated: First, there is no dispute between us that the Proponents of No-Self accept that such things as pots are without self.

original: gson po'i lus ni bdag cag bdag dang bcas pas 'dod pa des na de la rtsod pa yin na /
analyzed: gson po'i lus ni bdag cag bdag dang bcas pas 'dod pa des na de la rtsod pa yin na /
translated: But we do dispute that the living body is endowed with self, because we accept that it is endowed with self.

original: des na khas blangs pa'i bdag med pa @84a * //
analyzed: des na khas blangs pa'i bdag med pa @84a * //
translated: Therefore, since the self that is accepted as being without self

original: la srog la sogs pa med pa'i phyir go bar byed pa nyid du brjod pas ni bdag lung las grub pa khas blangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: la srog la sogs pa med pa'i phyir go bar byed pa nyid du brjod pas ni bdag lung las grub pa khas blangs par 'gyur te /
translated: is not the life-force, etc., the statement that it is the exemplification of that is an acceptance of a self that is established by scripture.

original: lung gis grub pa'i don la brten nas byas pa'i khyab pa grub pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung gis grub pa'i don la brten nas byas pa'i khyab pa grub pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the pervasion is established on the basis of an object that is established by scripture.

original: lung tsam las khas blangs pa ni tshad mas stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lung tsam las khas blangs pa ni tshad mas stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is accepted merely on the basis of scripture, it will be empty of valid cognition.

original: de bshad pa ni khas blangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni khas blangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚ÄúAcceptance, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de lta bas na srog la sogs pa ni rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa nyid de srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid bdag med pa ma grub pa'i phyir te bdag dang ldan par ma mthong bas bdag med pa maüîΩmthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bas na srog la sogs pa ni rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa nyid de srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid bdag med pa ma grub pa'i phyir te bdag dang ldan par ma mthong bas bdag med pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, the nonexistence of a self is not seen.

original: la lar bdag med par grub pa yin pa de lta na yang 'ga' zhig la bdag de log ste /
analyzed: la lar bdag med par grub pa yin pa de lta na yang 'ga' zhig la bdag de log ste /
translated: Even if the nonexistence of a self were established in some cases, still, in some cases, a self would not be refuted.

original: srog la sogs pa log kyang bdag med pa thams cad la skabs kyis srog la sogs pa ldog pa mi 'grub bo //üîΩdes na bdag med pa la srog la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa log kyang bdag med pa thams cad la skabs kyis srog la sogs pa ldog pa mi 'grub bo // des na bdag med pa la srog la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if life force and so on were refuted, the nonexistence of a self would not be established in all cases, because the refutation of life force and so on would not be established.

original: bdag med pa dang srog la sogs pa ldan pa ma yin pa dag khyab pa ma grub bo //
analyzed: bdag med pa dang srog la sogs pa ldan pa ma yin pa dag khyab pa ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore, because the nonexistence of a self does not exist in life force and so on, the nonexistence of a self and life force and so on are not established as a pervasion.

original: thams cad la ldog pa mi grub pa'i gtan tshigs ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad la ldog pa mi grub pa'i gtan tshigs ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The reason that the refutation is not established in all cases is because there is no relationship.üîΩIf something were refuted because it is not seen,

original: gal te ma mthong bas ldog par 'gyur na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong bas ldog par 'gyur na de'i tshe /
translated: then

original: ma grub sbyar ba brjod bya min //
analyzed: ma grub sbyar ba brjod bya min //
translated: The application of the unestablished is not a topic.

original: de yang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgras ni gtan tshigs gzhan sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgras ni gtan tshigs gzhan sdud pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in ‚Äúthat also‚Äù includes other reasons.

original: gang yang zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog na gzhung gzhan mi 'thad pa'i bsam pas yin no //
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog na gzhung gzhan mi 'thad pa'i bsam pas yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúwhatever‚Äù is from the thought that if there is an exclusion by mere non-seeing, other texts are not tenable.

original: ma grub sbyar ba de yang gang zhe na bshad pa de bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang ci rigs pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyis ma grub pa sbyar ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma grub sbyar ba de yang gang zhe na bshad pa de bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang ci rigs pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyis ma grub pa sbyar ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: What is that application of the unestablished? It is that which has the nature of the statement, ‚ÄúWhatever is like that, such as existing and not existing in the similar class,‚Äù and so on.

original: slob dpon gyis phyogs kyi chos nyid la /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis phyogs kyi chos nyid la /
translated: The master [Dharmakƒ´rti] said, ‚ÄúIn the property of the subject,

original: gnyi ga la yang rung ba dang the tshom za ba dang gzhi ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid ma grub pa rnam pa bzhi bstan nas mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis la yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi gas gtan tshigs rnam pa dgu la bsgresüîΩpa phyogs kyi chos la ji lta ba de bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni ma grub par sbyar ba yin no //üîΩma grub pa sbyar ba de @84b yang brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur te /üîΩgtan tshigs rnam pa dgu la ji ltar bshad pa'i ma grub pa mi brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang rung ba dang the tshom za ba dang gzhi ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid ma grub pa rnam pa bzhi bstan nas mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis la yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi gas gtan tshigs rnam pa dgu la bsgres pa phyogs kyi chos la ji lta ba de bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni ma grub par sbyar ba yin no // ma grub pa sbyar ba de @84b yang brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur te / gtan tshigs rnam pa dgu la ji ltar bshad pa'i ma grub pa mi brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nine types of reasons that are inconclusive because they are doubtful should be applied in the same way to the reason that is inconclusive because it is doubtful.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe nine types of reasons that are inconclusive because they are doubtful should be applied in the same way to the reason that is inconclusive because it is doubtful.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe nine types of reasons that are inconclusive because they are doubtful should be applied in the same way to the reason that is inconclusive because it is doubtful.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe nine types of reasons that are inconclusive because they are doubtful should be applied in the same way to the reason that is inconclusive because it is doubtful.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe nine types of reasons that are inconclusive because they are doubtful should be applied in the same way to the reason that is inconclusive because it is doubtful.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe nine types of reasons that are inconclusive because they are doubtful should be applied in the same way to the reason that is inconclusive because it is doubtful.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe nine types of reasons that are inconclusive because they are doubtful should be applied in the same way to the reason that is inconclusive because it is doubtful.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe nine types of reasons that are inconclusive because they are doubtful should be applied in the same way to the reason that is inconclusive because it is doubtful.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe nine types of reasons that are inconclusive because they are doubtful should be applied in the same way to the reason that is inconclusive because it is doubtful.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe nine types of reasons that are inconclusive because they are doubtful should be applied in the same way to the reason that is inconclusive because it is doubtful.‚Äù

original: the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa bzhag ste mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis la ma grub pa gsum brjod par bya'o zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa bzhag ste mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis la ma grub pa gsum brjod par bya'o zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nine types of reasons that are inconclusive because they are doubtful should be applied in the same way to the reason that is inconclusive because it is doubtful.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe nine types of reasons that are inconclusive because they are doubtful should be applied in the same way

original: mdor ma grub pa sbyar ba spyir bkag pa khyad par gnas par nges par bya'o zhes 'brel pa ston pa ni the tshom du gyur yang ma bzlog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mdor ma grub pa sbyar ba spyir bkag pa khyad par gnas par nges par bya'o zhes 'brel pa ston pa ni the tshom du gyur yang ma bzlog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The general prohibition of the application of the unestablished, and the certainty of the establishment of the particular, should be understood. The statement of the connection is: ‚ÄúEven if there is doubt, it will not be averted.‚Äù

original: the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa bzlog par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa bzlog par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The doubtful unestablished will not be averted.

original: phyogs kyi chos nyid du nye bar bstan pa'i ma grub pa sbyar bas ni the tshom du 'gyur ba bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos nyid du nye bar bstan pa'i ma grub pa sbyar bas ni the tshom du 'gyur ba bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The application of the unestablished that is shown to be the property of the subject will avert the doubt.üîΩIf it is just non-apprehension, then the doubt will be averted from the non-apprehension of the reason.

original: mi dmigs pa kho nar zad na the tshom za la ldog pa yang mi dmigs pa las yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir ma dmigs pa tsam gyi sgrub par byed pa ni the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa kho nar zad na the tshom za la ldog pa yang mi dmigs pa las yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir ma dmigs pa tsam gyi sgrub par byed pa ni the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mere non-apprehension of the proof is doubtful.

original: ldog pa ni mi dmigs pas rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa ni the tshom za ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa des na ji ltar khyab par med par ma grub par sbyor bar 'gyur mi
analyzed: ldog pa ni mi dmigs pas rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa ni the tshom za ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa des na ji ltar khyab par med par ma grub par sbyor bar 'gyur mi
translated: Therefore, how could it be applied as a nonestablished pervasion?

original: dmigs pa nyid la the tshom nges par ston pas dmigs pa la de med par bshad pa ni dmigs na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid la the tshom nges par ston pas dmigs pa la de med par bshad pa ni dmigs na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Since doubt is definitely shown in the case of nonobservation, the absence of that in the case of observation is explained as ‚Äúif observed.‚Äù

original: the tshom ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de ni mi dmigs pa kho na la yin par rigs so //
analyzed: the tshom ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de ni mi dmigs pa kho na la yin par rigs so //
translated: Since doubt does not exist, it is reasonable that it is only in the case of nonobservation.

original: rtogs bzhin pa nyid kyi chos la the tshom med pa'i phyir te nyams su myong ba ni ji ltar myong ba bzhin rtogs pa 'phel bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs bzhin pa nyid kyi chos la the tshom med pa'i phyir te nyams su myong ba ni ji ltar myong ba bzhin rtogs pa 'phel bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no doubt regarding the phenomenon that is being cognized, since experience increases the understanding in accordance with the experience.

original: gal te ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: If it is said that ‚Äúit is applied as appropriate,‚Äù this is what is being said.

original: khyad par med par ma grub pa sbyor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par med par ma grub pa sbyor ba ma yin te /
translated: An unestablished nonobservation of the absence of the pervader is not applied as a proof.

original: ci rigs par zhes smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it says ‚Äúin some cases.‚Äù

original: 'dir the tshom za ba ma grub pa ni dgag par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir the tshom za ba ma grub pa ni dgag par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, one might say, ‚ÄúAn unestablished doubt cannot be refuted,

original: mi dmigs pa'i rtsa ba can nyid kyis na ldog pa can the tshom za ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rtsa ba can nyid kyis na ldog pa can the tshom za ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na de ni ma yin te /
translated: because it is essentially a doubt that has a basis in non-apprehension.‚Äù

original: brjod pa gang zhig gnyi ga la yang nges pa de kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa gang zhig gnyi ga la yang nges pa de kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because it is said, ‚ÄúThat which is expressed as ‚Äòin both cases‚Äô is called ‚Äòdoubt‚Äô and so on.‚Äù

original: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba la nges pa sgrub par byed pa yin pa nyid kyis ldog pa la the tshom za ba sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba la nges pa sgrub par byed pa yin pa nyid kyis ldog pa la the tshom za ba sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is the establishment of certainty for the proponent and the opponent that is the proof, it is not the establishment of a doubt that has a basis in non-apprehension.

original: ci rigs par zhes gsungs pa ni gzhi ma grub pa nyid ldog pa la skyon du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes @85a * //
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes gsungs pa ni gzhi ma grub pa nyid ldog pa la skyon du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes @85a * //
translated: The statement ‚Äúin some cases‚Äù is made in order to show that an unestablished reason is not a fault in a reductio.

original: bstan pa'i phyir yin no zhes smra ba'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir yin no zhes smra ba'o //
translated: This is what we maintain.

original: des ni de ltar ma grub pa sbyar bas na slob dpon the tshom du gyur pa bzlog par bya ba bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni de ltar ma grub pa sbyar bas na slob dpon the tshom du gyur pa bzlog par bya ba bzhed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since the unestablished is applied in this way, the master wishes to refute the doubt.

original: des mi dmigs pa ldog pa sgrub par byed ba dgag par bshad pa yin no zhes smos pa ni de'i phyir mi dmigs pa yin du zin kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med par dgongs te /
analyzed: des mi dmigs pa ldog pa sgrub par byed ba dgag par bshad pa yin no zhes smos pa ni de'i phyir mi dmigs pa yin du zin kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med par dgongs te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúTherefore, even though there is non-apprehension, there is no exclusion from the discordant class‚Äù is explained as follows:

original: mi dmigs pa de dgag par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de dgag par bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is explained that non-apprehension is negated because it is intended that even though there is non-apprehension, there is no exclusion from the discordant class.

original: ci'i phyir ldog pa med ce na the tshom za bas so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir ldog pa med ce na the tshom za bas so //
translated: Why is there no exclusion? Because there is doubt.

original: ma mthong bas ldog pa med pa la gtan tshigs gzhan ston pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong bas ldog pa med pa la gtan tshigs gzhan ston pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The other reason for the absence of exclusion due to non-perception is stated in the words ‚ÄúMoreover . . . ‚Äù

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa ni go bar byed pa yin par bshad do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa ni go bar byed pa yin par bshad do //
translated: It is explained that the presence of concomitance and reverse concomitance is the indicator.

original: des na de med na go bar byed pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de med na go bar byed pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if that is absent, the indicator is absent.

original: ma nges pa la ni ldog pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa la ni ldog pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And there is no exclusion in the case of the uncertain.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is twofold: common and uncommon.

original: de la thun mong pa gcig tu rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis ldog pa med pa ste gzhal bya nyid do //
analyzed: de la thun mong pa gcig tu rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis ldog pa med pa ste gzhal bya nyid do //
translated: The common one is the non-exclusion which is possessed by the universal, and is the object of cognition.

original: thun mong ma yin pa ni mnyan bya nyid de /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa ni mnyan bya nyid de /
translated: The uncommon one is the audible,

original: thams cad la med pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba med pa bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa med pa la yang de med pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad la med pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba med pa bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa med pa la yang de med pa nyid do //
translated: because it does not exist in everything. Just as the probandum does not exist in the absence of the probandum, so too, the probandum does not exist in the absence of the probandum.

original: des na ldog pas thob par bya ba'i go bar byed pa'i bdag nyid bdag gir byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na ldog pas thob par bya ba'i go bar byed pa'i bdag nyid bdag gir byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the exclusion does not have the nature of the indicator which is to be obtained.

original: gang zhig gang med pa la med pa de ni yod pa na de med pa bzlog pa na de go bar byed pa yin te //
analyzed: gang zhig gang med pa la med pa de ni yod pa na de med pa bzlog pa na de go bar byed pa yin te //
translated: That which does not exist in the absence of something is the indicator of that when it exists, because it is the negation of the absence of that.

original: du bas me med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: du bas me med pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, smoke is the indicator of fire.üîΩWhen there is no fire, there is no smoke. When there is fire, there is smoke. Therefore, it negates the absence of fire.

original: me med pa la du ba med pa la de na ni yod pa yin pa des na me med pa zlog par byed pa'i phyir ro / des na mnyan bya nyid kyang gal te mi rtag pa bum pa la sogs pa med pas rtag pa nyid kyi sgrub
analyzed: me med pa la du ba med pa la de na ni yod pa yin pa des na me med pa zlog par byed pa'i phyir ro / des na mnyan bya nyid kyang gal te mi rtag pa bum pa la sogs pa med pas rtag pa nyid kyi sgrub
translated: Therefore, audibility is also the indicator of impermanence, because it does not exist in the absence of impermanence, such as in a pot, etc.

original: byed du 'god na da la med pas rang yod pas de med pa'i go bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed du 'god na da la med pas rang yod pas de med pa'i go bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is said that it is not established, then since it exists for you, it is established as impermanent because it causes the understanding of nonexistence.

original: des na nam mkha' la sogs pa rtag pa la yang ma mthong ba'i phyir rang yod pas rtag pa yang med par ston pa yin te /
analyzed: des na nam mkha' la sogs pa rtag pa la yang ma mthong ba'i phyir rang yod pas rtag pa yang med par ston pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, since it is not seen in permanent things such as space, it demonstrates that permanence does not exist.

original: des na gcig tu nges pa'i ldog pa med pas go bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gcig tu nges pa'i ldog pa med pas go bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is not ascertained as one, it is not a cause of understanding.

original: de ltar na thun mong ma yin pa la ldog pas thob par bya ba'i rnam par gcod pa rtog par byed pa ma yin par brjod pa gang yin pa de ma mthong ba la brten nas ldog par brjod @85b na mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar na thun mong ma yin pa la ldog pas thob par bya ba'i rnam par gcod pa rtog par byed pa ma yin par brjod pa gang yin pa de ma mthong ba la brten nas ldog par brjod @85b na mi 'grub bo //
translated: Thus, it is said that the uncommon is not ascertained by the exclusion that is to be obtained. Since it is not seen, it is not established as an exclusion.

original: gang gis phyir mnyan bya nyid la sogs pa thun mong ma yin pa rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la ma mthong ba'i phyir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du ci ste mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis phyir mnyan bya nyid la sogs pa thun mong ma yin pa rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la ma mthong ba'i phyir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du ci ste mi 'gyur /
translated: Why is it not a reason that excludes permanence and impermanence, since it is not seen in permanent and impermanent things that are uncommon, such as being audible?

original: gang zhig gang med pa la ma mthong ba de ni de med pa la med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang med pa la ma mthong ba de ni de med pa la med pa kho na yin no //
translated: Whatever is not seen in the absence of something else is only absent in the absence of that.

original: des na mnyan bya nyid rtag pa med pa la ma mthong ba'i phyir rtag pa med pa la med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na mnyan bya nyid rtag pa med pa la ma mthong ba'i phyir rtag pa med pa la med pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, since audibility is not seen in the absence of permanence, it is only absent in the absence of permanence.

original: de lta ma yin na byas pa nyid kyang mi rtag pa med pa la med par ji ltar 'grub /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na byas pa nyid kyang mi rtag pa med pa la med par ji ltar 'grub /
translated: Otherwise, how could it be established that being produced is absent in the absence of impermanence?

original: des na mnyan bya nyid sgra la yod la de yang rtag pa med pa la med pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rtag pa med pa rnam par bcad pa go bar mi byed /
analyzed: des na mnyan bya nyid sgra la yod la de yang rtag pa med pa la med pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rtag pa med pa rnam par bcad pa go bar mi byed /
translated: Thus, since audibility exists in sound and is absent in the absence of permanence, how could it not make one understand the exclusion of the absence of permanence?

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa med pa la ma mthong ba'i phyir de med pa la med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa med pa la ma mthong ba'i phyir de med pa la med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid do //
translated: Similarly, since it is not seen in the absence of impermanence, it is only absent in the absence of that, so it does make one understand the exclusion of that.

original: 'grel pa ni mnyan par bya ba nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni mnyan par bya ba nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary says, ‚ÄúAudibility also...‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la ma mthong ba'i phyir de dag las ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la ma mthong ba'i phyir de dag las ldog pa yin no //
translated: Because it is not seen in permanence and impermanence, it is excluded from those.

original: pas zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs de bas na de dag rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du 'grub ste sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: pas zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs de bas na de dag rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du 'grub ste sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means that for that reason, the reason is established as the reason that excludes those, just as it was explained earlier.

original: de med pa la med par yang grub pa /
analyzed: de med pa la med par yang grub pa /
translated: And it is established that it does not exist where that does not exist.

original: rang yod pas de rnam par gcod pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di mi srid do //
analyzed: rang yod pas de rnam par gcod pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible to say that it is not excluded by its own existence.

original: des na de rnam par gcod pa ni de las ldog pa las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de rnam par gcod pa ni de las ldog pa las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the exclusion of that is nothing other than the negation of that.

original: gang med na med pa'i phyir gang las gang zhig ldog pa de las ni de rnam par bcad pa gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: gang med na med pa'i phyir gang las gang zhig ldog pa de las ni de rnam par bcad pa gzhan ma yin te /
translated: When one thing does not exist without another, and one is negated in the absence of the other, then the exclusion of that is nothing other than the negation of that,

original: de tsam gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established by that alone.

original: ci de ltar na mnyan bya nyid go byed du bkod dam zhe na ma yin zhes smras te rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci de ltar na mnyan bya nyid go byed du bkod dam zhe na ma yin zhes smras te rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Is it the case that the quality of being audible is posited as the reason? No, it is not, because there is no pervasion.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di nye bar bkod de de ltar yin na mnyan par bya ba nyid kyang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa med pa la ma mthong ba'i phyir dang de dag med
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di nye bar bkod de de ltar yin na mnyan par bya ba nyid kyang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa med pa la ma mthong ba'i phyir dang de dag med
translated: This is stated to demonstrate that mere nonseeing is not a logical reason for nonexistence. If that were the case, then because audibility would not be seen in the permanent and the impermanent, it would follow that the permanent and the impermanent do not exist.üîΩ

original: pa la med par go bar byed par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa la med par go bar byed par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated to show that mere non-seeing is not a logical reason for non-existence. If it were, then audibility would also be a logical reason for non-eternality and non-non-eternality, because it is not seen in the absence of those, and it would follow that it would be understood to be absent in their absence.

original: des na rang yod pas de med pa ston par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na rang yod pas de med pa ston par byed pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is only when it is present that it shows the absence of that.

original: ma mthong yad med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir de med pa la ma mthong ba las kyang ldog pa mi 'grub na ni rnam par gcod pa ma yin par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong yad med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir de med pa la ma mthong ba las kyang ldog pa mi 'grub na ni rnam par gcod pa ma yin par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If non-seeing does not establish non-existence, then even in the absence of that, non-seeing would not establish the absence of that, and it would not be an exclusion.

original: gang gi tshe gang med pa la ma mthong ba de med pa la med pa nyid do @86a * //üîΩzhes nges pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gang med pa la ma mthong ba de med pa la med pa nyid do @86a * // zhes nges pa yin na ni /
translated: When it is ascertained that the absence of that in the absence of something is the absence of that,

original: de'i tshe gang na 'di yod pa der de med par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe gang na 'di yod pa der de med par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: then how could that be absent where this is present?

original: de med pa yin na ni 'di nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med pa yin na ni 'di nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is absent, then this itself would be absent.

original: yod pa yang yin te des na ji ltar nge med pa med par mi 'grub /
analyzed: yod pa yang yin te des na ji ltar nge med pa med par mi 'grub /
translated: It also exists, so how could it be established as nonexistent?

original: de bshad pa ni rnam par gcod pa ma yin pa de ni zhes bya ba nas rtog par mi byad ces bya ba'i mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni rnam par gcod pa ma yin pa de ni zhes bya ba nas rtog par mi byad ces bya ba'i mthar thug par ro //
translated: The explanation of that is from ‚ÄúThat which is not an exclusion‚Äù up to ‚Äúone should not imagine.‚Äù

original: ldog pa nyid du ma nges pa'i phyir rnam par gcod pa ma yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ldog pa nyid du ma nges pa'i phyir rnam par gcod pa ma yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because it is not ascertained as just an exclusion, it would be non-exclusion.

original: des na ni rnam par gcod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na ni rnam par gcod pa kho na'o //
translated: But that is just an exclusion.

original: 'di khyed kyis rang gi gzhung la yang mnyan par bya ba nyid ji ltar rnam par gcod par byed pa ma yin zhes dogs pa bsu nas de la rigs pa brjod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di khyed kyis rang gi gzhung la yang mnyan par bya ba nyid ji ltar rnam par gcod par byed pa ma yin zhes dogs pa bsu nas de la rigs pa brjod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Since you should listen to your own texts, how could it not be an exclusion? Anticipating this doubt, he states the reasoning there:

original: rang gi gzhung la tshul gsum med pa nyid kyis 'di go bar byed pa ma yin par grub pas rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid du the tshom mi za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi gzhung la tshul gsum med pa nyid kyis 'di go bar byed pa ma yin par grub pas rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid du the tshom mi za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not a means of knowledge because it does not have the three modes in one‚Äôs own texts. Since it is established that this is not an illuminator, there is no doubt that it is just an exclusion.‚Äù

original: gal te gzhan la yang de nyid kyis go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan la yang de nyid kyis go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not so, because it is not understood by others, then doubt would not arise.

original: bden te go bar byed pa ma yin pa ma mthong ba tshad mar byed na gnyi ga rnam par gcod pa ci ste mi 'grub ces bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: bden te go bar byed pa ma yin pa ma mthong ba tshad mar byed na gnyi ga rnam par gcod pa ci ste mi 'grub ces bya bar bstan to //
translated: It is true, but if one does not accept the non-perception of the means of understanding, why is it not established that both are excluded?

original: nged kyi ltar na ni gang gis thal ba 'dir 'gyur ba ma mthong ba tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: nged kyi ltar na ni gang gis thal ba 'dir 'gyur ba ma mthong ba tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: According to us, non-perception is not a means of valid cognition, because this consequence would follow.

original: des na 'di ldog pa med par gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir ma mthong ba tshad ma yin pa dgag par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di ldog pa med par gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir ma mthong ba tshad ma yin pa dgag par byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, in order to prevent this, we refute the validity of non-perception, because it is a means of establishing a thesis.

original: de lta ma yin na rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that it is a means of exclusion.üîΩSince all that is produced is produced as essentially perishable, is not the fact that sound is produced a proof that it is impermanent by nature, that is, perishable?

original: skyed par byed pa thams cad ngang gis 'jig pa skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir mnyan par bya ba nyid kyis kyang ngang gis 'jig pa'i rang bzhin mi rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed pa ma yin nam zhen ma yin te /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa thams cad ngang gis 'jig pa skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir mnyan par bya ba nyid kyis kyang ngang gis 'jig pa'i rang bzhin mi rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed pa ma yin nam zhen ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med par go bar byed pa nyid du mi srid do zhes rnam par nges pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bshad zin to //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med par go bar byed pa nyid du mi srid do zhes rnam par nges pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bshad zin to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe absence of a subsequent object is not possible.üîΩ‚Äù

original: 'dir pha rol pos smras pa gal te yang de med pa la med par rtogs pa de lta na yang gang gis 'dis gcig rnam par gcod pa na ma mthong ba khyad par med pa'i phyir gzhan yang rnam par gcod par 'gyur ba 'di ldog pa'i 'bras bu
analyzed: 'dir pha rol pos smras pa gal te yang de med pa la med par rtogs pa de lta na yang gang gis 'dis gcig rnam par gcod pa na ma mthong ba khyad par med pa'i phyir gzhan yang rnam par gcod par 'gyur ba 'di ldog pa'i 'bras bu
translated: Here, the opponent says: ‚ÄúEven if one understands the absence of an object as absent, still, when this [object] is excluded, since the absence of seeing is not distinguished, the exclusion of another [object] would also follow.

original: rnam par gcod pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this [exclusion] is not associated with exclusion.üîΩ‚Äù

original: de ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa yin no //
translated: Because it is undermined by another valid cognition.

original: dogs pa 'di nyid rnam par 'grel @86b pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dogs pa 'di nyid rnam par 'grel @86b pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This very doubt is explained:üîΩ‚ÄúIf . . .‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means ‚Äúwhen.‚Äù

original: gnyi ga rnam par gcod pa zhes bya bas ni tshad ma gzhan zhes bya ba'i yul bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga rnam par gcod pa zhes bya bas ni tshad ma gzhan zhes bya ba'i yul bshad pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe exclusion of both‚Äù explains the domain of ‚Äúanother valid cognition.‚Äù

original: tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa ci ste zhe na yod do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa ci ste zhe na yod do zhes brjod do //
translated: Why is it harmed by another valid cognition? It is said to be harmed.

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan de yang gang zhe na bshad pa phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo can rnams ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan de yang gang zhe na bshad pa phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo can rnams ni zhes smos so //
translated: What is that other valid cognition that harms it? It is explained: ‚ÄúThose that have the nature of mutual exclusion.‚Äù

original: gang dag la phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo yod pa ste rtag pa nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid rnam par bcad pa'i rang bzhin can yin la /
analyzed: gang dag la phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo yod pa ste rtag pa nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid rnam par bcad pa'i rang bzhin can yin la /
translated: Those that have the nature of mutual exclusion are those that have the nature of mutually excluding each other. Permanence has the nature of excluding impermanence,

original: mi rtag pa yang de rnam par bcad pa'i rang bzhin can yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang de rnam par bcad pa'i rang bzhin can yin no //
translated: and impermanence has the nature of excluding permanence.üîΩEven if these have the nature of a property that is eliminated and followed, in that case, they are said to be different from blue, yellow, etc., by the nature of mutually excluding each other.

original: gal te yang 'di dag la ldog pa dang rjes su 'jug pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo yang yod mod kyi de lta na yang phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa dang miüîΩ'dra bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang 'di dag la ldog pa dang rjes su 'jug pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo yang yod mod kyi de lta na yang phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa dang mi 'dra bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: Blue is eliminated from yellow,

original: sngon po ni ser po las ldog pa yin yang /
analyzed: sngon po ni ser po las ldog pa yin yang /
translated: but yellow is not eliminated from blue.

original: sngon po bkag pa tsam gyis ngo bo ni ser po mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon po bkag pa tsam gyis ngo bo ni ser po mi 'gyur te /
translated: The mere negation of blue does not have the nature of yellow,

original: de bkag pas dkar po yang 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bkag pas dkar po yang 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the negation of that would also be white.

original: gang zhig bkag pa gang gzung ba med pa ma yin pa de dag kho na'o //
analyzed: gang zhig bkag pa gang gzung ba med pa ma yin pa de dag kho na'o //
translated: Those are the ones that are not the apprehension of the negation of something.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir phan tshun bkag pa'i ngo bo can du nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir phan tshun bkag pa'i ngo bo can du nye bar bkod do //
translated: In order to teach that kind of distinction, the negation of one another is presented.

original: de la dngos po ldog pa'i chos dang bral na gdon mi za bar rjes su 'jug pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: de la dngos po ldog pa'i chos dang bral na gdon mi za bar rjes su 'jug pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: If a thing is devoid of the property of cessation, it must have the nature of the property of persistence.

original: de ni yod pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: de ni yod pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: That is the nature of existence.

original: byung ma thag tu 'jig pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'di de lta bu'i ngo bor gnas par khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: byung ma thag tu 'jig pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'di de lta bu'i ngo bor gnas par khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: Because it does not disintegrate as soon as it arises, it is accepted that it endures with that kind of nature.

original: de bzhin du rang gi rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ldog pa'i chos nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ldog pa'i chos nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, because it does not endure with its own nature, it is accepted that it has the property of cessation.

original: de bas na rnam pa de lta bu'i don rnams ni gcig rnam par bcad pas gzhan sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa de lta bu'i don rnams ni gcig rnam par bcad pas gzhan sgrub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in that kind of case, the negation of one thing establishes another.

original: 'di med par dgag pa tsam yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di med par dgag pa tsam yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a mere negation,

original: sngon po rtag gam mi rtag ces bya ba ni dngos po gzhan ma bsgrubs par mthar phyin par mi 'gyur te de bkag nas rtag pa 'am mi rtag pa rtogs pa'i phyir ji skad sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon po rtag gam mi rtag ces bya ba ni dngos po gzhan ma bsgrubs par mthar phyin par mi 'gyur te de bkag nas rtag pa 'am mi rtag pa rtogs pa'i phyir ji skad sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: because when one asks, ‚ÄúIs blue permanent or impermanent?‚Äù it is not completed without establishing another thing, because one understands permanence or impermanence by negating that.

original: dgag pa ma yin te zhes bya ba skabs kyis gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: dgag pa ma yin te zhes bya ba skabs kyis gzhan nyid do //
translated: It is not a negation, because the context is different.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: 'di mi rtag pa yin nam zhes mi rtag pa bkag pas rtag pa bsgrub par @87a * //üîΩ'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di mi rtag pa yin nam zhes mi rtag pa bkag pas rtag pa bsgrub par @87a * // 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIs this impermanent?‚Äù By negating impermanence, permanence is established.

original: des na 'di la de yang dgag par nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di la de yang dgag par nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that also is not able to negate this.

original: de bzhin du mnyan bar bya ba nyid la sogs pa'i chos kyang ma mthong ba'i phyir mi rtag pa med pa las ldog kyang rang yod pas mi rtag pa med pa rtag pa'i bdag nyid sel ba na mi rtag pa nyid rtogs par byed kyi de yang med
analyzed: de bzhin du mnyan bar bya ba nyid la sogs pa'i chos kyang ma mthong ba'i phyir mi rtag pa med pa las ldog kyang rang yod pas mi rtag pa med pa rtag pa'i bdag nyid sel ba na mi rtag pa nyid rtogs par byed kyi de yang med
translated: In the same way, because the quality of being audible, etc. is not seen, one turns away from the non-existence of impermanence. But when one‚Äôs own existence excludes the nature of permanence of the non-existence of impermanence, one understands impermanence. But that also does not exist.

original: par shes par byed nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: par shes par byed nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not able to make one understand that it is impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa nyid med pa la med pa'i phyir yod pa nyid las mi rtag pa nyid rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid med pa la med pa'i phyir yod pa nyid las mi rtag pa nyid rtag pa yin te /
translated: Since impermanence does not exist when existence does not exist, impermanence is permanent in relation to existence.

original: de nyid kyi tshe dgag pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe dgag pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible to negate it at that time.

original: des na mnyan bya nyid mi rtag pa med pa la med pa'i phyir rang yod pas rtag pa 'gog pa na mi rtag pa nyid sgrub pa yin te de ni dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na mnyan bya nyid mi rtag pa med pa la med pa'i phyir rang yod pas rtag pa 'gog pa na mi rtag pa nyid sgrub pa yin te de ni dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since audibility is impermanent in relation to nonexistence, when existence is negated, impermanence is established, because that is the property of an entity.

original: rtag pa med pa la med pa'i phyir ni rang yod pas mi rtag pa sel ba na rtag pa sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir chos gcig gi yul yod pa dang med par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa med pa la med pa'i phyir ni rang yod pas mi rtag pa sel ba na rtag pa sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir chos gcig gi yul yod pa dang med par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since permanence is not possible in relation to nonexistence, when impermanence is eliminated by existence, permanence is established. Thus, one would understand the existence and nonexistence of the object of a single property.

original: de smras pa ni bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de smras pa ni bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent says that this is not so, because establishment and negation are contradictory.

original: des na 'di med pa la med pa yin yang rtag pa dang mi rtag ba dag gcig la med pa mi rung ba'i phyir gang gis rang yod pas rnam par gcod par yang byed par 'gyur ba de med pa rtogs par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe
analyzed: des na 'di med pa la med pa yin yang rtag pa dang mi rtag ba dag gcig la med pa mi rung ba'i phyir gang gis rang yod pas rnam par gcod par yang byed par 'gyur ba de med pa rtogs par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe
translated: Therefore, although it is the case that the non-existent is not in the existent, since it is not possible for the permanent and the impermanent to be in one, that which is the existent is not the revealer of the non-existent, since it is the existent that is the revealer.

original: na / 'di bzlog pa'i phyir da ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: na / 'di bzlog pa'i phyir da ni zhes smos so //
translated: In order to refute this, he says, ‚ÄúNow, if it is said that . . . ‚ÄùüîΩIf it is said that audibility is not the non-existent of the permanent and the impermanent, since it is seen that it is the revealer, then it follows that it is the revealer of the non-existent, since it is seen that it is the revealer of the existent.üîΩIf that is so, since it is impossible for it to be external to both, there is the fault that it is the existent.

original: gal te mnyan par bya ba nyid rtag ba dang mi rtag pa la ma mthong ba yin yang rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de med pa la med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te mnyan par bya ba nyid rtag ba dang mi rtag pa la ma mthong ba yin yang rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de med pa la med pa ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, since it is the existent, it is not the non-existent.

original: de ltar yin na gnyi ga las phyi rol du gyur ba mi srid pa gnod par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin na /
analyzed: de ltar yin na gnyi ga las phyi rol du gyur ba mi srid pa gnod par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin na /
translated: If it is said that it is the non-existent of the non-existent, since it is the existent of the existent, it follows that it is the existent of the existent.üîΩIf it is said that it is the non-existent of the non-existent, since it is the existent of the existent, it follows that it is the existent of the existent.üîΩIf it is said that it is the existent of the existent, since it is the non-existent of the non-existent, it follows that it is the non-existent of the non-existent.üîΩIf it is said that it is the non-existent of the non-existent, since it is the existent of the existent, it follows that it is the existent of the existent.üîΩIf it is said that it is the existent of the existent, since it is the non-existent of the non-existent, it follows that it is the non-existent of the non-existent.üîΩIf it is said that it is the non-existent of the non-existent, since it is the existent of the existent, it follows that it is the existent of the existent.üîΩIf it is said that it is the existent of the existent, since it is the non-existent of the non-existent, it follows that it is the non-existent of the non-existent.

original: 'o na ni ma mthong ba la gnod pa'i phyir ma mthong ba las med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni ma mthong ba la gnod pa'i phyir ma mthong ba las med pa yin no //
translated: If it is said that it is the non-existent of the non-existent, since it is the existent of the existent, it follows that it is the existent of the existent.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: ma mthong ba med pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin pa ma bkag par ni gnyi ga las phyi rol du gyur pa mi srid pa nyid rnam par gcod par byed pa la gnod par byed pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang ma mthong ba med pa'i sgrub par byedüîΩpa nyid la gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba med pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin pa ma bkag par ni gnyi ga las phyi rol du gyur pa mi srid pa nyid rnam par gcod par byed pa la gnod par byed pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang ma mthong ba med pa'i sgrub par byed pa nyid la gnod pa yin no //
translated: But the existence of the non-existence of non-perception is contradicted.

original: de la mi gnod par ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis des nye bar bzhag pa'i gnyi ga rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi gnod par ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis des nye bar bzhag pa'i gnyi ga rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And since it is not contradicted, the exclusion of both, as presented by that, cannot be negated, in the manner explained.

original: de'i phyir gnod par byed pa'i tshad mas ni ma mthong ba nyid rig par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod par byed pa'i tshad mas ni ma mthong ba nyid rig par bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the non-perception, which is contradicted by the contradicting valid cognition, is to be understood.

original: @87b des na 'di las med par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: @87b des na 'di las med par mi 'grub po //
translated: Thus, non-existence is not established from this.

original: 'grel pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The commentary is ‚ÄúThus‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de ltar rnam pa 'dis ma mthong ba ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa 'dis ma mthong ba ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: In this way, non-perception is not a valid cognition.

original: rang gi yul med par sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi yul med par sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not establish the non-existence of its object.

original: skabs su bab pa'i rnam pa de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gnod pa srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i rnam pa de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gnod pa srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is possible that there is a fault‚Äù clarifies the point at issue.

original: gang la gnod pa yod pa der tshad ma ma yin mod /
analyzed: gang la gnod pa yod pa der tshad ma ma yin mod /
translated: If there is a fault, then it is not a valid cognition.

original: de tsam gyis ni ma mthong ba tsam spang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni ma mthong ba tsam spang ba ma yin te /
translated: But mere non-perception does not eliminate the object.

original: zla ba gnyis pa'i shes pa tshad ma ma yin pas dbang po'i shes pa thams cad chad ma ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis pa'i shes pa tshad ma ma yin pas dbang po'i shes pa thams cad chad ma ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If the cognition of two moons is not a valid cognition, then it follows, absurdly, that all sensory cognitions are not valid cognitions.

original: de bzhin du zhes smos so //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the same way‚Äù is used.

original: gnod pa ma mthong ba gzhan la yang tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa srid pa 'di ltar gal te gang zhig gang med pa la ma mthong ba de med pa la med par nges pa yin na 'di yang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag med pas na
analyzed: gnod pa ma mthong ba gzhan la yang tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa srid pa 'di ltar gal te gang zhig gang med pa la ma mthong ba de med pa la med par nges pa yin na 'di yang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag med pas na
translated: If the non-perception of a fault in another case is not a valid cognition, then it is possible that there is a fault in that other case. For example, if the non-perception of something in the absence of something else is not a valid cognition, then it is possible that the absence of something is not absent in the absence of something else. In this way, since permanent and impermanent things are absent,

original: de med pa la med do zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med pa la med do zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is possible that the absence of something is not absent in the absence of something else.

original: gnod bar byed pa mthong ba las ni de med pa la ma mthong ba yin yang de lta na yang de yod pa yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod bar byed pa mthong ba las ni de med pa la ma mthong ba yin yang de lta na yang de yod pa yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: But when one sees the object of harm, even though one does not see the absence of harm, one still understands that it exists.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i khyad par dang ldan pa gnod pa na gzhan gnod pa ma yin par rtogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa ma mthong ba de las ma mthong ba gzhan khyad par ni med do ;
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i khyad par dang ldan pa gnod pa na gzhan gnod pa ma yin par rtogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa ma mthong ba de las ma mthong ba gzhan khyad par ni med do ;
translated: When the object of harm is of such a kind, when it is harmed, one understands that the other is not harmed. But when one does not see the absence of harm, one does not see any other difference.

original: / khyad par med pas ni de bzhin du gzhan yang de'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir na ji ltar ma gnod ces bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: / khyad par med pas ni de bzhin du gzhan yang de'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir na ji ltar ma gnod ces bya bar 'gyur /
translated: Since there is no difference, then just as the other is of that nature, how could it not be harmed?

original: dbang po'i shes pa la ni tshogs pa mi 'dra bas bskyed par bya ba nyid kyi mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa dang khyad par yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa la ni tshogs pa mi 'dra bas bskyed par bya ba nyid kyi mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa dang khyad par yod pa kho na'o //
translated: In the case of sense perception, there is a difference in the production of the dissimilar assemblage, so there is a difference between direct perception and non-direct perception.

original: des na mngon sum ma yin pas gnod kyang mngon sum tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na mngon sum ma yin pas gnod kyang mngon sum tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even if non-direct perception is harmed, direct perception would not become invalid.

original: 'grel pa ni mtshan nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o snyam par bya ba gang yin pa dang byas pa nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa'i ma mthong ba 'di ni tha dad pa yod pa ma yin la de yang bsgrub par bya ba med pa la sgrub
analyzed: 'grel pa ni mtshan nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o snyam par bya ba gang yin pa dang byas pa nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa'i ma mthong ba 'di ni tha dad pa yod pa ma yin la de yang bsgrub par bya ba med pa la sgrub
translated: The commentary states that the term ‚Äúendowed with the property‚Äù is to be supplied in the above statement. The fact that the property of being produced, etc., is not seen in the case of space, etc., does not constitute a difference between the two cases.üîΩThe nonexistence of the probative reason in the case of the absence of the probandum is a reason that refutes the probative reason.

original: par byed pa med pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin pa la gnod pa yin no des na 'di yang de bzhin du dogs so //üîΩ'di ltar mnyan bya nyid ni sgra gcig pu'i chos yin pas bum pa dang nam mkha' dag la med pa yin gyi rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag las tha dad pa ni ma yin pa de bzhin du byas pa nyid kyang bum @88a * //
analyzed: par byed pa med pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin pa la gnod pa yin no des na 'di yang de bzhin du dogs so // 'di ltar mnyan bya nyid ni sgra gcig pu'i chos yin pas bum pa dang nam mkha' dag la med pa yin gyi rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag las tha dad pa ni ma yin pa de bzhin du byas pa nyid kyang bum @88a * //
translated: Thus, the opponent‚Äôs doubt is also resolved in this way.üîΩSound is the property of a single entity, and therefore it is not the case that sound is absent in space and pots, but it is not the case that sound is different from permanent and impermanent things.

original: pa la sogs pa nyid kyi chos yin pas nam mkha' la med pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: pa la sogs pa nyid kyi chos yin pas nam mkha' la med pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, the property of being produced is the property of pots, etc., and therefore it is not the case that impermanent things are devoid of the property of being produced.

original: des na sgra la de dmigs pas rtag pa bzlog par mi rigs so //
analyzed: des na sgra la de dmigs pas rtag pa bzlog par mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, since sound is observed to have the property of being produced, it is not correct to refute the permanence of sound.

original: byas pa ma mthong ba gang yin pa de las 'di gzhan pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byas pa ma mthong ba gang yin pa de las 'di gzhan pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not different from that which is not seen as being produced.

original: bltar rung ba ma mthong ba la sogs pa'i khyad par dang / ma mthong ba tsam ni 'di la yang sbyar bar sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bltar rung ba ma mthong ba la sogs pa'i khyad par dang / ma mthong ba tsam ni 'di la yang sbyar bar sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is easy to apply the mere non-seeing of the difference, such as the non-seeing of the visible, etc., to this [non-seeing of the produced].

original: des na ldog par sgrub par byed pa'i ma mthong ba la yod pa ma mthong ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'dir rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na ldog par sgrub par byed pa'i ma mthong ba la yod pa ma mthong ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'dir rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the non-seeing which proves the negation is not appropriate here by the definition of the non-seeing of the existent.

original: des na de la gnod na de'i mtshan nyid sun phyung ba kho nar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: des na de la gnod na de'i mtshan nyid sun phyung ba kho nar 'gyur te ;
translated: If it is impaired by that, then the definition of that [non-seeing] is refuted.

original: ma dmigs pa nyid la gnod par byas par gyur pas thams cad la yid brtan du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa nyid la gnod par byas par gyur pas thams cad la yid brtan du mi rung ngo //
translated: Since it is impaired by the non-apprehension itself, everything is unreliable.

original: rab rib la sogs pa las skyes pa la gnod pas ni mngon sum la gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rab rib la sogs pa las skyes pa la gnod pas ni mngon sum la gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: The impairment by what is produced from cataracts, etc. does not impair perception,

original: gzhan gnod pas gzhan la 'gal ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gnod pas gzhan la 'gal ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the impairment of one thing is not contradictory to another.

original: byis pa ma yin pa su yang gnod pa med pa nyid kyis ni mngon sum tshad mar mi smra'o //
analyzed: byis pa ma yin pa su yang gnod pa med pa nyid kyis ni mngon sum tshad mar mi smra'o //
translated: No one who is not a fool speaks of perception as valid cognition by the mere absence of impairment.

original: 'on kyang mi slu ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang mi slu ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not deceptive.üîΩSince it is established that its object is real, it is direct perception and valid cognition.

original: des ni de'i yul de nyid yin par grub pas mngon sum tshad mar 'gyur ba yin no zhes gzhan du bshad zin to //
analyzed: des ni de'i yul de nyid yin par grub pas mngon sum tshad mar 'gyur ba yin no zhes gzhan du bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained this elsewhere.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i yul la yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba mthong ste de dag gi yul las bzlog pa'i don rtogs par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i yul la yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba mthong ste de dag gi yul las bzlog pa'i don rtogs par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If direct perception and inference are seen to contradict each other with regard to the object of inference, then the object of inference is understood to be the opposite of what it was inferred to be.

original: de bas na yid brtan du mi rung bar mthong bar thal bar gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na yid brtan du mi rung bar mthong bar thal bar gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is seen to be unreliable.

original: 'di ltar sngo bsangs yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngo bsangs yin te /
translated: For example, the inference ‚ÄúHe is dark-complexioned

original: de'i bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin la byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes bya ba ni rtag ste mnyan bya yin pa'i phyir sgra nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa gnod pa yin
analyzed: de'i bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin la byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes bya ba ni rtag ste mnyan bya yin pa'i phyir sgra nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa gnod pa yin
translated: because he is the son of so-and-so‚Äù is contradicted by direct perception. The inference ‚ÄúSound is impermanent because it is produced‚Äù is contradicted by the inference ‚ÄúSound is permanent because it is audible, like tactility.‚Äù

original: no // des na rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: no // des na rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, inference also would not be a means of valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir de yang gnod pa med pa tsam gyis tshad ma ma yin pa de yod pa ni tshad ma yin par 'dod par bya ba yin pa des na mthong ba la yang khyad par med do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang gnod pa med pa tsam gyis tshad ma ma yin pa de yod pa ni tshad ma yin par 'dod par bya ba yin pa des na mthong ba la yang khyad par med do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not a means of valid cognition because it is merely non-deceptive, but it is accepted as existing as a means of valid cognition. Thus, there is no difference even in the case of perception.

original: 'di dgag pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di dgag pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes smos so //
translated: To refute this, it says, not that.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In the domain of inference, there is no contradiction with perception or inference.

original: ji skad bshad pa bum @88b pa lta bu la zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa la brten pa dngos po'i rang bzhin rnam par dpyod pas bskyed pa la'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa bum @88b pa lta bu la zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa la brten pa dngos po'i rang bzhin rnam par dpyod pas bskyed pa la'o //
translated: In the case of a pot, as has been explained, means in relation to the analysis of the nature of things that is based on connection.

original: de dag gis gnod pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa de lta bu ma yin pas bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa nyid gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis gnod pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa de lta bu ma yin pas bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa nyid gnod pa yin no //
translated: That which is harmed by them is not produced in that way, therefore it is harmed by being not an inference.

original: de bshad pa ni srid na ni zhes bya ba'o srid pa gang la yod pa ni srid pa can de yang skabs kyis mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba kho na yin pa des na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba srid
analyzed: de bshad pa ni srid na ni zhes bya ba'o srid pa gang la yod pa ni srid pa can de yang skabs kyis mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba kho na yin pa des na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba srid
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúif it existed.‚Äù That which exists in existence is existent. Since it is only contradictory with direct perception and inference, it is contradictory with direct perception and inference.üîΩ

original: pa dang ldan pa zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa dang ldan pa zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúif it exists.‚Äù That which exists in existence is existent. Moreover, it is only contradictory to perception and inference because of the context. Therefore, it is said to be ‚Äúcontradictory to perception and inference and existent.‚Äù

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: That is because it is external to the definition of inference.

original: / rjes su dpag pa ni dngos po'i mthus bskyed pa'i rtogs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang rtogs pa'i don du rtogs pa 'di ni dngos po yod pa'i rigs pa la brten pas yin no //
analyzed: / rjes su dpag pa ni dngos po'i mthus bskyed pa'i rtogs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang rtogs pa'i don du rtogs pa 'di ni dngos po yod pa'i rigs pa la brten pas yin no //
translated: Inference is not the understanding generated by the power of things, but rather, this understanding is for the sake of understanding and is based on the reasoning of the existence of things.

original: de dang khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpog pa la gnod pa srid pa'i phyir de lta bu'i rigs pas yod pa'i phyir don gzhan gyi rjes su dpog par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di la dngos po yod pa'i rigs pa yod pa ma yin
analyzed: de dang khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpog pa la gnod pa srid pa'i phyir de lta bu'i rigs pas yod pa'i phyir don gzhan gyi rjes su dpog par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di la dngos po yod pa'i rigs pa yod pa ma yin
translated: Because it is possible that there is a contradiction in the inference of a nature that is not different from that, there is no principle of existence in this kind of inference of a different object because of existence.

original: no // don gyi rang gyis bskyed pa'i rtogs pa la ni srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: no // don gyi rang gyis bskyed pa'i rtogs pa la ni srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is possible in the case of a cognition that is produced by the object itself.

original: der yang gnod par byed pa med pa'i ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes gzhan du bshad zin to //
analyzed: der yang gnod par byed pa med pa'i ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes gzhan du bshad zin to //
translated: And it has been explained elsewhere that it is not a valid cognition when there is no contradiction.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i yul la gnod pa mi srid na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can mi brjod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i yul la gnod pa mi srid na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can mi brjod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is impossible to contradict the object of inference, then the master Dignaga would not have stated the infallible contradiction.

original: dogs pa 'di spong ba ni 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can ma brjod pa ni 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: dogs pa 'di spong ba ni 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can ma brjod pa ni 'dod pa yin te /
