translated: This doubt is removed by stating that the infallible contradiction is accepted.

original: de ni slob dpon gyis rjes su dpag pa'i yul la ma brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni slob dpon gyis rjes su dpag pa'i yul la ma brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the master did not state it in the case of the object of inference.

original: 'o na gang la brjod ce na 'di'i yul ni bstan par bya'o zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'o na gang la brjod ce na 'di'i yul ni bstan par bya'o zhes smos so //
translated: Well then, what is it that is being said? The object of this is to be taught.

original: skabs su bab pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs gzhan yang bsnan pa'i phyir gzhan yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs gzhan yang bsnan pa'i phyir gzhan yang zhes smos so //
translated: Since another reason is added to the one that is relevant, it says ‚ÄúMoreover.‚Äù

original: ma mthong ba'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa mthong ba dang mi ldan te ldan pa 'gog pa 'khrul pa med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa mthong ba dang mi ldan te ldan pa 'gog pa 'khrul pa med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is a reason for non-perception, the perception of a sensation that is neither cold nor warm is not possessed, and the negation of possession is not erroneous.

original: ma mthong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma ni grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin reg pa rtogs par gyur pa dang mi ldan pa 'gal ba med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma ni grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin reg pa rtogs par gyur pa dang mi ldan pa 'gal ba med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The valid cognition that has the characteristic of non-perception is not possessed by the understanding of a sensation that is neither cold nor warm, and there is no contradiction. This is the meaning.

original: @89a * // de de ltar na 'di bshad pa'i gzhung dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @89a * // de de ltar na 'di bshad pa'i gzhung dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, this is connected to the text that is being explained.

original: mdo 'di nyid dgrol ba'i phyir slob dpon gyis gzhung gang bstan pa'i don du gzhung 'di yin pa de ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid dgrol ba'i phyir slob dpon gyis gzhung gang bstan pa'i don du gzhung 'di yin pa de ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In order to explain this sutra, the master teaches the meaning of the treatise that he composed, and this is indicated by ‚Äúif.

original: dgag par rigs pa ma yin no zhes slob dpon gyis gang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dgag par rigs pa ma yin no zhes slob dpon gyis gang bshad pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù The master explains that it is not logical to refute.

original: dgag pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ston pas slob dpon gyi gzhung gzhan yang ston pa ni gal te ma mthong ba tsam gyis ma mthong ba la sogs pa dag la 'gog par byed na ma mthong ba tsam gyis 'gog pa de yang rigs pa ma yin noüîΩzhes bya ba'o //üîΩdgag pa de ji ltar rigs pa ma yin te rigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dgag pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ston pas slob dpon gyi gzhung gzhan yang ston pa ni gal te ma mthong ba tsam gyis ma mthong ba la sogs pa dag la 'gog par byed na ma mthong ba tsam gyis 'gog pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o // dgag pa de ji ltar rigs pa ma yin te rigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The master also teaches another treatise, showing the nature of the refutation: ‚ÄúIf one refutes nonseeing and so on by mere nonseeing, that refutation by mere nonseeing is illogical.‚ÄùüîΩHow is that refutation illogical? It is logical.

original: ji ltar zhe na mi dmigs pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na mi dmigs pa zhes smos so //
translated: What is it like? He says ‚Äúnonobservation.‚Äù

original: pha rol po dag grang ba dang dro ba'i reg pa dag gi rten sa la sogs par grub pa yin pas na de las gzhan du gyur pa'i rdzas bsgrub par bya ba'i don du yon tan nyid kyis yon tan can la ltos pa grang ba yang ma yin
analyzed: pha rol po dag grang ba dang dro ba'i reg pa dag gi rten sa la sogs par grub pa yin pas na de las gzhan du gyur pa'i rdzas bsgrub par bya ba'i don du yon tan nyid kyis yon tan can la ltos pa grang ba yang ma yin
translated: Since the basis of cold and warm contact is established as earth and so on, it is not the case that cold and warm contact depend on substance for the sake of establishing a substance that is different from them.

original: dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa'i rten sa la sogs pa las gzhan du gyur pa'i rlung la rten pa yin no zhes sgrub pa'i phyir mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i sa la sogs pa rten yin pa nyid 'gog pas de dag la ma mthong ba'i phyir
analyzed: dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa'i rten sa la sogs pa las gzhan du gyur pa'i rlung la rten pa yin no zhes sgrub pa'i phyir mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i sa la sogs pa rten yin pa nyid 'gog pas de dag la ma mthong ba'i phyir
translated: In order to prove that wind is the basis of contact that is neither cold nor warm, which is different from earth and so on, the master refutes the position that earth and so on are the basis of contact that is seen and unseen.

original: med pa brjod do //
analyzed: med pa brjod do //
translated: Therefore he states that wind is not seen.

original: de la slob dpon gyi reg pas sa la sogs pa mthong ba dag la ma mthong yang ma mthong ba la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la slob dpon gyi reg pas sa la sogs pa mthong ba dag la ma mthong yang ma mthong ba la 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, although the master does not see earth and so on that are the basis of contact that is seen, he does not see that which is unseen.

original: 'on te de dag la ma mthong ba nyid kyis mthong ba ma yin no zhes brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te de dag la ma mthong ba nyid kyis mthong ba ma yin no zhes brjod na /
translated: If you say that because he does not see that which is unseen, he does not see it,üîΩthen it follows that he does not see that which is seen.

original: de la slob dpon gyis ma mthong ba tsam gyis ma mthong ba dag la 'gog pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de la slob dpon gyis ma mthong ba tsam gyis ma mthong ba dag la 'gog pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: The master [NƒÅgƒÅrjuna] has cleared away the negation of non-observation by mere non-observation.

original: 'di ni ma mthong ba ldog pa bsgrub par bya ba smra ba la mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ni ma mthong ba ldog pa bsgrub par bya ba smra ba la mi 'thad do //
translated: This is not tenable when speaking of the proof of the negation of non-observation.

original: gang gi tshe ma mthong bas ldog pa grub pa de'i tshe sa la sogs pa la yang grang ba dang dro ba ma yin pa'i reg pa dgag pa ci ste mi 'grub /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma mthong bas ldog pa grub pa de'i tshe sa la sogs pa la yang grang ba dang dro ba ma yin pa'i reg pa dgag pa ci ste mi 'grub /
translated: When negation is established by non-observation, then why is the negation of cold and non-hot contact in earth and so on not established?

original: des na ji ltar slob dpon ma mthong ba tsam gyis dgag pa rigs pa ma yin zhes gsung /
analyzed: des na ji ltar slob dpon ma mthong ba tsam gyis dgag pa rigs pa ma yin zhes gsung /
translated: Therefore, how is it that the negation is not tenable by mere non-observation of the master?

original: chos can mi snang ba la chos dgag pa mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: chos can mi snang ba la chos dgag pa mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not tenable to negate a property in the absence of the appearance of the property-bearer,

original: ldog pa la yang chos can thams cad snang ba ma yin te 'ga' zhig la med pa tsam gyis ldog pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa la yang chos can thams cad snang ba ma yin te 'ga' zhig la med pa tsam gyis ldog pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then in the case of negation, too, all property-bearers do not appear, because negation is not established by mere absence in some.

original: de ltar 'di'i bar gyis ni ma mthong bas mthong ba dang mi ldan pa slob dpon gyis 'gal ba nyid du gsungs pa yang mi @89b 'gal ba nyed du 'gyur ro zhes bsgrubs te /
analyzed: de ltar 'di'i bar gyis ni ma mthong bas mthong ba dang mi ldan pa slob dpon gyis 'gal ba nyid du gsungs pa yang mi @89b 'gal ba nyed du 'gyur ro zhes bsgrubs te /
translated: Thus, up to this point, it has been established that the contradiction stated by the Master, that one who does not see does not see, is not a contradiction.

original: da ni slob dpon gyis bzhed gzhung gzugs pa'i don du /
analyzed: da ni slob dpon gyis bzhed gzhung gzugs pa'i don du /
translated: Now, in order to establish the meaning of the Master‚Äôs intention,

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa sun 'byin pa ston par byed pa ni reg pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa sun 'byin pa ston par byed pa ni reg pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: he shows the refutation of the assertions of others, beginning with ‚Äúcontact.‚Äù

original: grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur ba yin pas de ma mthong bas 'gog pa yin gyi mthong ba tsam gyis ni ma yin nam des na ji ltar mi rigs she na ji ltar mi rigs pa
analyzed: grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur ba yin pas de ma mthong bas 'gog pa yin gyi mthong ba tsam gyis ni ma yin nam des na ji ltar mi rigs she na ji ltar mi rigs pa
translated: Since contact that is neither hot nor cold is the characteristic of the object of perception, it is not seen, and thus it is refuted. But is it not the case that it is refuted merely by seeing it? How then is it not reasonable?

original: ma yin gang gi phyir snang ba dang snang ba'i rang bzhin snang ba dang rigs mtshungs pa'i yul gang yin pa de tsam gyis reg pa 'gog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin gang gi phyir snang ba dang snang ba'i rang bzhin snang ba dang rigs mtshungs pa'i yul gang yin pa de tsam gyis reg pa 'gog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable, because the mere contact that is neither hot nor cold is not the refutation of contact, since it is the object of a perception that is similar to the perception of light and the nature of light.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te ;
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te ;
translated: This is what is being said:

original: 'di mthong bas gzung ba'i yul gyur pa tsam ni 'gog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di mthong bas gzung ba'i yul gyur pa tsam ni 'gog pa ma yin no //
translated: Seeing this, one does not refute the mere object that is perceived.

original: de byed pa ni mi snang ba'i chos can la brten pa nyid la byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de byed pa ni mi snang ba'i chos can la brten pa nyid la byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The refutation is of the fact that the object is based on something that does not appear.

original: des na 'di bum pa la sogs pa la snang ba'i reg pa de 'gog pa ma yin la snang ba dang rigs gcig pa'i yul la 'gog pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di bum pa la sogs pa la snang ba'i reg pa de 'gog pa ma yin la snang ba dang rigs gcig pa'i yul la 'gog pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the refutation is not of the contact that perceives the pot, etc., nor is it of the object that is of the same type as the perception.

original: mthong ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa 'gog pa ni 'di na grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa med la 'di dang rigs gcig pa gzhan yang med do zhes byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa 'gog pa ni 'di na grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa med la 'di dang rigs gcig pa gzhan yang med do zhes byed pa yin no //
translated: The refutation is of the nature of what is seen, and there is no contact that is neither hot nor cold, nor is there anything else that is of the same type.

original: 'di de dang rigs gcig pa nyid kyang chos can rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis 'gyur te 'di nyid dang rigs gcig pa la yang med do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di de dang rigs gcig pa nyid kyang chos can rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis 'gyur te 'di nyid dang rigs gcig pa la yang med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The fact that it is of the same type as that is due to its having the nature of that kind of object, and there is nothing else that is of the same type as that.

original: des na de ltar snang ba la ni snang ba mi dmigs pa kho nas 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na de ltar snang ba la ni snang ba mi dmigs pa kho nas 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, the refutation of the appearance is due to the non-apprehension of the appearance itself.

original: de'i rigs can la ni de dang rigs gcig pa nyid kyis rigs pa kho na las yin no //
analyzed: de'i rigs can la ni de dang rigs gcig pa nyid kyis rigs pa kho na las yin no //
translated: For those who are of that type, it is only by reason of being of the same type as that.

original: 'di ltar de ni des stong pa nyid kyis de dang rigs gcig pa yin gyi chos gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni des stong pa nyid kyis de dang rigs gcig pa yin gyi chos gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: In this way, it is of the same type as that by being empty of that, but not by being another entity.

original: des stong pa nyid du rigs mtshungs pa gang yin pa de la ni grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa dgag pa grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des stong pa nyid du rigs mtshungs pa gang yin pa de la ni grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa dgag pa grub pa kho na'o //
translated: That which is similar in being empty of that is established as the negation of a sensation that is neither hot nor cold.

original: gzhan dag ni de ltar dgag pa byed pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang des ni sa la sogs pa'i spyi bzung nas te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de ltar dgag pa byed pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang des ni sa la sogs pa'i spyi bzung nas te /
translated: Others do not make a negation in that way, but rather they take the universal of earth, etc.,

original: bltar rung ba dang de dang mtshungs pa'i rnam pa spangs te /
analyzed: bltar rung ba dang de dang mtshungs pa'i rnam pa spangs te /
translated: and having excluded the aspect that is suitable to be seen,

original: sa la sogs pa thams cad la dgag pa smras so //üîΩde la yang sa la sogs pa thams cad snang ba ma yin la thams cad mthong ba dang rigs gcig par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang nges par bya nus pa @90a * //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa thams cad la dgag pa smras so // de la yang sa la sogs pa thams cad snang ba ma yin la thams cad mthong ba dang rigs gcig par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang nges par bya nus pa @90a * //
translated: they say that the negation applies to all earth, etc.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not the case that all earth, etc., is not apparent, and it is not possible to ascertain that all of it is of the same type as that which is seen.

original: de'i rigs can gang yin pa de ni de lta yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rigs can gang yin pa de ni de lta yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But this is not the case for those that are not seen.

original: ma mthong ba dag la ni 'di 'am thams cad de'i rigs can yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba dag la ni 'di 'am thams cad de'i rigs can yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And when something is not seen, there is no certainty that it is or is not of the same kind as that which is seen.

original: gal te ji ltar sngon po'i rang bzhin ser po las ldog pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: gal te ji ltar sngon po'i rang bzhin ser po las ldog pa'i phyir ;
translated: If you say that because the nature of blue is the opposite of yellow,

original: de ma mthong yang gzhan du srid pa ma yin pa de bzhin du sa la sogs pa thams cad grang ba dang dro ba ma yin pa'i reg pa las ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ji ltar dgag par mi rigs she na /
analyzed: de ma mthong yang gzhan du srid pa ma yin pa de bzhin du sa la sogs pa thams cad grang ba dang dro ba ma yin pa'i reg pa las ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ji ltar dgag par mi rigs she na /
translated: then even though blue is not seen, it is not possible that it exists elsewhere, in the same way, it is not possible to deny the existence of earth, etc., because their nature is the opposite of a non-cold, non-hot contact.

original: de ltar ni mi nus te snang ba la ni mthong ba nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir sngon po dang ser po'i rang bzhin las ldog pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni mi nus te snang ba la ni mthong ba nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir sngon po dang ser po'i rang bzhin las ldog pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But this is not possible, because the nature of blue is the opposite of the nature of yellow, since it is established by perception.

original: mi snang ba dag la ni mthong ba la brten nas de ltar gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi snang ba dag la ni mthong ba la brten nas de ltar gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: But in the case of what is not seen, it is not so established on the basis of perception.

original: de de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir dang tshad ma rnams yul ma yin pa la brten pa rnam par 'jug pa'i nus pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir dang tshad ma rnams yul ma yin pa la brten pa rnam par 'jug pa'i nus pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is not its object, and because the valid cognitions are devoid of the power to engage in regard to what is not their object.

original: de'i phyir ma mthong ba la ni rigs pa'i rtsa ba las de ltar khas len pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma mthong ba la ni rigs pa'i rtsa ba las de ltar khas len pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the case of what is not seen, the acceptance of that is the root of non-logic.

original: gang gi phyir sngon po zhes bya bar mthong ba'i sngon po dang rigs gcig pa ni ser po las gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir de las ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngon po zhes bya bar mthong ba'i sngon po dang rigs gcig pa ni ser po las gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir de las ldog pa yin no //
translated: Because the blue that is seen as ‚Äúblue‚Äù is of the same type as the blue, it is the opposite of yellow.

original: 'on te rigs gcig la gzhan pa yang ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rigs gcig la gzhan pa yang ma yin na /
translated: But if it is not different in the same type,

original: de nyid la de ltar ming btags pas ji ltar ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: de nyid la de ltar ming btags pas ji ltar ldog par 'gyur /
translated: how can it be the opposite by designating it as such in that very thing?

original: de bzhin du sa gzhan yang gal te de'i rigs can yin na ni der grub bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa gzhan yang gal te de'i rigs can yin na ni der grub bo //
translated: In the same way, if another place is of the same type, it is established as that.

original: 'on te rigs mi gcig pa yin na de lta bu ma yin pa su zhig 'gog / rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyang ji ltar dgag ste spros pas chog go //
analyzed: 'on te rigs mi gcig pa yin na de lta bu ma yin pa su zhig 'gog / rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyang ji ltar dgag ste spros pas chog go //
translated: But if it is not of the same type, who can deny that it is not like that? And how can the difference in type be denied? Enough with this elaboration.

original: ma mthong bas snang ba ma yin pa la dgag pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi cha 'di ni srid par 'gyur ba yang yin no zhes bshad pa ni sa la sogs pa de la yang grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa
analyzed: ma mthong bas snang ba ma yin pa la dgag pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi cha 'di ni srid par 'gyur ba yang yin no zhes bshad pa ni sa la sogs pa de la yang grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa
translated: Not only is there no negation of what is not apparent due to not seeing it, but also this part is possible.

original: la sogs pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig la dogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig la dogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: This is explained as follows: Even in regard to earth and so on, there is doubt about some particular thing, such as that it is neither cold nor hot,üîΩand so on.

original: rig pa'i khyad par de lta bus la sogs pa brten par dogs par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rig pa'i khyad par de lta bus la sogs pa brten par dogs par rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable to doubt that such and such a particular thing is supported by earth and so on.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba 'di des ni zhes brjod pa dang 'brel te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba 'di des ni zhes brjod pa dang 'brel te /
translated: This also is connected with the expression ‚Äúby that.‚Äù

original: 'gog par smras pas kyang dogs par bya ba yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gog par smras pas kyang dogs par bya ba yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is also to be doubted by one who advocates cessation.

original: shing bal dang rdo ba dang lo ma la sogs pa dag sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de yod kyang 'jam pa dang rtsub pa la sogs pa reg pa'i @90b rnam pa mang po mthong ba'i phyir tsha grang ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyis reg par yang 'gyur
analyzed: shing bal dang rdo ba dang lo ma la sogs pa dag sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de yod kyang 'jam pa dang rtsub pa la sogs pa reg pa'i @90b rnam pa mang po mthong ba'i phyir tsha grang ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyis reg par yang 'gyur
translated: And even though cotton, stone, leaves, etc. have the nature of earth, etc., they are seen to have many different types of contact, such as soft, rough, etc. Therefore, contact would have a nature that is neither hot nor cold.

original: ro // 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa ni reg pa'i khyad par ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ro // 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa ni reg pa'i khyad par ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: Softness, etc. are not not particular types of contact,

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni lus kyi dbang pos gzung ba tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni lus kyi dbang pos gzung ba tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their characteristics are merely apprehended by the body faculty.

original: de'i phyir thams cad du ma mthong ba tsam gyis dgag par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad du ma mthong ba tsam gyis dgag par mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to deny something merely because it is not seen everywhere.

original: 'di gal te yang ma mthong bas ldog pa grub na chos mi mthun pa mi smos par thal ba dang / mnyan par bya ba nyid rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid dang bstan pa gzhan dag kyang mu stegs pa gzhan dag la yang thal ba yin pa de lta na yang phal cher thun mong ma yin bar sun 'byin pa yin pa'i phyir 'di rang gi sde pa'i
analyzed: 'di gal te yang ma mthong bas ldog pa grub na chos mi mthun pa mi smos par thal ba dang / mnyan par bya ba nyid rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid dang bstan pa gzhan dag kyang mu stegs pa gzhan dag la yang thal ba yin pa de lta na yang phal cher thun mong ma yin bar sun 'byin pa yin pa'i phyir 'di rang gi sde pa'i
translated: Even though that is so, since the refutation is mostly not shared, this is set forth from the perspective of our own schools.

original: dbang du byas nas nye bar bkod pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni de ltar slob dpon la zhes smos so //
analyzed: dbang du byas nas nye bar bkod pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni de ltar slob dpon la zhes smos so //
translated: This is what is meant by the statement ‚Äúin that way, the master . . . .‚Äù

original: gang yang rigs pas grub pa'i khyab pa rtogs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir slob dpon pa mtha' dag de ltar rtogs pa yin pa de lta na yang 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni bdag nyid slob dpon pa yin pa la ltos nas yin no //
analyzed: gang yang rigs pas grub pa'i khyab pa rtogs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir slob dpon pa mtha' dag de ltar rtogs pa yin pa de lta na yang 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni bdag nyid slob dpon pa yin pa la ltos nas yin no //
translated: Also, since there is no other way to understand the pervasion that is established by reasoning, the master understands it in that way. Even though that is so, ‚Äúsome‚Äù is in consideration of the master himself.

original: da ni mu stegs pa gzhan dang thun mong du sun 'byin pa yang bshad pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: da ni mu stegs pa gzhan dang thun mong du sun 'byin pa yang bshad pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Now, the refutation in common with other tƒ´rthikas is explained: ‚ÄúMoreover, . . .‚Äù

original: yul dang dus dang 'du byed pa'i khyad par gyis nus pa tha dad ces bya ba ngo bo nyid gzhan du gyur ba snang ngo //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang 'du byed pa'i khyad par gyis nus pa tha dad ces bya ba ngo bo nyid gzhan du gyur ba snang ngo //
translated: Due to the differences of object, time, and composition, the different potencies appear as different natures.

original: yul gang la snang zhe na rdzas la smos so //
analyzed: yul gang la snang zhe na rdzas la smos so //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIn what object does it appear?‚Äù it is said, ‚ÄúIn substance.‚Äù

original: de ltar snang ba'i yul ni de yin no //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba'i yul ni de yin no //
translated: That is the object in which it appears.

original: gal te de ltar yin mo de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin mo de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIf it is so, what is the consequence?‚Äù

original: de la zhes smos te /
analyzed: de la zhes smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIn that case . . .‚Äù

original: de ltar yin dang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang ngo //
translated: That is so.

original: gcig mthong bas gcig ces bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste mang po rnams mthong bas kyang mthong ba gzhan de yod par nges pa rigs ma yin /
analyzed: gcig mthong bas gcig ces bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste mang po rnams mthong bas kyang mthong ba gzhan de yod par nges pa rigs ma yin /
translated: Seeing one is not a reason to ascertain that another exists.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: khyad par can gyis rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rdzas kyi khyad par lan cig gam lan cig ma yin par dmigs te de'i phyir rang bzhin du dmigs pa na gzhan du gyur pa'i rang bzhin can du ma dmigs pa'i phyir rang bzhin de med na rdzas de ma
analyzed: khyad par can gyis rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rdzas kyi khyad par lan cig gam lan cig ma yin par dmigs te de'i phyir rang bzhin du dmigs pa na gzhan du gyur pa'i rang bzhin can du ma dmigs pa'i phyir rang bzhin de med na rdzas de ma
translated: In particular, the substance that is the nature is observed to have the distinction of being the nature, either once or not once. Therefore, when the nature is observed, the nature that is different from that is not observed.

original: dmigs pa las shing med na sha pa med pa bzhin du de med na ldog pas na /
analyzed: dmigs pa las shing med na sha pa med pa bzhin du de med na ldog pas na /
translated: If that nature does not exist, the substance does not exist, because it is the opposite of what is observed, like a tree if it does not exist, a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ does not exist.

original: khyed kyi 'dod pas rdzas de mthong bas de'i rang bzhin du nges par thal bar 'gyur na de ltar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: khyed kyi 'dod pas rdzas de mthong bas de'i rang bzhin du nges par thal bar 'gyur na de ltar mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it follows that by seeing that substance, its nature is ascertained. But that is not tenable.

original: 'ga' zhig rnam pa de ltar bu rang bzhin dang ldan pa ma yin yang rgyu'i khyad par las @91a * //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rnam pa de ltar bu rang bzhin dang ldan pa ma yin yang rgyu'i khyad par las @91a * //
translated: Some say: Although it does not have that nature, by the power of causes,

original: de lta bu nyid du gyur pa gzhan la rang bzhin khyad par srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du gyur pa gzhan la rang bzhin khyad par srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it becomes like that. For others, it is possible that the nature is different.

original: 'grel pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The commentary states, ‚ÄúIf it is said . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: ci zhig ltar te rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig las so //
analyzed: ci zhig ltar te rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig las so //
translated: What is it like? It is a cause.

original: rgyu mtshan de yang yod pa'i yin gyi thams cad la yod par ni ma nges so //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan de yang yod pa'i yin gyi thams cad la yod par ni ma nges so //
translated: The reason is that it exists, but it is not ascertained to exist in all cases.

original: des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsgrub par bya ba med pa la ma mthong ba gang yin pa de tsam gyis 'brel pa med pa yang der 'khrul pa med do zhes bya ba gang med na 'di ma mthong ba de med na med pa'o //
analyzed: des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsgrub par bya ba med pa la ma mthong ba gang yin pa de tsam gyis 'brel pa med pa yang der 'khrul pa med do zhes bya ba gang med na 'di ma mthong ba de med na med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, in the case of establishing the discordant side, there is no error in taking mere non-observation of the absence of the probandum as the reason for the absence of the relation.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba smos pa ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa la ma mthong bar brjod par 'gyur ba des na 'khrul pa med pa ni bsgrub par bya ba med na med pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba smos pa ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa la ma mthong bar brjod par 'gyur ba des na 'khrul pa med pa ni bsgrub par bya ba med na med pa yin no //
translated: The mention of non-observation of the discordant side implies the non-observation of the absence of the probandum. Therefore, the absence of error is the absence of the probandum.

original: des na de ltar gal te zhes bya bas gzhan gyis 'dod pa yin no zhes bya bar bstan nas dgag pa'i phyir yul 'ga' zhig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: des na de ltar gal te zhes bya bas gzhan gyis 'dod pa yin no zhes bya bar bstan nas dgag pa'i phyir yul 'ga' zhig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus, if one says in this way, it shows that it is the assertion of others. In order to refute that, it says in some places, and so on.

original: gal te gang med na ma mthong ba de yod na de yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i bdag nyid can gyi mi 'khrul ba ma mthong ba tsam la brten pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gang med na ma mthong ba de yod na de yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i bdag nyid can gyi mi 'khrul ba ma mthong ba tsam la brten pa yin na /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúIf that which does not exist when something does not exist exists, then it exists,‚Äù and if one sees that mere non-observation is the basis for such a nonerroneous awareness that has the nature of positive and negative concomitance,

original: de'i phyir gang du don gang dag rnam pa ji ltar mthong ba de dag la rnam pa de lta bu med par mthong ba yod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i rang bzhin can mtha' dag rnam pa de lta bu nyid du gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang du don gang dag rnam pa ji ltar mthong ba de dag la rnam pa de lta bu med par mthong ba yod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i rang bzhin can mtha' dag rnam pa de lta bu nyid du gyur na /
translated: then one would see that the nature of all things is just as they are observed, because if that which is observed does not exist in a certain way, then it would not exist.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te gzhan na gzhan du yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te gzhan na gzhan du yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because things appear otherwise.

original: de de ltar gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi 'khrul pa ma mthong bas 'grub par gzhan gyi brjod pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de de ltar gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi 'khrul pa ma mthong bas 'grub par gzhan gyi brjod pa bstan nas /
translated: ‚Äú If it were like that‚Äù and so on presents the opponent‚Äôs view that nonobservation establishes nonerroneous awareness.

original: yul 'ga' zhig na zhes bya bas de yod kyang de lta bu nyid ma yin par bshad pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya bas dgag pa sngon du 'gro ba'i sgo nas brjod kyang dngos su na 'dis phyogs bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: yul 'ga' zhig na zhes bya bas de yod kyang de lta bu nyid ma yin par bshad pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya bas dgag pa sngon du 'gro ba'i sgo nas brjod kyang dngos su na 'dis phyogs bkag pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not reasonable‚Äù is stated from the perspective of a prior negation, but in fact this refutes the position.

original: gang zhig gang du ji ltar snang ba lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig gang du ji ltar snang ba lta bu zhe na /
translated: What appears where and how?

original: dper na zhes smos so //
analyzed: dper na zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúFor example‚Äù is stated.

original: 'bras bu smin nas zad par 'gyur ba'i phyir sman kha cig zhing 'ga' zhig las ro dang nus pa dang smin par byed pa khyad par can du 'gyur la de dag nyid zhing gzhan las ni rnam pa de lta bu ma yin pa lta bu ste dbyar la
analyzed: 'bras bu smin nas zad par 'gyur ba'i phyir sman kha cig zhing 'ga' zhig las ro dang nus pa dang smin par byed pa khyad par can du 'gyur la de dag nyid zhing gzhan las ni rnam pa de lta bu ma yin pa lta bu ste dbyar la
translated: Some medicines have a special taste, potency, and ripening effect in some fields, because the fruit ripens and is exhausted. Those same medicines are not like that in other fields.

original: sogs pa'i dus dang lus la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis legs par bya ba'i khyad par las kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i dus dang lus la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis legs par bya ba'i khyad par las kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, in the summer and so on, and due to the characteristics of the body and so on, there are special good actions.

original: yul gang du zhing de las dus der ro la sogs pa de dag dmigs pa'i yul der skyes @91b pa de rnams kyis de ltar mthong zhes te /
analyzed: yul gang du zhing de las dus der ro la sogs pa de dag dmigs pa'i yul der skyes @91b pa de rnams kyis de ltar mthong zhes te /
translated: In whatever place that field is, at that time, those born in that place where the corpse and so on are observed see it that way.

original: thams cad de nyid kyi sman de yin pa nyid kyis ro dang nus pa dang smin par byed pa khyad par can de lta bu yin par ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad de nyid kyi sman de yin pa nyid kyis ro dang nus pa dang smin par byed pa khyad par can de lta bu yin par ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not established that the medicine is that way, that is, that it has a special taste, potency, and post digestive taste.

original: de la ni rnam pa de lta bu'i sman ro la sogs pa de med pa la mi dmigs pa yod pa yin te yul de pa rnams kyis de lta bu ma yin pa'i ro la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sman de ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni rnam pa de lta bu'i sman ro la sogs pa de med pa la mi dmigs pa yod pa yin te yul de pa rnams kyis de lta bu ma yin pa'i ro la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sman de ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, the non observation of that kind of medicine with a special taste and so on is possible, because those born in that place do not see that medicine possessing a special taste and so on.

original: thams cad du de lta bu nyid kyang ma yin te gzhan ni gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du de lta bu nyid kyang ma yin te gzhan ni gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not that way everywhere, because one place is different from another.

original: gang las 'khrul par 'gyur ba de de ltar dmigs kyang gzhan du de lta ma yin par 'gyur ba'i rgyu ci yin /
analyzed: gang las 'khrul par 'gyur ba de de ltar dmigs kyang gzhan du de lta ma yin par 'gyur ba'i rgyu ci yin /
translated: What is the cause for the error that it is that way when it is observed in one place, but not that way when it is observed in another?

original: gal te de ltar snang ba de yang de lta ma yin par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te de ltar snang ba de yang de lta ma yin par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If that appearance were not so,

original: gang gis sha pa la sogs pa dag kyang de lta ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir shing la sogs pa la 'khrul par 'gyur ba sha pa la sogs pa dag kyang ji ste de lta ma yin par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis sha pa la sogs pa dag kyang de lta ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir shing la sogs pa la 'khrul par 'gyur ba sha pa la sogs pa dag kyang ji ste de lta ma yin par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: then since it would not be so for the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ and so on, why would the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ and so on, which cause error regarding trees and so on, not also not be so?

original: dogs pa 'di bsu na /
analyzed: dogs pa 'di bsu na /
translated: In response to this doubt,

original: yon tan gyi khyad par rnams ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par rnams ni zhes smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe specific qualities . . .‚Äù

original: yon tan de spangs nas yon tan gzhan du 'gyur ba ni rgyu'i khyad par la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan de spangs nas yon tan gzhan du 'gyur ba ni rgyu'i khyad par la ltos pa yin no //
translated: Abandoning those qualities, they become other qualities, which depend on the specific causes.

original: de'i phyir rgyu khyad par yod na de lta ma yin par 'gyur bas de lta ma yin par ma dmigs pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin can ni de lta bu nyid du nges pa 'khrul par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu khyad par yod na de lta ma yin par 'gyur bas de lta ma yin par ma dmigs pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin can ni de lta bu nyid du nges pa 'khrul par byed do //
translated: Therefore, if there is a specific cause, it is not so. Thus, because of not observing that, the specific nature of that is ascertained as just that.

original: khyad par gzhan dang ldan pa las rgyu de nyid kyis dngos po de nyid sngar mthong ba'i khyad par dang bral bar khyad par gzhan skyed pa gang yin pa la 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: khyad par gzhan dang ldan pa las rgyu de nyid kyis dngos po de nyid sngar mthong ba'i khyad par dang bral bar khyad par gzhan skyed pa gang yin pa la 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: In particular, what contradiction is there in the very thing that is endowed with other attributes being produced with other attributes, devoid of the previously seen attributes, by that very cause?

original: de lta na 'o na sha pa la sogs pa la yang yon tan gyi khyad par rgyu'i khyad par la rag las pa'i phyir shing ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na sha pa la sogs pa la yang yon tan gyi khyad par rgyu'i khyad par la rag las pa'i phyir shing ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then even a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree would not be a tree, because the particular qualities of a tree depend on the particular causes.

original: de dag la yang khyad par gyi rgyu mi srid pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la yang khyad par gyi rgyu mi srid pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not impossible that there are causes for the particular qualities of those.

original: gal te gzhan la de ltar dmigs pa dang / ma dmigs pa ni rang nyid kyis 'khrul par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te gzhan la de ltar dmigs pa dang / ma dmigs pa ni rang nyid kyis 'khrul par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe nonobservation of that in other things and the observation of that in other things are due to error on your part,‚Äù

original: 'di la ni khyad par gyi rgyu yod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di la ni khyad par gyi rgyu yod pa yin la /
translated: then in this case there is a cause for the particular qualities,

original: gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: but in other cases there is not.

original: smras pa chos gang zhig gang gis rang gi ngo bo yin pa de la ni yon tan gzhan gyi rgyu las kyang ngo bo de spangs nas yon tan gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /üîΩ'on kyang rgyu mtshan de dang 'brel pa las de'i bdag nyid kyis chos dang mi 'gal bar dngos po'i chos gzhan dang @92a * //
analyzed: smras pa chos gang zhig gang gis rang gi ngo bo yin pa de la ni yon tan gzhan gyi rgyu las kyang ngo bo de spangs nas yon tan gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin gyi / 'on kyang rgyu mtshan de dang 'brel pa las de'i bdag nyid kyis chos dang mi 'gal bar dngos po'i chos gzhan dang @92a * //
translated: Objection: That which is the intrinsic reality of a certain phenomenon is not transformed into another quality by the cause of another quality.

original: gzhan 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan 'byung ba yin no //
translated: However, due to the connection with that reason, another quality of that thing arises without contradicting its intrinsic reality.

original: des na rgyu'i khyad par dang ldan pa las sha pa sha pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes ni nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na rgyu'i khyad par dang ldan pa las sha pa sha pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes ni nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to say that due to the special cause, the sprout becomes non-sprout.

original: sa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa las ni ring po dang thung du'i tshad la sogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa las ni ring po dang thung du'i tshad la sogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: However, due to the special qualities of earth and so on, it becomes the measure of long and short.

original: gang gi phyir shing nyid ni sha pa'i rjes su zhugs pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir bdag nyid bzhin du rgyu stong gis kyang 'di spong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir shing nyid ni sha pa'i rjes su zhugs pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir bdag nyid bzhin du rgyu stong gis kyang 'di spong ba ma yin no //
translated: Since wood is the basis of sprout, like itself, it is not abandoned by the empty cause.

original: des na chos gang zhig don gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa'i chos de spangs nas rgyu gzhan las chos gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur ba des na yon tan gyi khyad par rgyu'i khyad par la ltos par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na chos gang zhig don gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa'i chos de spangs nas rgyu gzhan las chos gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur ba des na yon tan gyi khyad par rgyu'i khyad par la ltos par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, having abandoned any phenomenon that is not the nature of the object, another phenomenon arises from another cause. Thus, the difference in qualities is explained as depending on the difference in causes.

original: de'i phyir sku ru ra nyid ro la sogs pa dang gcig tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sku ru ra nyid ro la sogs pa dang gcig tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the body itself does not become one with taste, etc.

original: de bas na rgyu gzhan gyi byed pa ni de la brten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu gzhan gyi byed pa ni de la brten par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the function of another cause is based on that.

original: gal te chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid tha mi dad pa'i don la 'ga' zhig ni chos 'ga' zhig dang gcig tu gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid tha mi dad pa'i don la 'ga' zhig ni chos 'ga' zhig dang gcig tu gyur pa yin la /
translated: If the identity of all phenomena is not different in meaning, then some would become one with some phenomena,

original: gzhan ni de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba gang las she na /
analyzed: gzhan ni de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba gang las she na /
translated: but others would not. Why is that?

original: de'i bdag nyid la ji ltar rnam par dbyer med pa de ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid la ji ltar rnam par dbyer med pa de ni bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been explained how that identity is undifferentiated.

original: de bas na chos de dang ldan pa'i rang gi rgyu'i nang du gtogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pas 'bras bu de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i chos khyad par du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bas na chos de dang ldan pa'i rang gi rgyu'i nang du gtogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pas 'bras bu de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i chos khyad par du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, since the effect is endowed with a special quality that is included in its cause, it is a phenomenon that is not the self of that effect.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'thad par 'grub pa yin gyi dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'thad par 'grub pa yin gyi dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is established by logical reasoning, but it is not established in dependence on observation or nonobservation.üîΩTherefore, since all things are like that, they are like that by their very essence.

original: de'i phyir de ltar thams cad de nyid kyis de lta bur zhes bya ba 'dis dngos po gang zhig rgyu ji lta bus bskyed pa de de las byung ba yin yang rgyu khyad par dang ldan pa las khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phyir rigs mthun pa'i
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar thams cad de nyid kyis de lta bur zhes bya ba 'dis dngos po gang zhig rgyu ji lta bus bskyed pa de de las byung ba yin yang rgyu khyad par dang ldan pa las khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phyir rigs mthun pa'i
translated: This statement shows that whatever thing is generated by whatever cause, even though it arises from that, it becomes endowed with a special quality from a cause that is endowed with a special quality. Therefore, it is similar to its cause in type.

original: rgyus bskyed pa nyid kyis ni thams cad du khyad par med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pa 'di rtsa bar gyur pas khyad par gzhan dang ldan pa'i de'i rang bzhin can ma mthong yang de'i rang bzhin las khyad par dang ldan par rtogs par miüîΩnus so zhes bsgrubs nas sman de'i rgyu ma yin pa las de'i rang bzhin gyi sman ma mthong ba'i phyir sman de nyid ni rgyu de med na ldog pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin las de'i rgyu can du rtogs pas thams cad de nyid kyis de ltar mi 'gyur
analyzed: rgyus bskyed pa nyid kyis ni thams cad du khyad par med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pa 'di rtsa bar gyur pas khyad par gzhan dang ldan pa'i de'i rang bzhin can ma mthong yang de'i rang bzhin las khyad par dang ldan par rtogs par mi nus so zhes bsgrubs nas sman de'i rgyu ma yin pa las de'i rang bzhin gyi sman ma mthong ba'i phyir sman de nyid ni rgyu de med na ldog pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin las de'i rgyu can du rtogs pas thams cad de nyid kyis de ltar mi 'gyur
translated: The reason for this is that it is not tenable to say that the nature of the effect is not seen because it is not different from the cause.üîΩThe reason for this is that it is not tenable to say that the nature of the effect is not seen because it is not different from the cause.üîΩThe reason for this is that it is not tenable to say that the nature of the effect is not seen because it is not different from the cause.üîΩThe reason for this is that it is not tenable to say that the nature of the effect is not seen because it is not different from the cause.üîΩThe reason for this is that it is not tenable to say that the nature of the effect is not seen because it is not different from the cause.üîΩThe reason for this is that it is not tenable to say that the nature of the effect is not seen because it is not different from the cause.üîΩThe reason for this is that it is not tenable to say that the nature of the effect is not seen because it is not different from the cause.üîΩThe reason for this is that it is not tenable to say that the nature of the effect is not seen because it is not different from the cause.üîΩThe reason for this is that it is not tenable to say that the nature of the effect is not seen because it is not different from the cause.üîΩThe reason for this is that it is not tenable to say that the nature of the effect is not seen because it is not different from the cause.üîΩThe reason for this is that it is not tenable to say that the nature of the effect is not seen because it is not different from the cause.üîΩThe reason for this is that it is not tenable to say that the nature of the effect is not seen because it is not different from the cause.

original: ba ma yin pa'i phyir ci ste mi dgag gces dogs pa la rigs pas grub pa'i @92b ldog pa nyid rgyu khyad par med na ni zhes bya bas 'chad do //üîΩrgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ba ma yin pa'i phyir ci ste mi dgag gces dogs pa la rigs pas grub pa'i @92b ldog pa nyid rgyu khyad par med na ni zhes bya bas 'chad do //üîΩrgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The reason for this is that it is not tenable to say that the nature of the effect is not seen because it is not different from the cause.üîΩThe reason for this is that it is not tenable to say that the nature of the effect is not seen because it is not different from the cause.üîΩThe reason for this is that it is not tenable to say that the nature of the effect is not seen because it is not different from the cause.

original: rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu zhing la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid khyad par med pa can 'bras bu khyad par med pa nyid kyi skyed par byed pa tsam du gyur pa dang rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par gyi rgyu ste rgyu'i khyad par las 'bas bu'i khyad par mngonüîΩpar grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu zhing la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid khyad par med pa can 'bras bu khyad par med pa nyid kyi skyed par byed pa tsam du gyur pa dang rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par gyi rgyu ste rgyu'i khyad par las 'bas bu'i khyad par mngon par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of the special entity of the effect is the cause of the special entity of the effect, which is distinguished by special causes.

original: de la khyad par gyi rgyu bkag na rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu lus pa yin no //
analyzed: de la khyad par gyi rgyu bkag na rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu lus pa yin no //
translated: If the special cause is refuted, the cause of the mere entity remains.

original: des na rgyu khyad par med pa rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu de de la rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rgyu khyad par med pa rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu de de la rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cause of the mere entity, which is not distinguished by special causes, is inferred from that.

original: de'i don ni khyad par gyi rgyu ni rjes su dpag par bya ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu dpog go zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: de'i don ni khyad par gyi rgyu ni rjes su dpag par bya ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu dpog go zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning of that is: The special cause is not to be inferred, but rather the cause of the mere entity is inferred.

original: ma mthong ba tsam las ni khyad par gyi rgyu yang rjes su dpog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam las ni khyad par gyi rgyu yang rjes su dpog par 'gyur te /
translated: From mere non-perception, the special cause is also inferred.

original: zhing la sogs pa'i khyad par can med na 'bras bu de ma dmigs pa lan 'ga' zhugs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhing la sogs pa'i khyad par can med na 'bras bu de ma dmigs pa lan 'ga' zhugs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If there were no special field, etc., then the effect would not be observed even once.

original: sman de mthong bas de'i 'bras bu rjes su dpog go //
analyzed: sman de mthong bas de'i 'bras bu rjes su dpog go //
translated: The effect is inferred from the seeing of the medicine.

original: de lta yin dang zhing la sogs pa la gnas pa mthong ba'i khyad par rjes su dpog pa na thams cad khyad par med par nges pa yin pa'i phyir khyad par gyi rgyu rjes su dpag pa ni skabs su gyur pa pha rol po'i phyogs sgrub par 'gyur
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhing la sogs pa la gnas pa mthong ba'i khyad par rjes su dpog pa na thams cad khyad par med par nges pa yin pa'i phyir khyad par gyi rgyu rjes su dpag pa ni skabs su gyur pa pha rol po'i phyogs sgrub par 'gyur
translated: If that were so, then when the special effect of seeing the field, etc. is inferred, it would be ascertained without any distinction, and the inference of the cause of the distinction would be established as the opponent's position.üîΩWhen this statement If there is no distinction in the cause is used, there is also this doubt here: If there is no distinction in the cause, then the effect would be the same everywhere.

original: ro // de la rgyu khyad par med na ni zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di 'jug pa na 'dir dogs pa'i khyad par 'di yang yod de yul de pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas khyad par med pa bkag pa na pha rol po dag 'brel pa khas blangs
analyzed: ro // de la rgyu khyad par med na ni zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di 'jug pa na 'dir dogs pa'i khyad par 'di yang yod de yul de pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas khyad par med pa bkag pa na pha rol po dag 'brel pa khas blangs
translated: When the absence of distinction is refuted by the people of that country, etc., the opponent accepts the connection,

original: kyang khyad par med na thal bar ston pas smras pa /
analyzed: kyang khyad par med na thal bar ston pas smras pa /
translated: but when there is no distinction, the consequence is shown.

original: 'bras bu de'i rgyu la nges pa'i phyir khyad par can gyi zhing la sogs pa'i 'bras bur dmigs pa'i sman rnams ni ji ltar mthong ba'i zhing la sogs pa'i rgyu can nyid du re zhig thams cad du khyad par med par rjes su dpag par bya ba yin
analyzed: 'bras bu de'i rgyu la nges pa'i phyir khyad par can gyi zhing la sogs pa'i 'bras bur dmigs pa'i sman rnams ni ji ltar mthong ba'i zhing la sogs pa'i rgyu can nyid du re zhig thams cad du khyad par med par rjes su dpag par bya ba yin
translated: Because the effect is ascertained in relation to its cause, the medicines that are observed as the effects of the special field and so on are to be inferred as being the effects of the special field and so on, without distinction.

original: no // des na de'i rgyu can du khyad par med pas na bdag nyid thams cad kyi de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: no // des na de'i rgyu can du khyad par med pas na bdag nyid thams cad kyi de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, because they are not distinguished in terms of their cause, they all become the nature of that.

original: rgyu khyad par med na 'bras bu khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu khyad par med na 'bras bu khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the cause is not distinguished, the effect is not distinguished.

original: des na de la gcig ma mthong bas gzhan la de yod par nges pa med do zhes ci ste brjod ce na /
analyzed: des na de la gcig ma mthong bas gzhan la de yod par nges pa med do zhes ci ste brjod ce na /
translated: Therefore, how can it be said that ‚Äúsince one is not seen, the existence of the other is not ascertained‚Äù?

original: de bsal ba'i phyir rgyu khyad par med na ni zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir rgyu khyad par med na ni zhes brjod do //
translated: To dispel that, it is said ‚Äúif the cause is not distinguished.‚Äù

original: rgyu khyad par med pa ni khyad par med pa'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu khyad par med pa ni khyad par med pa'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: The cause is not distinguished means the cause is not distinguished.

original: rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu ni spyi tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu ni spyi tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause of its own nature is merely general.

original: des na khyad par med pa'i rgyu nyid spyi tsam @93a * //
analyzed: des na khyad par med pa'i rgyu nyid spyi tsam @93a * //
translated: Therefore, the cause is not distinguished in the least.üîΩ

original: rjes su dpag par nus kyi chos gzhan ni ma yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par nus kyi chos gzhan ni ma yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, we say that the cause of the non-distinction can be inferred, but not any other fact.

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa dgag pa'i phyir skabs su dpe bzhag ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa dgag pa'i phyir skabs su dpe bzhag ste /
translated: In order to refute the opinions of others, an example is given in this context.

original: dpe gzhan ston pa ni byed pa po ma mthong ba can gyi tshig kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpe gzhan ston pa ni byed pa po ma mthong ba can gyi tshig kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example of another is shown by the words, ‚ÄúEven though the agent is not seen.‚Äù

original: gzhon nu 'byung ba dang rig byed la sogs pa bdag cag gis byed pa po ma mthong ba'i tshig kyang skyes bu'i 'du byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhon nu 'byung ba dang rig byed la sogs pa bdag cag gis byed pa po ma mthong ba'i tshig kyang skyes bu'i 'du byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The words, ‚ÄúEven though the agent is not seen,‚Äù such as the young sprouts, the Vedas, etc., are preceded by the activity of a person.

original: de ltar 'di ni rgyu khyad par med pa'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni rgyu khyad par med pa'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this is an inference of a cause that is not distinguished.

original: la lar gzhan las 'grub par khyad par sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'di dag thams cad kyi sgrub par byed pa ma yin par rnam par bzhag pa'am /
analyzed: la lar gzhan las 'grub par khyad par sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'di dag thams cad kyi sgrub par byed pa ma yin par rnam par bzhag pa'am /
translated: In some cases, it is established from another. In order to establish a distinction, it is not established by all of these.

original: de rtag par rang nyid kyis grub pa nyid kyi khyad par gyi rgyur 'gyur ba gang yin pa skyes bu'i ngag gi khyad par gyi rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rtag par rang nyid kyis grub pa nyid kyi khyad par gyi rgyur 'gyur ba gang yin pa skyes bu'i ngag gi khyad par gyi rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the particularities of a person‚Äôs speech are the cause of its always being established as itself.

original: rang gi grub pa la khyad par bsgrub pa mi srid kyang khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi grub pa la khyad par bsgrub pa mi srid kyang khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: Although it is impossible to establish a particularity of something that is already established, we have stated it for the sake of argument.

original: gang gi tshe skyes bu ngag gi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu yin pa de'i tshe ni ngag las skyes bu rjes su dpog par rigs te du ba las me rjes su dpog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe skyes bu ngag gi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu yin pa de'i tshe ni ngag las skyes bu rjes su dpog par rigs te du ba las me rjes su dpog pa bzhin no //
translated: When the nature of a person is the cause of speech, then it is reasonable to infer a person from speech, just as one infers fire from smoke.

original: des na byed pa ma mthong ba yin yang skyes bu'i 'du byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
analyzed: des na byed pa ma mthong ba yin yang skyes bu'i 'du byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
translated: Therefore, although the agent is not seen, it is preceded by the activity of a person.

original: tshig de dang de dag skyes bus bsnge  bas pa'am brjod pa ni 'du byed pa yin la de yang de'i sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: tshig de dang de dag skyes bus bsnge  bas pa'am brjod pa ni 'du byed pa yin la de yang de'i sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: The activity of a person is the utterance or expression of this or that word, and that is preceded by that.

original: yang ji ltar na skyes bu ngag gi rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu yin gyi khyad par gyi ni ma yin no zhe na tshig la zhes smos so //
analyzed: yang ji ltar na skyes bu ngag gi rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu yin gyi khyad par gyi ni ma yin no zhe na tshig la zhes smos so //
translated: Moreover, how is it that a person is the cause of the nature of speech, but not of its particularities? He says, ‚Äúin the case of speech.‚Äù

original: gang zhig skyes bu dag gis byed pa'i ngag gi khyad par de ni yod pa ma yin te de'i bdag nyid thams cad skyes bu las mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig skyes bu dag gis byed pa'i ngag gi khyad par de ni yod pa ma yin te de'i bdag nyid thams cad skyes bu las mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That particularity of speech which is produced by persons does not exist, because all of its nature is produced from the person.

original: de bshad pa ni rnam pa yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pa de dag ni skyes bu dag gis byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni rnam pa yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pa de dag ni skyes bu dag gis byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is explained: ‚Äúbecause they are seen to be produced by persons.‚Äù

original: rtag pa yang de nyid la skyes bu nye bar sbyor pa'i phyir thams cad skyes bus byas par rtogs pa nyams par 'gyur ba rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las nye bar sbyor ba khyad par la brten par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa yang de nyid la skyes bu nye bar sbyor pa'i phyir thams cad skyes bus byas par rtogs pa nyams par 'gyur ba rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las nye bar sbyor ba khyad par la brten par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And because permanence is also seen in that, the understanding that everything is produced by a person is not undermined by the application of the forward and reverse pervasions. The understanding that the application of the pervasion is based on a particularity is not undermined.

original: des gzhung 'di 'di ltar bshad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des gzhung 'di 'di ltar bshad par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this text should be explained in this way.

original: gal te sgra rnams la ni khyad par med pa nyid la /
analyzed: gal te sgra rnams la ni khyad par med pa nyid la /
translated: If you say that the mere fact that the sounds are not differentüîΩand that the myrobalan fruit, etc., are present is stated, then how is that

original: skyu ru ra la sogs pa ni yod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig brjod pa yin na de 'di ltar ci ltar nges @93b par bya /
analyzed: skyu ru ra la sogs pa ni yod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig brjod pa yin na de 'di ltar ci ltar nges @93b par bya /
translated: determined in this way?üîΩIf you say that it is from the observation and nonobservation of that, no,

original: de ltar dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa dag las so zhe na ma yin te ma dmigs pa tsam gyis med pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa dag las so zhe na ma yin te ma dmigs pa tsam gyis med pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because nonobservation alone does not ascertain nonexistence.üîΩSince it is not the cause of the difference of any manifest thing, it is not

original: gsal ba 'ga' zhig la khyad par gyi rgyu ma yin pas gsal ba gzhan la yang med par mi nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba 'ga' zhig la khyad par gyi rgyu ma yin pas gsal ba gzhan la yang med par mi nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ascertained that it does not exist in another manifest thing.üîΩEven if the cause is not different, the other cause is excluded, but not

original: rgyu khyad par med pa nyid las kyang rgyu gzhan rnam par gcod par 'gyur gyi rtag pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu khyad par med pa nyid las kyang rgyu gzhan rnam par gcod par 'gyur gyi rtag pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: permanence.

original: des na ne tso dang ri skegs la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ne tso dang ri skegs la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would not be the basis of the parrot and the myna bird.üîΩThat which is not permanent because of the absence of that is not made

original: gang zhig de med pas rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba khyad par gyi rgyus rtag par byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig de med pas rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba khyad par gyi rgyus rtag par byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: permanent by a cause of difference.

original: khyad par dgag pa'i phyir rgyu'i khyad par bkag pa ni khyad par med na med pa yin pas skyes bus ma byas pa dgag pa'i don du yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par dgag pa'i phyir rgyu'i khyad par bkag pa ni khyad par med na med pa yin pas skyes bus ma byas pa dgag pa'i don du yin no zhe na /
translated: In particular, the refutation of the distinction of the cause is for the purpose of refuting the non-human cause, since if there is no distinction, there is no cause.

original: de ltar mtshon pas mtshon pa la yang skabs dang 'brel bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar mtshon pas mtshon pa la yang skabs dang 'brel bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the illustration is not related to the illustrated.

original: de'i phyir tshogs ji srid kyis bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu de de las bskyed par bya ba las mi 'da' yang thams cad khyab par spang bar ni mi nus so zhes dper na sman kha cig ces bya bar brjod la /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs ji srid kyis bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu de de las bskyed par bya ba las mi 'da' yang thams cad khyab par spang bar ni mi nus so zhes dper na sman kha cig ces bya bar brjod la /
translated: Therefore, although the effect generated by the collection does not go beyond what is to be generated from that, it is not possible to eliminate all pervasions. Thus, it is said that some medicines are like that.

original: de lta yin yang skye ba'i rgyu mtshan spangs pa'am thams cad du khyad par gyi rgyu khyad par med pas khyad par med pa nyid ma yin no zhes 'di nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin yang skye ba'i rgyu mtshan spangs pa'am thams cad du khyad par gyi rgyu khyad par med pas khyad par med pa nyid ma yin no zhes 'di nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: Even though that is so, the reason for generation is eliminated, or the cause of distinction is not distinguished everywhere, so it is not non-distinction. This is what is being presented.

original: gzhan du na rgyud mang dang gling bu la sogs pa sgra'i khyad par gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir de med par bshad pa 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na rgyud mang dang gling bu la sogs pa sgra'i khyad par gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir de med par bshad pa 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would contradict the explanation that it does not exist because of being the cause of the particular sound of a lute, flute, and so on.

original: de ni yod kyang rgyu'i byed pa tsam las skyes pa nyid mi ldog pa'i phyir rig byed la sogs pa ni skyes bus byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni yod kyang rgyu'i byed pa tsam las skyes pa nyid mi ldog pa'i phyir rig byed la sogs pa ni skyes bus byas pa nyid do //
translated: Even though it exists, it is not refuted that it is produced merely from the activity of the cause, and therefore the Vedas and so on are produced by a person.

original: gzhan gyi rmongs pa spang ba'i phyir rab tu grags pa'i sman la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i dpe gzhan ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rmongs pa spang ba'i phyir rab tu grags pa'i sman la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i dpe gzhan ston pa ni /
translated: In order to eliminate the confusion of others, he presents another example that is similar to the well-known medicine and so on.

original: de lta bur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn that way.‚Äù

original: ji ltar ngag rnams las rgyu'i khyad par bkag nas rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu rjes su dpog pa gzhan gyis 'dod pa'i rtag pa 'gog pa'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar ngag rnams las rgyu'i khyad par bkag nas rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu rjes su dpog pa gzhan gyis 'dod pa'i rtag pa 'gog pa'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the particular cause is refuted from among the statements and the cause of its nature is inferred, it is the cause that refutes the permanence asserted by others.

original: nged kyis 'dod pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa dgag pa'i phyir pha rol pos rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi rgyu rjes su dpog pas so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa'i chos mtshungs par bsgrub mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nged kyis 'dod pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa dgag pa'i phyir pha rol pos rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi rgyu rjes su dpog pas so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa'i chos mtshungs par bsgrub mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that we cannot prove that the qualities of ordinary beings and ƒÅryas are the same because the opponent infers the mere intrinsic nature of the cause in order to refute omniscience and so on.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu dag la rgyu'i khyad par yod kyi ngag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu dag la rgyu'i khyad par yod kyi ngag la ni ma yin no //
translated: Because there is a difference in the causes of persons, but not of speech.

original: gal te ngag las yang ne tso dang sha ri ka la sogs @94a * //
analyzed: gal te ngag las yang ne tso dang sha ri ka la sogs @94a * //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt there a difference in the causes of speech, such as parrots and myna birds?‚Äù

original: pa khyad par gyi rgyu yod kyi brjod pa ma yin nam zhe na bden mod kyi khyad par mthong ba las rjes su dpag kyang gzhan 'dod pa'i brtag pa nyid mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: pa khyad par gyi rgyu yod kyi brjod pa ma yin nam zhe na bden mod kyi khyad par mthong ba las rjes su dpag kyang gzhan 'dod pa'i brtag pa nyid mi 'grub bo //
translated: It is true, but even though we infer that there is a difference in what is seen, we do not establish that it is the imagination of what others want.

original: 'dir ni khyad par gyi rgyu yod na nged kyi 'dod pa grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir ni khyad par gyi rgyu yod na nged kyi 'dod pa grub pa nyid do //
translated: Here, if there is a difference in the cause, our assertion is established.

original: des na de ltar rgyu khyad par med par brjod do ;
analyzed: des na de ltar rgyu khyad par med par brjod do ;
translated: Therefore, we say that there is no difference in the cause.

original: / skyes bu smos pas ni kha cig lha rnams kho na shes pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang ldan pa yin no zhes 'dod pa dang 'gal bar 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na spyod pa rnams la cung zad 'dod chags dang bral

translated: The mention of ‚Äúperson‚Äù is to counter the assertion that some think that only the gods are free from attachment, becauseüîΩeven though there is some freedom from attachment in the desire, form, and formless realms, it is not established that they are free from attachment in all ways, since they are not free from attachment to their own realms.üîΩIt is also reasonable that the gods have such power.

analyzed: ba yod kyang gzhan du der spyod pa nyid mi 'grub pas gtan 'dod chags dang bral ba med pa'i phyir dang lha rnams kyis de lta bu'i nus pa dang ldan pa yang rigs pa yin pas bya rgod bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang
translated: Since they are not omniscient, like the vulture, they are not free from attachment in all ways.

original: bzhin gyis grub pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa bkag pa na skyes bu'i rtsol bas thob par bya ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhin gyis grub pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa bkag pa na skyes bu'i rtsol bas thob par bya ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
