original: de lta na yang skyes bu zhes bya ba sems kyi khyad par brtag pa ma yin pa des na 'di skye ba nyid na rgyu'i khyad par la brten nas khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang skyes bu zhes bya ba sems kyi khyad par brtag pa ma yin pa des na 'di skye ba nyid na rgyu'i khyad par la brten nas khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: Nevertheless, the so-called person is not an investigation of the mind‚Äôs special qualities. Therefore, when it is born, it becomes special in dependence on the special cause.

original: da ni khyad par de nyid dang khyad par gyi rgyu yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni khyad par de nyid dang khyad par gyi rgyu yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach just that special quality and the cause of the special quality, he says:

original: legs par bya ba'i bye brag las //üîΩzhes smos so //
analyzed: legs par bya ba'i bye brag las // zhes smos so //
translated: From the particular of good action,

original: 'dis ni khyad par gyi rgyu bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni khyad par gyi rgyu bshad do //
translated: This explains the cause of the special quality.

original: yon tan thams cad la zhes bya bas ni yon tan gyi khyad par dang khyad par du 'phel ba @94b nyid bshad do //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad la zhes bya bas ni yon tan gyi khyad par dang khyad par du 'phel ba @94b nyid bshad do //
translated: By ‚Äúall good qualities,‚Äù he explains the special quality and the increase of the special quality.

original: rang gi rgyu las skye ba nyid la sogs pa brjod pa'i sems kyi rgyun sems gzhan du gtogs pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu tha mi dad pa yin yang mtshungs pa nyid ni ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las skye ba nyid la sogs pa brjod pa'i sems kyi rgyun sems gzhan du gtogs pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu tha mi dad pa yin yang mtshungs pa nyid ni ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: The continuum of mind, which is described as being born from its own cause and so forth, is the cause that produces the mind that belongs to another mind. Although it is not a different cause, it is not the same.

original: rgyu so so la bzo dang sgyu rtsal la mkhas pa la sogs pa thun mong ma yin par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu so so la bzo dang sgyu rtsal la mkhas pa la sogs pa thun mong ma yin par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the particular cause is observed to be the uncommon expertise in the arts and crafts and so forth.

original: khyad par med pa'i rgyu tsam las skyes pa'i 'bras bu ni khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i rgyu tsam las skyes pa'i 'bras bu ni khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: An effect that is produced from a cause that is not distinguished does not become distinguished.

original: de'i phyir rjes su mthun pa'i rgyus bskyed par khyad par med kyang de'i khyad par la brten te khyad par du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su mthun pa'i rgyus bskyed par khyad par med kyang de'i khyad par la brten te khyad par du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, although the production by a similar cause is not distinguished, it becomes distinguished in dependence on its distinction.

original: mkhas pa de yang mtha' med pa nyid de /
analyzed: mkhas pa de yang mtha' med pa nyid de /
translated: And that skill is also infinite,

original: de la yang rim gyis skye ba na khyad par du 'phel ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang rim gyis skye ba na khyad par du 'phel ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one sees that it increases in distinction when it is produced gradually.

original: de thams cad kyang 'du byed pa'i khyad par nyid las khyad par du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de thams cad kyang 'du byed pa'i khyad par nyid las khyad par du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And all of that is distinguished from the distinction of the formative forces themselves.

original: bzo dang sgyu rtsal la sogs pa goms pas ni gang las de dag mi shes pa'i rtogs pa po dag tshul mtha' dag la mkhas par 'gyur ba sems kyi rgyun khyad par du 'phags pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bzo dang sgyu rtsal la sogs pa goms pas ni gang las de dag mi shes pa'i rtogs pa po dag tshul mtha' dag la mkhas par 'gyur ba sems kyi rgyun khyad par du 'phags pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: By the practice of the arts and crafts, etc., one who is ignorant of them acquires a superior mental continuum, which is skilled in all the arts and crafts.

original: de'i phyir rang gi rgyu las grub pa'i sems la rgyu'i khyad par gzhan yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi rgyu las grub pa'i sems la rgyu'i khyad par gzhan yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the mind, which is established from its own cause, has only another cause as a difference.

original: ci ltar 'di yod pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang gnyis su med par rtogs pa dang / thams cad shes pa nyid la sogs pa gzhan la yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ltar 'di yod pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang gnyis su med par rtogs pa dang / thams cad shes pa nyid la sogs pa gzhan la yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as this exists, so also the other, such as the knowledge of the path, etc., are possible, because of the absence of defilement and the realization of non-duality.

original: rang gi tshad mas rtogs pa de thob pa'i thabs goms pas de'i bdag tu 'gyur ro zhes le'u gnyis par sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi tshad mas rtogs pa de thob pa'i thabs goms pas de'i bdag tu 'gyur ro zhes le'u gnyis par sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is realized by one‚Äôs own valid cognition becomes its own nature through the cultivation of the means of attaining it. This will be established in Chapter Two.

original: mi srid par smra ba gang yin pa de la ni mi srid par rjes su dpag pa la yang rgyu mtshan gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med do //
analyzed: mi srid par smra ba gang yin pa de la ni mi srid par rjes su dpag pa la yang rgyu mtshan gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med do //
translated: For one who advocates the impossible, there is no valid cognition that contradicts the reason in the inference of the impossible.

original: mi srid pa la rang bzhin nam 'bras bu'i rjes su dpag pa yod grang na re zhig rang bzhin ni med de /
analyzed: mi srid pa la rang bzhin nam 'bras bu'i rjes su dpag pa yod grang na re zhig rang bzhin ni med de /
translated: If there were an inference of nature or effect regarding the impossible, first, there is no nature.

original: de ni gnod par byed pas de'i bdag nyid du grub pa nyid ni 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gnod par byed pas de'i bdag nyid du grub pa nyid ni 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is established as its own nature by the contradictor would change.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa sgrub pas gnod pa'i phyir de nyid de'i gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa sgrub pas gnod pa'i phyir de nyid de'i gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: because omniscience is undermined by the proof of non-omniscience.

original: des na gal te sma ba la sogs pa 'ga' zhig thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dang de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin na de'i tshe 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na de ni 'di la med do //
analyzed: des na gal te sma ba la sogs pa 'ga' zhig thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dang de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin na de'i tshe 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na de ni 'di la med do //
translated: Therefore, if speech, etc. were non-omniscience and of its nature, then it would be so here, but it does not exist here.

original: ji ltar zhe na 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes smos so //
translated: How so? He says, ‚Äúfree from attachment.‚Äù

original: @95a 'di skad bshad pa yin te ji ltar rtag pa la mi srid pa'i rim dang cig car nyid dang ldan pas yod pa mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: @95a 'di skad bshad pa yin te ji ltar rtag pa la mi srid pa'i rim dang cig car nyid dang ldan pas yod pa mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid do //
translated: This is what is being said: Just as permanence is not possible, and so it is endowed with sequence and simultaneity, and so existence is of the nature of impermanence,

original: zhes rtogs pa de bzhin du gang gis 'thad pa las byung ba nyid kyis gnod par 'gyur ba smra ba la sogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa dang de'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes rtogs pa de bzhin du gang gis 'thad pa las byung ba nyid kyis gnod par 'gyur ba smra ba la sogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa dang de'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
translated: in the same way, speech, etc. are not omniscience and not of its nature, because they are undermined by what is tenable, free from attachment, etc.

original: de'i phyir gang gi phyir de las bzlog pa dgag pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa 'di thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi phyir de las bzlog pa dgag pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa 'di thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba /
translated: Therefore, since this is the opposite of that, all of this refutation becomes a reason that is the opposite of the nature of the omniscient one.

original: smra ba nyid dam gzhan thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'dod chag dang bral ba nyid dang 'gal pa ni mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid du brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: smra ba nyid dam gzhan thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'dod chag dang bral ba nyid dang 'gal pa ni mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid du brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: It should be stated that the very fact that he is a speaker is established by direct perception, and that he is in contradiction with all others who are omniscient and free from attachment.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa ma mthong na chos 'ga' dang yang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa ma mthong na chos 'ga' dang yang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if one does not see the one who is free from attachment and so on, he will not be in contradiction with any phenomenon.

original: ma mthong ba dang ni chos 'ga' yang gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos por mi 'grub pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs de gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba dang ni chos 'ga' yang gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos por mi 'grub pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs de gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since one who is not seen is not established as the object of refutation or the means of refutation, that reason that is the opposite of the nature of the omniscient one is not a refutation.

original: gal te rtag pa don byed pa bzhin du rim dang cig car dag gis don thams cad rtogs par mi srid pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa don byed pa bzhin du rim dang cig car dag gis don thams cad rtogs par mi srid pa ma yin nam /
translated: If permanence is like the performance of a function, is it not the case that it is impossible for all objects to be known either sequentially or instantaneously?

original: des na don byed pa las skad cig ma bzhin du reg par bya ba mngon sum du gyur pa nyid las thams cad ma yin par rjes su dpog go //
analyzed: des na don byed pa las skad cig ma bzhin du reg par bya ba mngon sum du gyur pa nyid las thams cad ma yin par rjes su dpog go //
translated: Therefore, it is inferred that all objects are not directly perceived, just as momentary objects that are capable of producing effects are directly perceived.

original: 'gro ba'i yul dang dus kyi dbye bas mtha' yas so //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i yul dang dus kyi dbye bas mtha' yas so //
translated: Since objects are infinite in terms of the distinctions of place and time, they are not all directly perceived.

original: de thams cad rim gyis 'dzin na mtha' yas pas 'dzin pa mtha' thug pa med pa de'i phyir rim gyis 'dzin pa ma yin no //üîΩcig car yang ma yin te mtha' yas pa nyid kyis 'di tsam zhes mi nges pa'i phyir thams cad rtogs sam /
analyzed: de thams cad rim gyis 'dzin na mtha' yas pas 'dzin pa mtha' thug pa med pa de'i phyir rim gyis 'dzin pa ma yin no // cig car yang ma yin te mtha' yas pa nyid kyis 'di tsam zhes mi nges pa'i phyir thams cad rtogs sam /
translated: If all objects were directly perceived in sequence, then the process of direct perception would be endless, because objects are infinite. Therefore, objects are not directly perceived in sequence.

original: phyogs gcig rtogs zhes mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ni 'di tsam kho nar zad de 'di las gzhan ni med la /
analyzed: phyogs gcig rtogs zhes mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro // 'di ni 'di tsam kho nar zad de 'di las gzhan ni med la /
translated: They are not directly perceived all at once, because it is not established that all objects are directly perceived or that one part of objects is directly perceived, since it is not ascertained that ‚Äúthis much‚Äù is directly perceived because of the infinity of objects.

original: de yang rtogs so zhes thams cad rtogs pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di tsam zhes ma rtogs na ni 'di thams cad rtogs pa yin nam /
analyzed: de yang rtogs so zhes thams cad rtogs pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro // 'di tsam zhes ma rtogs na ni 'di thams cad rtogs pa yin nam /
translated: It is established that all objects are directly perceived, because it is ascertained that ‚Äúthis much‚Äù is directly perceived, since it is ascertained that ‚Äúthis much‚Äù alone is directly perceived and no more than that is directly perceived.

original: phyogs gcig rtogs pa yin zhes ji ltar nges /
analyzed: phyogs gcig rtogs pa yin zhes ji ltar nges /
translated: If it is not ascertained that ‚Äúthis much‚Äù is directly perceived, then how is it ascertained that ‚Äúall objects are directly perceived‚Äù or that ‚Äúone part of objects is directly perceived‚Äù?

original: 'gro ba mtha' mad pa la 'di tsam du rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar 'di thams cad 'dzin par 'gyur zhe na de ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'gro ba mtha' mad pa la 'di tsam du rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar 'di thams cad 'dzin par 'gyur zhe na de ni mi 'thad de /
translated: Since there is no such cognition of all things in the infinite world, how can it apprehend all things?

original: gnyi ga @95b ltar yang 'dzin pa bkag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga @95b ltar yang 'dzin pa bkag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not tenable, because it is not refuted that it apprehends both.üîΩSince it apprehends each thing as it arises, it is not that it does not apprehend all things because it apprehends each thing as it arises. It is not that it does not apprehend all things because it apprehends each thing as it arises.

original: skyes shing skyes pa 'dzin pas gzhan dang gzhan bzung ba thug pa med pa'i phyir thams cad 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de rim gyis 'jug kyang don yod pa'i dus las ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes shing skyes pa 'dzin pas gzhan dang gzhan bzung ba thug pa med pa'i phyir thams cad 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de rim gyis 'jug kyang don yod pa'i dus las ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if it engages in a sequence, it does not turn away from the time when it has a purpose.

original: 'das pa bzung nas ma 'ongs pa 'dzin pa de nas ni da ltar 'dzin pa 'am rim pa gzhan gyis kyang rung ste de'i tshe skyon ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'das pa bzung nas ma 'ongs pa 'dzin pa de nas ni da ltar 'dzin pa 'am rim pa gzhan gyis kyang rung ste de'i tshe skyon ci zhig yod /
translated: If it apprehends the future after apprehending the past, then it apprehends the present, or it does so by another process. What is the error at that time?

original: mtha' yas pa'i phyir mi 'dzin to zhe na /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i phyir mi 'dzin to zhe na /
translated: If you say it does not apprehend them because they are infinite,

original: rim gyis rtogs pa ni re zhig ma 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: rim gyis rtogs pa ni re zhig ma 'brel pa yin te /
translated: then the cognition of the sequence is not related to the cognition of the infinite.

original: de ltar 'dzin pa nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for it to apprehend them in that way.

original: mtha' med pa rnams la 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa yang ma yin te de yod pa dang med pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' med pa rnams la 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa yang ma yin te de yod pa dang med pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not impossible to apprehend the infinite, because it does not depend on existence or nonexistence.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i mkhyen pa ni dngos po gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa ma yin par gang zhig ji ltar bden pa de de kho na bzhin du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i mkhyen pa ni dngos po gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa ma yin par gang zhig ji ltar bden pa de de kho na bzhin du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the Omniscient One is not dependent on other things. Whatever is true, that he knows just as it is.

original: de dngos po yod pa la ltos pa yin na ni de dag mtha' yas pa'i phyir da'i yul can gyi 'dzin pa mthar phyin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dngos po yod pa la ltos pa yin na ni de dag mtha' yas pa'i phyir da'i yul can gyi 'dzin pa mthar phyin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it depended on the existence of things, then since things are infinite, the apprehension of their object would not reach its end.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yul nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yul nyid do //
translated: For that very reason, the past and future are objects.

original: rnam par rtog pa dus kyi khyad par can du 'dzin pa nyid de'i dus par 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang lhan cig tu snang ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dus kyi khyad par can du 'dzin pa nyid de'i dus par 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang lhan cig tu snang ba yin te /
translated: Imagination is the apprehension of a distinction in time; it is not the apprehension of that time, but rather it appears simultaneously.

original: da ltar ba'i dus bzhin no //
analyzed: da ltar ba'i dus bzhin no //
translated: Like the present time.

original: dus kyang nyi ma 'char ba la sogs pa yin gyi gzhan 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus kyang nyi ma 'char ba la sogs pa yin gyi gzhan 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Time is the rising of the sun, etc., not the other as some believe.

original: des na ngo bo can mtha' yas kyang rang nyid nges pa'i yul dang dus kyi dngos po la mi ltos par snang ba'i spyod yul du mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: des na ngo bo can mtha' yas kyang rang nyid nges pa'i yul dang dus kyi dngos po la mi ltos par snang ba'i spyod yul du mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, although the nature of things is infinite, it is not contradictory that it is the domain of cognition that does not depend on the thing and time that are the objects of determination.

original: dngos po gcig nyid mtha' yas pa'i dngos po rnams la ltos pa 'am ltos par bya ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: dngos po gcig nyid mtha' yas pa'i dngos po rnams la ltos pa 'am ltos par bya ba mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that a single thing depends on or is dependent on infinite things.

original: des na byis pa las kyang legs bshad blang ba yin pas 'di blangs so //
analyzed: des na byis pa las kyang legs bshad blang ba yin pas 'di blangs so //
translated: Therefore, since even a child would accept the good explanation, I have accepted it.

original: tshad nges par mchad pa mtha' yas pa'i 'gro ba mtha' dag byed pa po'i dbang phyug gcig ni mi srid do //
analyzed: tshad nges par mchad pa mtha' yas pa'i 'gro ba mtha' dag byed pa po'i dbang phyug gcig ni mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible that the creator, ƒ™≈õvara, is one and that he is the creator of all infinite transmigrating beings.

original: bya ba mtha' med pa'i phyir dbang phyug gis 'gro pa na gnas pa'i dngos po rnams byed pa na thams cad byed pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: bya ba mtha' med pa'i phyir dbang phyug gis 'gro pa na gnas pa'i dngos po rnams byed pa na thams cad byed pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
translated: Because there is no end to his actions, it is not tenable that ƒ™≈õvara, when he creates the things that exist in the world, creates everything.

original: 'gro ba mtha' yod pa nyid yin na thams cad bya bar 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba mtha' yod pa nyid yin na thams cad bya bar 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the world had an end, it would be established that he creates everything.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni de'i gzugs brnyan tsam dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ltos pa dang ltos par bya ba ma yin pa rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i dngos po dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rang bzhin @96a * //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni de'i gzugs brnyan tsam dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ltos pa dang ltos par bya ba ma yin pa rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i dngos po dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rang bzhin @96a * //
translated: The mirror-like intuition is associated with the mere reflection of that, and therefore is not dependent on the object of dependence, and is associated with the entity that has the intrinsic reality.

original: tha dad pa dang mtha' yas pa yin yang tha mi dad cing mtha' yod pa'i 'dzin pa ni mi 'gal lo //üîΩmtha' yas pa ni tshad chad pa med pa'i phyir thams cad dang phyogs gcig rtogs pa khyad par med pas thams cad rtogs so zhes rnam par gzhag par mi nus so zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig byis pa'i tshig snying po yin par 'gyur gyi byed pa bzhin
analyzed: tha dad pa dang mtha' yas pa yin yang tha mi dad cing mtha' yod pa'i 'dzin pa ni mi 'gal lo // mtha' yas pa ni tshad chad pa med pa'i phyir thams cad dang phyogs gcig rtogs pa khyad par med pas thams cad rtogs so zhes rnam par gzhag par mi nus so zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig byis pa'i tshig snying po yin par 'gyur gyi byed pa bzhin
translated: Although it is different and infinite, the apprehension of it as undifferentiated and finite is not contradictory.üîΩSince the infinite is not limited in extent, it is not possible to establish that it is all-pervading, since there is no difference between the apprehension of all and the apprehension of a part.

original: du 'dzin pa mi srid par grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: du 'dzin pa mi srid par grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This much is the essence of the words of the childish, but it is not established that the apprehension of it as an agent is impossible.

original: mtha' yas pa 'dzin par byed pa la ni 'gal ba 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa 'dzin par byed pa la ni 'gal ba 'ga' yang med de /
translated: There is no contradiction at all in apprehending the infinite.

original: gzung ba'i chos 'dzin pa'am de'i chos gzung ba las thal bar 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir glang po'i gzugs brnyan la glang po'i chos sam /
analyzed: gzung ba'i chos 'dzin pa'am de'i chos gzung ba las thal bar 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir glang po'i gzugs brnyan la glang po'i chos sam /
translated: Because the attributes of the object apprehended are not different from the object apprehended, the attributes of the elephant are not different from the elephant.

original: glang po la glang po'i gzugs brnyan gyi chos bzhin no //
analyzed: glang po la glang po'i gzugs brnyan gyi chos bzhin no //
translated: Because there is no entailment that the apprehension of the object is the apprehension of its properties, or vice versa, it is like the case of the reflection of an elephant and the properties of an elephant, or the elephant and the properties of the reflection of an elephant.

original: tshad nges par chad pa med pas thams cad 'dzin pa med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad nges par chad pa med pas thams cad 'dzin pa med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And because there is no restriction of measure, it is not the case that there is no apprehension of everything.

original: dpar na khyim nang na gnas par rtogs pa'i bum pa lnga la gzhan yod dam med ces tshad nges pa ma brtags par phyir song ba bum pa yod do zhes rtogs par 'gyur gyi grangs nges pa'am 'di tsam nyid mthong ngo zhes ni ma yin pa bzhin no
analyzed: dpar na khyim nang na gnas par rtogs pa'i bum pa lnga la gzhan yod dam med ces tshad nges pa ma brtags par phyir song ba bum pa yod do zhes rtogs par 'gyur gyi grangs nges pa'am 'di tsam nyid mthong ngo zhes ni ma yin pa bzhin no
translated: For example, when one goes outside and thinks, ‚ÄúThere is a pot in the house,‚Äù one does not investigate whether there is another pot or not, or the number of pots, or how many there are. One just thinks, ‚ÄúThere is a pot.‚Äù

original: // de yang brtsal bas ni grangs dang ma dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan med pas 'di tsam nyid dang de thams cad la yang rtogs pa zhugs pas na thams cad rtogs pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: // de yang brtsal bas ni grangs dang ma dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan med pas 'di tsam nyid dang de thams cad la yang rtogs pa zhugs pas na thams cad rtogs pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: And when one searches, one does not see any other pot, and so one thinks, ‚ÄúThere is only that one,‚Äù and one thinks, ‚ÄúI have understood everything about it.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad ces bya ba ni grangs dang 'dra bar dngos po'i chos ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad ces bya ba ni grangs dang 'dra bar dngos po'i chos ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúall‚Äù is not a property of things that is like a number,

original: gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it depends on something else.

original: grub pa dag la ni ltos pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: grub pa dag la ni ltos pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But what is established does not depend on anything else.

original: des na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du rtogs pa med kyang dngos po ma rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du rtogs pa med kyang dngos po ma rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even without understanding omniscience, one does not fail to understand things.

original: tshad nges par chad pa nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dam /
analyzed: tshad nges par chad pa nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dam /
translated: The limitation of the object is not understood by omniscience,

original: mi dmigs pa tsam gyis rtogs par bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tsam gyis rtogs par bya bar mi nus so //
translated: or by mere nonapprehension.üîΩSound, etc., are not limited objects because they are permanent and all-pervading.

original: sgra la sogs pa ni rtag pa dang khyab pa nyid kyis yul dang dus rnam par chad pa med pa'i phyir tshad nges pa med pas kyang glen pa zhig ste /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa ni rtag pa dang khyab pa nyid kyis yul dang dus rnam par chad pa med pa'i phyir tshad nges pa med pas kyang glen pa zhig ste /
translated: They are also stupid, because they are not limited in space and time.

original: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa tsam gyis tshad ma yin pa bkag nas rgyu mi dmigs pa khas blangs pa'i phyir rgyu med pa la yang de nyid rtogs par byed pa shes rab phul du phyin pas rtogs par bya ba'i thibs po la kha ngan zer bas ngan
analyzed: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa tsam gyis tshad ma yin pa bkag nas rgyu mi dmigs pa khas blangs pa'i phyir rgyu med pa la yang de nyid rtogs par byed pa shes rab phul du phyin pas rtogs par bya ba'i thibs po la kha ngan zer bas ngan
translated: Having refuted that non-appearance is valid knowledge, he accepts non-observation of a cause. Therefore, he is the one who speaks ill of the dense thicket that is to be realized by the highest wisdom, which realizes that very thing in the absence of a cause.

original: song la gzhol ba'i snying rje ba nyid do //
analyzed: song la gzhol ba'i snying rje ba nyid do //
translated: He is the one who is compassionate towards those who are headed for a bad rebirth.

original: rgyu 'di yin no zhes bstan du med pas ni med @96b par smra mi nus te /
analyzed: rgyu 'di yin no zhes bstan du med pas ni med @96b par smra mi nus te /
translated: Since it cannot be shown that this is the cause, one cannot say that it does not exist.

original: de nyid kyis the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that very fact, there is doubt.

original: gal te don thams cad rig pa rnam par shes pa nyid yin pas de la yid la sogs pa nyid rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te don thams cad rig pa rnam par shes pa nyid yin pas de la yid la sogs pa nyid rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If all objects are just consciousness, then mind and so on would be the cause of that.

original: de dag las kyang de srid pa ma yin pa de'i phyir med pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de dag las kyang de srid pa ma yin pa de'i phyir med pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: Since they are not the cause of that, therefore they do not exist at all.

original: gal te de lta na don gyi yul can gyi yid mi srid pa'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta na don gyi yul can gyi yid mi srid pa'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then because a mind that has an object of an object is impossible, a sense consciousness would not exist.

original: ma yin te dbang po lhan cig byed pa can las de 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin te dbang po lhan cig byed pa can las de 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: No, because it arises from the sense faculty that is its co-operating cause.

original: 'o na lhan cig byed pa gzhan dang ldan pas don thams cad pa'i yul can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na lhan cig byed pa gzhan dang ldan pas don thams cad pa'i yul can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Well then, since it is endowed with another co-operating cause, it would have an object that is all things.

original: ma yin te de med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin te de med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: No, because that does not exist.

original: blo gros med pa'i sgrin shas chog go //
analyzed: blo gros med pa'i sgrin shas chog go //
translated: What a clever person without intelligence!

original: sgom pa tshad ma'i yul can nyid kyis ni /üîΩmkho ba yod pa ma yin te mi gsal ba'i rnam pa gsal bar byed pas mthar phyin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: sgom pa tshad ma'i yul can nyid kyis ni / mkho ba yod pa ma yin te mi gsal ba'i rnam pa gsal bar byed pas mthar phyin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: Since meditation has an object that is a valid cognition,üîΩit is not necessary, because it is perfected by clarifying the unclear aspect.

original: de'i phyir mi snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid kyis de med par brjod par bya ba yin na de ni tshad ma yin pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid kyis de med par brjod par bya ba yin na de ni tshad ma yin pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the non-appearance of something is itself non-observation, it should be stated that the non-existence of something is expressed by the non-observation of something that is observable. But that is a valid cognition, so it is not to be rejected.

original: de'i phyir rgyu mtshungs pa yod kyang khyad par gyi rgyu spang du med pa'i phyir rigs gcig pa yin yang skyes bu dag khyad par med pa ma yin la rigs mthun pa'i rgyu las ni 'da' bar dka' ba'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa ni med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu mtshungs pa yod kyang khyad par gyi rgyu spang du med pa'i phyir rigs gcig pa yin yang skyes bu dag khyad par med pa ma yin la rigs mthun pa'i rgyu las ni 'da' bar dka' ba'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa ni med la /
translated: Therefore, although there is a similar cause, the special cause is not eliminated. Although there is a single type, the persons are not without distinction. Since it is difficult to transcend the cause of a similar type, there is no non-human creation.

original: don thams cad 'dzin par rung ba'i sems ni yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: don thams cad 'dzin par rung ba'i sems ni yod pa kho na'o //
translated: However, the mind that is suitable to hold all meanings definitely exists.

original: gal te rgyu rigs mi mthun na 'bras bu rigs mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur mod //
analyzed: gal te rgyu rigs mi mthun na 'bras bu rigs mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur mod //
translated: If the cause is dissimilar, the effect would be dissimilar.

original: des na skyes bus byas pa gang yin pa de ni skyes bus ma byas pa las gzhan kho na yin mod kyi de la yang skyas bus khyad par bzhin du tha dad pa byed pa'i khyad par bltar mi rung ba nyid kyis tha dad par mi mngon paüîΩyin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na skyes bus byas pa gang yin pa de ni skyes bus ma byas pa las gzhan kho na yin mod kyi de la yang skyas bus khyad par bzhin du tha dad pa byed pa'i khyad par bltar mi rung ba nyid kyis tha dad par mi mngon pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, whatever is created by a person is indeed different from what is not created by a person. However, just like the distinction of a person, the difference of the creator is not seen, and therefore it is not evident.

original: tshig rnams ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: tshig rnams ni zhes smos so //
translated: The words are stated.

original: skyes bu'i khyad par bzhin du tshig rnams ni khyad par spang bar 'os pa ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i khyad par bzhin du tshig rnams ni khyad par spang bar 'os pa ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: The words are not like the particularities of a person, which are not suitable to be abandoned.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na khyad par bltar rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na khyad par bltar rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because the particularities are visible.

original: bltar rung ba mi snang na ni med do zhes nges pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bltar rung ba mi snang na ni med do zhes nges pa kho na'o //
translated: If the visible is not seen, it is certain that it does not exist.

original: tshig gi khyad par dag kyang de lta bur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig gi khyad par dag kyang de lta bur gyur pa yin no //
translated: The particularities of words are also like that.

original: khyad par bltar mi rung ba yin pa de lta na yang 'di dag skyes bus ma byas pa yin no zhes rnam par 'jog pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: khyad par bltar mi rung ba yin pa de lta na yang 'di dag skyes bus ma byas pa yin no zhes rnam par 'jog pa mi 'thad do //
translated: Even if the particularities are not visible, it is not tenable to posit that they are not made by a person.

original: de bshad pa ni bltar mi rung ba nyid gcig ces smos so //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni bltar mi rung ba nyid gcig ces smos so //
translated: The explanation of that is stated as ‚Äúonly the non-visibility.‚Äù

original: rgyal ba sgrogs pa la sogs pa ni skyes bus @97a * //üîΩbyas pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyal ba sgrogs pa la sogs pa ni skyes bus @97a * // byas pa yin la /
translated: Jina-ghosa and so on are made by a person.üîΩThe Vedas are not not made by a person.

original: rig byed ni skyes bus ma byas pa ma yin no zhes rigs mi mthun pa nyid mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rig byed ni skyes bus ma byas pa ma yin no zhes rigs mi mthun pa nyid mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that they are of a different type.

original: ci ste yang mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i yul can nyid rigs mi mthun pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste yang mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i yul can nyid rigs mi mthun pa yod pa yin no //
translated: But if the subject is not the domain of perception and so on, then it is not a valid object of knowledge.

original: skyes bus byas pa ni grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi don ston pa yin la /
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa ni grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi don ston pa yin la /
translated: The Vedas teach the nature of things that are established,

original: bya'o zhes bya ba nyid ni rig byed kyis rtogs par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: bya'o zhes bya ba nyid ni rig byed kyis rtogs par byed do zhe na /
translated: and the injunctions teach what should be done.üîΩBut if the Vedas are not the work of a person, then they cannot teach either the nature of things that are established or what should be done.üîΩThis is the argument that is presented in the following:üîΩThe Vedas are not the work of a person, because they are not composed, like the sound of a conch.

original: de ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni de'i khyad par rnams ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni de'i khyad par rnams ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äútheir‚Äù refers to the particular features of the Vedas.

original: der khyad par du 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni zhi ba sa la sogs pa'i rgyud gzhan la yang srid pa yin no //üîΩ'di dag ni 'di las 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ltar bya ba rtogs par byed pa dag la yang byed pa yod pa yin la /
analyzed: der khyad par du 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni zhi ba sa la sogs pa'i rgyud gzhan la yang srid pa yin no //üîΩ'di dag ni 'di las 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ltar bya ba rtogs par byed pa dag la yang byed pa yod pa yin la /
translated: The particular features that are asserted to be in the Vedas are also possible in other texts, such as the ≈öƒÅstras of Kapila and so on.üîΩThe Vedas are not the work of a person, because they are not composed, like the sound of a conch.

original: gzhan dag gi dgos pa ni bya ba ston par byed pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang gzhan las skyes bus byas pa dang ma byas pa'i khyad par grub na srid pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi dgos pa ni bya ba ston par byed pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang gzhan las skyes bus byas pa dang ma byas pa'i khyad par grub na srid pa yin no //
translated: If it is established that the difference between that produced by a person and that not produced by a person is produced from another, then it is possible.

original: des na de ltar rtogs par byed pa nyid ni skyes bus kyang phyogs gcig dmigs pa khyad par dang ldan pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa na /
analyzed: des na de ltar rtogs par byed pa nyid ni skyes bus kyang phyogs gcig dmigs pa khyad par dang ldan pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa na /
translated: Therefore, when a person is posited as the apprehender in that way, it is only a part of sound that is observed that is qualified.

original: ci 'di sgra mtha' dag rtogs sam sgra'i phyogs gcig ces 'dri ba la thams cad rtogs so zhes lan 'debs pas sgra'i rang bzhin tshad nges par rnam par bzhag nas de la dmigs par ni brjod par mi nus kyis /
analyzed: ci 'di sgra mtha' dag rtogs sam sgra'i phyogs gcig ces 'dri ba la thams cad rtogs so zhes lan 'debs pas sgra'i rang bzhin tshad nges par rnam par bzhag nas de la dmigs par ni brjod par mi nus kyis /
translated: When asked, ‚ÄúDoes this apprehend all sounds or a part of sound?‚Äù the answer is, ‚ÄúIt apprehends all.‚Äù Therefore, having posited the nature of sound to be of a definite measure, it cannot be said that it is observed.

original: 'on kyang gcig yin pa'i phyir cha med pa nyid kyis thams cad rtogs so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gcig yin pa'i phyir cha med pa nyid kyis thams cad rtogs so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: However, because it is one, it is said that all is apprehended by partlessness.

original: des na 'gro ba mtha' yas pa yang tshad nges par rnam par gzhag nas thams cad rtogs par ni mi smra'i /
analyzed: des na 'gro ba mtha' yas pa yang tshad nges par rnam par gzhag nas thams cad rtogs par ni mi smra'i /
translated: Therefore, having posited infinite worlds to be of a definite measure, it is not said that all is apprehended.

original: 'on kyang mtha' yas kyang ngo po dang ldan pa de'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin ba mi srid pas dus gsum dang ldan pa mkhyen to zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang mtha' yas kyang ngo po dang ldan pa de'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin ba mi srid pas dus gsum dang ldan pa mkhyen to zhes brjod do //
translated: But since it is impossible that the object of consciousness which has the nature of the infinite be not the object of consciousness, it is said that the Buddha knows the three times.üîΩEnough of this discussion of the fool‚Äôs speculation!

original: blun po'i brtag ba la lan btab pas chog gi srid pa 'gog pa'i 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyang med par bshad pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: blun po'i brtag ba la lan btab pas chog gi srid pa 'gog pa'i 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyang med par bshad pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The argument that the effect of the cessation of existence does not exist has been explained.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyis ni 'dod chags rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'khrul pa med pa can med par brjod de /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyis ni 'dod chags rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'khrul pa med pa can med par brjod de /
translated: The argument from the effect of desire, etc., is stated as follows: Since desire is inferred, the effect of desire, etc., is said to be without error, because freedom from desire is refuted.

original: tshig la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin pas yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin pas yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But words, etc., are not like that, because they have a further existence.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs @97b pas med par sgrub pa yang sel ba ni srid kyang thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i khyad par rnam pa bltar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs @97b pas med par sgrub pa yang sel ba ni srid kyang thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i khyad par rnam pa bltar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-apprehension of a nature also proves non-existence, but it is impossible to see the distinctions of omniscience, freedom from attachment, and so on.

original: bltar rung bdag la mthong ba med pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: bltar rung bdag la mthong ba med pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yin na /
translated: The non-apprehension of a nature is the non-perception of a visible self.

original: 'di ni bltar rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bltar rung ba ma yin no //
translated: But this is not visible.

original: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa tshad ma yin pa nyid do zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa tshad ma yin pa nyid do zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: The non-appearance of the imperceptible is a valid cognition.

original: de lta bu dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúsuch as these.‚Äù

original: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pas bltar mi nus pa dag la ni spang ba srid pa ma yin no //üîΩgal te 'jal ba tshad ma'i rgyu can ma yin nam /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pas bltar mi nus pa dag la ni spang ba srid pa ma yin no // gal te 'jal ba tshad ma'i rgyu can ma yin nam /
translated: But in the case of things that are not visible due to being separated by place, time, and nature, it is impossible to eliminate them.üîΩAre not all valid cognitions based on valid cognitions?

original: don thams cad rab tu grub pa la ni rgyu tshad ma yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don thams cad rab tu grub pa la ni rgyu tshad ma yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But in the case of the establishment of all objects, there is no valid cognition as a cause.

original: mig la sogs pa nges pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dang yid kyang thams cad kyi tshe phyi rol gyi gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas de la ma ltos par mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang sgom pa yang thos pa dang dpag pa'i yul can nyid kyis don thams
analyzed: mig la sogs pa nges pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dang yid kyang thams cad kyi tshe phyi rol gyi gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas de la ma ltos par mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang sgom pa yang thos pa dang dpag pa'i yul can nyid kyis don thams
translated: Because the eyes and so on are definite objects and because the mind is always controlled by external others, it does not engage without depending on them.üîΩ

original: cad kyi yul can du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cad kyi yul can du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eye and so on are restricted to their own objects, and because the mind is not engaged without relying on them, since it is always under the influence of external objects, and because meditation is not established as having all objects, since it has the objects of hearing and inference.

original: de'i phyir don thams cad 'jal ba 'gog pa'i tshad ma ni rgyu mi dmigs pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir don thams cad 'jal ba 'gog pa'i tshad ma ni rgyu mi dmigs pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the reason that refutes the comprehension of all objects is the nonobservation of a cause.

original: de ni ma yin te ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i shes pa'i rgyu dag kho na don thams cad gcod pa'i rgyu yin no /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i shes pa'i rgyu dag kho na don thams cad gcod pa'i rgyu yin no /
translated: That is not so. The causes of the consciousness that sees all are the causes of comprehending all objects.

original: ji ltar yongs su mthong ba thams cad don thams cad 'jal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su mthong ba thams cad don thams cad 'jal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever is seen is the comprehension of all objects.

original: rgyu ma yin na yang de dag de la nus pa med pas 'jal ba de rgyu med par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin na yang de dag de la nus pa med pas 'jal ba de rgyu med par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Even if they are not causes, since they are not capable of that, how could that comprehension be causeless?

original: sgom pa rgyu ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sgom pa rgyu ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Meditation is not a cause.

original: gal te sgom pa rgyu'i dngos por rtogs na de med na don thams cad 'jal ba med do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sgom pa rgyu'i dngos por rtogs na de med na don thams cad 'jal ba med do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you think that meditation is the cause of the thing, then if it does not exist, it would follow that there is no comprehension of any object.

original: de ltar na yang gang du de med pa der med par 'grub kyi de yod par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang gang du de med pa der med par 'grub kyi de yod par ni ma yin no //
translated: In that case, it is established that it does not exist where it does not exist, but it is not established that it exists where it does exist.

original: 'on te de yang rgyu nyid du mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de yang rgyu nyid du mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: But if you think that it is not tenable that it is the cause,

original: da ni rgyu ma yin pa rgyur 'gyur pa bkag nas de'i rgyu can ma yin pa'i 'bras bu ci 'gal /
analyzed: da ni rgyu ma yin pa rgyur 'gyur pa bkag nas de'i rgyu can ma yin pa'i 'bras bu ci 'gal /
translated: then now, having refuted that it is not a cause, what is the contradiction in the effect not having it as its cause?

original: gal te pha rol pos sgom pa de'i rgyur khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te pha rol pos sgom pa de'i rgyur khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But if you think that the opponent accepts that meditation is its cause,

original: da ni khas blangs pa de yang dag pa ma yin par 'gyur gyi zhes khas len mi shes pa'i spobs pa nyams pas don yang nyams par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: da ni khas blangs pa de yang dag pa ma yin par 'gyur gyi zhes khas len mi shes pa'i spobs pa nyams pas don yang nyams par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: then now, that acceptance would be false, but it is not the case that the meaning is lost due to the loss of the confidence of not knowing how to accept.

original: rmongs pas du ba'i rgyu sa bon yin par khas blangs pa la gnod pas me las du ba yod par 'gyur ba yang bkag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rmongs pas du ba'i rgyu sa bon yin par khas blangs pa la gnod pas me las du ba yod par 'gyur ba yang bkag pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the existence of smoke from fire is refuted because of the refutation of the acceptance of seed as the cause of smoke due to confusion.

original: 'o na rgyu gzhan gang yin @98a * //
analyzed: 'o na rgyu gzhan gang yin @98a * //
translated: But what is the other cause?

original: zhe na / gam na gnas pa tsam rig pa'i phyugs kyang stong pa nyid la 'khrul pa ni ma yin na 'di ni phyugs ma byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhe na / gam na gnas pa tsam rig pa'i phyugs kyang stong pa nyid la 'khrul pa ni ma yin na 'di ni phyugs ma byas pa ma yin no //
translated: If you say that, then it is not the case that the cattle of the logicians, who merely abide nearby, are confused about emptiness.

original: 'jig rten mthong ba ji lta ba bzhin snang ba nyid sgra'i don yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten mthong ba ji lta ba bzhin snang ba nyid sgra'i don yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is taught that the meaning of the word is the appearance of the world just as it is.

original: bya ba'am de'i yul can gyi bya ba sgrub pa ni med de ;
analyzed: bya ba'am de'i yul can gyi bya ba sgrub pa ni med de ;
translated: There is no action or agent of action.

original: bstan bcos kyi sgra rnams mdor bsdus nas bye brag tu rtogs par 'dod pa rnams kyis rang bzhin dang rkyen la sogs pa de'i don can ma yin pa dag kyang de'i don can du brtags pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po mi dran pa la sogs pa yang 'gog par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi sgra rnams mdor bsdus nas bye brag tu rtogs par 'dod pa rnams kyis rang bzhin dang rkyen la sogs pa de'i don can ma yin pa dag kyang de'i don can du brtags pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po mi dran pa la sogs pa yang 'gog par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those who wish to understand the meaning of the treatises in brief imagine that words such as ‚Äúnature‚Äù and ‚Äúcondition,‚Äù which do not have that meaning, have that meaning, and because it would be refuted that the agent is not remembered, and so on.

original: des na de ltar khyad par bltar mi rung ba nyid du khas blangs nas tha dad par byed pa'i khyad par yod pa nyid bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar khyad par bltar mi rung ba nyid du khas blangs nas tha dad par byed pa'i khyad par yod pa nyid bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, having accepted that it is not suitable to view it in that way, the existence of a difference that makes a difference is refuted.

original: khyad par bltar mi rung ba nyid kyang srid pa ma yin no zhes 'chad pa ni sgra mngon sum pa rnams la zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par bltar mi rung ba nyid kyang srid pa ma yin no zhes 'chad pa ni sgra mngon sum pa rnams la zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The words ‚Äúfor those who are direct perceivers‚Äù are used to explain this.

original: mngon sum du gyur pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de la rang gi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i mngon sum ma yin pa'i ngo bo mi srid do //
analyzed: mngon sum du gyur pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de la rang gi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i mngon sum ma yin pa'i ngo bo mi srid do //
translated: For any entity that is a direct perceiver, it is not possible that it has a nature that is not a direct perceiver.

original: de nyid la rang gi rnam pa gtad pa nyid kyis bdag nyid la rtogs pa bskyed pa dang / gzhan gnyis ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de nyid la rang gi rnam pa gtad pa nyid kyis bdag nyid la rtogs pa bskyed pa dang / gzhan gnyis ni mi 'thad do //
translated: It is only by presenting its own form that it generates an awareness of itself. The other two ways are not tenable.

original: de de tsam gyi rang bzhin nyid yin na /
analyzed: de de tsam gyi rang bzhin nyid yin na /
translated: If that is its nature,

original: rang bzhin de gcig pu nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin de gcig pu nyid do //
translated: that nature is only one.

original: de ltar na yang bltar mi rung ba 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ltar na yang bltar mi rung ba 'gal lo //
translated: In that case, it is contradictory that it is not seen.

original: rang bzhin gzhan nyid na yang de'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan nyid na yang de'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: If it has a different nature, it is not that nature.

original: des na mngon sum ma yin ba ni mngon sum gyi rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mngon sum ma yin ba ni mngon sum gyi rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, what is not a direct perceiver does not have the nature of a direct perceiver.

original: 'o na ji ltar skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa snang ba dang rang bzhin gcig pa yin yang mngon sum ma yin na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa snang ba dang rang bzhin gcig pa yin yang mngon sum ma yin na /
translated: Well, then, how is it that although momentariness and so on are of the same nature as what appears, they are not directly perceived?

original: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa mngon sum ma yin pa ni cung zad kyang med kyi 'on kyang mdun du gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa mngon sum ma yin pa ni cung zad kyang med kyi 'on kyang mdun du gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: There is not the slightest momentariness and so on that is not directly perceived. However, it is the nature of what is clear in front of one that is of the same nature as that.

original: de snang ba na cha med pa de nyid mngon sum nyid dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de snang ba na cha med pa de nyid mngon sum nyid dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: When that appears, that very partless nature is endowed with direct perception.
